Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: adrianamh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days at the Nine Zero. We were really happy with the location (between 2 metro stations which we walked to very easily). The room was very clean and modern, and the bathroom was spacious. The staff was incredibly helpful and we would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Boston. The room was a little small but I would expect that for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: sheldon9
Reviews.Content: I haven't even stayed at this hotel yet and have already had the best customer service I've encountered in a long time. I booked a room at this hotel through an internet provider who had a noncancellation policy. To make a long story short, the room the service booked for me was too small for my party and Andrew, the manager of this hotel, went out of his way to help me cancel this room and get a full refund and even offered me their best room for an incredible price as he felt sorry for us since it was my daughter's 16th birthday gift. Needless to say, after such wonderful service, I have rebooked a room for April 28th and look forward to my stay here. If the hotel is as great as the service - this should be an amazing time!! Can't wait to write my next review of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big Pimpin', Spendin' G's!”
Reviews.Author: tonyrome_27
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero was really great. The staff were really friendly and knowledgeable, the rooms were always clean and neat, the noise level was sort of minimal (despite a few church bells) and the water was always hot. If I had to be critical, being that our window faced the alley on the side, we heard the beeping of trucks and other vehicles in the morning hours. Also there is a church close by so the bells will repeat over and over again. With the window closed though the noise is very minimal. The key cards sometimes didn't work so that was a bit inconvenient, but they had fresh water with fruit slices in the lobby! So that was a really nice touch. The KO Prime restaurant attached is nice, but we didn't eat there so I can't comment on that. It's overall a really nice place, I was very comfortable here. Oh that reminds me, the beds are amazing!! You will sleep well here and it's safe and close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value! Spacious cave-like room! Delightful continental breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: DebandBill
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal and was pleasantly surprised on arrival to discover that the rate included continental breakfast! Particularly warm welcome at reception which was reinforced throughout our stay by both reception staff and the concierge. Room was spacious and perfectly outfitted with the usual Kimpton amenities that make you smile. Bath was very clean and spacious. Housekeeping delivered extra pillows within minutes. Elevator rugs said "inspire" and "dream"! Breakfast was probably the best continental we've ever had - fresh fruit, warm croissants and muffins, great coffee and juice with thoughtful service. Some minor quibbles: Please put a sign out front that a driver can see as Boston traffic can be busy on Tremont! Seldom travel with a car and was new to valet parking - forgot my gloves in the car and went without for two days as car was inaccessible in some elevated garage. The "12" rooms are cave-like with a view of the legs of a man lying on his bed in the Omni next door. Always expect that we will not get the best room when we get a great deal but avoid the "12's" if possible! In summary, loved the location in proximity to the Boston Common, great restaurants, and the T. Appreciated the value and would return in a Boston minute (except not to 712)!

Reviews.Title: “Would be excellent if not for some housekeeping issues”
Reviews.Author: CCnyc123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with my extended family - kids, mother in law and sisters in law. Great location, rooms had great view, modern and appealing design - we were at the18th floors. Staff was helpful and friendly. However we had a few issues with housekeeping. We reserved two rooms, when we arrived at around 2:30 PM, only one was ready which was no problem since check in was at 3 PM. When we came back at around 4 PM the room was still not ready, we all crushed in the room that was supposed to be ready, taking turns to go to the bathroom, only to have housekeeping coming in to check the mini bar and the bathroom. Very annoying. When the second room was finally ready, I did notice dust flying in the air as we sat on the beds, maybe the faux fur bed covers are not very practical to clean. Also the toilette did not flush properly. As I mentioned, the staff was friendly and they tried to make up for the inconvenience of having to wait for our room. They offered a free breakfast, which we declined, and ultimately gave us a bottle of wine (retail ~$6.00) and 4 chocolate pralines.

Reviews.Title: “Takes Pride in friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: keithnewhook
Reviews.Content: Only spent one night at Nine Zero but had to add my review as it was very impressive. The rooms were modern, newly renovated, with large well appointed bathrooms (with Zebra Print bath robes, lol). I stayed in 1806, with a great view of the city skyline. The KO Prime steakhouse seemed very popular and was delicious. The hotel staff, and especially the bar staff were very friendly, funny, and helpful in any tips for walking around Boston. Great location, probably a 7 minute walk from TD gardens and Boston Commons. Will stay here again next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: deedeerph
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only one night for a Boston girls' weekend and was very happy with this hotel! Funky design, great location, and supremely helpful and kind staff. We were able to walk everywhere (theater, restaurants) and the T stop is about a 2 minute walk away. Beds are very comfy! The only slight I could find is that there was no fan in the bathroom, which means your roommate can hear you tinkling as though they are in the room with you (sorry for the graphic). Minor issue obviously. The restaurant/bar makes fantastic martinis and the breakfast was terrific too. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: cannytraveller2008
Reviews.Content: Visited Boston in September 2011 and spent 5 nights in Nine Zero. Had joined Kimpton club before I travelled so that I had free internet access but they also gave me vouchers for free continental breakfast each morning and $5 mini bar credit. Prices of mini bar mean that you are unlikely to use mini bar unless you had this voucher. Room had 2 large king sized beds, storage area, room safe and large plasma TV. En suite with power shower and quality toiletries. Zany decor, faux fur rugs etc perhaps not to everyone's taste but an alternative to normal bland hotel chain. Free wine reception for one hour each night but no soft drink option only glass red or white. Central location and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: marksilver94
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in february, very comfortable beds, interesting design touches, it is just a shame that all the staff i came into contact with, cared more about themselves than their guests. Mr kimpton needs to spend more on training and less on design !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place with Our Pugs”
Reviews.Author: NorthamptonSyd
Reviews.Content: The Kimpton Hotels have nearly always exceeded my expectations. The Nine Zero has stunning views of the Boston Common and State House (higher floors). As in in-touch member, we were given an upgraded room at little cost. The restaurant on-site is intimate, chic, and has food one would want to eat in a regular/non-hotel restaurant. The pugs were given beds and treats every time they went in and out. The rooms are clean with great decor. The bathrooms are nicely appointed. The location for getting around Boston by foot cannot be beaten. The Beacon Hill area is a simple walk across the Common. Downtown and Copley area shopping are nearby. Movies, restaurants, and theatres are plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Levi22
Reviews.Content: I live in Boston and had a free night at Kimpton that was about to expire. This hotel had more to offer than some of the others in Boston so I booked it. The hotel is conveniently located between many T stops (State, Park, and Downtown Crossing). Boston Common is two blocks away and Samuel Adams' grave is across the street. You also have a lot of great bars and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is very clean and modern. The bed was also very comfortable. Now the downside... There aren't a lot of rooms on each floor which makes requesting a room away from the elevator almost impossible. I was able to hear the elevator dinging whenever I was in the room. Kimpton is also a pet friendly hotel. I've never had a problem with this before, but this time there were a few dogs on my floor and was able to hear them barking. Granted this will not always be the case, but I would recommend trying to get a room not on the same floors as people with animals.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: BD_FDNY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during the week. We arrived early but the woman at the front desk was VERY helpful and had a room ready for us. She also suggested we talk to the concierge about our dinner plans during our stay. He was also VERY helpful. The room was great. It was a nice size, extremely clean and decorated nicely. We were in a King Premiere room on the 5th floor. Not much of a view but that happens when you are in the city. All the staff at the hotel were great. The wine hour is a nice touch. My only negative was that I stopped in to the restaurant bar during "Happy Hour", I asked for a glass of wine, the bartender while polite, seemed to be more interested in talking to the waiters then taking care of the patrons. Overall though this was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EAPDallas
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for two nights. We were warmly greeted by Gabriella and escorted directly to our spacious double room. I grabbed a complimentary glass of Pinot Grigio on the way up, as it was happy hour. The decor is interesting but the alley view wasn't much to look at from the 6th floor window. Starting with the beds: wonderful linens, plenty of pillows, slept like a rock on a bed more comfortable than my own at home. The bathroom was modern, but the tub had an awkward system for running the shower which required getting wet to turn it on. Also, the water got all over the floor in spite of our best efforts to regulate the shower curtain. There was no exhaust in the bathroom which made for a really steamy room. That surprised us. The towels are also quite puny for a hotel like this. On our last morning we had very little hot water. Huge plus: the best stocked mini bar I have ever seen. And it wasn't that expensive either. Our TV remote did not work and it was replaced within five minutes of my call to the front desk. Nice bar on the second floor. We ordered room service one morning which came promptly. The room service menu clearly states that an 18% gratuity is added and a charge for delivery is also added to your order. However, the check handed to me by the server indicated only the price for the bagels and lox (which was $42 for three servings). I should have asked about the tipping, but instead I added a 20% tip. I was surprised to see that the final cost for three bagels with lox came to about $80. So the moral of the story is: don't add tips to room service. Most expensive bagels ever! They were good though. It's my fault for not asking for clarification. The location is wonderful. We walked all over Boston and enjoyed easy access to the Boston Common and Newbury Street. The front desk was extremely helpful in providing directions and they gave us a suggestion for Sunday breakfast (which had to include waffles!) so we walked to Beacon Hill and ate at The Paramount. Great suggestion. Our flight was cancelled and they graciously stored our bags for the entire last day so we could tour more of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: CheerDenise0026
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Awesome services. Everyone was extremely nice. Andy was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and accomodating hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal C
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero hotel in Boston is as close to perfect as you can get in downtown Boston. My boyfriend and I stayed at the Nine Zero this past weekend for an early Valentine's weekend. We were welcomed with friendly smiles and a willingness to help with anything we needed. I am a Kimpton InTouch member and have stayed at all of the Kimpton hotels (Marlowe, Nine Zero, and Onyx) in Massachusetts. I can honestly say that all of the Kimpton hotels are great. Nine Zero has spared no expense to make their hotel one of the best in Boston. Check-in is easy and quick. They have a great location, restaurant and decor. Our room was roomy and comfortable. The beds are great too, very comfortable!!The hospitality they provide is top notch! I only stay at Kimpton hotels when I visit Boston/Cambridge and that is because of the wonderful service and accomodations they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Great chic hotel with fabulous customer service & great location”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGirl007
Reviews.Content: In peak season this is a pretty pricey hotel for us. I saw a New England perks voucher & called & was told their prices drop to a more affordable price range for us in the winter. We spent Valentines weekend there. We also had vouchers for massages at the Athena Aveda salon on Newbury which were great, and we had a fabulous dinner at the Elephant Walk. I wanted to look at furniture/design stores in the area. The concierge Thomas Burke pointed us in the direction & gave us his card. When we could only find one I called him. He emailed me a few more with addresses, contacts & phone numbers. He emailed later to ask how it went. We were really impressed with this level of customer service. They also had a wine reception in their dog friendly lobby. It was nice to sip some wine & pet other peoples dogs. The staff were very friendly & helpful. The location is across from the graveyard & 1 block from the park. You can walk to Newbury & Bolyston St's or downtown, or Faneuil Hall no problem. The hotel looks newly renovated. Not my color scheme in the rooms (black & mustard), I prefer calming colors, but it was nice & clean. The water pressure in the shower was AMAZING!!!!!! We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ckdemanche
Reviews.Content: Myself and five of my girlfriends stayed overnight on a recent Saturday night and wished we could've stayed the week! From the moment we dropped the car off at valet until, the time we picked it back up, we were treated like privileged guests by all staff, especially Victor, Andy and the female front desk attendant whose name I embarrassingly can't recall. We were guided with superb recommendations for dinner along with post-theater plans...we even got a little special treatment at a local trendy night club bc our conceirge Andy set that up. The rooms were impeccable and shabby chic in decor. The bottle of wine and personal note from Victor just added to what was an amazing evening. I highly recommend this hotel to all travelers wanting a little bit of luxury on Tremont Street without breaking the bank...looking forward to our next stay...thanks again...xo

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ciao07
Reviews.Content: Chose the Nine Zero for a girls weekend getaway. From reservations to check in, the entire process was pleasant and easy. Rooms are spacious, nicely decorated and appointed. Loved the fur coverlets on the bed! The complimentary wine reception was a fun way to start the weekend. Following the wine reception, enjoyed happy hour apps and drinks in the hotel's top notch restaurant, KO Prime. The hotel is centrally located to Fanueil Hall, Newbury St., Boston Common, and many other attractions. Although didn't have my dog with me, the hotel is pet friendly and was not disturbed by any "barky" guests. Downside: don't expect spectacular views. Hotel is packed between several buildings, so at best, you'll get views of Tremont and/or Washington St.. Overall - Thumbs up and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back”
Reviews.Author: Willem M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last summer with my wife and 2 kids. There were some minor problems with the TV and the hot water but the staff were very pleasant and helped us resolve the situation without much inconvenience to us. The location is great, service is great and rooms are clean. We are planning to Boston return again in 2013 for my cousin's wedding and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pet-Friendly For Sure!”
Reviews.Author: katrinklet
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night recently on business/pleasure and exposed our adopted pup to his first 'big City' visit. The Nine Zero treated us all very well, and made it SO much easier to begin "Tucker's" travel experience with us. I would stay there again for sure; very well-positioned to Boston Commoms and all the great attractions near North End. Had a lovely room overlooking the park, was nice & quiet and very comfortable. If you must have coffee in your room, do not forget to ask for a coffee-maker; they aren't in the room unless you ask. But the coffee service in their restaurant is wonderful, and lots of daily newspapers to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, right pric”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_R8
Reviews.Content: I came here with my girlfriend for her birthday and we really had an amazing time. Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning personnel were warm and welcoming, offering smiles and greetings at every opportunity. I walked into the lobby, sopping wet, following a downpour enroute from South Station, and the people at the from desk worked hard to get my room ready in under ten minutes, even though I had arrived far before check-in time. When I got up to the room, I was seriously impressed with the view. Once I walked in I began to regret that we could only stay for one night. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice romantic night in Boston as the hotel is very chic, nicely situated, and uncompromising in service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, fabulous rooms.”
Reviews.Author: monkeybay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Nine Zero for a week in October. It's an elegant and well-run hotel with excellent service a stone's throw from Boston Common. There is much to recommend the hotel: modern rooms, lovely complimentary wine in the evening, a well-equipped gym, prompt desk and room service, and -- if you are staying on the top three floors -- fabulous views. Staff go out of their way to accommodate guests and make sure they are comfortable during their stay. I do have a few quibbles... While there is a fully stocked bar with mixes, etc in the room ...There was no kettle in the room... no tea, no coffee. After a damp and cold afternoon of walking around the city I returned to my room jonesing for hot cup of something and had to call room service for a cup of tea at GREAT expense. There is a Starbucks a block away but in-room tea is always a plus in the Fall. While my room had a great soaker tub, my friends who had booked a room a few floors down through Hotwire ended up with just a walk-in shower. Be aware that a cheaper room might have a lesser view and a less well-quipped washroom. Also... the restaurant in the hotel was not as great as the hotel itself. The dinner menu is ok but there are better places to eat in the city. The breakfast is a little ho-hum and one morning staff snapped at me because -- unbeknown to me -- I had shown up ten minutes before they opened for breakfast (at 7:50am!). The woman also failed to take that moment to direct me to the coffee bar across the room set up for guests (which might have been a nice way to divert my attention for those ten minutes). But really.. the only blemish on what was otherwise an idyllic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm...here we go again!”
Reviews.Author: Danod1
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero is a beautiful boutique hotel. After plenty of research and reading reviews my wife and I stayed there last year for our anniversary. It's located just a short walk from the common , so we parked in the common and only paid 11 dollars a day for parking as opposed to the 40 a day or so that most places charge. The room was great with a sweet view but a bit smaller than I expected and I was surprised how old the t.v was . When we got there it wouldn't work but they were prompt on fixing it. I guess some sensor fell off the back of the unit. The heating unit started rattling at night and kept us up for a bit. I called the desk in the morning and they promptly fixed it. The beds were so comfy and the work out room was very nice. Great restaurant with a great staff. The desk staff was pleasant and everyone greeted us . We are an average middle class working couple and sometimes I feel as though some hotels look down on you but not here. I wasn't sure we would stay here again and were thinking about staying at The W or the onyx the sister hotel in the north end. But after plenty of research we are staying here again at the end of Feb for our 19th anniversary. And I will admit we are looking forward to it. Even though a few minor things went wrong they worked very hard at taking care of them and in my book that's what matters...kudos to the management for having a well prepared and caring staff. Being in management myself I know that not always the easiest thing to do.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential”
Reviews.Author: DMB1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel and thought it was beautiful. We had two issues that marred an otherwise wonderful stay. The first had to do with the cleanliness of the bathroom. (Well, the lack of it) We chalked it up to a bad day for the maid and cleaned up the sink area. We did mention it at check out, but did not make a huge deal and certainly don't feel that this is what to expect as "standard". The staff seemed very upset about that and since we did not report it so they could address it, I don't feel they owed me anything over this. I mention this only because they seemed so sincere and to me, that means I can expect greatness from them. Second, which was more of an issue for us, was that we had a guest next to us partying. We called the desk a couple of times and they did send someone up, but the rude guest took a long time to settle down. After the party ended, we heard a lot of noise for some time. The next day, the front desk told us that the noisy guest was paying for our parking. What we loved about the place was the decor and the service overall. The food was excellent and we were impressed that we never even had to ask for directions. They had cards printed that explained how to get around the detours and how to get home easily. The decor rivals that of many of the high end resorts without charging the same premium fees. The staff was polite, knowledgeable about the surrounding areas, and seemed to enjoy what they do. I did not give them a perfect score due to the lack of soundproofing, which even without the loud guest seemed to be a slight issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: Pink_bear19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in January and were 'wowed' from the moment we checked in. We arrived long before normal check in time, intending to leave our bags but were able to check in. The reception staff were really friendly and efficient - very welcoming. Our room was on the 17th floor with gorgeous views over Boston Common and the Charles River (despite being one of the cheaper rooms). The bed was really, really comfy (pillow top) and we found it hard to tear ourselves away - was very luxurious. Well designed room that felt quite spacious and a gorgeous bathroom with really good toiletries. Location is fantastic - on the doorstep of Boston Common and close to good shopping. Overall, really good stay and would definitely recommend it to others. Our second stay in a Kimpton hotel and definitely will be back. The service is fantastic and rooms show real attention to detail. A must stay when you're in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and great location”
Reviews.Author: zeekester
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were greeted warmly by a friendly manager at the check-in desk. The lobby and rooms were beautifully decorated and the rooms were large for a city hotel. The room also had a very large bathroom. We stayed there 2 nights and attended the wine reception on our second night. We were having a great time enjoying our wine, socializing and watching the 2 dogs other guests had brought with them. One of the dogs had an accident on the carpet that we brought to the dog owners attention. The dog owner then informed the hostess of the matter. During the next 30 minutes no one cleaned it up! We watched as guest after guest walked through the mess. By the time we left, no one had cleaned it up. While I thought it was a fabulous hotel and wish I could give it 5 stars across the board, it was disturbing to witness that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design but very bad mattress”
Reviews.Author: vincetraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Hotel which is well located in the center of the city and close to the tube station. The design of the room is very modern and trendy but the mattress of the bed was awful and it should be changed ! We complained at the desk but don't take care about it. The service at the restaurant was excellent as well as the food (meat !) which compensate a bit the "less" good level at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Always Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Vivola
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time staying at the Nine Zero and once again it was fabulous! The staff go out of their way to make the guests happy. For example, my husband went downstairs for coffee on New Year's Day and the restaurant was closed. (Usually they have complimentary coffee for guests in the am.) A manager, who apparently was in a meeting, asked if he could help, and went back into the kitchen to get a coffee for him! In November, we stayed there with our friends who were celebrating their 25th wedding anniversary. I happened to mention this to the front desk person when we checked in and later that day, we discovered a delightful plate of cheese, crackers and chocolate covered strawberries. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ladybug912
Reviews.Content: Our second time staying at this hotel. Came for the weekend to celebrate a birthday. (They surprised us and left a bottle of champagne in our room!) The staff is friendly, courteous and go out of their way to please. This small boutique hotel is warm and welcoming. Rooms are extremely clean, stylish and comfortable with probably the best shower I have ever had in a hotel! They have a complimentary wine hour which is fun. Location is perfect for walking everywhere, especially to Fanuel Hall Marketplace and the North End. We will stay here everytime we visit Boston!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a gem”
Reviews.Author: davidosh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend at Nine Zero and we had a tremendous experience. We were down in Boston to celebrate my wife's birthday which I mentioned to the hotel when I made the reservations. Upon check-in we were told that we were being upgraded to the top floor and we were offered wine to bring up to our room. When we got to our room there was a bottle of champagne and chocolates waiting for us. The room was beautiful and the view was amazing. We overlooked the Commons and could see the Charles. Everyone from the valet and the front desk to the house keeping was pleasant and friendly. If you are looking for a place that is clean, comfortable and convenient to everything then this is the place. My wife and I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SRLMA
Reviews.Content: Great location...walk to Fanual Hall and North End. Friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms, outstanding service. Can't go wrong at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mslehmann
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we went to Boston to celebrate my husband's birthday. The hotel was lovely and the staff was friendly. The place was stylish without being pretentious. They left a birthday card and gift in the room, and had a dog bed and bowls waiting for our pup. The location was perfect and allowed us to leave our car parked at a local parking garage for our entire stay. Worth the money for all the thoughtful touches (wine hour, free wi-fi, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay & Staff!”
Reviews.Author: SalFino53
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay & service by the staff. We drove in from NY and had no problems with valet or requesting for the car before we went out. The staff were extremely friendly and eager to help. Upon arrival we upgraded to a corner room with a view for a discounted upcharge since it was available. It was a great choice because the view was worth it. It is located in the heart of town, close to bus tours and sightseeing locations. There are CVS and 7-Elevens located within a block of the hotel if you need to pickup anything. We ate once at the restaurant for breakfast. It was good but expensive. Example about $15 for a bacon, egg, cheese sandwich. Would highly recommend anyone visiting Boston to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella526
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for New Years weekend. This is our second time at Nine Zero. We stayed here the night before our flight in route to Hawaii for our honeymoon. We had a fabulous time!! We were on floor 19 and the view of Boston was incredible!! We saw the fireworks right from our room. Our room was very upscale. If you like boutique hotels, Nine Zero is it! We went to KO for dinner and breakfast, outstanding food! The staff was excellent and knowledge. It was nice that they had added security on New Years... We felt like celebrities, we will definitly be back! Thank you for making our stay awesome:)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Christa_Rocks
Reviews.Content: This is hotel was amazing! The rooms are beautifully furnished, minibar included, and there's a free wine hour in the lobby at 5pm. The on-site restaurant and bar was amazing, I had the lobster stuffed trout and loved it. There's fur-trimmed bedding, tiger stripe robes, fluffy down comforters, and marble bathrooms - I can't imagine a better hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another Wonderful Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandrajoan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many of the Kimpton Hotels and always had a wonderful expereince. The Nine Zero did not disappoint. We booked 4 rooms. They were all different, yet each was lovely. No one had any complaints. Our friends were upgraded to a room with a view which was smaller, but with a great view. All the staff we encountered were the best. Kimpton should be proud of their employees. They are friendly, helpful and very businesslike. No requests were too much trouble. They excelled in hospitality. We would definitely return. P.S. The staff is very well versed in the dining scene. The Italian restaurant they recommended in the North End was the best Italian meal we've ever eaten. Everone agreed. There was not one complaint over the entire stay. If not familiar with Boston, we recommend the city tour. The front desk and conscierge recommend the tour that picks up close to the hotel. A quick walk down the street, and a right to the bus stop. A great place to stay due to the proximity of many attactractions. You could walk to most everything. Accolades to Nine Zero and the Kimpton Organization. P.S. The bar and restaurant (K.O.) was very nice. Great place for an evening cocktail. We enjoyed the breakfast. Good breakfast menu. Did not have time for dinner because of other commitements. Our group is already planning a trip to Kimptons in Washington, D.C. and Chicago in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice treat”
Reviews.Author: DeeZee4
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in, the staff treated us wonderfully. Room was well appointed, clean and the beds tremendously comfortable. Looking forward to returning! Only down point was the wonderful stereo provided was enjoyed a little too much by a neighboring room, but we didn't ask that the staff intervene and they eventually turned down the music. Great military rates too - very much appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel! Great for pets!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nine Zero hotel over Christmas and I must say it is a great hotel with a great location and we will be back the next time we are in Boston! The rooms are very comfortable small but big in relation to other hotels in the city. They also have every thing you need wine glass etc. All I had to do was ask... they brought me a buck of ice and champagne glass for the bottle of champagne I brought. The staff where also wonderful and the concegerie was excellent. We also loved the fact that they had a little bed mat for our dog plus two doggie bowls for his food and water. We where booked on the 18th floor and had amazing views of Boston Commons, the water, Cambridge and the church. I could stay in that room forever with a glass of wine and stare out the window. It was great value for the money and we didn't hesitate to book it because they are so pet friendly. We will be back! Only downside was they bed was so soft it was almost uncomfortable. They probably need to replace the bed we where on.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Nine Zero”
Reviews.Author: ScarboroughFoodie
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel whenever we're in Boston - the location is great - an easy walk to the North End, Fanueil Hall, Newbury Street, Boston Opera House. And the staff is always great - we got an email before our arrival asking if we needed anything. We requested a Keurig coffee maker in the room and it was all set up! Staff are friendly and helpful, and I love all the pets that visit - makes for an interesting time in the lobby watching all the cute dogs!

Reviews.Title: “Our second (and last) stay at the hotel - gone downhill..”
Reviews.Author: nospeel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights at the hotel. The location is fantastic. Room size is average. Somewhat boutique feel to the hotel. We had a few issues - dirty (stained) sheets, no newspaper, ridiculous billing error, and alarm in the middle of the night. We travel a lot - stay at a lot of hotels. And, every hotel will have some issues. My concern is that the responsive of the staff to these issues - particularly the sheets, newspaper and billing error - was indifferent at best. This was not the case in our previous visit - and, not what one should expect at this price/star level. There are many other suitable choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Worth visiting”
Reviews.Author: Sean M
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy to get to. Check in by front desk staff was smooth and both had great people skills. Room was great, clean and everything you could ask for. Not much of a view but sure the higher up rooms would have a great view. I was on the 14th floor. Check-out wasn't so smooth, took a while to find a cooler with lobster, and finally after about 20 minutes it was found but wasn't kept in a freezer as requested and told it would be. However the front desk staff hustled and did a good job locating it and were both professional and had great people skills. I would for sure go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could do better”
Reviews.Author: Bjspencer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on price and the marketing suggested a more boutique feel than he big brand hotels. When checking in I upgraded to a queen suite which was as you woul expect for the price, separate bedroom was great as we were travelling with young children but the TV and sofa area were a bit dated, and the sofa bed for the kids was just OK. Here were a few small touches that the great hotels get right that nine zero didn't and that is why I probably wouldn't go back, I have listed them below. How can you not have coffee or tea or even hot water facilities in the room, this costs so little but makes such a difference when relaxing in the room. If you don't want to offer this in the room have an area where you can get a hot drink in the communal area ( I don't want to go to the Starbucks around the corner for this). When cleaning the room do not leave the blankets for the sofa bed thrown in a bundle in the corner of the room. Have wine gasses in the room, I don't want to drink from tumblers. I will not be watching much TV on my vacation but if I do why would I want to watch a fuzzy picture and where are the channels for kids?

Reviews.Title: “Quick Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: kitkatdaisy
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week at the Nine Zero Hotel. Originally a Bostonian, I was familiar with the location of this hotel which is one block from Boston Common and Downtown Crossing. The hotel is a small, chic boutique hotel. My room was on the 8th floor and while I could see the river and back bay, there was a huge water tower on the adjacent building which was directly in front of my window and blocked alot of the view. The room was not huge, but a nice cozy size. The bathroom was sizable with marble floors, sink and tub area. The bed was very comfortable. I wish there was more of a selection of channels available on the television. Food from room service was a little pricey but very good. I ate one evening at KO Prime. The servers were very friendly and the food was very good. The wine hour offered in the lobby each day was a highlight of the hotel. What a wonderful way to socialize with the other hotel guests. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Boston as it is conveniently located and near most of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent fun choice...big bathrooms for Boston”
Reviews.Author: Done_with_shoveling
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay but likely not our last. The room we stayed in was a deluxe upper floor room. The room size was more than ample and the bathroom very roomy with a well functioning shower and drainage. The linens were very plush and the bed quite comfortable. The wine hour is a nice touch too. This is a very well located hotel. If you are driving in from out of town park at the Boston Common Garage as the nights and weekend rates are a fraction of the cost of valet.

Reviews.Title: “Pup says Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Bella3814
Reviews.Content: Modern Bright Clean and we had a great view of the city. They said dog friendly and they meant it, Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique style hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HarperzMad
Reviews.Content: I like smaller hotels and this hit the spot perfectly. Excellent service with comfortable, well equipped rooms and a delicious continental breakfast. Wine tasting in the evening was welcome after a days shopping and sightseeing. The location is perfect too. Next to the common and within walking distance of most places. Even the Prudential Centre (good for shops) can be reached in about 20 to 30 minutes. The tube system is pretty good and we easily found our way to places like TD Garden for the ice hockey (strongly recommended - go to stubhub.com for tickets).

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Chic - and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Neese39
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Nine Zero for the first time in mid-December. After a somewhat disappointing stay at the Back Bay Hotel a short distance away, we could tell at check-in at Nine Zero that this stay would be different. The front desk staff was attentive, engaged, and very welcoming. Patricia took the time to address our preferences in a helpful and pleasant manner. The room lobby and decor throughout the hotel is unique and functional. The small aquarium outside the lobby level elevators was charming. Funky, functional, whimsical - all of that applies. But we didn't feel, as mid-lifers in sneakers for comfort, that we weren't cool enough to stay there. Bedding and pillows are superior, closet, laptop safe, mini bar and robes a nice touch. Great location for walking to the Common, Quincy, and of course the North End. Our anniversary was acknowledged with a sweet card and some goodies from Patricia, such a nice and increasingly rare gesture. We look forward to our next opportuinity to visit Nine Zero.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LeighHolford
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Nine Zero hotel on the first leg of our journey from Boston to Washington. We were in the hotel for 2 nights. I was thoroughly impressed with all aspects of our stay. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean. The design of the hotel was fairly modern and was to my taste. The staff were extremely helpful and were more than happy to provide details of directions or help with any queries etc. The wine hour was particularly enjoyable within an inviting environment. Also, the hotel was situated perfectly for walking around downtown Boston and I would certainly recommend this for anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton get it right”
Reviews.Author: DMTM
Reviews.Content: Second Kimpton Hotel stay in a week, and, glad to say, another jewel. Super helpful staff, Thomas the bellman and Gabriella on front desk, the standouts from a great team. Funky but functional (the description for this chain) Everything works, beautifully. Great restaurant. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: rchavarria86
Reviews.Content: I walk in and the first thing that caught my eye was the Gucci "a gift shop?" I asked. "No sir our concept is style we can book the personal shopper for you if you'd like" .....I almost shed a tear lol! Spring Break, St. Patty's, and it's my first time in Boston and I stayed here. Can't and won't say enough about this hotel. Amazing modern art museum look. Room was beautiful, up high and over looked Boston Commons. K & O was fantastic and the staff were very attentive to my friend and I the concierges were a dream team. It rained bad 3 of the 4 days but we made the best of it. Chic, eclectic, minimal, and cool all at the same time. Location was almost to good to be true especially for a 1st timer. Dont change a thing NZ!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: WalesSid
Reviews.Content: just returned from a four night stay at Nine Zero Hotel. Excellent! Room was well appointed & clean. The staff were extremely helpful couldn't do enough for you. Walking to our room after check in we could hear a dog barking & I hadn't told my husband it was a pet friendly hotel, he was horrified and said there was no way he was putting up with that but thankfully we only heard a bark for a little while! Phew!! the position of the hotel was excellent and really couldn't have been in a better spot. Wine hour was a very nice touch. One evening we didn't make the wine hour and when we went to reception the receptionist asked us if we'd like a glass of wine as we weren't there. I was so nice that she had noticed. Another evening I asked another receptionist about a show as it was our anniversary and would like to do something different but as it was a Monday there was nothing on so we went to the pictures instead, when we got back to our room she had sent up strawberries and a card. As I just mentioned, it was our anniversary and on arrival we had strawberries &wine in our room. Every thing about our stay was 1st class but I must say the staff in the hotel made it extra special. Thank you Nine Zero!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: pensfan58
Reviews.Content: I was here on business and pleasure, and actually worked out of my room for a few days. No one bothered me and the staff was at tentative when needed. My only complaint would be no coffee maker in the room (although available upon request). The front desk was helpful when I locked myself out of the room and in splitting the business invoice from the personal stay. Te room was comfy, bed great and it was very clean. Great location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Benchmark!”
Reviews.Author: bsiace
Reviews.Content: We switched over to the Nine Zero after two days at a large business chain in the financial district. Best move of our trip! Great staff, small but very well appointed rooms that were very clean with all the details looked after. Great location near the common and the North End. Do yourself a favor, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: debpeckdanville
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero Hotel is a top-notch hotel sporting lovely rooms and an incredible staff. We couldn't have been happier with our overall experience. Hats off to the Nine Zero employees who went above and beyond for us...the memories of our time at this incredible hotel will always bring smiles to our faces as we share our experience with family, friends and colleagues. The next time we visit Boston, we will most definitely be staying at Nine Zero!!! Give this hotel a try...you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BlairE33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week at this hotel as part of our holiday from Australia. It lived up to everything it promised on its website. The decor was stunning and from the moment we checked in, the staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in a King Premier View Room and the extended stay rate was very reasonable for the spacious room and bathroom. It was spotlessly clean and well maintained for our time there. The mini-bar had everything you could want. We ate a number of meals at the restaurant, both breakfast and dinner, and enjoyed the menu, the food and the service. The Concierge was very helpful in assisting us to book tours and plan out our tourist time. The location, almost on Bostom Common and walking distance from Beacon Hill, provided great walks. It was also an easy walk to the waterfront. We could not find fault with this hotel and happily recommend it to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zero Went the Extra Mile”
Reviews.Author: hearttropical
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to the Nine Zero this weekend to celebrate his birthday. This was the second time we stayed at the hotel. The valet and the front desk were super friendly. They upgraded our room so we had a beautiful view of the city. The front desk had asked what the purpose of our stay was and I told them we were here to celebrate my fiance's birthday (I'm sort of a big mouth!). They said happy birthday and that was that...or so we thought! The location of this hotel is perfect and I would recommend it to anyone who preferred to walk to all the sites instead of paying for cabs or navigating the T. We were able to walk through the Commons to dinner and enjoy probably the last warm night for awhile! When we came back to our room we were extremely surprised to what we came back to (We seriously thought we had gone to the wrong room). We came back to music, cheese and crackers and a bottle of champagne! There was also a card to my fiance thanking him for spending his birthday at the Nine Zero! It was unbelievably thoughtful! They really went the extra mile to make sure our stay was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Simply great”
Reviews.Author: german_in_nyc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at this hotel over the course of 5 years and enjoyed it tremendously both times. It is a very stylish, and comfortable hotel. The rooms are modern, cozy and quiet. The staff is attentive, and the location is just perfect. There is a very popular wine happy hour in the lounge, from which you can overlook Tremont Street. Perfect for a pleasant stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel! Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shelma0326
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nine Zero for 4 nights for both work and pleasure. The staff was very friendly, always saying hi when you walked through the lobby, and eager to please if you had any questions. The room was very nice and very clean. I LOVED the decorating in both the room and the common spaces of the hotel Not much of a view from our room, but that didn't bother us at all. The pressure in the shower was great!! The only minor negative things are the lack of a coffee pot in the room, and you had to pay in excess of $10.00 a day for Wi -Fi service. We walked down the street to Bruggers and got both coffee and free Wi-Fi. The best part of this hotel is its central location. Less than a 10 minute walk to any major attraction in Boston. We will definately stay at this property again when we visit Boston. I would recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nine Zero, Boston”
Reviews.Author: dia1411
Reviews.Content: My wife & I love visiting Boston, we travel from Texas every summer to enjoy the city & catch a Red Sox game. For the past 3 trips in a row, we have stayed ath the Hotel Nine Zero. It is everything you expect from Kimpton - stylish decor, clean modern rooms, friendly & attentive service. For the price of other hotels in this area & around the Common, Hotel Nine Zero is great. We found the location to be perfect, 2 blocks from the Public Garden/Boston Common, and right on the Freedom Trail. It's about a 10 minute walk to Quincy Market. Every evening around 5pm they have a wine & cheese hour for the guests. Haven't sampled the restaurant, but there is a great pub with food just across the street. All in all, clean rooms, cool design and great location.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amykb12
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in, we were impressed... the staff was fantastic and the rooms were immaculate, well decorated, and had a wonderful, subtle scent. The wine happy hour was a nice touch (free wine in the hotel lobby each evening), as was the complimentary continental breakfast. The valet folks were pleasant and were always eager to get whatever we needed, whether the car or a taxi. The hotel is situated right on the Freedom Trail, so the location could not be better! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at Nine Zero”
Reviews.Author: chopandmick
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero Hotel is perfectly located to the Freedom Trail, theatre district and surrounded by plenty of night life. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The concierge recommended restaurants in the area and make our reservations for us. Every recommendation was on point. Nine Zero is a classy, five stars hotel from the minute we walked-in to the minute we checked-out. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jnewshel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Nine Zero for a weekend getaway in November. The hotel was great overall. The staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms was well appointed, clean, and had all the amenities. Loved the bathroom and bed. The fitness center was small, but efficient. The restaurant was pretty with good service and a nice little bar. There are free newspapers each morning and a wine happy hour every evening. The location was just perfect. Boston Common was just out the front door and it was about 15 minutes from Faneuil Hall. We walked to Copley Square, Newbury Street, the North End - it all was easy accessible. If you don't want to do as much walking, there is a T stop outside. My only suggestion is to ask for a high floor - facing away from the bell tower. We were on the 4th floor and heard the t rumbling by constantly. We were also facing a cemetary and a bell tower which rang every morning, every 15 minutes. It was quite annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: chrisred82
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time researching Boston hotels and narrowed my choice down to two. I emailed both of them and chose Nine Zero when they replied to me in minutes compared to days in the other hotels case! It is in a great location making all of Bostons main attractions very accessible. When we checked in the welcome on reception was very warm and we were upgraded to a grand view room (I think, number was 1805 if you would like to request it) which had huge windows offering a beautiful view over Boston. The hotel is very modern and clean and runs a very popular wine hour until 6pm which is worth going to to chat to other guests or get a glass to take back to your room. The bar is very cool if a little pricey but I don't mind paying for quality. Overall I definitely recommend this hotel for all types of people whatever the purpose of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great style!”
Reviews.Author: daboken
Reviews.Content: Went up to Boston to enjoy a nice weekend with the wife and could not have picked a better place to stay! Service was exceptional, the room was trendy and comfortable and the wine reception was a really nice touch. Really enjoyed our stay there and what a view!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JohnWoodford
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; and stylish. But even premier room was surprisingly small: no proper place for empty luggage. We were given the wrong type of room initially; but the mistake was put right when we pointed it out.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME STAFF”
Reviews.Author: desp4vacay
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night with my family of four in the Nine Zero Hotel. From the moment we drove up, every single staff member was beyond helpful, friendly and delightful. That said, we were a little surprised by the $42/day parking charge. I joined the Kimpton In Touch rewards program so I had been made aware of a great deal going on with rooms starting at $129. Well of course it wasn't that cheap, we got a Queen Queen Room with a beautiful city view for $259. We took it anyway because we had read great things about it. We were going to look at Boston colleges for our daughter and decided it was worth it. We walked in the door and everyone from the valet person to the bell man to Gabriella, the front desk manager, was incredibly friendly and helpful. Gabriella was kind enough to give us coupons for $20 off dinner at their restaurant KO Prime (not that teen friendly, a little steep for burgers and fries), 4 coupons for free continental breakfast, 2 free drink coupons since we missed the wine reception, and $10 to use for the mini bar. We felt like celebrities. The room was quiet, and very "swanky" but one of the two queen beds was very well worn; the mattress was quite indented. Also the toilet had a little thing it did after each flush; made some interesting noises that might have alarmed someone that didn't know to jiggle the handle and wait a moment. The decor is so trendy and modern, you just can't help but feel really cool in there. We had a great trip and sadly had to cut it short, but I would definitely recommend this hotel and would go back myself. I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because of the mattress and the bathroom. Let's face it, we got a deal but if I was paying upward of $450/night, I would not want to be rolling into the middle of a mattress because it was too soft on one side. Can't comment on kid's activities because our kids are too old for the stuff they offer but it seems they do try to cater to young kids, we saw a stroller or two and in fact we also saw several people traveling with their pets. Not a fan of that personally, but I guess if I just couldn't leave Fido home, why not pay big bucks to give him some kibble from the room service menu?? :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Boston Secret!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonFrances_1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fabulous as it is just a block up from the Boston Common. One can safely walk around the neighbourhoods to see the Beacon Hill area or the Theatre district. It always feels like I'm returning to "home away from home" when I arrive there. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They go out of their way to make you feel like you're family. I like the fact that they have a decent BATH TUB! The products are also wonderful and they provide you with a work-out kit if you're interested in doing yoga stretches in your room. The rooms are also very quiet so you can sleep at odd hours. The adjacent restaurant is excellent. i love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Gwaliagirl
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 2 night stay celebrating our 3rd anniversary. Staff went out of their way to be helpful (thanks Victor - do you ever sleep?!). When we arrived in our room - top floor on the corner, amazing views! - we were greeted by a bottle of champagne, chocolate-covered strawberries and a sweet note of congratulations from the Concierge (alas, the note said there would be sparkling water for me, since I'm pregnant, but there was none to be had). It was such a nice touch. The room was great for two. It was not huge, and had a queen-sized bed, but that is what we're used to, so it wasn't a problem. I did see some signs of wear in the room - chipped corners of desk drawers, paint touch-ups that didn't quite match the original paint job - but the room was very clean and bright. My complaints about the facilities are really quite minimal. I do wish the bathroom lights were on a dimmer, since the overhead light in the otherwise excellent shower (stall, but plenty big!) shined brightly in my eyes whenever I tipped my head back to rinse. Again, I'm being nit-picky here, the room and facilities were lovely. The room was quiet too - we did hear our neighbor's door open and shut a few times, but that was it. We enjoyed the complimentary wine hour (well, my husband did - I had lemon water, which was always available in the lobby). The hotel is a great home base to explore Boston. I've stayed all over the city and really, this location can't be beat. You're literally steps from the Park and State Street T stops, you're literally around the corner from fabulous shopping, dining and sight-seeing. The hotel is situated at the corner of the Boston Common, and if you're happy walking (Boston is very walkable!) you can really enjoy the sights. We had a fabulous stay. We'd definitely recommend this hotel to folks looking for a nice stay in Boston. And we hope to return ourselves! Kudos to the staff for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “I've found my favorite Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: rednikki
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The location can't be beat - it's one block from Park Street. Our room was quite spacious for a Boston hotel. The TV was a little dated (CRT rather than flatscreen), but we weren't coming to Boston to watch TV. Loved the decor and the quietness. The lighting fixtures look great, but it was hard to figure out how to turn some of them on! Wine hour was lovely as always.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and modern room”
Reviews.Author: jtaw
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in Boston. Stayed in July 2011 with my sister. Two double beds, very modern furniture, great bathroom (but bad shower curtain - need glass doors). Stayed on one of the upper floors, but had no view (well of the neighbouring building). Service is spectacular - they complimentarily press your clothing, for free and then refuse a tip for the service. Love that. Never tried the wine reception. I like the water in the lobby (with fresh orange/lemon in it) - very refreshing in the July summer! The hotel is also very very centrally located. It is quite expensive, but is definitely one of the better Boston hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Stay”
Reviews.Author: domotofu
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was quite happy with my stay here. We arrived later in the evening than planned since we crawled through heavy traffic from NY due to the unseasonably intense snowstorm. We were quite tired. The woman at the front desk was courteous and very nice. She had us quickly checked in and offered us a glass of wine (this was way past the wine reception hour) to help unwind after the ordeal! Like others mentioned, it's very easy to miss the hotel. I saw the sign for the Omni Parker Hotel first which clued me in that 9-0 was coming up. I never spotted the 9-0 sign, but I did see the KO cow sign for their steakhouse so I knew the hotel was right there on that corner. Having read another review, I told my friend to make a left into the side street for valet parking. There's no way of knowing otherwise! No signs at all until you've passed it...and only if you're looking hard (it's on the column post). It's a pretty busy area (depending on the time you arrive) so it's no fun to have to go around and come back for a 2nd attempt. Tremont is a one way street. The hotel being a Kimpton is pet friendly, and I saw plenty of dogs. Last year, I stayed at Kimpton's Marlowe in Cambridge across the Charles River and saw only 1 or 2 dogs. I also liked that the decor at 9-0 is more restrained. None of the loud leopard prints (not my style) found at Marlowe. The hotel wasn't too busy but not sure whether it's because it's a bit off season now or whether the weather kept people away. It was nicely quiet, and I only heard the neighbor's door close at night and in the morning. The cleaning crew was not particularly loud. This hotel seems to be following the trend of scenting the public areas (particularly the elevator). I'm not too keen on this, and I found the elevator to be a wee bit strongly scented as if someone wearing strong perfume had just exited. I prefer subtle to no scents but have experienced worse so I considered it acceptable. We really liked our room which had two queen beds with a view of the city. It was adequately spacious given the prime downtown location. I only felt cramped in that I had no good spot to put my luggage. My friend by the window was fine but I was right up against the door. I ended putting the luggage rack up against the bed (so as not to block the door). Problem is the bed would prevent my luggage from fully opening as it would push against the top. So when I needed to access it, I would pull the rack out and push it back in when done. At least I had a workaround. The view was fabulous overlooking the commons and the city beyond. We were on the 18th floor which is nearly at the top. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the windows actually open! It was nice to get a bit of fresh breezy air in. Not that it was stuffy. The desk was outfitted with the essentials but not much else. Fine for me. I did like the desk chair which appeared to be adjustable (unless it was broken ;) haha!). It was comfortable but supportive. I didn't care for the faux feathery blanket on the bed. It looks nice as a decorative item, but from a hygienic standpoint...I quickly took it off the bed. ;) I doubt it gets a regular cleaning because the tag said dry clean. =O The bed was comfy and we had 4 pillows each. They're not all the same so keep switching them out until you find one you like. That was a pleasant discovery as I once stayed at a hotel where they had nothing but fat pillows (I asked) that made my neck hurt. I didn't sleep a wink there. =( Be forewarned that there is a feather mattress pad. Mine had feathers escaping. Not realizing this, I was disturbed to be poked in the dark by the linens. I feared I was sleeping on unclean linens littered with crusty stains (yes, it's happened to me elsewhere). It was only the hard end of the feathers. Phew! After pushing them back in, it was smooth (literally) sleeping. Like other Kimptons, there is no coffee/hot water maker. You must call it up. I didn't need it this time so it was ok, but I understand how people would be upset not knowing this detail. I don't know why they do this except for cost savings? I hope it also means the devices are cleaner being under their watch which I would consider to be the greatest perk (hint! hint! if you're reading Kimpton!). FYI, the prices for the mini bar items are on the reverse side of the big square paper with the hotel name. I thought it was a giant coaster so I didn't think to look at it. The bathroom was spacious with a pivoting (looked like it) mirror. The shower was nice and hot with decent pressure. The faucets though were odd. At the sink, you need to turn them opposite of what's normal (clockwise?) but at the tub, it was the normal direction (anti-clockwise?). One niggle with the shower faucet is that there is no indicator of how far you must turn to get the right temperature as it's not a lever with clear stops on either end. Once you figure it out, you can enjoy the fixture as it matches the sink and is not the ho-hum typical ones. =) For me, 2 to 2.5 full turns was just right. Volume control is the little lever by the way. ;) I didn't care for the toiletries as the scent was a bit too strong for me. The bar soap is the type that leaves that oily feeling after rinsing which I don't like. In the tub, that translates to a bit of slipperiness on the feet. I quickly washed it off and then was fine. My only real complaint about 9-0 is the cleaning staff. The shampoo, conditioner and lotion are in tubes. I used the lotion shortly after arriving. There was a foil seal under the cap indicating unused. When I showered later, I opened the shampoo cap but found no foil seal. Hmm...is that because you're in the tub and it would be cumbersome to remove with wet hands? Plus where would you put the foil aside from flinging it somewhere in the bathroom? Turns out the conditioner had a foil seal so clearly the cleaning staff did not do their job on replacing the used shampoo. =( Either way, I think it's a silly idea to have people remove tiny foil seals in the shower. I'm sure some have washed down the drain. I kept mine half attached. ;) As for the location, it's truly a prime spot. You have many T stations at your disposal. Park St (by the Commons) for the Red, Green and Orange (if you know how to find it) lines, Downtown Crossing (with its many shops in the area) for the Orange line and Government Center for the Blue line (not too far). Of course all the landmark spots are nearby. The entire area is a great for walking with the lovely buildings, history, upscale and not upscale shopping, delicious eats, theatres and of course for strolls through the park. We didn't get to eat at KO. We'd planned for Sunday brunch but turns out they're closed then! The woman at the front desk suggested Scollay Square to us which I'd read prior to arriving that it was pretty good. A short walk. Much to my delight, I found that Mooo, the steakhouse is right next door. Perhaps Mooo was not mentioned because it is part of the XV Beacon Hotel. Haha! It was as delicious as I'd expected. We had no reservations obviously, but it wasn't a problem. I'm not so sure they could have taken us if it were a Saturday night. Though just a weekend jaunt, we had a very pleasant stay and would stay here again. The staff are very courteous and accommodating to your needs. Boston is a wonderful city, and I never tire of visiting it. I just might try the Onyx Hotel (the other Boston Kimpton) out of curiosity the next time I'm in town. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff made it a special stay”
Reviews.Author: Brigid B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night of our wedding and had an amazing experience. The staff greeted us with champagne and took us up to the room which was outfitted with flowers, snacks and more champagne! The views from the room were gorgeous, the staff is friendly and you cannot get a better location for a trip to Boston. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area. Thank you Kimpton for once again providing a terrific experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: vacationtimereviews
Reviews.Content: Happy to report the hotel was great. Lots of extras....started out with me phoning the hotel ahead to get some info on travel arrangements and the front desk staff was really helpful (she'd also been on a cruise to Bermuda and we shared info). Arrived early and because the room wasn't ready they said they would call...and they did. Really good sized room, came back to room in eve and had wine and cheese to greet us. The restaurant in the hotel had really good food and they do little extras as well....free little appy and cookies to finish. The signage on the hotel outside is really small and not very easy to see so make sure you give the taxi driver the address and he will then know where you want to go. We bid on this hotel... (expedia/hotwire , quincy market area), so didn't know what we were getting ( a little scary), but so worth it.!! Would stay here again...the 'T' is really close and we felt really safe. Also, they have really, really great pillows....and if you wanted more selection, you could choose from about 6 more I think!!

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton deliver again”
Reviews.Author: Pressure_Drop
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Nine Zero knowing they were part of the Kimpton Group - we have previously stayed at the Argonaut in San Francisco which was wonderful, and yet again Kimpton didn't let us down. Check in was swift although our room wasn't ready but we had a couple of beers in the Beantown pub next door which went down fine after our long flight from England, all the reception staff were great but I particularly remember Patricia and here lovely smile. The room was sizeable with an incredibly comfortable bed and usual funky bathrobes, good bathroom and shower and decent TV which was housed in a built in unit so not a problem it not being a flatscreen. Free wireless which is always a bonus. No tea/coffee making facilities but for us early risers not a problem getting a decent hot cup of tea in the restaurant in the morning. The complimentary drinks between 5pm and 6pm go down well but it was only wine, if I remember correctly it was also beer in the Argonaut - either way it's a nice way to meet fellow guests. The location of the Nine Zero couldn't be bettered, just across from Boston Common and right on the Freedom trail, all in all a great hotel if not quite up to the standard of the Argonaut but even so I would still highly recommend it, the staff alone make it worthwhile. It was a great start to our New England roadtrip - the Nine Zero is a great hotel and Boston a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girlfriend Getaway.”
Reviews.Author: Jane F
Reviews.Content: In September, three best friends travelled to Boston for our 50th Birthdays. My neice had recommended Nine Zero and everything she said was true. From the moment we arrived until we left- the amazing staff helping us celebrate our birthdays. The room was spotless, the beds comfortable and the wine hours, was something we looked forward to. The staff was extremely helpful at all times and always offered great suggestions. The service from all the staff there was spectacular. We would love to return again and would not hesitate to encourage others to give Nine Zero a try. As a side note- Boston is a great city to shop in!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: jenmark14
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and great location. Subway, tours, etc are near the hotel. Nice staff and clean rooms. I will come back to this hotel if ever in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Right on the Freedom Trail”
Reviews.Author: BSL68
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location for Boston sightseeing. Beautiful boutique hotel. Staff was fantastic - we were even welcomed at check-in with glass of wine (much-needed after a long drive)! Room was beautifully decorated, though rather small, and not much of a view. Very clean, great shower, very comfy bed. Attempted dinner at the restaurant but they were fully booked for the night. Room service food was excellent and much more enjoyable anyway, being freshly showered and settling in with our wine. Parking is only via valet, at $42/night (no big surprise in abig city) and was tough to get to - valet entrance is on a tiny side street at the corner of the hotel and easy to miss. With all the one-way streets, if you pass it up you'll have a heck of a time getting back to it - speaking from experience.

Reviews.Title: “good until the last night”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Julie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the nine zero as part of our 30th wedding anniversary trip to the US. Boston is a great city and the vibe was good as soon as we arrived. The hotel was a $20-25 ride from Logan airport. It is very centrally located to just about all the city has to offer. We were given a bottle of wine on arrival, for our anniversary, from Patricia at the front desk whom we found more than helpful. The room was not as large as previous hotels on our trip, we had trouble locating a position for our two suitcases that was not in the way. The room itself was very nice although there were no facilities for making coffee in the room. I joined the Kimpton club to take advantage of the free wi-fi for members. This was very good. My main problem with the hotel was on the last night there was a function held in the lobby. Guests were ushered through a back door by staff, who seemed to be there to make sure that you kept moving and would not interfer with the function. The noise generated by the function was quite loud. We were on the 10th floor and could feel the thump from the base music. It would have been unbearable on the lower floors. The music continued until around midnight. I feel the hotel management was treating the guests with contempt for hosting this event. They are either a hotel or event management establishment. We paid a considerable amount to stay at the hotel and did not appreciate the inconveinance from the hotel, especially when we had to catch an early flight the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel violated credit card merchant agreement (plus design nightmare)”
Reviews.Author: cjstephens
Reviews.Content: When I checked into the hotel, the clerk demanded to see photo ID. When I declined, he got all huffy and told me it was to prevent credit card fraud. I explained that demanding to see photo ID violated the credit card merchant agreement. He didn't seem to care. What was particularly odd was that I had pre-paid for the two night stay, so I was handing over my credit card only to guarantee payment on incidentals (like the mini-bar that no one touches, I suppose). I complained to management, which replied that the policy was to prevent credit card fraud, but they completely ignored the fact that they were violating the terms under which they are allowed to use credit cards. If they are ignoring these (really rather important) rules, you have to wonder what other rules they are ignoring. If they think it's OK to put their guests in danger of identity theft (which is why they aren't allowed to ask for ID), maybe they are cutting corners with fire safety, too? Maybe they don't thing that building codes are something they need to comply with? Two other complaints: the motto for this property is "Inspired by Design". The rooms are certainly distinctive, and while the decor is easy on the eyes, it is anything but practical. For example, my room had a wing-back chair that had all sorts of wacky odd proportions that made it look like something out of Alice in Wonderland. The problem with this is that it also made the chair really uncomfortable to sit in. There was also a bed spread that looked like it was covered in feathers, but you had to wonder how they keep this thing clean - dry clean after every guest comes through? The bathroom had very clean, simple lines, but that meant there was nowhere to hang your towels after you used them. Your average Marriott may never be featured in Architectural Digest, but you'll have a more comfortable stay. Finally, the location on Tremont Street was convenient for the T, but at night it can be a little seedy, with lots of teenagers and panhandlers hanging out nearby. You're better off staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: vegeterian
Reviews.Content: We arrived here during the time for the complimentary afternoon wine reception and we were greeted at the front desk by a friendly staff person who asked us if we would like a glass of wine and when we said "yes" she brought it to us while we finished checking in! The entire time we stayed here (4 nights) we found the entire staff extremely warm and friendly and immediately helpful with everything we asked. Our room was fairly small, but very tasteful in a modern way and we had a large bathroom. The view from our room was an office building next door and it was so close, we could watch the people working there type on their computers. We were not there for the view, so it did not matter. The location of this hotel is fantastic. The weather was beautiful and we walked to all the sites in the historic district, including the entire freedom trail. It was also convenient for many good choices for dinner. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone sightseeing in Boston. Also, it is close to 2 subway stops and one day we took the subway (transferring to the commuter rail) to Salem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: nonrevver
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice hotel with a modern look and feel in a great spot. Easy walking distance to shopping a couple blocks away, short walk to the North End for great local Italian food, and a couple of different T-stops nearby to get around town quickly. Service is excellent with 24 hour room service available. Room is decent sized and well appointed. It does still have a cathode ray TV which I find odd for this type of hotel class, but it was fine. It's not a huge hotel so it never feels crowded, or there are long lines for checkout and there's also access to KO Prime steakhouse located downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great position.”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: First hotel on our trip to New England. Very good. Fairly standard room for a city centre hotel (i.e. basic, relatively small, but clean and functional) and within easy walking distance of many city sights such as Quincy Market and the main Tourist Information office. Would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service, fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RHLM
Reviews.Content: After an incredibly trying road trip from New York (our fault for heading over on Labour Day weekend!), my husband and I arrived after 6pm (previous ETA had been 2.30pm!). Tired and jaded, we were greeted by the awesome staff, who took our car and bags and immediately brought me a glass of wine and my husband a beer... This was just the start of their fabulous service. It was our honeymoon and we went to our room to find champagne and chocolate strawberries waiting for us. We took full advantage of the great consierge service, listening to their advice on tours to take and letting them book us into restaurants they recommended.
