The room was fabulous, although the gym was a little bit small. With a complimentary wine reception each evening, hotel Nine Zero was an absolute gem of an hotel, a small boutique feel in a large hotel- PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitdha
Reviews.Content: This hotel was above my expectation. Hotel is in the center of most of the tourist attraction. The staffs are courteous and friendly. The room was clean and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly & great location”
Reviews.Author: DBtraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed for 3 nights after picking hotel from reviews on TA. Its a modern hotel, very comfortable fairly spacious rooms (We had a corner room overlooking the Granary Burial Ground- not that spooky). Bed & bedding extremely comfortable, plenty of lighting, armchairs, iPod alarm & DVD player,safe,free wi-fi (If you join Kimpton in-touch loyalty scheme), iron & ironing board. Bathroom large with a great large walking shower. Good quality complimentary toiletries. Minor issue was hairdryer only had a 2foot lead so one had to bend down to use the dryer and the mirror at the same time. Staff extremely friendly & helpful - suggested alternate nearby locations for breakfast (we followed advice & had one breakfast at Paramount Breakfast Bar - Charles St. great for good value omelette, home fries etc). Nice touch was complimentary wine every evening 5-7pm (1, 2 or more glasses if you wished) But the real benefit was the location close to Boston Common, Faneuil Hall and right on Freedom Trail. Would stay there again. Good quality accommodation at good price (Booked via net but some months in advance)

Reviews.Title: “Location , Location , Location”
Reviews.Author: Chinpolo
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed here for a copl nights during the summer, really great hotle tucked away right beside the Kings Chapel. Just short walking distance from the Fenel Hall, very interesting . Rooms were well appointed, amenities great and the Bed was sooooooo comfortable. Staffe were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, but very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: cardifftravellers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for four nights. We arrived there a bit early but could check in straight away, we were given breakfast vouchers which we were not expecting. The receptionist came around to the front of the desk to show us where the lifts were, which was a nice touch, and told us that wine was served between 5.00 and 6.00pm every day in the reception area. The room was excellent, lovely large bed with feather pillows, I was a bit worried as the interior is very modern, but all the furniture was very comfortable, including two lovely armchairs in the bedroom. The only downside was that we didn't have a view, but there again we were out every day. We went down to the reception area at 5.00pm and had more than one glass of wine! a very nice touch. Benjamin the "bellboy" was more than helpful, he really couldn't do enough, he would suggest where to go and eat and he always asked us if we had enjoyed our day. Would we stay there again, definately.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: exmarsa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at this classy hotel perfectly situated in downtown Boston. The doormen and receptionists greeted us with a smile as did the three canines at check-in. The pooches were never seen or heard thereafter. Maybe they did not want to leave their comfortable rooms. Ours was of ample size with a modern minimalist decor which may not be to everyone's taste. Room and bath were clean and well maintained. Great shower with good water flow. All the essential amenities. The view out the window was of the offices across the street - not a problem in itself (especially on the weekend when they were empty), but would probably splurge next time for a room with a real view. One advantage to being on the little side street is that the room was quiet and we got a good night's sleep on the comfy bed. We could see Sam Adams' grave from the room by looking down the street - which leads to this hotel's best feature: its location. It is within easy walking distance to several of Boston's prime attractions and convenient to the financial district and Government Center. Our only disappointment was that the food at dinner at the hotel restaurant - KO Prime - was entirely forgettable. Overall, a pleasant stay. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive, professional and personal service from top Kimpton team”
Reviews.Author: 17veritas2011
Reviews.Content: We've been guests at Nine Zero four times in the past year and it gets better each time. The front desk/concierge team work to ensure an excellent guest experience. Andrew, John, and Gabriella are among the best Kimpton staff we've worked with. Location is ideal for financial district, all historic sites, walking anywhere... and the T is directly across the street for easy access to many routes. We take the red line right in to Cambridge; no need for a car when you stay at the Nine Zero. Bedding is quite comfortable and some rooms have a nice view of Boston Common. For us, it's a much better experience than staying at the larger chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Same thing Happened to me. Over Charged.”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang V
Reviews.Content: This is a good chain but they have a bad location right smack in the middle of a depressed area swarming with angry homeless wanna-be doormen. I do not get upset when a hotel overcharges me or adds things like a mini-bar that we never touched, all those things are sorted out. However the accounting department never can be reached. We overheard someone at KO-Prime on Friday that appeared to work for the hotel say that they have big problems with that department. Still the rooms do look like an Ikea showroom and the place is so small you can hear every ambulance and fire truck screaming down the street. I wish I had read the reviews before my assistant booked me in this room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant hotel, ideally situated.”
Reviews.Author: lizcee
Reviews.Content: We booked the "Fall into bed" package which included one night luxury queen accommodation for 2, up to 50$ in room breakfast allowance, free valet parking and 2pm checkout, which was excellant for us as we had a late evening flight out of Boston. After booking online we received an email offering a free room upgarde for 15$ if available, on arrival, we opted for this. We arrived about 1pm after a long drive, car taken, no probs, unable to check in till after 3pm but able to leave bags, great so went off sightseeing. Arrived back after 4pm to an upgrade to a lovely luxury king size room, views not too good but ok for one night. Later we realised they hadn't mentioned the breakfast allowance at checkin so we enquired on our way out, they had too look this up and then give us the details, we also checked we had 2pm checkout. Next morning lovely breakfast arrived as ordered. Housekeeping tried to get into our room about 9.30pm. We left the do not disturb on our door. At 1pm we received phone call from Housekeeping asking if we were going to stay another night we informed them that we had a 2pm checkout. Checked out and asked if we could leave bags till later, no probs. Went back 6pm got our bags and asked for car, we were then charged 10$ as we had left our car past 2pm. We had not seen any details informing us of this and no-one had mentioned this this before, but we paid. Also they do advertise luxury toiletries which are soap, shampoo, hair conditioner and moisturiser, no shower or bath gel which do not even appear on their list of items to ask for if forgotten!! Overall a lovely last night in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Willow_1974
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Boston and we booked the Nine Zero Hotel based on the trip advisor reviews. Firstly the negative points. We had some problems when dealing with the reception staff. On checking into the hotel the receptionist thought we were only staying for 4 nights instead of 5. She didn't seem to understand the pre-paid voucher which we had been provided with by our travel agent. The voucher clearly stated we had 5 nights booked - we also had our e-ticket with us as proof of this. The receptionist advised us that she would need to check the booking with the travel agent and that she would let us know if we â€œowed them any moneyâ€�. I must assume that she was dubious of our booking as, at this point, she only provided us with breakfast vouchers for 4 nights. The next day we spoke to the receptionist again to check if everything was sorted and she said that it was, however I still had to ask for the additional breakfast vouchers. The day before departure we requested a late check-out and were advised that this wasn't a problem. We were told that there was usually a charge but that on this occasion the charge would be waived. On our day of departure we arrived back at the hotel after doing some last minute shopping only to find our room key cards were no longer working. Given our previous experience we did not find this surprising. We had to return to reception and explain our situation in order to have the key cards reactivated. When we came to check-out we once again dealt with the same receptionist. She had apparently forgotten about our problem on check-in and said that we had pre-paid for one night and that we still owed the balance for the other four. I had to remind her that our accommodation was all pre-paid (via the voucher). After much keyboard tapping and staring at a screen she then announced that everything was fine and we were free to go. I understand that the staff deal with a lot of different people but we spoke to the same receptionist 4 times during our stay and she did not remember us. I feel this is a very important customer care issue. When I got home I didn't have much confidence that I wouldn't be charged twice for staying at the hotel so I contacted my travel agent immediately. Luckily I was only charged for the expected items. Now the positives. The hotel is in an ideal position just off Boston Common. Our room was on the 16th floor with a spectacular view of the river and city. On arrival, there was a complimentary bottle of wine with cheese, biscuits and fruit and a lovely note from house keeping. The room was huge with an absolutely wonderful, extremely comfortable bed. Breakfast is served until 11am during the week and 12pm at the weekend which is fantastic if you want to have a relaxing holiday. We had the continental breakfast which consisted of fresh fruit juice, water, coffee/tea, croissant, muffin and mixed fruit which was a perfect way to start the day. I would have no hesitation in staying in the Nine Zero again, it was just a shame that the issue with reception put somewhat of a dampener on what was otherwise an excellent holiday.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: beedeejoe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Friendly helpful staff. Our 16th floor room was very quiet, did not hear anything outside the room. We had the coffee maker in the room and daily local paper delivered to the room each day. Also enjoyed the daily wine event in the late afternoon. Location is central to all historical sites, T stop is about a block away. Hotel had bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries sent up to our room for our anniversary. We stayed in a king view room, had a great view of Boston Commons. Hotel KO restaurant was closed 2 of our 4 nights there, but MOOO just around the corner was a fabulous place! Sun & Mon nights they have $35 prix fix menu available. Also, Lounge 6b across from MOOO has a wonderful spiced pumpkin martini! Nine Zero is our choice for our next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay in a Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nchacer
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Ben took our bags to our room - the 19th floor! View of the common was great, could see across Charles River and beyond. Staff all great (especially Ben.) Disappointed that restaurant KO Prime was not open two of the three nights we were there, but Ben (yes, Ben again) recommended Moooo at XV Beacon. Wonderful beyond description. Will seek out a Kimpton again, also stayed at the Argonaut in San Francisco - different but same quality.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Kimpton Hotels and Nine Zero Is No Exception.”
Reviews.Author: Bic20
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Nine Zero twice and Kimpton Hotels in Philadelphia and Seattle as well. Even though they are part of a chain each hotel has a distinct personality (although they all have a wine tasting and animal print robes!). Nine Zero is sleek and stylish. The rooms and bathrooms are adequate size and the beds are excellent. The staff is enthusiastic and friendly. The location is also perfect for us because it is within easy walkiing distance of the Quincy Market area, the North End and Back Bay. It is also convenient to the major transportation hubs of North Station, South Station and Downtown Crossing. This is our hotel whenever we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: Offthetouristtrack
Reviews.Content: For our visit to Boston we decided to splash out on the Nine Zero, having stayed in a Kimpton Hotel in San Francisco previously. The premier king view room was on the 15th floor, and had great views over the city. The room was clean and in reasonable condition, though an upgrade is probably about due. The room had no coffee maker, which was a surprise, but a quick call to hotel service saw one delivered in minutes. Kimpton pride themselves in service, and if you need anything, just ask, and they always respond quickly. At $500 plus per night it should be good!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Anderida
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in a great location! Easy walking distance from all the main downtown locations - right on the Freedom Trail. The staff are helpful and pleasant. The hotel is clean and very nicely decorated. Rooms very good and pretty quiet considering the central location. Our bed was really comfortable although (a queen) a little smaller than some in the US. Would probably have given 5/5 had we not had a slight problem with a breakfast (which was eventually fixed to our satisfaction!) and had the wine (and bizarrely the glasses!) not run out just before the end of the free wine reception [admittedly we got there about 5 mins before the end!]. All in all a super hotel and would definately use it next time in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, rooms same as on photos”
Reviews.Author: tatjanamk
Reviews.Content: A very, very good hotel with great service. Extremely clean everywhere, even elevators and corridors. Spacious rooms, modern style and great bed. I couldnâ€™t believe that rooms are exactly the same as on photos for hotel presentation! No surprises at all. The hotel location cannot be beat as it was central and an easy walk anywhere. Close to sightseeing bus stops also. I will live here again. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mfaco
Reviews.Content: A very good Hotel with great service. Spacious rooms with great bed and a very well furnished frigobar. The location could not be better. You are just in front of a great park and the Freedom Trail. A walking distance to great historical places. I recommed it.

Reviews.Title: “Do it if you can swing it ...”
Reviews.Author: KFerg
Reviews.Content: LOVELY hotel - beautiful rooms, amenities and dining. Meeting space is fine. Small property allows for fantastic service but also great privacy. Location is great for town activities, theatre district, public garden & etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: dragonOL2
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston on Labor Day weekend with my wife; we were in town to watch my first game at Fenway and also to see what Boston had to offer. Originally, I searched for hotels closer to Fenway, but they were booked, so I found Nine Zero and after reading details and reviews, made my decision to stay here. Great deal on a government rate for our stay of 5 days. I had little to no knowledge of Boston, but I'm glad I chose this Kimpton hotel because (as usual), it was great and made for a comfortable and pleasurable stay. We've stayed at several Kimptons in the past and each one has delivered quality, and this was no different. Our room was spacious and comfortable; we were upgraded to a King room with a view that overlooked Boston Common, the Public Garden, and we could see Fenway in the distance. A spectacular view for a great location; I'm glad we didn't' get stuck with a view of the alley or back of the hotel like some others apparently have; guess we were lucky. The only slightly negative thing that I noticed about the room was that it was apparent that the furniture was old and had been through some tough times; scratch marks and signs of wear and tear on the desks, the chairs, the night stands, and some of the doors were all visible. And yes, like others have said, the TV in the room was one of those old HUGE flat front and gigantic back TVs... could probably use an upgrade. But oh well, we didn't spend our trip in our room so things were satisfactory. Yes, it's a pet hotel, but I can't recall seeing more than a few pets around and we were never bothered by noise of any kind, from guests or pets or anything, so no issues there We took advantage of the fitness room, which had treadmills, elliptical machines, some free weights and a weight machine, and other exercise items. It wasn't huge, but it was adequate and there were never more than 2 or 3 people in it at a time, so no worries there. We ate at KO Prime for dinner our first night and for breakfast the next morning. The food selection was great and service was good as well. We absolutely loved the dinner and left stuffed and fulfilled. Breakfast took a little long to get to us but was fine once we finally were able to start eating. The quirky and chic nature of the entire establishment was a breath of fresh air. Always got a good vibe of the atmosphere, the staff were all nice and helpful whenever we needed info or help with transportation, and everything appeared clean and well taken care of. We only took advantage of the reception with wine on our first day of arrival (mainly since we were out so much) but it was a welcome perk on arrival after our plane ride. Some Kimpton hotels offer shuttle service back and forth to the airport, but this one is a little out of a shuttle range, so if you have no car, you'll have to take a taxi back and forth for your flight. One thing that I'm proud of is my decision to not have a rental car for this trip. Nine Zero is located right next to Park Street Station for the T (their subway station) and it took us everywhere we needed to go. Just another benefit of Nine Zero's location and vicinity to other things. There are some shopping areas, stores, restaurants, and sites to see in the area as well so it pays to walk out of the hotel and explore the area since there's so much available. All in all, I was very satisfied with my stay, the value was what I expected, and Nine Zero lived up to Kimpton's reputation of great service, great hotels and great perks. FREE WI-FI!!! Gotta love the inTouch program... :) if we're in Boston again (which might happen because we LOVED our trip), we'll definitely make use of Nine Zero again if we're in the downtown area. Absolutely recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel - one small problem”
Reviews.Author: P G
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for tourists - close to attractions and the metro. The staff is very nice and extremely friendly, but also leave you alone if you are not talkative which I think is great. The room was small, but was still very nice. One problem I had: one day, they didn't clean our room. We had the "please make up this room" sign hung on our door but no one came. We left early in the morning and came back late so they had all day - this was very strange. I called to ask and they gave me no explanation or apology. Other than that, good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: DCAfficionado
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Boston, I knew this would be a convenient location and it would be excellent for tourists--near the common and convenient to transportation, the North End and other nice dining spots. The room was small but nice and nicely decorated--high end amenities, very comfortable. Hard to reach by car, though, and really only valet parking. Parking under the Common is close by and about half as much overnight. Helpful staff but not as responsive as some other reviewers experienced. Might go back for a great price but nothing so outstanding as to earn longstanding loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelindiva96
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I spent 3 nights at the Nine Zero. As Kimpton In Touch members, we try to stay at Kimpton hotels whenever possible. They had the secret password promotion going on so we got a complimentary bottle of wine a check in. NICE! We also got a raid the mini bar card as well. The location of the hotel is pretty good. It's a 2 minute walk to the subway. There are also many things to see in walking distance. The room was nice. Modern accents and updated bathroom. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location To Walk Boston”
Reviews.Author: SteveDV
Reviews.Content: Boston is a very walkable city and the Nine Zero Hotel is perfectly located. I am partially handicapped but I was able to walk to Newbury St, Copley Plaza, Boston Common, Beacon Hill,Freedom Trail, Fanueil Hall, Paul Revere House, North Church and the North Side. Remember, many of the sidewalks are uneven bricks so be careful when walking. Make sure you buy tickets to the Freedom Trail Tour. Michael was our tour guide and was excellent. A must to understand Boston and our history. Loved the cemeteries-amazing they date back to the 1600's. Breakfast-walk to the Paramount on Charles St. Stand in line, order, pay and they will seat you. Line moves quickly. Lunch-Legal Seafood. Loved the chowder and clam roll. Dinner-Union Oyster House for history and good food. Mooo on Beacon St for maybe one of the best dinners we've had. Ordered the Delmonico steak and caramelized scallops. Share the sides of mashed potatoes, Parmesan fries, don't miss the corn succotash and creamed spinach. Finished with warm blueberry pie with vanilla ice cream. Worth the $150 for 2. We've paid more for dinner butbhave never had better. Back to the Nine Zero-the breakfast was great, especially the view of the granary cemetery. People are all very helpful and the room was beautiful, large and clean. Love the bed! Great trip! We plan on staying at the Nine Zero again.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, excellent chain”
Reviews.Author: oxfordlawyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in August. Couldn't fault it. Super staff, excellent room and very child friendly. Left cup cakes, cookies and milk as a treat for our six year old (and us!) as well as giving him a well stocked kids' rucksack which kept him busy for days. This is how all hotels should be. Well done! We also stayed three nights in the Kimpton hotel in Cambridge (Hotel Marlowe) which is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel choice in a central location”
Reviews.Author: HanD
Reviews.Content: We found everything that was said in the other positive reviews to be true. Our king room was very comfy and quiet - order allergy pillows in advance if you do want them. The location is perfect and the wine hour (5-6) is very welcome. The only slightly odd thing was that the bar and restaurant were shut on sunday and Monday which wasn't ideal. The staff were all very friendly and helpful at recommending other places to go though. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: We found Nine Zero through a SniqueAway deal, so my wife and I decided to take advantage of it for our anniversary trip. Our room was the "Queen Premier View", it was on the 18th floor and looked out towards the Capital Building and the Charles River. The bed and bedding was soft and comfortable with standard TV channels and on demand system. We ate breakfast in the restaurant once and had room service a few times, each time the food was very good and fairly priced (for a hotel). From the location of this place you can get just about anywhere in the city. It is a 10-minute walk to the waterfront near the New England Aquarium and a block away is the Park Street MBTA subway station. Also, the Freedom Trail starts in Boston Common which is just a block or two away. We found all of the staff to be very helpful and friendly and would gladly stay here again. In fact the only negative thing I can even think of about this place is that with the way the shower is configured the floor in the bathroom gets very wet, so make sure you have a towel on the floor so you don't slip.

Reviews.Title: “'Can't wait to get back to this hotel"”
Reviews.Author: holistix
Reviews.Content: Everything here works - service, restaurant, rooms etc. Brought my daughter here for a significant birthday. Well, the hotel, especially John and his colleagues, made it memorable for her. We were delayed by Hurricane Irene and were quite frustrated by the time we checked in. It was a real pleasure to end up at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They do everything possible to make you happy”
Reviews.Author: Parsky
Reviews.Content: I love the Kimpton chain to begin with, and this venue did not disappoint. Realizing that the standard room did not accommodate the brood, I requested and got a luxurious suite overlooking the Common for a nominal fee. Gorgeous eye candy of all flavors decorate both the front desk and the lobby after dark, and of course the complimentary wine every evening starts everything right. A perfect location rounds out another perfect Kimpton, and I'll certainly be back. Don't miss this one!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Start, Great Finish”
Reviews.Author: Personal N
Reviews.Content: Arrived at expected time & room wasn't ready - had to wait almost 5 hours before the room was ready. I wasn't the only one waiting for their room to be ready, but it seemed everyone else got theirs before mine. ALthough they kept me updated on the status, I had specifically stated that I would be arriving early & with a 3pm check in found it sad that I had to wait over 90 minutes before I could check. However, the room was amazing, large, clean & everything I expected. A true luxury that was well worth the money I spent on the room. The bathrobes they supplied were not very luxurious & felt rough against me, but were a nice touch. The food in the restaurant is extremely overpriced from a value standpoint, but was fresh & top quality. Would I stay there again? Probably not, because of the problems at check in, but I would recommend it as is near the T line, nicely located in the heart of the city & most things are close by. Just remember to join their loyalty program for the $10 in free mini bar purchases & the free in room WIFI they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Love Kimpton!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne050
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero was the second hotel in the Kimpton chain in which we've stayed and we will always look for Kimpton hotels in future! Well located, modern, trendy, funky but without "Ã¤ttitude" sums up the Kimpton philosophy. The decor at Nine Zero is super trendy, the rooms superbly finished and large, a bed that is so comfortable and a great bathroom all adds up to a perfect stay. The staff are friendly and helpful without any "plastic falseness" and really make you feel welcome. We elected to have a room with a view on a higher floor and it was well worth it. I cannot fault this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel + Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: DCtravler244
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night here, but we liked the hotel a lot. It's contemporary and stylish but still comfortable [in my experience, that isn't always the case]. The location is great for both tourists and business guests [there was a nice big desk in our room, plus a business center onsite]. The daily wine reception is a nice touch, but very crowded. Our room had a great view of the Granary Burial Ground, the Boston Common, the top of the State House dome, and the Charles River -- hard to beat. The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. We liked the fact that pets were allowed at the hotel. In fact, as you enter the hotel there's a dog dish with biscuits and a water bowl for canine guests. Very sweet. Our only quibble: why did the hotel select remote controls that make it so hard to watch TV? Unlike the remotes we've encountered in other hotels, the remotes at Nine Zero don't indicate how to navigate from pay-per-view movies to regular TV channels. Nor are there any on-screen prompts to help. It's really frustrating when you just want to watch the news to deal with a system that's clearly designed to prevent you from doing this [perhaps the designers thought that if they made it really hard to access regular TV channels, guests would just give up and pay to watch a movie?]. We ended up calling the front desk for help - a waste of everyone's time. Other than this small annoyance, we enjoyed our stay at Nine Zero and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In good location & clean”
Reviews.Author: Frank D
Reviews.Content: Centrally located within walking distance from train station to & from airport, clean rooms with walk in shower and comfortable king size bed. Not sure mini bar in room full of items that need to be purchased is required, we liked to buy our own drinks & refrigerate as required. Friendly staff who organised tours and provided advice & maps, checking in & out was done quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, would definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: cehoke
Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay at Nine Zero. Parking was a hassle and the building is not well marked, so we drove by it without finding it the first time. Staff was friendly and helpful, even provided us with complimentary champagne for our honeymoon! Centrally located and right next door to a really good pub (Beantown Pub).

Reviews.Title: “Very chic and great location”
Reviews.Author: smithie98
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel--walking distance to Boston Common, Downtown Crossing, and Government Center/Quincy Market--is hard to beat. The rooms were very stylish (and large for a boutique, city hotel). I liked the water in the lobby and wine hour every night! I was concerned about the fact that they allow dogs, but I didn't see any while I was there, so either they are handled well or other guests didn't bring them. Gym is apparently quite nice (other members of our party used it), though I wish there was a pool as that is my preferred AM hotel exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff great views of the city”
Reviews.Author: rosgo
Reviews.Content: Management treated us extremely well. Room was a little on the small side but the view was spectacular. 24 hour room service was a nice plus. Hosted wine party was a relaxing touch. A couple of blocks from Boston Common. Thomas, the concierge, couldn't have been more knowledgeable or patient.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: AlexandriaGrandDad
Reviews.Content: While a little pricey the location is great - we could see Boston Common from our window. Very convenient to many historic sites. Parking is $$$ but it is downtown Boston. Room not large but well organized. Bath is small but well laid out.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay on Beacon hill”
Reviews.Author: anoulia
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable modern hotel. Location was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Different in parts but we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: G4CHP
Reviews.Content: Smallish hotel with frendly staff,idealy located. Well equiped room with animal print robes and bedding. Managers reception was a few glasses of wine...no nibbles.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch- Best Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nine Zero hotel over the 4th of July weekend. From check-in until check-out our experience was better than any other hotel I had the pleasure of staying with, from across the States, South America, Europe, or the Middle East. The decor was modern and unique, room comfort was fabulous, the social atmosphere during their manager's wine hour was a welcome relief, city location was extremely convenient to all downtown locations, and the service went above and beyond the norm. I would recommend this hotel to all, especially for anyone with pets, since they are more than "pet friendly". Also, since we were celebrating our first wedding anniversary the hotel provided us with complimentary chocolate covered strawberries and a nice bottle of champagne.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city centre location, great service, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: ZoeLewis
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to this hotel and just as good as the first time. Really friendly service, we had a glass of champaign on arrival as it ws our anniversary. They also kindly gave us a bottle in our room and strawberries dipped in choc to celebrate, which was a lovely touch. Beds are so comfortable nad pillows are awesome. good size rooms, we were on the 3rd floor.Recommend Paramount for breakfast 5 mins away. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pet-Friendly Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jryan110
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel largely because it was the most affordable that included all the amenities we were seeking. The number one item on our list was a pet-friendly hotel and the Nine Zero most certainly delivered. Upon check-in, we were greeted by some of the friendliest hotel staff I have ever met, who quickly turned their attention to our dog and showered her with treats and affection (yes, the staff actually came out from behind the counter to greet our dog!). However, despite being a pet-friendly hotel, the lobby, elevators, hallways and room were immaculate and showed no traces of previous pets (or guests) anywhere; this was one of the cleanest and most well-put-together hotels I have stayed in. The rooms were slightly smaller than your run of the mill hotel, but the quality of the bed, linens and pillows more than made up for this. And considering we only slept and showered in the room, size was irrelevant anyway. We were also fortunate enough to have a room on the 17th floor, overlooking Tremont Street and across Beacon Hill to Cambridge; the view was spectacular! Unfortunately, we didn't eat at the on-site restaurant, KO Prime. Although the menu left my mouth watering, my wife is a vegetarian and they offered very few dishes that were not centered around red meat or fish. For what it's worth, the restaurant smelled incredible! The location was also ideal, as we were centrally located and could walk to all the major tourist areas (Boston Common, Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market, New England Aquarium, Newbury Street) and were just a short trolley ride from Fenway Park and Cambridge. When we go back, I would absolutely choose Nine Zero again and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Trip to Boston At the Nine Zero”
Reviews.Author: rickyred
Reviews.Content: It is expensive to stay in Boston in the summer, however, the four of us found the Nine Zero to be a gem. Even with its $400 price tag...it was $100 each and the location was prime. It is located directly across from The graveyard where Paul Revere is buried! The room was interesting and contemporary...very clean and very cool on a hot summer day. We loved it- plenty of room for all four of us. At 5pm, we showed up for a wine and beer reception in the lobby that was refreshing and a rarity for a hotel in Boston. Another rarity in any hotel? FREE wi-fi in your hotel room. The beds and linens were extremely comfortable. Pillows were great too. The staff was attentive and friendly. We only got to stay over one night, but it was a terrific place to stay!! No complaints. Valet Parking is $40

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well positioned, clean, posh”
Reviews.Author: orso77
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure being guest at this hotel. It was hard to find it at the beginning, you have to pay attention to the small signs. Rooms are big and clean, people friendly and helpful, atmosphere posh and classy. It is really well positioned on the freedom trail. A wonderful choice. I will suggest this hotel to the people who will want to spend some days in boston.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Happy Hour”
Reviews.Author: courtkhoury
Reviews.Content: Complimentary happy hour? Sure! Why not? I love Kimpton Hotels. Our first visit to Boston was welcomed by this fantastic hotel. We felt welcomed by anyone we talked to; it's chic and for all age types. There is nothing about Nine Zero that we did not like. It's centrally located and we walked everywhere. If you are driving into Boston, be prepared to pay $40 a day for valet parking at the hotel and you can get your car at anytime. There is self parking near by and if you are an AAA member you can print show your card and save coupons for local garages. We were so hungry after checking in we could not wait so we ordered sandwiches that were very yummy but if you think it's pricey, there are several restaurants around to cater you. Walking distance to shopping, the wharf, the park; etc. The Nine Zero was very clean and safe. The robes and bath amenities were my favorite; not to mention the fabulous throw on the bed. Definitely visiting the Nine Zero very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IrelandEvanstonWY
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful, the location was perfect (near Boston Commons, Fanueil Hall, Freedom trail and the "T" line) and the room was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great to People Watch”
Reviews.Author: rangerf75
Reviews.Content: Great location. Hard to find to park. Treated guests so well. Room was very big. So pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Trentmeister
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nine Zero is a fairly chic hotel, located close to Boston Common, handy for many of Boston's central tourist attractions, and also for "T" stations for visis further afield. While our room was not what we had specified (we needed two Queen beds but were instead assigned to a room with one Queen and a rollaway), we are not sure that this was not an error on the part of our booking agent. However, the rooms were large, well equipped and perfect for our needs. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful enough.

Reviews.Title: “They impressed us with their service and their style!”
Reviews.Author: CDCNJ
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Kimpton hotel and we are hooked if they all are like the Nine Zero in Boston. Not only was the hotel beautifully appointed and clean, the staff was utterly amazing. We felt very special due to their attentiveness and personal service. While the evening wine hour was crowded in the small lobby, everyone seemed not to care since they were having a great time and the staff was so accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Abesbabe23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. We loved the pillow menu! Very clean room and bathroom was very nice. The hotel offers free wine and drinks from 5-6 in their lobby. We also ate breakfast both days at the hotel's restaurant. Good food but very expensive. We paid $12 for a small plate of fruit:( The hotel does not offer free coffee and tea and it is very expensive to order it from room service ($7 got tea, $5 for coffee). When we couldn't find a coffee shop open around the hotel later in the evening, the front desk sent us complimentary tea and coffee - bonus points!! Location of this hotel is great and the staff is excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation - Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Rob_from_LI
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed a 3 night stay from August 4th through the 6th at the Nine Zero. This was our first stay at a Kimpton Hotel. We signed up for their in-touch program when making the reservation. This gave us the option of upgrading our room from a Queen Deluxe to either a Queen Premier View or a King Premier View for $15 a night if any were available at check in. In addition we were given a $10 credit for mini-bar. It is worth it to sign up if you havenâ€™t. We were upgraded and stayed in room 1502, which is a Queen Premier View Room. The room was located in a corner. We had two windows, one looking down Tremont St toward the Government Center and the other gave us a view of the State House and out across the Boston Common. I did not see the deluxe room so I cannot compare the two. The room was spacious, especially for a â€œboutiqueâ€� hotel, which was worth the extra money. However the view from our end of the building was nothing special, it was obstructed, where the other end of the building was not. This had to be the quietest hotel that I have ever stayed in, which was appreciated. I was skeptical of this because of Kimptonâ€™s pet policy, but no complaints. I heard one dog bark in 3 days. We were able to sleep in without being woken by loud doors and hallway noise, certainly a first. The beds, pillows, sheets were so comfortable. They are on par with anywhere else we have stayed. The bathroom was spacious and it had a nice marble shower. They pay close attention to detail in the hotel which makes it feel special. The lobby is very welcoming. The location is great. It is located Steps from Beacon Hill and the Boston Common, a short 5 minute walk to Quincy Market / Faneuil Hall, close to the Waterfront boats, ferries and aquarium and the Theater District. There is a T line right down the street to take you to Copley Sq / Back Bay or down to visit the animals at Fenway Park and to the North End going the other direction if you donâ€™t want to walk. The staff was also very friendly and accommodating. The concierge was very helpful. They helped us try to get an extra set of tickets to the Red-Sox Yankee game, and gave us advice on tours. The ferry ride to Salem was nice and relaxing. We used the fitness center once. It has two treadmills, two ellipticals, two universal weight machines and some free weights. We did not eat at the restaurant, however the KO Prime looked great. It cost us $40 a night to park, but that is pretty much the norm in Boston. This was the fourth hotel which I have stayed at in Boston (Marriott Long Wharf, Marriott Cambridge, Millennium Bostonian, I usually go with who offers the best rate at the time, this time it was the Nine Zero) and it was as good as the others mentioned. The only cons were, there was no dresser space to put you clothes. Just one small drawer. I like to unpack and not live out the suitcase, not an option. Also there is not mini-fridge, which I could have used, just the stocked honor bar. Really minor details. I would recommend the Nine Zero to anyone. I will try to post some photos when I have time. Iâ€™m happy to answer any questions if you have them.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE Nine Zero!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTraveling1126
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Nine Zero and I was impressed even more! The customer service and atmosphere is great. The pet policy is top of the line and they make everyone feel welcome! I recommend this hotel to everyone. If you are even near Boston I would make it a point to stop just to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Services and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: hillsidejean
Reviews.Content: Right off the Boston Common, across from the main "T" (metro) station, and easy access to all the tourist sites, Nine Zero avoids the large downtown hotel syndrome! No vast lobby, rather a friendly face and multi-tasking back of the desk staff, welcome you and are able to handle reservations, directions, massage and dinner reservations, whatever. My grand daughters loved the wine and cheese hour when they were offered the non-alcoholic option of WIi units instead of chardonnay! Their mother however opted for the chard. When we ordered massages with 4 hour advance: no problem. The massage therapist were conservative but competent. Food: restaurant OK. If you are a business traveler, too long a wait! But quick food is just around the corner. Or Room Service...it was excellent. Great boutique hotel right downtown and as one who lived there for many years, it is the best of that brand in Boston. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel.... convenient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: katpag1
Reviews.Content: Our daughter attends Boston College, so we have stayed in a number of hotels during visits/parents weekends/football games, etc. This hotel ranks among the best we have stayed in. The decor of Nine Zero is top-notch and the location can't be beat! The Common is across the street and the green T stop is only steps away from the front door-easy to get to the BC campus and anywhere else in the city! Quincy market and the aquarium/waterfront are also an easy walk from the hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, which made our stay even better. We were also pleasantly surprised to find this is a pet-friendly hotel. Although we don't generally travel with our pets, we are dog-lovers and were happy to see a boxer, a french bulldog and a bulldog among the guests (we didn't notice any "doggie" odor at all in the hotel.) We also enjoyed the wine sampling in the lobby, which they have every evening. There was a full house laughing and chatting the night we went down for a glass of wine. We booked a premier view room, but I'm not sure if it was worth the upgrade.... although we could see the Boston Common (very pretty), we also had a view of the tops of buildings with air conditioning units, antennas, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom2010
Reviews.Content: This was my 7-year-old son's and my first time to Boston. I searched very carefully for a hotel near Boston Common and the Freedom Trail. Nine Zero is 2 blocks from Boston Common and right on the Freedom Trail, directly across the street from the old burial ground that includes Sam Adams, Paul Revere, John Hancock, and other Amercian patriots. We were traveling with friends and made a special request to have our rooms together or adjoin only a few days prior to arrival, and we were accommodated. From that first request through to our departure, every member of the hotel staff from the front desk and concierge to the bellmen and cleaning staff was welcoming and accommodating. Our room was luxurious and very spacious for a city hotel. This was my first stay at a Kimpton Hotel and it won't be the last. In fact, I will look for Kimpton everywhere I go -- all because of the room and service at Nine Zero in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: MimiBampa
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Nine Zero since it opened and love this hotel. The staff members are very friendly and helpful. We are always impressed with the cleanliness of the entire hotel. The rooms are furnished with everything you would expect to find in an upscale boutique hotel. Wonderful beds and pillows, nice decor, great robes!!! The restaurant is excellent and we highly recommend it. We love the hotel's location in the city - great for shopping to visiting historical sights to catching a Celtics game. We can easily walk to Boston Commons, Faneuil Hall, North End, Downtown Crossing, Newbury Street, Beacon Hill or there are subway stops near the hotel to take to a Red Sox game. Also the hotel is right on the Freedom Trail.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and value!”
Reviews.Author: IrishGal21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights while on business at Emerson College. Lovely hotel in very convenient location. The Park St station for the T is steps away with connections on two popular T lines (Green and Red). There are also restaurants, coffee shops, bars, and a movie theater within walking distance. As to the hotel itself, the room was great and beautifully furnished. Small point deduction for the outdated CRT TV that occasionally buzzed with a bad picture, but otherwise it was fine. Loved the fully-stocked minibar and comfy robes. I would have given this hotel five stars had they not double-charged me for my room (once with Expedia, once on my incidentals credit card). by the time I discovered the error and called the hotel, they had reversed the charges. If I am in this neighborhood again, I will definitely consider the Nine Zero (and just watch my bill at checkout).

Reviews.Title: “fun!”
Reviews.Author: jchbrl
Reviews.Content: This is a very funky hotel, in line with what I expect from a Kimpton property. We are Kimpton In Touch members and received a room upgrade with a great view of the city and Beacon Hill. The room was a little small but other than that, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: SPLD89
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on a tour of New England and was a wonderful place to begin our trip. We arrrived late in the evening feeling stressed and tired after a long wait at customs at Boston airport to be greeted by a lovely receptionist who immediately asked if we would like a complimentary glass of wine while she checked us in - just what we needed! We were upgraded to a king room on the 17th floor with beautful views over the city and our room was just amazing - so comfortable and clean with every detail thought of. The hotel is perfectly located by Boston common and we walked around the whole of Boston without having to use the subway or buses. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: lcf2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night at the Nine Zero in early July on our way to Cape Cod. We had a wonderful time. Clean and large room with two queen size beds. Helpful staff and a fun cocktail hour in lobby (my kids came with us and where well received with juice cocktail as well). Finally, it's well situated. Boston is such a wonderful city to walk and visit and our hotel had the perfect location for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel for business travelers.”
Reviews.Author: MaryJBPPI
Reviews.Content: In July I spent a week in Boston on business. The Nine Zero turned out to be the perfect place to stay. The staff were incredible, the hotel rooms were clean and functional, the location is within walking distance to the financial district as well as premium shopping on Newburry Street. The hotel is a stones throw away from Boston Common as well. Overall satisfaction was achieved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel from all perspectives!”
Reviews.Author: ZebraNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and subway lines three blocks away! It is a Kimpton Hotel so be sure to find the most outstanding decor!! Very modern and luxurious!! The room we got had two beds and it was enough for four people with bags. TV and sound system for all types - Ipod, CD, DVD. The bathroom nicely organized and spacious - bathtub instead of standing shower - something rare in boutique hotels these days. The staff of the hotel is SUPER NICE and HELPFUL. We got there at 5h30am and we were very well taken care. The only this that might be a problem if you need your car is that you need to call them 30mins as the parking is not on site. Definitely a great property in Boston!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: drbcabarete
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly placed and staffed by an excellent and knowledgeable group of folks. Was on the 17th floor overlooking everything which was a joy as a former Boston citizen. From a very well stocked mini bar to a fireplace with sound in the television, this room served us well. Both my wife and I and my Mom who was given another room just down the hall, enjoyed the whole experience. I would most certainly recommend this hotel for its location, comfort, staff and overall treatment of its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mklaw2000
Reviews.Content: Location is central and walking distance to key landmarks and neighborhoods, shops and restaurants. Close to public transit and across the street from boston commons. Good sized rooms and quiet accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and great location”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Sear
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero hotel is < 1 minute from Boston common (and a subway stop) so the location is great and the room was comfortable and large. But I am not sure that it is good value for money. I had the cheapest room which had a view of a brick wall a few metres away. This is fair enough, you get what you pay for and the more expensive rooms may have great views but maybe there are other hotels with good locations and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: cjurban25
Reviews.Content: It was our 6th wedding anniversary. The room was great. Very Clean. Not a great view, but still nice. We came back after having some lunch and the Concierge brought us a bottle of sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries. What a treat! The hotel is in the heart of Boston. Easy to get to from the subway. Across from Boston Common. We will definitely stay there again. The only bad thing is they allow pets and it took a little longer than expected for someone to clean up the dog pee in the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DavidJacqui
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and loved it. The location couldn't have been better - walking distance to many attractions and close to the subway for others. The concierge and front desk staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. In addition, the afternoon free wine reception in the lobby was a welcome bonus - an opportunity to relax, have a drink and meet other hotel guests. Rooms too were great. All in all, a wonderful hotel and we certainly would recommend it and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: reallyseeing
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero is a small botique hotel perfectly located for a family tour of Boston. It is a very short to the Public Gardens, the T and the Freedom Trail. The decor is friendly, the rooms an adequate size and it is probably the most service focused hotel that I have ever stayed in. The staff is competent, friendly and truly works to make your visit easy and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the middle of America's history”
Reviews.Author: Surfn in Ventura
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Nine Zero Hotel was fantastic! The staff was very attentive and our room was spacious, very comfortable and quiet. When we registered we mentioned that it was a retirement vacation for me. The front desk sent 2 glasses of champagne to our room, and later that night 2 delicious cupcakes were delivered. The desk clerk who registered us - Preethi (?) - was extremely helpful. I'm glad we decided to stay at the Nine Zero. The hotel is in downtown Boston, right on the Freedom Trail. Our stay was over July 4. The cemetery with Samuel Adams, John Hancock and Paul Revere is right across the street. Boston Common is a block away. We found the people there to be very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClarkMidlands
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate our birthdays, the location is excellent (a very easy trip on the subway from the airport), The staff were amazing and went more than the extra mile providing a surprise room service of champagne and strawberries. The house keeper was also special and even took the trouble to enquire how my friend was when one morning she didn't feel well enough to go out. The recommendations for dinner also excellent and we had breakfast at the hotel every day. We ate in the restaurant one evening and the meal was outstanding. (we hope everything goes well with the impeding birth). Would definately stay in this hotel if visting Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: roxypiglet
Reviews.Content: The staff at Nine Zero were all super friendly. We stayed with them as the last lap of my 50th birthday trip from Uk. We stayed at three Kinmpton Hotels in Washington, New York and Boston. We loved the Kimpton Hotels Nine Zero just like in Washington was super friendly. Lovely room lots of treats for my birthday and being signed up to Kimton in touch lots more complimentary extras too. The Location is ideal for everything. The room spacious, bathroom spotless over all a great stay. The concierge staff were very helpful and I loved Shannon (hope I have your name right) on reception she was such fun! all the staff were great though. Thank you all for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: iyi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed one night, but we wished it was longer. The staff, especially Megan, couldn't have been nicer. Megan talked us in on our cell phone from the airport, as we were terribly lost. The rooms and amenities are very nice and well appointed. We had breakfast at their restaurant and it was very good. If I were to go back to Boston, I would pick Nine Zero again. It is located well to all historic areas and close to the tour trolley pickup. I do wish their parking was less expensive, but given the fact there is no parking to be found in most of Boston, I guess it was a bargain. Well done, Nine Zero/!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Dedicated Staff that Goes the Extra Mile- Why is this not the #1 Hotel in Boston?”
Reviews.Author: NYLawyr
Reviews.Content: Well Folks, I have stayed at the best of them in Boston. My partner and I have stayed at both Ritz Carlton's (the Taj and Boston Common), the Four Seasons Boston, the Westin Copley Place. We have been coming back to the Nine Zero Hotel for the past 3 years. Like clock work every 4th of July and everyone of my birthdays. This true boutique hotel has such a great feel and the staff's dedication and truly friendly nature makes this one of the best kept secrets in Boston. This does not compare to the 5 star chains. The staff goes out of there way to make you feel comfortable and all the little niceties (if thats a word) make this hotel a home away from home. From the 5 o'clock wine presentation in the lobby, to the complimentary internet to a concierge who is so dedicated to making the guests stay in Boston the best (Thanks John). Ben, the porter always has a smile on his face and is always there to talk with us and ask about our day. Our room attendant Nazifa made our room sparkle everyday and the linens and towles were always fresh in in great quantity. I have found very few establishments to comment about on Tripadvisor, but the Nine Zero definitely deserves all the praise. Thanks to the staff and keep up the good work. See you for Birthday #31 :) **Quick Tip, the Beantown Pub next door is a great little spot to grab lunch** Their baked beans compliment the Suffolk Stuffer (thanksgiving in a roll)

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: SarahJT325
Reviews.Content: We had one night in Boston at the end of a two week trip. This was a great base. We were dropped off by friends at 8.30 am and di not expect to get our room but we did. The hotel is very stylish. The staff are excellent, everyone we met was without exception a fantastic ambassdor for the hotel. We just didn't have time to use the gym, the spa, meet up with other people at the drinks reception which had we been at the hotel longer I am sure we would have enjoyed. We did not use the bar or restaurant, there is so much else near by. We got a great deal with expedia which made the hotel a really affordable option in a central location to explore the great sites Boston has to offer. We had the Queen deluxe room, more than adequate for our needs and room for our 3 big luggage bags. Defiantly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to praise it enough”
Reviews.Author: osspeak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 2 Superior King rooms for 6 days, one for my 94 year old mother. We are from Australia and have been away for over a month. The rooms were fantastic. I have stayed at a lot of the hotels in my 19 trips around the World, all over a month away. This one rates as one of the best. The bed is just exceptional. The view from our 12th floor corner room was excellent, although the hotels position means that many of the rooms would have limited to no real outlook. It was over the 4th of July weekend and it was all happening right outside, or close by as long distance walking is a problem with a 94 year old. The hotel staff were exceptional, even the porter. Nothing was too much trouble. We were concerned as the breakfast menu is more like fine dining, and my mother was in a decline as her normal cereal was not offered, and she is very set in her routine, but when mentioned, it was arranged that the required cereals were sent over to the restaurant every morning by room service. The cooked breakfast menu is a little limited, but any request was quickly catered for. The Dinner menu is also a bit limited if you are staying for a longer period, but the food was excellent. The staff here were a treat, especially Mellissa, who was a beam of sunlight in the mornings. But the other staff were also great. We were concerned that there was no hot water jug in the room, as free tea and coffee will be brought up anytime, but a request at the desk resulted in a choice of jug, or coffee maker, so all my concerns were met. My old mother loved the place. The central location just made our stay in Boston. There is a very good little gym, which I used a lot, but if it doesnâ€™t suite, there is free access to a large health club nearby. I have no negative comments, except the temperature in the lobby is kept very low, but that is hardly a problem.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luvvacation
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a great trip to Boston and a wonderful stay at Nine Zero. I tend to be a bit of a "extreme planner" when it comes to vacation and always worry about what hotel to pick. I couldn't have picked a better place. The location is fantastic, right along the Freedom Trail, close to the Boston Common, the subway, restaurants, etc. The hotel offered fruit-infused water all day long, iced tea in the afternoon and a wonderful happy hour with wine and sangria. The rooms were very modern looking, but not cold or stark. The bed was heaven, towels were fluffy and housekeeping was great. I honestly cannot think of one negative to this hotel. To all you other extreme planners, go forward with your vacation knowing that you've picked an excellent place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a relaxing weekend...”
Reviews.Author: ital2883
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at a Kimpton hotel and this hotel continues to follow the Kimpton standards... I love this chain of wonderful hotels... ROOMS: We had a room with 2 beds, room size was good practical and functional with a desk and chair, TV, CD player with kimton relaxing music... bathroom was perfect size and had everything we needed. Beds are soooooooooooooo comfortable, my friend wanted to take it home :) SERVICE: As usual the staff was warm, friendly and welcoming. Always saying have a good day or have a good night or is everything ok... World class service!! We dealt with Preethi at the reception desk when we had problems with a room key and she gaves us quick service and some advice to make sure they dont deactivate. She also checked us out and was very professional and warm and held avery nice converation during the process. Service like this should be everywhere... VALET: this is our first time using valet service from a hotel, it was quick and efficient and the staff were very polite and helped us to load our bags on departure. last but not least... the Kimpton tradition... WINE HOUR: this is like the best part of everything I like about the Kimpton... one hour of wine service red/white... best part you can have more than one glass!! :) I find this service gives you the feel that you are truly staying in a luxury hotel... OTHER: Hotel is well located near train stations, boston common and few other places within walking distance (ie Aquarium abt 15-20 min walk). Another great touch is that they have water dispensers in the lobby. It is flavored with real fruits and is delicious coming back from a warm day on the town... Keep up the good work Kimpton Family!! if any travellers have any questions please dont hesitate to ask...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely.”
Reviews.Author: BeachGal3333
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend and really enjoyed our stay. Fantastic location in Boston perfect for walking and seeing sights. Room was very nice and comfortable and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable beds and bedding”
Reviews.Author: farmgirl02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nine Zero for four nights. The location is ideal as it is in the centre of the city next to Boston common. Happy hour every evening. Always iced water with lemon or orange sometimes iced tea in reception. Pillow menu useful as we needed one firm pillow and another not so firm. Restaurant good but pricey as with most hotels though lots of places to eat or get takeaways nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: latonyabennett
Reviews.Content: From the lobby to the hallways to the rooms this hotel is excellent. I am truly in love with Kimpton Hotels after my stay at Nine Zero. Our room was on 12th floor and had a great view. IT was my friends B-day and we were presented with a B-day card, Champagne, Choc Strawberries and cheese and crackers.The rooms are intimate, sexy, and trendy with a boldness. Service is top notch. Never saw a housekeeper, but all towels and toiletries were replenished daily. I am a very picky person when I travel and had no complaints at all> Thomas at the front desk is a gem. I will be sure to send him a thank you card as soon as I find the time. If you are looking for a beautiful hotel, great service, great location to all of Boston then this is your hotel. Please don't pass this great stay up!!! SN: Shower and bed comfort to die for!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Fabulous Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JK1263
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero is in a great location, central to government center and historic Boston, right on the Freedom Trail. My husband came for the week on business, but we brought the family too. We travel often and found the NIne Zero's front desk and bell staff, along with the concierge service to be outstanding - the best we've experienced in any hotel in the US or abroad. While the hotel is not as kid-friendly as some of the bigger chains, the staff was very welcoming and assisted with ideas for tours and dining for our children (age 8 and 6.) We did experience a few disappointments with housekeeping and room ammenities/condition - Very compact room with no drawer space other than the nightstand; Poor lighting over the bed ( we had a two-queen room with one lamp is in-between the two beds); Aging but functional desk and Sony Trinitron TV (not the modern flat-screen listed on the hotel's web page); Rust stains running down the wall edge in the bath next to the tub and a lack of hooks or bars to hang towels to dry -wish there was even just one hook on the back of the door. Although there were four of us, housekeeping was not consistent with leaving four towls and washcloths on a daily basis. Turndown service occurred on three of the six nights (we did not request - don't know if it is standard, by request or random - but certainly appreciated it along with the chocolates which were left for us! ) Despite these concerns, the Nine Zero is a great place to stay in Boston..

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: caz1950
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel right on the Freedom Trail in Boston. It was the second Kimpton property we stayed in during our stay in the USA and we would definitely stay in these hotels again as all experiences were very positive. There was a mix up on arrival as they said they didn't have our booking for the two rooms. I had paperwork with me confirming the bookings and once it was sorted out they couldn't be more helpful. The room was excellent - overlooking the Granary Burial Ground over the road. The restaurant was expensive and very noisy. We decided to eat out on the second night and the concierge recommended an excellent Italian restaurant in walking distance. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: DebbieInMokena
Reviews.Content: Very beautifully decorated hotel in an excellent location. It is right on the Freedom Trail and a block from Boston Commons. The room was spacious and immaculate with the most comfortable beds. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The valet guys were very prompt with retrieving our car and were a wealth of information for how to get around town. Valet parking was pricey ($40 a night) but what do you expect in the city of Boston? If you don't need to travel outside the city, do not rent a car. This hotel is located in the midst of everything you want to see. High speed internet provided free if you are part of the Kimpton InTouch program which is free to join. Love Kimptons!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Eureka_9
Reviews.Content: Located in downtown across the street from the Burying Grounds, a historic cemetery. Clean, quiet with attentive staff. Rooms are small, even by Boston standards. Restaurant has a limited menu by west coast standards and tends towards a lot of beef items.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: dhmills
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Beautifully designed, nice rooms, great service. The location is great and the hotel was very clean. Nothing bad to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in The heart Of Boston”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoSnowTraveler
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in a corner room at the Nine Zero in August 2010. The room had a lovely view of historic graveyard and Boston Commons. One side of the room had windows that faced an adjoining office building. Several of the lights had blown in the room as well as the alarm clock was broken. The sleeping quarters of the room for the most part was well taken care off, but the bathroom was a bit dusty and lightbulbs were blown. The front desk staff although somewhat aloof, tried their best to be helpful. The doormen where very helpful with giving directions, both driving and walking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic +++!!!”
Reviews.Author: Francesco518
Reviews.Content: Was in Boston for a 3 days business trip and had a wonderful stay at the Nine Zero. Very friendly, helpful and kind staff. Upon arrival they offered a glass of very good white wine and in my room I found a welcome plateau of cheese and fruit that was much appreciated. Very nice, large, clean and comfortable room with a fantastic view over the city. The first night there was a big thundestorm over Boston and this caused some problems on the tv reception but the Front Desk staff offered me the complimentary view of an on-demand movie. Great central position, one block away from subway station and main attractions. I don't know if I'll ever go back to Boston, but if I will, the Nine Zero will for sure be my home. Definetely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel_2203
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came to Boston for the first time for opening weekend of the Red Sox and initially struggled to pick a hotel not knowing anything about the area. Although we considered staying somewhere that looked more historic, we ultimately chose the Nine Zero and could not be more pleased with our choice! We were initially greeted with complimentary glasses of wine and check-in was a breeze. The room was exactly as described on Expedia...very clean and extremely comfortable. My only complaint if I had to find one was that there is no ventilation fan in the bathroom. We arrived fairly late (approx. 9pm) and were pleasantly surprised that the concierge was still working and able to direct us to a near by bar for a late dinner and drinks (never did get a bad recommendation from any one there!). Location is great...we were able to walk everywhere except to and from the airport (Fenway Park, the Freedom Trail, Newbury Street, Quincy Market, the shoreline, etc. - I should warn you that some of these were very long walks though). Hotel staff was great with giving us directions anywhere necessary and making dinner reservations for us. Thanks to all that made our stay amazing and we will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: vt2go
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Kimpton hotels. The staff is incredibly friendly and I love the wine at 5 and the great locations. Nine Zero was no exception. The staff and especially the concierge were fantastic. The location could not have been better --- on the Freedom Trail just 1/4 block away from the Boston Common and the central MBTA line, so you could walk almost everywhere or take the subway to places like Cambridge, the MFA or the airport. We had a small room but it was a corner one with glass walls on two sides and a view of the Park St. Church, Boston Common, Charles River, and even (at night) the lights of Fenway Park. As with all Kimpton hotels, the beds were unbelievably comfortable and the lines luxurious. I had told them that it was my friend's birthday and they not only gave us the prettiest room in the place but also the concierge sent champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, which we ate while watching the Royal Wedding on TV. It doesn't get much better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hospitable service.... highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: scottyshaffer
Reviews.Content: What else can I say - great service, accomodating to early check-ins, continental breakfast was really a continental breakfast +, clean rooms, fast internet (need a Kimpton account though) and great location right near a T station.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: DWMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Well located opposite the fascinating old burial ground and a block from the common. Really helpful staff especially the concierge who headed us up on tours etc. Rooms are fine if you like dark furniture, but the bathrooms particularly are a real treat. Room had been freshly deodorized when we arrived which was bit overpowering, but soon settled down. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised, pleasantly!”
Reviews.Author: SusieQTraveler
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotels aren't really my thing, so when I arrived I was braced for a cold experience. I was happily surprised - a friendly staff, complimentary wine tasting, pet-friendly policy, and free WIFI made for a relaxing stay. The rooms were well designed/ decorated, trendy but comfortable as well. Extra points for the great shower, fabulous water pressure. And the location was super!

Reviews.Title: “Compact but comfy”
Reviews.Author: Sweeter123
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nites in the Queen Deluxe Room. Disagree with previous reviews that rooms are showing their age. We were in 1601 and it was in perfect condition. Room was on the small side for two adults though. The bed dominates the room, along with a writing desk and chair. While Kimpton prides itself on design, there were a couple of problems in my view. 1) TV is built into the wall and it is well above eye level. Not very practical. 2) Shower door opens outward and a lot the water spills out onto bathroom floor. Overall though I was very pleased with the room and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed.”
Reviews.Author: tusc_5
Reviews.Content: A bath couldn't be filled with water in my room because a plug didn't work. It is very relacxing time for me to take a bath. Called and asked the front desk, there was no apology with insincere talk. It was very dissapointing. Can I stay 4 more nights here?

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DuxburyMom
Reviews.Content: Don't miss the social hour! It's quaint and inviting, kinda like you're at a cocktail party with people you just haven't met yet... The entire staff was friendly and attentive, but the front desk manager / cocktail host -- Andrew Smith -- was top notch when it comes to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “4.5 Stars for a nice hotel that is showing a little wear”
Reviews.Author: kabooki001
Reviews.Content: Overall I was really pleased with our stay. The style, service, and location of the hotel can't be beat but the furniture in our room all showed some wear. All the edges were worn on our two night stands and desk. Also our duvet had a stain and a hole the size of a cigarette burn. The worn comforter seems like an obvious oversight on a hotel that charges $300/night but we would choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tamiam1969
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Nine Zero for a few days as part of a business trip. The staff are all very friendly. The room was nice and the bed was great - no sleep issues at all! The hotel seemed pretty quiet too. They allow pets, but I never heard any barking. The restaurant is nice, but note that it is closed on Sundays and Mondays (room service is available though). My office was about a 5 minute walk away (right down Arch street from Treemont). I didn't go any place else, but my husband did lots of walking. He said it was great that everything was in good proximity to the hotel. I will have to go back to Boston now and then for work, and I plan to stay at this hotel each time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and even better staff.”
Reviews.Author: chibnik
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Vermont for work and decided that I would stay in Boston. The main reason I chose to do this was so that I could have the luxury of staying at a Kimpton Hotel. Nine Zero, on 90 Tremont (Get it?) is an amazing hotel in the heart of Boston. It is centrally located near all of the attractions that you would want to go to and feels extremely safe and comfortable. The architecture is beautiful and in an area where real estate is at a premium, Nine Zero feels very spacious. The views from their guest rooms are spectacular. The bed was very comfortable, even more so than other Kimpton Hotels I've been in. The room was very modern and mature. I really enjoyed all of the amenities that the hotel provided, including the excellent selection of mini bar items. What separates Nine Zero (and the other Kimpton's) is the top notch service provided. The staff at Nine Zero makes you feel like you are an honored guest, no matter what room you book. Michelle and Erin at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. They made the check in process fast and easy. After a long day of driving from Vermont, they were a welcome distraction from the stress of work.
