Even more impressing was the personal attention and level of knowledge that Thomas the lead concierge provided. He made me feel like a VIP and was attentive to all of my requests. Kevin the concierge was also very helpful. One thing Nine Zero has done right, is to hire staff that lives up to the Kimpton name. When work sends me back to Boston or the surrounding areas, I plan on staying at Nine Zero. I feel comfortable recommending it to my friends, family and coworkers.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: InnkeeperSedonaAZ
Reviews.Content: We love Boston, this hotel is close to everything we walked everywhere. Be sure to get a room on the outside so you will have a view we stayed in room 1702 and had a corner room with views of the river and the north end. Only downside is the rental car for a day cost us more to park at the hotel than the rental did. We loved getting out friendly dog pat with Mia the boxer and her owner the young lady was more than helpful in getting us a perfect room. We will be back this is our third stay in a Kimpton hotel and as innkeepers ourselves we know standards and the work it takes to keep guests happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the friendliest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: jldrx
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff at Nine Zero far surpassed our expectations. I have stayed at Kimpton Hotels before and have always enjoyed the experience. However, Nine Zero was a notch above the great Kimpton Hotels! Everyone was so knowledgeable and helpful. The concierge John gave us the best recommendations for restaurants and things to see. And the entire staff was always pleasant and helpful. A great trendy hotel in a fabulous location. And the bed was super comfy too! Will definitely stay here on a return trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great happy hour and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbug1979
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay at this kimpton property - NINE ZERO in Boston. Rooms were clean, bathrooms VERY clean, water pressure awesome in the shower (that's important to me!) and service was great too! everyone was so friendly and welcoming. The concierge, Thomas Burke was so helpful and enthusiastic. There is a daily happy hour with wine, loved that! This was my first experience with a Kimpton property and my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed it. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: A2Travel
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay! Got a running map from the front desk and took off exploring. Great location, restaurant bar had a nice atmosphere. Would recommend for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bobm128
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton hotels in general, so I am a bit biased. However, the Nine-Zero is a sleek hotel with good sized, comfortable rooms. It has very friendly and professional staff who were proactively inquiring about how they could assist me. The Nine-Zero is in a fantastic location in Boston, downtown w/in a half mile or so from the New England Aquarium, Fanuiel Hall, and some great restaurants. I could walk to pretty much everywhere I wanted and it's close to the trains so you can catch one to Fenway Park. I view Kimptons as branded more for adult travelers, which I prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Almost there”
Reviews.Author: sandie-113
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the the Nine Zero last weekend, beautiful rooms, wonderful comfortable beds, excellent position, staff - nearly all very pleasant and helpful but just a couple of irritating things. No coffee/tea facilities in rooms and $10 a day for internet access for standard guests. OK I know I'm a Brit, but waking up in the morning and having to go in search of a hot drink - not good! If the bookstore down the street can offer free Wifi why can't Kimpton? These are small things which would be standard in any good UK hotel, not expensive to provide but a real inconvenience for guests when they're not readily available. So come on Kimpton let's make it a 10/10 instead of an 8

Reviews.Title: “Fitted the bill very nicely”
Reviews.Author: angus s
Reviews.Content: Justifies its billing as a design hotel - the decor is modern, rooms v comfortable and relaxing environment. The in-house restaurant (KO Prime) does great food (breakfast was a treat and the dinner was really v good). Also of note was the mixology at the KO Prime bar. The downside that caught me by surprise was coming back to my room on the second night to find it cleaned but the bed un-made (i.e. as I'd left it in the morning). I called Reception straight away to be told - 'oh, we only change the beds every other day unless you specify - would you like us to come and make it now?' a) if this is policy why not inform guests at check-in, and more importantly, b) this is a 4 star hotel and whilst I don't necessarily expect clean bedding every day I don't think it's unreasonable to expect the bed to be made. This did irk, but overall the hotel was good and I would certainly (being more prepared re services) stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Boutique Hotel in the Center of Boston”
Reviews.Author: dehenderson
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Nine Zero was win-win for me - I discovered an outstanding boutique hotel in a great location, and I discovered the Kimpton Hotel group. Superb staff, nice rooms. My only suggestion might be higher quality of breakfast food choices. While it strikes me that a discriminating person might choose the Nine Zero, the fairly poor food quality is counter-intuitive.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at a Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: loudab
Reviews.Content: Kimpton Hotels are my brand of choice. Who can argue with free wine, wi-fi, papers and morning coffee? The Nine Zero is a well situated hotel--it's right off the Boston Commons and a block from a subway stop. We were fortunate to have been placed on the 19th floor and had a beautiful view of the Charles and downtown Boston. As usual, the bed was comfy with soft sheets, perfect pillows and a nice mattress. The bathroom was fine as well and had nice toiletries and fluffy towels. The rooms were not as soundproofed as they could be--there's a gap under each door that could be filled so that all the noise from the hallway is better filtered. The hotel front desk seemed a bit understaffed although the staff there could not have been more lovely. Housekeeping did a great job and the rooms were kept spotless. There is one thing that this Kimpton does that I've never encountered elsewhere that I think they should change. The Kimpton offers free morning coffee which is great. Every other Kimpton I've stayed in has large carafes in the lobby and guests can serve themselves. The Nine Zero requires guests to go to their restaurant and ask the beleaguered hostess to get you a cup. You don't get to cream and sugar it yourself--they do it for you. Twice, I had to wait five minutes just to get the hostess's attention. It makes no sense that I have to ask someone for a free cup of coffee. The Nine Zero needs to move the coffee to a place guests can serve themselves. But, the coffee is a small thing. It's a lovely hotel, the staff is great and the location ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Can't argue with these glowing reviews”
Reviews.Author: HughJarres
Reviews.Content: The locaion is superb - just opposite the Old Granary Burying Ground, along from Park Street Church and a stone's throw from Boston Common. Tremont Street is pretty busy and I'd be wary of any room on the front; thankfully ours was not. The bed was quite the most comfortable I've ever slept in, and that includes the one I have at home! Niggles? Well, it's pretty pricey, but I guess not so much in the context of Boston prices. And I'd have appreciated a coffee maker automatically in the room (which I discover from reviews that I should have requested). On that subject, the refrigerator was stacked with stuff I'd never touch, whereas a couple of complimentary bottles of water would have been much more appreciated. Otherwise, the other reviews say it all: elegance all around and service second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better the Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: edandmer
Reviews.Content: We had another amazing stay at the Nine Zero! We had stayed back in June 2010 and John, the concierge, recognized my kids as soon as we checked in! He kept the kids entertained, brought them and myself snacks while we were out and a goldfish! Erin at the front desk and al the other people we met in the lobby ( sorry I can't remember your names, Andrew?) were so friendly and nice and always had a smile. This is the first time we traveled with our dog and they made the whole experience an amazing one. Very easy!!! They also recommended incredible restaurants and were so helpful in making reservations for us. When you talk about someone going the extra mile for their customers, they go the extra 100 miles!!! We will be back AGAIN!!!!!! Thanks again for an amazing stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ruthh4389
Reviews.Content: Firstly I think that you have to certain academy to work in this hotel. At this academy you learn to be THE most helpful, kind, knowledgable, polite and lovely staff members. If this is the case, then everyone at this hotel must have graduated with honours!!! We stayed 5 nights in April. The hotel deserves its 4 star rating. We asked for a pet free floor and I'm glad we did. Although the hotel was spotlessly maintained and extremely clean it does except pets. It is not the hotel but some of the owners that there could be issues with. I had an elevator ride with an extremely wet very smelly English sheep dog. Now I am a dog lover myself and have a dog indoors in my home, its just if you have any allergies, asthmas etc then you may wish to book a pet free floor. Otherwise when travelling far from home after leaving your pet, it is nice to see dogs around the hotel. There was a small issue for our first night and when we finally arrived very late at night we had been given an lovely cheese platter and a bottle of wine and complementary continental breakfast cards. This was not at all expected but just goes to show how they can not do enough for their guests The rooms are very clean and stylishly decorated with lovely products. Our whole stay at this hotel was absolutely wonderful. Thomas and Peter?James (sorry) the concierge gave us so many ideas and their recommendation for things to do and for meals were spot on. I must say one of the best meals we have ever eaten was at Grlll 23. The best rib eye our whole family had ever had and the deserts were delicious. Also Atlanitc Fish Company is also a great night out. Neither are a cheap restaurant but worth the splurge. The Kimpton hotels offers free wifi when you are a member and a few other little benfits. It costs nothing to join and we found this a bonus. A stay in this hotel will not disappoint. From my first contact with Erin at the front desk, to the final goodbye at 5.30am no one could have been nicer and more helpful. Book this hotel for your stay in Boston. The position is also great walking distance to many areas of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Supreme Service”
Reviews.Author: FrankieFile
Reviews.Content: I cannot imagine another hotel with greater eagerness to provide top quality service. At every turn, I was asked if everything was ok (it was) or if they could do anything to make my stay more pleasant. All requests we made were promptly satisfied, ex. to have a coffeemaker placed in the room. The room was clean and stylish. Our 18th floor room overlooked Fenway Park in the distance. For members of their 'club,' there is free internet in room. Wine social hour for all. The hotel's location is not central but is a brief walk to any usual tourist site. The neighborhood is safe and 100 steps away from the Boston Common. I love Kimpton Hotels and this one did not disappoint. I would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cherie2812
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero has class. The decor is trendy, lively, fun, and elegant. The staff was exceptional and helpful with tips on restaurants and sites for our short stay in Boston. The accomodations were very comfortable, and the zebra striped robes in the room were too fun! The location of the hotel couldn't have been better. I will definitely being staying there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Viking1EastYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Nine Zero Hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the concierge, Thomas, made the stay extra special by arranging some birthday surpirses for my partner. The rooms are spacious with very comfy beds and great in room amentities. Our view from the room was amazing and it was also very centrally located. We loved Boston and this hotel. Can'e wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: rch_sa
Reviews.Content: We stayed during a visit to see friends. It's a great location. We had an issue with our room and they way that the handled it could not have been better. Mark from Housekeeping is a class act. Anytime I'm back in Boston, this is where I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the High Price”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Nine Zero. Our first stay here was wonderful, so we booked it again, despite the fairly high price this time. Although our room included nice views of the Boston skyline, we did not find the quality of service or the room to be worth the price that we paid. Further, the bed was very uncomfortable and had a bump in the middle. I would only recommend the Nine Zero if you are able to get a good deal on the price. On the positive side, the Nine Zero does offer free wireless Internet for Kimpton InTouch members, which is a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel -great service.”
Reviews.Author: fraser301
Reviews.Content: We are currently enjoying a 5 night break at the 90 zero and have been greatly impressed by the quality of the room.The staff have been very helpful and friendly the one hour wine session from 5.00-6,00 p.m is a welcome relief from all the activities which can be found close by.The free internet for kimpton in touch members is also much appreciated.On arrival in our room we found a bottle of bubbly and six strawberries dipped in chocolate -a welcome touch even though our 30 anniversary, isn't till tomorrow,The concergie staff have been great in securing dining reservations.The whole of Boston is taken up by the marathon but I certainly intend to visit the city again and enjoy the hospitality of this great hotel found in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping is extremely noisy early.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and the front desk staff are incredibly helpful. However, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to sleep past 7:30 am. Each morning at around 8, my husband and I were jolted awake by housekeeping literally slamming doors and yelling at each other down hallways. We did not get a single night's sleep. I expected more based on previous Kimptons I have stayed at and the rate I paid. Location and hip decor does not matter if you can't sleep at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overprized Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aoesterl
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms, the lobby and the ambiente are very elegant and worth to see. But, the quality of the room cleaning can be improved, e.g. Coffee cups are not cleaned. We stayed with kids - concierge service was really friendly, but we had to ask for a coffee maker, and every time we want to have capsules we had to call the room service. Waiste of time for both sides, especially 6am. We never had breakfast, so we oly can recommend the nice, little coffees 40m away from hotel with reasonable prices. Internt access was free of charge, if you register at the kimpton hmepage right before to get a member number (free of charge). So in total a good business/design hotel, not to recommend with kids. Valet parking for 40 bucks even to high and staff not always careful with the car.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; Great location!”
Reviews.Author: anncsb
Reviews.Content: In Boston for three days, the Nine Zero Hotel was beautiful! I have visited Boston several times in the last few years, and this hotel was by far my favorite! Great location, very courteous staff and wonderful room. I was on the 5th floor in a room with the most comfortable bed and pillows. Very quiet. Loved the flavored water in the lobby and the wine reception each evening. The location is just across from Sam Adams' grave and the Beantown Pub, so you can toast Sam Adams with a Sam Adams! Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “All around awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2011 and loved the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was nicely appointed and had tons of amenities (like the stereo, which I did not expect, but used every day). Housekeeping was awesome! After I checked in, they actually came to my room to make sure I was comfortable and had everything I needed. This hotel is perfectly situated in the center of Boston. It is across the street from Boston Common and close to the T. There are restaurants, coffee shops, shopping, historic sights, EVERYTHING, within a 5 minute walk in any direction. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Comfort in a Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: STL531
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nine Zero for three nights while visiting friends in Boston. I got a great deal on the room by booking it at the same time as my flight on a travel website. The location--right near Boston Common and near two major metro stations--was perfect. The bed was comfortable, the curtains blocked out light well, and I couldn't hear too much street noise, so I slept well. I did occasionally hear noise from the hallways and other rooms. The only other things I had issues with in the room was the bathroom--there were no convenient places to hang towels near the shower, and the bathrobe provided smelled absolutely horrible. I did not try the hotel's restaurant (KO Prime) at all, but it seemed pretty over-priced, especially for breakfast, which is not generally included in the room rates. Overall, I felt that I got a great deal for the quality of the hotel and the location, and I would revisit the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: McHarvard
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for my recent trip to Boston and relied on Trip Advisor (as usual). Without knowing anything about areas in Boston, I read many, many reviews and settled on the Nine Zero Hotel. I was actually disappointed in the hotel and do not understand why it is so highly rated. When I arrived, check in was awkward due to a special event in the lobby. I was not directed to use a different entrance, so I entered in the main lobby. After many unfriendly stares from the people who I guess were having the event and tripping over a special effects lighting apparatus, I made my way to the 3rd floor lobby. The desk person seemed nice enough, but I was not even asked if I needed assistance to my room. The dÃ©cor of my room, which I guess is â€œtrendy,â€� was not to my taste at all. The comforter on the bed and the robe was an animal print, akin to something from the Flintstones. Since the hotel is squeezed between other buildings, I had windows that faced those buildings, so the drapes had to remain closed. Therefore, the room was dark unless using the lamps in the room. I went out to inspect the area. When I returned, I was directed to enter the hotel via what was a service entrance because of the special event. It took three calls to get room service. In fact, I never reached themâ€“my order had to be called in by someone I reached at the front desk. One of my dinner items was delivered uncovered (!) and the turkey burger melt was definitely burnt. The volume on the phone in my room was terrible, and no amount of adjustment would make it any louder. Over the course of a 4-day stay, the ice machine on my floor was never fixed. The toiletries are musk-scented (not my favorite scent) and everything in the room carried a price tag. I was afraid to use the soap, lest I be charged to my bill. Iâ€™m glad I travel with my own toiletries. The only positive thing I can say about the hotel is that it is close to everythingâ€“from the Freedom Trail to the T system--and seemed relatively quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Small, chic hotel with 5-star service located in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Julia_Hartz
Reviews.Content: The team here is truly one-of-a-kind. We were treated like royalty from the moment we walked through the door. The service was fantastic and we felt right at home for our entire stay. The location is also central and closely located to Boston Commons and the T.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel overall with friendly staff, great accomodations, and good location.”
Reviews.Author: nadiashahmalik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed only for one night (wish we could have stayed longer) but had a great experience overall. We love the Kimpton Hotel brand and have stayed at The Epic in Miami and Hotel Solamar in San Diego. I believe this is our 3rd Kimpton Brand hotel and we plan on trying to always stay Kimpton hotels because of the level of luxury and friendliness of staff. Nine Zero's rooms are pretty big. We stayed in a king bed room. The bathrooms are super clean and nicely decorated. The bed is really comfortable. I think I slept 9 hrs straight without waking up for even a second. The room has modern decor except for the tube tv (which still worked perfectly). The lobby is really trendy and eclectic. We didn't attend the wine hour because we don't drink but we did grab a soda and other people really seemed to enjoy it. The best part of this stay was the kindness of the concierge, John Bizzozero, who sent up a cheese platter w/ bottles of water, just to make our stay extra special. He even included a hand written note welcoming us to the hotel! It's the little things like this that Kimpton Hotel's do that make us want to stay only at Kimptons. Make sure you sign up for Kimpton In touch so you can get free wifi, $10 worth of items from the mini bar, and many other benefits. Nine Zero overall was wonderful and worth the cost. The location of this hotel is great also. It's really close to the subway and various bus stops. Also you can walk easily to a lot of restaurants, recreation, and entertainment spots.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay - Close to Emerson College”
Reviews.Author: kadrew
Reviews.Content: Decided to treat myself to a relaxing night away after dropping off my daughter at Emerson College. The Nine Zero Hotel was just the right place! Friendly greetings at check in, complimentary wine in the late afternoon and a comfy bed with lovely amenities. It was peaceful, quiet and very clean! The Boston Common is just across the street. My daughter joined me for delicious breakfast before we parted ways and I headed back home to reality... Next trip, I will be my pug, because the Nine Zero is pet friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Celebrate an Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Cindy53
Reviews.Content: We booked a getaway at the Nine Zero Hotel to celebrate our anniversary through SniqueAway. When we arrived to check in, we were greeted with "Happy Anniversary" and 2 glasses of champagne. Our room wasn't quite ready (we arrived early) so we waited in the lobby enjoying our champagne for just a short time. A couple of hours later, we received a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries from Kevin, the concierge. Earlier in the week, I had emailed him about where to have a pre-theater dinner. He responded immediately with 5 suggestions. The one we chose (Scollay Square) was an outstanding choice. We were able to enjoy our dinner and walk to the Opera House in plenty of time for the play. The hotel was very clean and well appointed. We loved the funkiness of the furnishings as well as the comfort of the room. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a get away or for business. They really take care of their guests!

Reviews.Title: “I Called It Home”
Reviews.Author: 11traveling
Reviews.Content: Recently finished a three month stay at Nine Zero. I can not say enough about this hotel and the outstanding staff. Gabrielle, Erin, John, Thomas, Ben and everyone else I could never thank you enough for making my business trip an absolute pleasure. My dog and I were far from homesick since you went out of your way to look after us and keep us entertained. Nine Zero is in a great location and my only problem was deciding where to go next and what to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay -- exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: hjreid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Nine Zero for one night recently on a birthday trip down into Boston. I got a deal on SniqueAway. I bought the more expensive room option on SniqueAway to get a King room with a view. I was a little worried that perhaps the hotel might not honor that... but not only did we get a lovely King room with a fabulous view of the Boston Common and city skyline... we were also treated very well by the hotel staff. Right from the moment of our arrival they were welcoming and helpful. The young woman who checked us in asked what brought us to Boston and I explained it was my husband's birthday. She offered us champagne to take up to our room with us -- a very nice welcoming gesture. Later than night, after we got back from dinner, there was a bottle of champagne in our room -- another very pleasant surprise! The room itself was great -- good sized, somewhat hip, very large bathroom. But the real killer was the view.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great service males a great experiece”
Reviews.Author: Thodin
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero hotel in Boston was a very pleasant surprise. From the minute you stepped in to the Hotel you felt welcome, and through my stay the staff at the reception desk kept their hearty and high level service to guide you through your stay in Boston. Rooms are just, great, great, great - big, fantastic interior, nice accessories, good beds and very clean. Nice breakfast, nice restaurant, cosy bar and again a great service. The hotel has a good central location in Boston just next to Boston common a nice place for a walk or the morning jogging. Some may consider the hotel a bit Ã³n the pricy side - but compared to the standard and service of this hotel it is more than worth every dime the charge you for a stay. I have stayed in many hotels throughout the World also hotels Ã³n the pricy side and I rate the Nine Zero hotel in Boston among the very best I ever stayed in. I can absolutely reccomend you the Nine Zero Hotel. By the way dÃ³ not forget the complementary wine tasting in the hall at five P.M. Enjoy your stay Best wishes Per Toennesen, Copenhagen, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT, WOULD RETURN WITHOUT HESITATION”
Reviews.Author: geebs77
Reviews.Content: I returned yesterday from a four day stay at the "Nine Zero " hotel , it was exceptional from the second we arrived, Checking in at 5pm offered the added bonus of a glass of red wine as the daily wine reception had just started. We were checked in , in less than 5 minutes, I have stayed in many hotels and this was by far was the least strenuous. Location was excellent, we had a room that overlooked Boston Common and Beacon Hill, we were close to all attractions. The Hotel offers the boutique style we like and standard of any deluxe property that we have ever stayed in, Special thanks to Tom and Gabrielle, they made are stay smooth and answered any questions we may off had ! Would definilty recommend the NINE ZERO , and we will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Every Expectation!”
Reviews.Author: d_hops
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to explain how wonderful my experience was at the Nine Zero - from arrival through checkout, the service and accommodations were flawless. John and Erin at the front desk were incredible! My room wasn't quite ready (I arrived around 11am) so I went for a run along the river and stored my bags at the hotel; when I returned my bags were waiting for me in my room. The hotel itself is in a perfect location, and as an added bonus my 18th-floor corner room had tremendous views of the Boston Common, Charles River and Fenway Park. The amenities I had requested were waiting upon my arrival. The decor and ambiance were so inviting, I can't wait to go back! It was a pleasure to stay at the Nine Zero, and I would recommend it to anyone desiring a unique, personalized hotel stay in the heart of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “great service great room great location”
Reviews.Author: atlantatvlr
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay at Nine Zero! from the greeting of the bellman - checking in was easy, they accomodated our room request, handed me a glass of wine, and just made life EASY, beautiful warm fun atmosphere - the room was very comfortable, great sheets and pillows,!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: klever08
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Nine Zero, after booking on Snique Away, to get away from our normal, stressful life and it was exactly what we needed! From the valet to Gabriella at the front desk, who upgraded our room for free, our stay was excellent! We received complimentary glasses of delicious champagne when we checked in. Then from 5-6 there is a wine reception in the lobby's lounge, with a choice of red or white...also complimentary! The location is excellent. Right on Tremont St. We could see the Pru from our window. The restaurant is also excellent! No snooty Boston people here; just lovely and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cuomo-UK
Reviews.Content: Perfect balance between what you need for business - big desk, comfy work chair, close to office, all-night room menu - and what you need to feel like being someplace fun and special - great lobby, fun room, grest service.

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zero - a beautiful hotel matched with superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: mrbc53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the absolute pleasure of staying at your beautiful hotel this past weekend. We have stayed in many fine hotels in the US and Europe. The physical beauty of your hotel is matched by the quality of your wonderful staff. Absolutely everyone we encountered was friendly, polite and intent on making our stay as pleasurable as possible. It is nice to be acknowledged - the staff looks at you and says hello! They truly seem to enjoy their jobs . The hotel is ideally located for people who like to put their car away for the weekend. The theater district, Boston Commons, shopping and the "T" are within a few blocks. We will be returning to Boston over the next years since we now have a son living there and we will definitely stay at Nine Zero.

Reviews.Title: “Modern elegance”
Reviews.Author: TmvB
Reviews.Content: Right on the Freedom Trail and a short walk to many historical sites, this hotel was the perfect overnight stay while in Boston to celebrate Valentine's Day. The staff was helpful and accommodating. We were even offered a glass of wine when we arrived!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Perfect Location and So Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kitch40
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Boston for meetings at the State House. Nine Zero was close by and so lovely. The room was perfectly appointed, clean and comfortable and the staff couldn't have been nicer. They had a wine and chocolate reception the evening I was there and I met the most interesting people. Even met a well behaved dog! Being fond of animals, this was a highlight of my trip. Will definitely go back to Nine-Zero!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff goes above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTravelFiend
Reviews.Content: Exhausted from a conference, all I wanted was a room away from noise and with a tub. The first room didn't have a tub, so they moved me. Then the second room was adjacent to the ice machine and I was only hearing people getting ice outside my door. Unfortunately the hotel was completely booked aside from these last two rooms, so the staff couldn't switch me again. I departed for dinner a bit bummed about the room to which I would be returning later in the night. Upon returning, I immediately saw candles and bath soaking salts in my room with a note from the front desk giving apologies for my room and wishing me a relaxing stay. On night two, they moved me to a quieter room but one without a tub (apparently not a ton of tubs available). Again, the front desk seemed truly sorry they couldn't give me the perfect room. Within an hour, a knock came at the door with a staffer bringing me a bottle of wine, chocolates and chocolate-covered strawberries and another hand-written note apologizing for my room and wishing me an enjoyable evening. Both rooms were very nice, but just not exactly what I wanted. However the front desk staff went above and beyond with these nice touches to make my stay more comfortable and relaxing. Regardless of the room I'm given, I'll stay at Nine Zero any time I'm back to Boston! The hotel's location is ideal as well. And the restaurant KO has a delicious breakfast (eggs Benedict specifically yummy).

Reviews.Title: “I can recommend it highly- service is tops!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: Because of recent business trips, I have stayed in about 4 business-level hotels (4 and 4.5 star) in Boston in the past few months. I loved this hotel! I would stay here again in a second. Here's why: Excellent service. It actually reminded me of an elegant European hotel with polished, low-key but truly outstanding service. Sending a fax at 2 am? No problem. Arranging a car service to the suburbs? No problem, and even a question on budget considerations. Local recommendations? Yup, they had it. Fast, free internet, well-designed room that was small but with a nice overlook to a park (actually a historic cemetery but I thought it was a park during my stay). These folks have not only been trained to have a personal touch but they execute it, from top to bottom. Beds are very comfortable, rooms are library-quiet, bathroom was small (only shower) but functional. I can highly recommend this property. Plus the $199 rate I paid was an unbelievable deal for the value of this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel,Warm Friendly Service and Great Location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: casey99
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Nine Zero Hotel . Went to Celtics game and RV and Camping Show at Trade Center. Used hotel Valet Parking Service....very friendly and smiling attendants greeted us at our vehicle. Check-in service smooth, front desk staff efficient.. Room was on the smaller size but had everything we needed. In room safe is large enough for laptop storage. Concierge very helpful in selecting restaurants. Location is perfect for moving around the city. Park Street Station very close. Can walk through common to Beacon Hill area or walk to Financial District/Quincy Market Area. Had late night drinks at KO Prime..which has small comfortable bar and lounge. Drinks were awesome..try the lemon tarragon martini!! Had breakfast in the restaurant, both food and service excellent. We had one episode of noise in the hallyway during the night requiring me to call the front desk. It was promptly addressed and taken care of immediately with a followup apology in the am. Every staff member we interacted with for the entire stay was pleasant,helpful, courteous and smiling. You cannot ask for a better place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable evening in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Carrieweed
Reviews.Content: I arranged an evening at the Nine Zero to celebrate my third anniversary with my boyfriend. It was a surprise and I wanted to do something special for the occasion. Andrew Smith, the Front Desk Manager, helped me plan it perfectly--it was truly remarkable. He helped me with an early check in, scheduled a time for me to drop off our overnight bag without my boyfriend knowing, and even had Champagne on ice in the room when the surprise was revealed. We had an incredible time and the hotel is absolutely beautiful. This place knows what hospitality really means! A big thank you to the entire team!

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous hotel, superb staff who know what vegemite is!”
Reviews.Author: judith36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nine Zero as part of a month in the US. We arrived in the middle of the Boxing day snowstorm and were promptly served a galss of wine. As a dog lover far from our pets, I loved the presence of 2 beautiful well mannered dogs. The crowning service was the day our 19yr old type one diabetic son had a tummy bug. After many hours of vomiting and wondering when we should take him to hospital, he recovered at 11pm. We decided some vegemite toast would be the best food. In no time some fresh toast was delivered - we had the vegemite but the evening staff knew what it was! No bill for this. This was my only trip to Boston so I can't really comment on location, except to say it's on the history trail, the trains are easy to use, and we all enjoyed the various sights.

Reviews.Title: “User friendly!”
Reviews.Author: searchnerd
Reviews.Content: A small group of us enjoyed the city while staying at Nine Zero. Not only were the rooms awesome and modern, but the staff was great. Highly recommend this spot if you are traveling with pets, too.

Reviews.Title: “Relax, at hotel zero you are THE most important person staying there.”
Reviews.Author: ALRadz
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I actually fell in love at (and with) this hotel two years ago. We stayed here again most recently to celebarate our two year anniversary. We felt like the two most important people in Boston. All the details, all the little things that they did made us feel truly pampered. We missed their complementary wine hour because our train was delayed, so at check in they gave us two glasses of sparkling wine while they welcomed us back. They upgraded our room to a high floor overlooking the commons and when we walked in... Magic. There were rose petals on the bed, around a bottle of champagne they left chilling, and around our two companion goldfish. They also left us a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and an ORIGINAL Boston creme pie! Immediately we got a call from the front desk asking if everything was to our liking, which it absolutely was! For the rest of our stay we got to know some of the staff and their concierge who was able to get us special reservations at one of the more popular places in Boston. The whole staff was extremely helpful and prompt with whatever we needed. Most importantly they spoke and acted with sincerity, and seemed absolutely genuinely happy that we were there. The hotel itself is great too! Located within a stone's throw of the Boston commons, the granary burial Ground, and close to the T station. The rooms are tastefully appointed with ample space. I've heard some people say that their lobby is small, but at this boutique hotel I think it comes across as intimate. A lot of awesome people stay here and it's kind of fun to just hang out in the lobby. Overall this hotel strikes a perfect balance - upscale without being uptight.

Reviews.Title: “If I have to be away from home for work, Nine Zero is the place I look forward to visiting.”
Reviews.Author: Beachwords
Reviews.Content: I am on the road constantly for work. This was my first stay at Nine Zero and I cannot say enough about the staff and facility. Not only is this hotel in the heart of town, I came back from work each day welcomed by the staff and relaxed within minutes in my room. You want for nothing here. If it isn't in the room, they have it at the desk. The food is excellent. I had to work long hours in my room and it was such a pleasant surprise to have a staff member bring me a pot of coffee in the early hours after he found me roaming the hotel looking for courtesy coffee. The rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. Not your standard cold hotel room. I will be back in a couple weeks and won't even consider staying anywhere else. I wish I could take Nine Zero with me to every city!

Reviews.Title: “Very hip - but lacking in normal amenities”
Reviews.Author: This_too_shall_pass
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nine Zero two nights on business. It is a hip, modern place with fun decor and complimentary glasses of wine at every turn. However, my room was small and storage space was lacking; the hotel restaurant is closed for dinner 2 nights/week (Sunday, Monday), and the shower would be absolutely impossible for a large person to utilize. (The shower door opens inward and one must s-q-u-e-e-z-e between the door and the shower wall to enter/exit the shower. A big person would simply not fit. It is also necessary to turn off the water during entrance / exit or else spray the room. An ergonomic disaster.) Business center is available but no free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with an unexpected perk”
Reviews.Author: tldearden
Reviews.Content: I chose Nine Zero after reading Trip Advisor reviews (thanks Trip Advisor!), and I was not disappointed. I walked from the train station in a cold drizzling rain and was pretty chilled when I walked in the front door. The very friendly front desk clerk asked me if I'd like a complimentary glass of wine to warm me up. I said that would be great if I was a drinker, but what I really needed was a hot cocoa. We both chuckled and I went to my room (which is great, by the way). A few minutes later, as I was putting on my running shoes to go to the fitness center there was a knock at the door. To my surprise and delight a gentleman was standing there with a slice of pie and a tall hot cocoa, complete with marshmallows! He said that he was the night manager and had overheard my conversation with the front desk clerk and wanted to welcome me to the Nine Zero. The hotel is beautiful. The room is great. Kimpton hotels always have great beds, this is no exception. The fitness center is small, but up-to-date and complete. One thing I love about Kimpton hotels is a small thing. They all have a light switch when you walk in that actually turns lights on in the room, instead of just the little hall light you get in most chain hotels. It feels like home. Like I said, it's a small thing, but it's the little things that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel experience - best service”
Reviews.Author: GCF3060
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero was the best hotel service I've ever encountered. We booked through Hotwire and got a great deal, and couldn't have been happier with the experience. We were greeted with a glass of wine upon check-in, and a free upgrade to a Premier room on the 17th floor with incredible views. When we got to the room, there was a bottle of chilled champagne, a cheese platter and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us, as well as a very sweet card from Thomas, the head concierge, wishing us a happy anniversary (I had no idea at the time, but he'd been emailed before our arrival explaining our trip was an anniversary surprise for me). The room itself was small but well-planned, with very comfortable beds and pillows and a spacious bathroom. In fact, the hairdryer that came in the bathroom was even nicer than the one I have at home. The service was unbelievable. Kevin, at the front desk, gave us wonderful restaurant recommendations again and again, and Thomas had another bottle of champagne sent up for us on our last night, as well. It pays to become a Kimpton InTouch member ahead of time - free wifi! Location was excellent, close to two different T stops and right next to Quincy Market, so even the nearly two feet of snow that fell on our second day in Boston barely affected our plans. The hotel also gave us a free on-demand movie rental during the blizzard, and even sent up popcorn when we decided to watch it! My only possible complaints would be the heat was very loud whenever it kicked on, especially in the middle of the night, and there's no fan in the bathroom. But overall, the service was so superb, nothing could get us down. Nine Zero made this an amazing trip to Boston even in the middle of a blizzard - that's saying something. We'll definitely be back to visit Nine Zero again, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barinr
Reviews.Content: We just stayed a week at the Nine Zero. We were booked for four nights but the blizzard kept us three three additional nights. Don't feel sorry for us. It was a real pleasure. When we arrived we were warmly greeted on a very cold evening and immediately offered a glass of wine. The staff was wonderful. Our every request was promptly handled. The location provides a wide range of places to eat, although being near Fanuel Hall, some are too touristy for our taste. But there are plenty of other options. If I have a complaint it was the food. We only ate breakfast there which was adequate, fast, with great service, but it lacked a tad. The afternoon free wine from 5-6 is well attended and offers a chance to meet other guests. The elevators are super fast, wifi works throughout the hotel, and water pressure was great. A large chain hotel we stayed at a week earlier in Boston failed all three of these tests. The next time we return to Boston we will surely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “near perfect”
Reviews.Author: flitzaround
Reviews.Content: I joined the Kimpton Hotel guest program prior to staying here. I was greeted with a glass of wine, and (presumable because it was the New Year week), a complimentary bottle of champagne in my room. All the staff without exception were particulatly delightful, helpful, friendly, and seemed to be genuinely interested in doing anything they could to assist me in any way. The bed and pillows were fantastic, the room and bathroom had excellent lighting and amenities. Best of all is the price. For comparable hotels, this is outstanding. For the first night, a friend decided to join me, so I phoned to ensure I had a king bed or two queens. I was given the option, and chose two queens. All this at no extra cost. My only criticism is that there is no decent towel rail in the bathroom to dry towels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: rjslatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Christmas for a week. We booked the King Premiere Room with a view. The view was excellent and the room was very nice. We didn't eat at the restaurant or try the bar so I can't comment on those. The location is excellent being just a block from Boston Common and several blocks from Faneuil Hall. Newbury street is just across the Common. Overall we really liked the hotel and will stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, great location, fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Daydreamingtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, literally steps away from the Freedom Trail and a block from the Park T stop. The staff was beyond helpful, giving us directions, making reservations, offering advice and just being friendly. The accomodations are amazing, very modern up to date with all the ammenities you could ask for. They always have fresh fruit infused water out, hot chocolate in the afternoon and a wine reception at night. I forgot my hair straightener...and they had some one hand to borrow!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room , TERRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: BostonFestuca
Reviews.Content: Spent New Years Eve at 90 and although the location was great and the hotel itself is clean and modern, my stay was a disaster. The check-in was slow the valet parking was total chaos. The pay movie channel was broken,the request for service was met with excuses and promises of a quick fix,and no follow up! The front desk assured us that the problem would be addressed . Still no reply! My vehicle was parked on the street in the valet exit area with a brand new dent ! My complaint was met with complete indiference. No apology, no concern, just blame game pointing the finger at contracted parking company (Laz) Awful , total incompitence!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: Tigrotto70
Reviews.Content: Centrally located downtown, opposite the Granary Burial Ground, near the Boston Common and within walking distance from metro station (Park St) so easily accessible from the airport. Spacious and clean, minute details. Breakfast varied and tasty. The staff is extremely knowledgeable, friendly and polite, always willing to answer our requests. The city of Boston is really beautiful and livable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: andrewfm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a reservation here after Christmas. We planned to stay here for a night after leaving Nantucket where we spent our Christmas. Unfortunately, due to a large snow/wind/rain storm, all the boats and planes from Nantucket were canceled for two days. We called the hotel to cancel our reservation. The hotel said they would be happy to cancel it, but since we made the reservation through a third party (Skoosh.com), we would have to cancel through them. The hotel told us they would have to pay Skoosh either way so we asked to just get a credit with the hotel, which they refused. The hotel said if the third party would agree to let us cancel, they would be happy to oblige. We contacted the third party and they said many other people had this same type of issue due to the large storm. They told us they would be fine with canceling the hotel reservation, but that they would have to see if the hotel would agree. A day later, we were informed that the hotel would not agree to let us cancel the reservation. We had stayed here about 6 nights previously. I would think that a hotel of this caliber would value repeat business and not look to make money off bad situations like this. We will avoid this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice for those with little ones in boston”
Reviews.Author: nezz81
Reviews.Content: I went to the nine zero hotel in boston for the first week of december with my 20 month old. I am also pregnant so i needed something in a great walkable location. I researched each posibility myself as well as looked at trip advisor comments. I eventually narrowed it down to the nine zero and the omni parker. On Oyster.com they have a picture of the bathrooms in the Omni parker, it wasn't very appealing to me so i went for the nine zero. I have been to kimpton hotels before so i knew that the rooms, the decor, the service and the perks would be impeccable and the nine zero did not disappoint. I called the night before we flew and told them i booked a standard room but was wondering if they had a larger room available. They did, they held a room for us and it just made it that much more comfortable. Every morning and most nights they would bring warm milk for my little one to help her start the day or settle down at night. They did this at no extra cost, i know it's just a small cup of milk but as tired weary parents the last thing we wanted to do was walk to dunkin donuts or starbucks in the cold for milk (both of which are close by) They also had toys to give to my daughter (which she thought was amazing.) There are two metro or T stops close by : government center and park street. If you fly into logan you get a shuttle to the blue line and get off at government center. Faneuil Hall/Quincy market is a very short walk and is a good option for different types of foods.They also have live shows outside which was a nice treat. There is shopping close by, the childrens museum and breweries (for when baby naps in the stroller) were very easy to get to. If you have any questions the concierge are very very helpful. In the winter time there isnt much going on for very little ones. Target have a deal with the childrens museum for friday nights - they have made the entrance fee $1 per person so we took advantage of that. The tree lighting ceremony was cool to watch too. For the rest of the time I was at a loss for ideas and the concierge pointed us into the right direction. At first this seems like an adult hotel with it's free wine and snacks every night and lobby filled with very well dressed business people. I found they really welcomed us and helped us in any way they could. We had a wonderful trip and when i make my next trip to boston i will go to the nine zero for sure.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartyBeingMarty
Reviews.Content: My first visit to the Nine Zero came because the Ames was sold out, and it was my luckiest day of the year. Let's take this by category: 1. Location: well situated near Government Center and Downtown Crossing. Not as close to the Financial District as I would like, but Boston is a small enough city that it doesn't really matter. 2. Check-in experience: Greeted promptly and warmly at the desk. After a quick run through the details of my reservation, I was introduced to the concierge (in case I needed anything) and also pointed to the reception in the lobby. 3. Decor and facilities: very modern, clean and crisp. The lobby itself is a bit small, but more inviting than the Ames and with better chances to people-watch. 4. Room: I had a room on a high floor with an impressive view of the Common and Back Bay. Bed was VERY comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and modern, and they had a nice audio system in the room. 5. Restaurant: the only blemish: the seating area in the bar is smaller than it could be, and they ran out of Heineken at 11pm. The best part of the Nine Zero is the quality of the staff. On my second trip (and subsequent stays) I was greeted by name in the lobby - no way they could ever do that at the Westin at Copley. The Nine Zero reminded me why I've cut down my stays at Starwood properties - even an upgrade at the Westin Copley is less enjoyable than a standard rate room at the Nine Zero. I couldn't recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “Really delighted”
Reviews.Author: AndyZ18
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero truly exceeded all expectations. Room styling was bold and distinct from the routine business room, yet everything was familiar and worked well. Service was friendly and speedy. The wine hour is a nice touch, particularly here, where professional and international guests abound. The location was very convenient. The continental breakfast was stylish and plentiful, and was served rather than a buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: reppop
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero is a perfect place to stay when visiting the beautiful city of Boston. You are in the heart of it all at this premiere location and the service, from the moment you walk in the door to departure, is fabulous. The staff aim to please and are very knowledgeable about area attractions, restaurants and nightlife that suit your fancy. In house amenities are great and fun to indulge in. Recommend dining or ordering room service from the neighboring restaurant. Conveniently delicious! We were so happy to take in a one night stay and look forward to many more in the future. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Lydia356
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to its central location right next to Boston Common. Most sightseeing highlights are in easy walking distance. We stayed on the 13th floor and the view over the park and the city was incredible. The room was conveniently decorated, however, the room service was very basic and something that could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Truly memorable experiencing the VIP treatment”
Reviews.Author: shellygq
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on Tripadvisor, but I just couldn't go without telling everyone what a great time I had. We travelled from Ireland for a girlie shopping weekend. We had our hotel reservation cancelled from 1800 hotels when they went bust so I called the hotel direct. An email to the reservations manager Josh put any worries to rest when he matched the 1800 price. On arrival after a long flight we were greeted by the smiling face of Erin who got us a glass of wine whilst we checked in. Our room was beautiful, on 6th floor as I cannot travel in elevators........room was a tiny bit small for all our shopping after the outlets but can request a bigger one for our next visit!!! On our return that evening a cheese board and wine awaited us in our room.........Breakfast was good and set us up for the day. After the outlets the bell hops brought our bags to the room while we part took in the wine tasting.............we are Irish after all! Anyway, I jokingly commented to John B the concierge that we were thrilled with the cheeseboard but would've loved the choc strawberries as they are my fave. When we got back to the room that night there to my complete surprise was a plate of choc strawberries!! There are so many more things I can tell but don't wanna bore you or indeed make you jealous. Suffice to say I have stayed in many 5 star hotels and this is more than a match for any of them. The only thing they haven't got the star for is that they don't have a pool/spa...........but it certainly makes up for it in many many ways. I have never felt so welcome and so important EVER in any hotel. Our girlie trip was one of the best trips of my life and I'm already planning our return. Thanks so much to all the staff at the Nine Zero esp Josh, John B, Kevin, Erin and Ben. Don't change a thing, keep doing what you're doing coz you're doing it well!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Boston without question”
Reviews.Author: eilig
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the Boston Marathon, and was delighted with this choice. Excellent service, and wine greeting upon arrival. Updated, modern, and stylish decor. Spotless clean, and awsome shower with good water pressure. First room was a bit disappointing, as someone in the neighboring room was violating the non-smoking hotel policy. The hotel said they would look into it, but nothing happened. Smelled smoke my entire first night of stay, which really upset me because I have asthma. They had no other rooms and could not relocate me, and they didn't seem to get the neighbor to abide by the rules. But they more than made up for it the next day, when they upgraded me to a suite on the top floor with outstanding view, along with their sincere apologies. Were it not for this, I'd rate the hotel much lower than I did. The food was excellent, and the location is ideal for most things. Close to marathon bus pickup area. And a straight easy cab ride to the airport. Also only a few blocks to nearest "T" (public transportation). Aside from the smelling smoking neighbor issue, which was resolved the next day, it was a great stay at a well-located, well-managed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic decor w/ Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: MrReid
Reviews.Content: Well trained staff and comfortable rooms. Decor is kind of metro-artsy, and you can't beat the location. While I appreciated the complimentary after work glass of wine, I would have preferred AM coffee service in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, hip hotel with AMAZING staff and the best location!”
Reviews.Author: CVanAllen
Reviews.Content: Once a year, two of my girlfriends and I get together for a girls' weekend. We are not the kind of people who travel tons, so it's important to use to find the best place for our trip. We ABSOLUTELY did on this trip to Boston!! There are so many wonderful things to say about this hotel - it is beautiful, hip, modern. The beds were SO comfortable!! The wet bar had a MARTINI bar - including mixers and glass rimmers. The two keys for us were service and location. You cannot BEAT the location. Dead center of everything - walk to Boston Common, Newbury Street, Fanueil Hall, North End and more, right from the front door. And the service? EXCEPTIONAL!! I venture to say, nicest most accommodating staff I've ever encountered. From the call to set up our reservation, calls to ask questions, pulling into the hotel's valet (which, at $40/day is a tiny bit pricey, but you can take your car in and out all day), the front desk staff, the concierge - EVERY SINGLE PERSON made you feel like you were the only guest, and the only goal they had in life was to make you enjoy your stay. The concierge, Jon, was amazing - got us reservations to tours, then, upon our return when we missed the wine hour, he got us wine. The front desk staff, when called on the phone, don't act snooty - they treat you like there is no one else in the world they'd rather talk to. The wine hour, the water containers with fresh fruit 24/7, the late night staff - they are all there to serve, and do it with a smile and welcoming attitude. This hotel is definitely in a price range I don't typically reserve (due to having a 10 year old), but I can't WAIT to return!! THANK YOU NINE ZERO!! You made our girls' weekend absolutely fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “A well situated hotel with an attractive, competent, well trained staff.”
Reviews.Author: mr-cafe
Reviews.Content: Hard to match the combination of location and competence of staff at this hotel. You can walk to almost anything of interest in Boston from this location and the staff will make sure you have a good time when you get there. Need a reservation at a tough to get into restaurant? No problem. If you can, try to get a room on a higher floor. The views of Boston, day or night, intoxicating. A can't miss destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fabulous views in Boston”
Reviews.Author: michael_zrh
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero is probably the best bet you can get in Boston. The rooms on the top four levels have terrific views, unfortunately we had a X10 room, which is the farthest awy from the park, but still has great views over the city. The staff is very professional and helpful. A small problem with our rental car was immeditely solved, so was a small complaint about the breakfast by reimbursing the full amount! almost every evening there's a wine reception in the small lounge at the hotel with a member of the staff. excellent location - in walking distance to financial district and tourist sights.

Reviews.Title: “Two legs or four you will be well looked after.”
Reviews.Author: Aitch099
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and the place has a great buzz. Rooms were clean and smart and the location was fine. If you don't like pets (mainly dogs) then don't go. From our experience the dogs share equal billing with the regular two legged guests. The restaurant was good but not great, although everyone there was keen to see that you enjoyed yourself. The afternoon freebies in the lobby were a nice touch. All in all, a very good 3 night stay. Aitch 099

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amied027
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel with a modern design. The rooms were small but decorated very nice. A welcome gift of chocolates and a bottle of water were in my room when I arrived. The shower was awesome! The beds were also very comfortable. I was a little disappointed by the cleanliness in the bathroom. It looked like the counter around the sink had not been cleaned in awhile. Other than that I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great job Nine Zero, absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: JD2929
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in we could tell that customer service was a top priority for the staff. We stayed three nights over a long weekend. One of the lesser expensive "nice" hotels in the area. I highly recommend signing up as an In-Touch member. That gave us free internet access and they placed us in a room on a high floor thus providing us with an awesome view of the river, the Back Bay area and even Fenway Park to the south. GREAT location, close to two T stops and the Common and Public Gardens and so many attractions are within walking distance. Treats upon check-in was a nice touch as was the turndown service with the music playing when we got back to our room each night and the nightly wine hour. Beds were SO comfortable and as an In-Touch member you get to choose your bedding. Concierge gladly will print your airline boarding passes. The only negative we would have is there is virtually no drawers for clothes and the closet space is tiny in the queen regular room we had. Great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: toemoe8
Reviews.Content: Great personality to this hotel. Looked really nice - very out of the ordinary. Excellent location, right downtown, and not far from the airport. Room was very comfortable too

Reviews.Title: “A Warm Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TMR4roses
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel to stay at. It is well located, close to the T and almost in Beacon Hill. It is several steps from the Boson Common. The rooms are clean, well lit and the beds are very comfortable. We had a very nice view of the golden dome of State Building from our room on the 18th floor. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The concierge (Thomas) is excellent. The late afternoon complimentary wine hour is a nice way to end a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great location - Service Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mussettc
Reviews.Content: just got back from our 4 night stay at Nine Zero. My husband took me there for my 40th Birthday and we were treated exceptionally well. Champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries on arrival along with a complimentary room upgrade. The staff are are incredibly helpful and friendly. The hosted wine evening is a nice touch and a great way to meet fellow travellers. The location however is what truly makes this hotel. Thank you so much for making our stay special and look forward to coming back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Better have a small family”
Reviews.Author: JasonWright_10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Kimpton hotels in Boston, NY, and Washington DC on business and have found them VERY business friendly. Unfortunately, I can't say the same for family travel. For the second time in the past year, I've had problems booking a Kimpton room because apparently my family of five is too big. I tried to book a six night stay only to be told that all the rooms are rated for 4 people or less. I don't really buy that this is a Fire Marshall issue as was explained to me on my previous attempt last year as I have stayed at similar sized hotels in Boston and NYC with my apparently enormous family without any problems. The location is great, the hotel is clean, but I can't stay with my wife, a 9 year old, 5 year old, and infant. I think I'd rather earn points elsewhere when I'm traveling on business so that my mega-family and I can enjoy a free night out every now and then.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff I have ever come across”
Reviews.Author: NessySomerset
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are second to none. They looked after me like royalty and I would not dream of staying anywhere else in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, awesome beds and lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: sarahv70
Reviews.Content: The reviews about this hotel are right - it's great. The beds were luxurious and we were spoilt with champagne and strawberries. The shower was amazing, like some of the other reviewers we did end up with half a tub of water by the time we finished tho! Love the music playing as you walk in every evening and just the whole feel of the place was great. You can't ask for a better location - right on the freedom trail 2 mins (if that) from 2 T stops and just round the corner from Downtown Crossing for cheap shopping. Would come back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dete444
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over Labor Day Weekend and really enjoyed staying at the Nine Zero. It is close to tourist attractions as well as the T rail system. The rooms are unique and with very nice views of Boston Common and the Back Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel w/ prime location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nutstarr02
Reviews.Content: Pros: - prime location - free evening wine hour - friendly staff - surprise treats from the concierge for our special occasion - pet-friendly - environmentally conscious Cons: - tub draining problem (details below) - very expensive - street parking is difficult to find in that area Details: STAFF: We were greeted with a smile from the friendly Gabriella at the front desk. We stayed here for our 7 year anniversary. Since it was a special occasion, she also gave us champagne at check-in. When we arrived to our room, we found that Thomas, our concierge, had spoiled us with a bottle of champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries and a signed note from the staff. What a delightful surprise! LOCATION: The location is prime! Right across from part of the Freedom Trail, a block from Boston Commons, and the State house. KO prime is the steakhouse right next door (although we didn't get to try it). There's also a movie theater just down the street. ROOMS: Bed was super comfortable. No complaints there. I love the fact that they have recycling in the rooms. I also love the fact that they are pet-friendly. There was a yappy little dog in the room right next to us, but we were hardly in our rooms and I love dogs. However, just a warning for those that aren't pet-lovers The only problem that we had was that our tub didn't drain well. By the time that I finished showering, the water had reached my ankles. I never complained during my stay. When I filled out a survey after we left and discussed that, I got an email immediately apologizing and letting us know that they would get right on fixing that. PERKS: They also have a free wine hour everyday from 5-6 for guests. Great chance to unwind right before heading out to dinner. EXPENSE: The price will most likely prevent us from going back unless it's for a special occasion. OVERALL: Loved this place! Would recommend it to a friend, but would warn them about the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wehad a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: shimipor
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 night at the hotel. We were amazed by the atmosphere - everyone made his/her best to give the best help or service. We really felt like guest and we appreciate the time being there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarciaB10
Reviews.Content: I picked Nine Zero to stay at for our one night in Boston based on the many positive TA reviews and we were not disappointed. I think we got a pretty fair rate, in advance for a downtown hotel. The positives - location -location - location! Walking distance to almost everything we wanted to do. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. Nice sized room.. But we were in the back, only a view of the office building next door. The only minor cons- no exhaust fan in the bathroom, and I was awoken by very loud garbage trucks about 5am. Overall we had a great, but short stay in Boston. I would definitely come back for a few more days.

Reviews.Title: “checked into Nine Zero on a whim and it worked out well”
Reviews.Author: rpilk210
Reviews.Content: While taveling in Boston we decided to extend the stay one night and needed to change hotels to do so. the hotel right next door was Nine Zero and they could not have been more accommodating. It was almost 6 PM and the rate were received was discounted and the room was excellent. The hotel is pretty new and very high styled, really not what I'm used to. The front desk staff was great, the room was small but really very cool. There were floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Boston Common, state house, Charles River, back bay, etc ... it was stunning. The room was clean and the bed super comfortable. Aveda toiletries, a shower head that worked super well (great pressure) and a nice little foyer for the room too. The bellstaff was friendly and they brought up a couple of glasses of wine with the bags. Magazine selection in the room was great. For the short notice, easy rate, great view and good sleep the decision to saty one night and rool the dice with Nine Zero worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Perrrrfect boston hotel!”
Reviews.Author: michelle1901
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Nine Zero on our east coast honeymoon road trip. This was our first time in Boston and we couldn't have asked for a better experience. After driving almost 8 hours fron Niagara Falls it was so nice to pull up to this beautiful building with welcoming faces. Originally we were going to park at a self parking lot to save a few extra dollars, but since it was so convienent we valeted the car right at the hotel. It was well worth the extra money and gave us a nice piece of mind about our car. The girl at the check in desk was beyond nice and made sure we had everything we needed. Once we got to our room I was so impressed. Everything looked brand new, but with a lot of charactor. It was spotless! Our view was also amazing. We over looked the old cemetary across the street and we could see all of the boston skyline. They even had a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us in the room. A really nice suprise! We got settled and went downstairs to start exploring. We stopped at the concierge to get a city map and sat and spoke with Thomas about what we wanted to do. He was beyond helpful! So genuine and wanted to make sure we were comfortable with all that we were doing. He gave us subways maps and even circled our routes. I wish there was a Thomas in every city to make traveling this enjoyable! Nine zero really focuses on details that makes this hotel stand out among the rest. For instance after a long day of running around the city, we got back to the hotel to find cold tea and lemonade in the lobby. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Anniversay Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: livelife23
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I met here for our 1 year anniversary. It was both of our first times to Boston and we could not have picked a better place to stay! From the hotel itself to the warm and welcoming staff - they really knew how to make a special occasion even more memorable. I've stayed in many hotels and while the hotel itself is wonderful - you can't put a price on the experience..thanks Gabriella and Thomas for going above and beyond. Really looking forward to making our second trip to Boston!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotels simply don't get better than this!!”
Reviews.Author: BournemouthFan
Reviews.Content: A review on Tripadvisor simply can't do our stay in this hotel justice. From the moment we walked through the door and spoke to reception to the moment we left we were made to feel like we were the most important people staying there. A free (shhh!) room upgrade gave us a top 3 floor room with stunning views over Boston Common and the Charles River. A knock on the door with complientary cookies for the boys, cheese/fruit for us "adults" and bottles of water along with an handwritten note welcoming us was beyond what we expected. Not forgetting the free books and jigsaws for the boys to play. The rooms are what you'd expect from a Kimpton hotel in that they are very chic and contemporary and while I can't comment on every room as most seem to be of different sizes, the bathroom in ours was HUGE!!! Fantastic staff, fantastic facilities, fantastic rooms and fantastic location...what more can a hotel do? Along with the Argonaut in San Fran, you couldn't ask for better advertisments for a hotel chain and I know the first port of call for my next trip in the US will be to check out the Kimptons available in the area. Only one place to stay in Boston though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Kimpton property”
Reviews.Author: corevel
Reviews.Content: If you're used to staying at Kimpton properties, well you won't be disappointed. It is however a little different than others in that it is not as charming as it is "hip" (sorta like the nightclub feel that a "W" offers). I will put this next comment in for the hotel management (I assume you guys read these reviews). It's time to replace the televisions in the rooms. While I'm not all that picking about things, you do need to upgrade to HD flat panel TVs. Not a reason not to stay at Nine Zero, just an observation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumiey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cute and clean. It is along the "freedom trail" and a short walk to everything. The T is a few steps away and can take you anywhere. Beantown pub next door (you can drink a Sam Adams while looking at Sam Adams), Cheers is a short walk through the park. Hotel is quiet and quaint. I would stay here when I come back to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond...Simply WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Sinberg
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Nine Zero tired and cranky with two children in tow and were immediately enveloped in a sense of serenity from the time we drove up to the hotel. Staff were friendly and engaging with our children, had everything prepared for our late night arrival, and all of our prearranged requests/preferences were met. What more can I say than what's already been said? Customer service from the valet to check-in staff, room service waiters to housekeeping staff were exemplary and went above and beyond to not only meet our needs but anticipate them. Our room was spotless and comfortable. Chic and cozy. Our view over the Boston Commons was lovely. This is a small hotel in the heart of Boston but our room was very quiet and peaceful. Convenient for sightseeing and a delight from the moment you arrive until your departure. We stay in Boston several times a year and usually stay at the Hotel Marlowe. After trying many hotels in Boston from the Four Seasons to the new Mandarin Oriental, the Hotel Marlowe remained our firm favorite. Who knew another Kimpton hotel would be the only contender to give it a serious run for the money? Now we are going to have so much trouble deciding between the two!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, perfect location, love this hotel! â™¥”
Reviews.Author: NoviceTrlvr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Boston for the first time a couple of weeks ago and stayed at the Nine Zero Hotel and we cannot say enough good things about it! For us, the most important aspect of a hotel is location, location, location and this hotel had it. You felt like you could walk almost anywhere in 15 minutes. It's located in the Theatre District and the hotel is right along the Freedom Trail, so you are literally in the midst of all of the activity. Plenty to see, do and eat! The rooms were spacious, comfortable and very, very clean. The staff at the hotel was more than accommodating and made you feel at home from the minute you walked into the hotel. Their complimentary wine and refreshments at the end of the day were a very nice touch. The Park Street T Station is located right next to the hotel and is a very convenient way to get around the places in the City you can't necessarily walk (we took it to the Museum of Fine Art and Fenway to catch a Red Sox game). There is an excellent place next door called the Beantown Pub, which has a really nice atmosphere and good food (I recommend the Paul Revere sandwich)! KO Prime, which is located in the hotel, has a very nice and tasty breakfast menu at a reasonable price for hotel fare. Overall, we would recommend this hotel to anyone.
