We LOVED Boston and are planning another trip up there soon, and will be sure to make the Nine Zero our hotel destination!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SalemNut
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here every year for 3 years. It is my favorite hotel. The staff is beyond amazing and accommodating. Best Pet Policy ever!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant find”
Reviews.Author: jandj45
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Boston and the Nine Zero hotel was a brilliant find. The room was great - very comfortable bed and everything we could want provided, including ice just outside the door - and the location was ideal. Slight issue with payment for meals; they have a voucher system but no one explained this to us and, despite having paid for breakfast in advance as part of our booking, we found ourselves having to agree to pay again before they would give us anything to eat. The problem was soon sorted out at reception but, if itâ€™s not mentioned to you, itâ€™s worth remembering to ask about the vouchers when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like VIPs”
Reviews.Author: Youngkeems
Reviews.Content: They went above and beyond to make us feel like VIPs. Thomas (lead concierge) was nothing but accommodating, helpful and made us feel like part of a family. It was our anniversary and he did everything he can to make our stay a special one. He upgraded our room and little surprise waited for us. Also gave us great recommendations for restaurants & bars. Thank you Thomas! Staff exceeded my expectations, super friendly and always with a smile. Hotel was clean, room was a decent size and comfortable. Location was excellent, right in the middle of everything, restaurants, bars, 7/11, D&D and T were all steps away. We also ate dinner @ KO restaurant (located on 2nd floor of hotel) and it was delish! We are looking to come back real soon. When in boston, stay here! I promise you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with wonderful staff, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: danaluv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this great hotel in Boston. The location was great, with easy access to walking freedom trail tours, and the T ( transit system) subway. The ammenities were wonderful! We enjoyed the free coolers in the lobby after walking in the heat of the summer. The free wine and sangria in the lobby every evening was just great! I can't say enough about the friendly staff, bellmen, front desk reception, and especially the concierge, who was quite helpful in getting us where we needed to go, along with booking our tour for us. The room was very comfortable and quiet. We really enloyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: buffalobaby
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Nine Zero was absolutely amazing. Excellent location and exceptional customer service, especially from John the concierge. We will most definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service beyond compare!”
Reviews.Author: Theresamk430
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in Boston with my 10-year-old daughter and this was the best customer service of any hotel ever. Period. I am a frequent global business traveler and I have never experienced this level of service. Without asking, I was upgraded to a corner room suite on the top floor. Unbelievable views and comfort! Upon check-in I was invited to a hotel cocktail hour which featured homemade white sangria. When they ran out of that, out came a lovely bottle of champagne with apologies for running out of the sangria. Who cared?! They also, without asking, wheeled a flat screen into the lobby with a Wii console attached for my daughter to play! My daughter mentioned that we were in Boston for her birthday trip and that evening, when we returned back to our room, Gabriella, the Front Desk Manager, brough us cookies and 2 glasses of milk on a platter with "Happy Birthday" written in chocolate. Unbelievable and unexpected. She also, earlier, brought a goldfish in a bowl to our room so that my daugher could have an overnight pet! World class service in a gorgeous hotel in a perfect location. Perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: agentshb
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel and staff, they were so accomodating. The free wine hour in the lobby was a great perk to my stay. It's an expensive hotel, but I booked it using reward points and will probably book for future trips with or with out using reward points

Reviews.Title: “WOnderful hotel-convenient to everything Boston has to offer”
Reviews.Author: poochienoonan
Reviews.Content: went to the theater and stayed here. RIght down the street-so easy to get everywhere. Cut across the common and you are on Newbury street. one of downtowns most central location. freedom trail right outside your door

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great place to stay in heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: mommerbomber
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at Nine Zero with my husband and teenager. We loved the place, cannot say enough good things about it. Friendly, helpful staff,comfortable beds, quiet room, never heard a sound from any of the other rooms. Great location, can walk to Faneuil Hall, the Commons, Freedom Trail. Afternoon wine hour is wonderful amenity. We also thought the fitness center was well-equipped, better than your typical hotel. Overall, very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: KMPH
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero is well placed for exploring Boston. We only used the transit once to visit Harvard, otherwise we walked everywhere. You can step right out of the front door and onto the Freedom Trail and if you need a subway it's just a block away. Rooms are stylish with spacious, well appointed bathrooms and comfortable beds. There is a pleasing ambiance throughout the hotel and we found the early evening wine reception a fun way to start the evening and exchange stories with fellow guests. Staff were courteous, friendly and professional and happy to make our stay as comfortable as possible. A boutique hotel might not seem an obvious choice with two teenage boys but we all appreciated the hotel for different reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Grab your friends, love ones or neighbors and just GO!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom34
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a breath of fresh air from the world where customer service just doesn't exist, run, don't walk, to Nine Zero. It is a welcome change from the norm when you pull into the Nine Zero. Imagine this, people are NICE and SMILING and HAPPY to help you!! I know, it's hard to believe but it's true! We were greeted with a smile by Ben, welcoming us to the Nine Zero, then Brian was very happy to welcome us and wish us a happy anniversary and offer us a glass of champagne. THEN we met Michael, who also wished us a Happy Anniversary and said he had a very special room for us....very special indeed! It was the pent house suite, I know why they call it Could Nine, because it truly was. A cold bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries were soon delivered to the room, again, unbelievable service!! Kevin, the concierge searched high and low to find the perfect place for us to get a margarita. The room was gorgeous, beyond gorgeous actually, the staff were all so friendly, even the lady cleaning the room next door, said hello with a smile. Everyone, I mean everyone, was happy and friendly and genuine. A true haven in from the cold world of today. Yes, the room was immaculate, the shower was hot, the drinks were cold, the bed was comfy, the towels ALL the towels, were soft! Stop looking for another hotel and just go. Thanks everyone, for everything, right down to the cold water for the road trip home. Ben, Brian, Kevin, Lindsay (Have fun in Italy and go to the Epic :0) and of course Michael, THANK YOU! I'll be back soon! (but not soon enough!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahuffington
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of downtown Boston. I would definitely stay here again. Its got a great little free wine tasting from 5-6pm in the lobby. The restaurant there looked great - we didn't have a chance to try it but it looks great. The beds were quite comfortable. You get a full ironing board with iron in the room. There is a great mini bar with all sorts of liquor. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, but room to improve”
Reviews.Author: MinnViking
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, right on the Freedom Trail and very close to a T station. Much of Boston is in walking distance, and to go a bit further, just head down to the T. The facility seems to be fairly new. Staff was friendly, and they provide a wine-tasting hour from 5 to 6, which we enjoyed before heading out to dinner. The hotel is pet-friendly, which is good or bad depending on your point of view (for us, it just meant hearing some dog barking, but not too bad). Rooms in Boston generally are pretty high priced, but we watched for specials and thought the rates we got at the Nine Zero were reasonable, plus they included a discount at the restaurant, and so we had our breakfasts there. The hotel, however, had several deficiencies. The air conditioning struggled to keep up in the heat of the day; the lighting in the room was very poor, and two efforts to get additional lighting failed; one of the two elevators was out of service almost the entire time of our stay, so there were long waits for the one working elevator; one of the key card readers failed repeatedly, leading to some unhappiness; and on some occasions, hot water came out of the cold water tap. I thought my wife was kidding when she told me about this, but later I went to get a drink and had the same experience. The exercise room isn't much, but I guess they'll give you a pass to a nearby Bally's if you looking for more. Overall, if you are willing to put up with these inconveniences, and if you can snag a good rate, the hotel might fill the bill for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gcleone
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with the Nine Zero Hotel. I made a reservation for one nights stay, for my partner's birthday. I mentioned on the phone to them that it was going to be her b-day when we were there, and the surprised us with a room upgrade. Not only were they really generous doing that, they sent up some champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, and gave us coupons for free cocktails in the bar! They went above and beyond our expectations. The rooms were also decorated really nicely. They were hip and modern without being too trendy or weird. Beds were comfy, didn't hear any noise outside of the room, and everything was in good condition. Couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “A graet hotel”
Reviews.Author: itsingers
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at Nine Zero, and were delighted with the location comfort and helpful friendly staff. Rooms were large quiet and comfortable, and the free breakfast voucher a good idea, whilst the quality of the breakfast was first class. A great idea was the free "Happy Hour" between 5 and 6 each evening A top hotel and highly recommended. Only downside was that the hot water was a bit tepid!

Reviews.Title: “Some great, some not so great”
Reviews.Author: lauri1973
Reviews.Content: I'm very torn on this hotel. While some aspects of my stay were wonderful, like the style of the room, the luxriousness of the decor, the service at the front desk upon checkin, there were other aspects that made me shake my head in disbelief. I was greeted warmly, checked in promptly and went to my room. I immediately felt like I was in a high-end hotel. Although the elevators seemed slow, I'm thinking "This is nice". Word of warning, if you don't like ambient music played rather loudly throughout the hotel's common areas, this may not be the place for you. Upon entering my room, I was immediately impressed with the decor and cleanliness. The view is lacking but like any hotel in a space deprived city, sometimes you just have to look at another wall. What surprised me the most was the apparent attention to detail in all things visually, but the TV in the room was not an HD or even LCD. It was a 5+ year old Sony Trinitron. It just seemed out of place. I went to dinner in the hotel restauarant. The food was EXCELLENT but you need a light source to see the menu. It's THAT DARK. The restaurant is called KO and it's a steakhouse. I only wish they had a steak smaller than 7 oz on the menu and a Filet option less than 8oz. Still I opted for the Filet and ended up eating all of it. It really was good. While there is no coffee in the room (or a place to get it in the hotel) there is an abundence of alcohol. I suppose partiers would enjoy this. On my second night, I ordered out. When the delivery person arrived I received a call and he was escorted to my room for safety. I thought that was excellent. However, when I called down to ask for utensils (delivery man forgot) I waited 30 minutes and eventually made due and ate my food without. Thankfully, I could. The water in the shower / sink was EXTREMELY hot. I could hardly take a shower today because I could only turn the knob barely on to get the water as cool as it could be while still maintaining enough pressure to come out of the shower head. It was a trickle of water. The location is fantastic. But I think the hotel is entirely too expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you don't have a dog - or if you like sleep”
Reviews.Author: jacquinot11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Easter weekend to attend the Celtics and Red Sox games, and there were tons of dogs, it was very noisy. Then, the room next to us had an extremely loud, out of control party until 3am - it was unbelievable. We had to call security 3 times, which I have never done before. I'm only 30 and like to party, but this was unbelievable it was impossible to sleep. I cannot believe the hotel staff was so unable to control the loud music, excessive drinking, and noise. The guests should have been thrown out. It was only when I informed the hotel staff that my next call was to the police, that they actually addressed the situation. We were not offered a room discount or anything. I was very disappointed. The location of the hotel is great, and the amenities are nice, but it was being managed very poorly when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KayJay C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. It was an easy walk from the T station (Park St.). Hotel is located literally in the middle of history. Boston Common down the street, the Granary Burial Ground across the street, lots of bars, pubs, restaurants, convenience stores in the area. Front desk check in was quick and helpful, always friendly. The room was fantastic, great linens, not big rooms but plenty of space for the two of us. The best was our huge window that overlooked the city. We did sleep with the window cracked open just a bit and the church bells across the street started a little too early in the morning for my liking, but really it just added to the atmosphere. :) We did have brunch at the hotel restaurant one morning, service was rather slow, but it was a nice brunch, good selections and food was well prepared. We hope to return to Boston soon and will definitely stay at the Nine Zero again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ItalianGirl729
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at Nine Zero. We reached Boston and made a wrong turn and we were not able to find the hotel too easily at that point. I called the hotel and asked for directions. John stayed on the phone with us giving us directions turn by turn until we reached the hotel. What amazing customer service! The hotel is clean and the beds were great and had a great night's sleep! The location was within walking distance to everything. Only one minor thing - someone on my floor was smoking and the odor made me sick. Brian at the font desk said he would address it and offered vouchers for breakfast. We declined as we were meeting family for brunch. Next time, Brian. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular, from the views to the service”
Reviews.Author: biqui
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel with a chic vibe, a great restaurant, and absolutely superb service. The "view room" we had looked out over the statehouse dome and the Boston Common to the sea on one side, and to the harbor on another--perfect! Make it a point to speak to the concierge, Thomas Burke, who will give you the inside story on the best place for lunch and if you're lucky, will see that you get a flute of birthday champagne.

Reviews.Title: “A really bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmm60763
Reviews.Content: A lousy and pretentious decor. The first room that I was given had so many problems (i.a the bathroom door didÂ´t work) that I had to ask for another room. On top of all, I am a foreign diplomat entitled to tax exempt and the Hotel charged the tax in violation of the law even after I gave all the explanations and produced all the necessary documents.

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zeroh!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust6553
Reviews.Content: Umm...I don't really know how to put this but the walls are thin. Like really thin. So thin in fact that I was awoken at 2:30 in the morning by some chick's very loud and ridiculous orgasm. Yeah, not pleasant. Heard their music the next morning as well. Other than that, the hotel was pretty great. Awesome staff. Nice wine reception. Unbelievable location. Gave me the room I requested. Gave us a voucher for $10 at the mini bar since I am a Kimpton member. Also gave us late check out without a problem. Comfortable beds. Nice shower pressure, etc. I would stay here again just wish walls weren't so thin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nine Zero!”
Reviews.Author: flymeaway
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a wonderful four day stay at the Nine Zero. We were in Boston for my husband to run the Boston Marathon, and I booked a room at the Nine Zero because of our previous positive experiences with Kimpton Hotels. The Nine Zero did not disappoint. We arrived just after noon, and both people at the front desk were helping other guests. The concierge, Thomas, immediately came out from behind his desk and offered to check us in. I thought that our room might not be ready because we were well in advance of the posted check-in time, but not only was our room ready but we'd received a complimentary upgrade to a suite! We also were given a $10 minibar credit for being Kimpton In Touch members. Our room was fabulous - very large with a living and dining room area, a good-sized bathroom and a separate bedroom. Our window looked right out on the historical Granary Burying Ground across from the hotel and also afforded views of the Common just down the street. Our bed was quite comfortable and our room exceedingly quiet. We never heard other guests or street noise. We found the hotel's location ideal for walking around on the Freedom Trail and for taking the T to sites further afield. The Nine Zero is a stone's throw from the Park Street T station and just a block or two from the Government Center station. Thomas and the rest of the front desk staff were exceptionally friendly and welcoming as we came and went from the hotel. We also enjoyed the afternoon wine reception in the lobby. An unexpectedly nice touch was a complimentary breakfast set out for the runners the morning of the marathon. They even had packets of runners gel for them to take along to the race! Some highlights of our time in Boston were an afternoon Red Sox game, pizza at Regina's in the North End, cannolis from Mike's Pastry, riding the green line out Comm Ave to Boston College and being shown around by my cousin who's a student there, strolling through the Boston Common, and having dinner with friends at Antico Forno in the North End. We were very impressed with the incredibly warm reception of Bostonians to the marathon runners. Everywhere we went the night of the race, people congratulated my husband. The manager at Regina's even brought him a free keyring from the restaurant. Overall a wonderful trip to Boston and a great stay at the Nine Zero. My husband requalified for next year's Boston Marathon and we will definitely stay at the Nine Zero again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly serviceable...but a little odd”
Reviews.Author: Gofornow
Reviews.Content: My stay was brief; just a business overnight, so this review covers just an initial reaction. The hotel has a good first-class urban location, convenient to the Financial District and the Commons. It is a 1990s-era boutique hotel, in a building with a clean architectural look, though nothing special. The common areas/amenities are limited, but fine. The hotel offers a good range of services (spa, small fitness room, room service, etc.). The rooms and bathrooms are good-sized, though the build quality is not great and you may well hear your neighbors (a baby, in my case). If it makes a difference to you, they feature Aveda products. As a "hip, cool, urban" place to stay, this is faded glory. The room fixtures are OK, but clearly dated (the whole look, the lack of flat-screen TVs', etc.) and a bit beaten up (chipped furniture). I found the place a little weird. First, the smell of incense in the room (no kidding) was about as subtle as the "Conservatory" at the Bellagio in Las Vegas. And the decor package in the rooms (and the lobby) has a "kasbah" quality. Naugahide/plastic...whatever it is, I found it neither comfortable nor tasteful. The very tall headboard, with its four "pillows" hanging from the top, is an attempt at design that didn't work. Also, the little display in the bathroom that if you forgot something, no problem, they'll SELL you anything you want, seemed too commercial for the boutique feel. Final analysis; if you're looking for a boutique hotel, this is a decent value, but not a great hotel. 15 Beacon is far better and not far away, but you'll pay for the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay-Great Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmkFrankfort
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Boston was fun and we enjoyed staying at the Nine Zero. The staff made you feel important and were very helpful. Our room was nicely decorated and we enjoyed the atmosphere. The location was central to everything. J. Kilroy

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carate
Reviews.Content: Based on all the nice rewievs here on Tripadvisor we selected this hotel for our stay in Boston from March 12 til March 16th during the seafood exhibition. We were disappointed. The hotel is nice, but nothing special. The room is OK as well as the bathroom, but again nothing special. However, we did experience something very nasty one day. Late Sunday morning, when I was drying my hair, somebody knocked - I assumed it was housekeeping, but my husband answered, and only told me later, who our guest was. It was in fact two new guests to our room! They only knocked because they could hear the noise from the dryer. They had keys and would otherwise have entered our room. We were on our way out, so my husband didn't mention anything. Late afternoon somebody called us asking for a strange name, and later they came knocking on our door, seeking their friends - reception had given them our room number. We were again on our way out, but when we returned late Sunday nigth reception called and apologised for the trouble - and this was it. We consider this to be a very serious lack in their security system, and felt very unsafe for the rest of our stay, but we were busy and didn't want to spend any time dealing with the hotel, but we did expect a more formal apology! Also we discovered that the cleaning had been very light! We had very bad weather during our stay, so it was only on the last day the sun was shining, and we could see all the dust everywhere - on all tables! Nasty. Finally we had some bad advise regarding dining from Thomas (we told him later, but he had never experienced this before, so what he was saying was that he didn't believe us!). We had before coming to the hotel asked for his help getting some basketball tickets, and this worked out fine. When picking them up Friday night, we asked for a nice restaurant for Saturday nigth. He recommended Atlantic Fish and made a reservation. Again it was OK, the food was OK, but it was very busy, and not at all what we expected. Ofcourse Thomas got a nice tip for the help with the tickets and the reservation, so we expected him to act in our interest. Sunday he was not at work, so we told his colleague that we were not happy with Atlantic Fish, and asked for something better for Sunday night. After mentioning 5-8 other restaurants he finally got to the Oceannaire, which was quite close, why we picked this. It was over the top. A real restaurant, whereas Atlantic Fish was more cafeteria-style. When mentioning this at Oceannaire, our waiter told us that the concierges at the hotels receive commission from some restaurants, and this is how they make their pick. If this is right it means that we tipped Thomas for some advise, he already received payment for from the restaurant - very bad attitude! Well, we do not recommend this hotel for any purpose - no matter if they have a sign with your pet's name on it...

Reviews.Title: “Good value Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diarmaid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nine Zero for 4 nights and found that the hotel matched the expectations from previous Trip Advisor reviews. The staff at reception were welcoming at all times and the room itself was surprisingly large for a big city central hotel. The room was extremely comfortable, clean and well designed. Our only issue was the sound proofing, as doors being slammed/closed next door could be clearly heard. Also as a city hotel, there didn't appear to be many amenities other than a restaurant on the 2nd floor. There were nice touches souch as the wine reception, although with as we were on holidays, we preferred to venture outdoors. There also seemed to be a great service for dog owners. The hotel is ideally located in Boston, close to the Common and two T stations.

Reviews.Title: “Charm personified”
Reviews.Author: Suseyq
Reviews.Content: This is not an "all-singing-all-dancing hotel" as far as amenities go, but it is a beautifully run, charming boutique hotel, with service second to none. The staff are welcoming, incredibly helpful and always looking for ways to make your stay more enjoyable. The rooms are spacious, clean and very well appointed. The one slight problem was the humming of the boiler/air conditioning. We think this might have been due to being on the top floor - perhaps we were near the room with the boiler? The KO Prime restaurant was better than I was expecting for a hotel restaurant. I was particularly impressed with the pea and nettle risotto and the fois gras burger. The latter was a high quality burger with pan-fried fois gras for $18! Another nice touch was the "wine hour" from 5pm where the hotel offer a red and a white wine in the foyer. Finally, it is a great location from which to start any tour of this delightful city. I can't await to get back there!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing service ever”
Reviews.Author: Operasinger95
Reviews.Content: A few friends have reccommened Kimpton hotels before, but this was our first foray with this company. I couldn't be happier with our experience. We traveled with our three small dogs, and the entire staff was incredible regarding our "furbabies". There was an adorable sign with treats with their names on it when we first walked in. A dog bed and bowls were sent up and every one always said hello to them when we walked through the lobby. If you are not a pet lover or traveler with your pet this hotel was still awesome. Our room had a nice view of the Common which was an added bonus. The room was nicely appointed and spacious, especially for an urban setting.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting... and that's not necessarily a good thing.”
Reviews.Author: Middento
Reviews.Content: I'll preface this by saying that I didn't necessarily have a "bad stay"; on the whole, the room was very nice, clean, and fun; the hotel had a great location for what we wanted (very near the Common); nothing was "wrong." If my title is somewhat negative, however, it is because I was first turned on to Kimpton hotels because I had had a wonderful stay in the Hotel Marlowe only one year earlier across the river in Cambridge; my wife had a similarly good experience with the boutique chain in Denver, and we specifically looked for a Kimpton hotel this time in order to make this visit special. What changed this time was simple: whereas previously we had both been attending conferences, this time she attended a conference while I accompanied our young son around Boston. And it was specifically within the kid department that things were just... OK. I had specified in my reservation that not only was my five-year-old coming, but that it happened to fall on his birthday. From this site, I realized that he might get a special treat; from Kimpton's website, I saw that they have a special program for kids. And when we checked in.... nada. In fact, we were asked to wait while the room was finished being "made up"; for this, I assumed something was happening that was special for our child. When we were finally up to the room, we found... a very nice room, but nothing special was added. We went out for a bit, and upon our return there were some lovely cookies and chocolate covered strawberries (which were great, and appreciated) -- but if they knew we were checking in (we were not early at all), I wondered if things should have been settled ahead of time. Granted, I did not ask for anything specific for our child, but even when I asked specifically for a list of nearby kid-friendly activities (which their website advertises), this was not provided. The concierge (very nicely) told me verbally about some of the museums (Children's. Science, etc.), but the very things advertised that would make this a special experience for a kid were never offered. My disappointment in my stay, therefore, is simply that I had *expected* something more, since I had had a very personal experience previously. I specifically chose a Kimpton hotel to feel "special" -- and I felt this was lost. I think perhaps the simple problem may have been that we had a child, and that staff generally did not know what to do with him. (I did not see any other children around during our stay.) Only one bellhop specifically addressed our son at all -- and, given that this happened at the VERY end of the trip, my son completely loved it. I *do* think that this is a good hotel in general -- but I found it in the end a bit cold, and perhaps more specifically catered to business travelers than other vacationers. Had I been on a business trip, I think I would have been fine. That said, when I go back to Boston myself for a business trip, I will seriously consider the extra train ride to stay in Kimpton's Hotel Marlowe, where I already had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - responsive in every way”
Reviews.Author: pmenon1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nine Zero for three night in mid-January 2010, and had an amazing experience. The hotel's location is a true asset, and my partner and I were treated with courtesy and respect from the moment we stepped through the doors. A special nod to the concierge, Thomas Burke, who was really the highlight. He really went above and beyond to help me plan a special trip. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CherylGLBoston
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend with high school friends at the Nine Zero. It was fantastic! The location allowed us to walk virtually everywhere. The staff was efficient and helpful. They offer wine and cheese in the lobby from 5-7, which is a nice touch. The queen room was comfortable for all 4 of us. Loved the zebra robes! The only very small complaint is that the bathroom fan didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool bathroom and comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: qpas3
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel- very central location, and I thought the bathroom design was fun. Overall, very clean & comfortable room and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Traveled with dogs...”
Reviews.Author: NyCuse
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Nine Zero in Boston, because my three large dogs were welcome and it is close to Boston Common park. This worked out perfectly. The hotel was very comfortable with a friendly and helpful staff. In addition to the proximity to Boston Common, Nine Zero is in a lovely location. I hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern escape in a city of old-world charm”
Reviews.Author: Zoukie
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Boston and stayed at Nine Zero Hotel. We are big fans of Kimpton Hotels. They are generally well-kept, modern and in great locations, without being ridiculously overpriced. The hotel was across from the old graveyard which is a big tourist attraction, and is close to the Freedom Trail, Boston Common and a short walk to Feneuil Markets. The room was spacious, clean and modern, and the decor was gorgeous. If you get a chance make sure you visit the Old Oyster House, which they say is America's oldest restaurant. The clam chowder there can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: meklof
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend at this hotel and everthing were above my expectations. It started with my early arrival when I could check in immediately without any questions. The room was not large but plenty for the weekend. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the morning shower was a dream. The location is only two short blocks for them Park Street Metro which is one of the hubs giving you access to most of the city as well as Cambridge. Morning papers including Boston Globe and New York Times were provided even the sunday editions. Next time I am in Boston, this will be my

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Experience”
Reviews.Author: BraintreeLady
Reviews.Content: I spent this past Friday night at the Nine Zero Hotel. The place is AMAZING. This is our second time staying at this property and it is the ONLY place to stay in Boston. The rooms are immaculate and the views are OUTSTANDING. We sipped champagne and ate chocolate covered strwaberries while watching ths sun set over the Charles River and watched people strolling through the Boston Commons. It was equally as nice to see the Citgo sign and Fenway park while lying in our bed! Speaking of beds, the bed was SO SO comfortable that I did not want to leave for dinner. The sheets were fresh and clean and the mattress and featherbed gave you a feeling of royalty. The marble bathroom and shower were spic and span clean and the water pressure was awesome. The staff could not have been more accomodating. We received a glass of wine at check in and then champagne and strawberries in our room. The front desk staff were always helpful, professional and friendly. Kudos to the staff for being on top of everything! Definitely a worth while trip, even just for one night (like we did for our anniversary).!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very urban feel, loved it”
Reviews.Author: Hambug
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Feb 24-26 for a business meeting which was just around the corner from the hotel. Pros: My room was fully stocked (and I always like Aveda bath products), there was a comfy zebra stripe robe to wear, the shower water pressure was really good, the minibar contained a wide variety of items, and the bed was very comfortable. The doorman was friendly and hailed cabs for us in the rain, the lobby was inviting, and the pleasant front desk staff gave me a travel size hairspray since I forgot mine. I didn't eat at the restaurant but had room service one night which was good. I didn't hear any noise from neighbors at all. Very slight cons: The free wi-fi worked fine in the evenings but I couldn't get a connection in the mornings (maybe everyone was trying to connect at that time). They generously provided 4 towels, so I followed the "green" instructions to hang your towel up and therefore not have it needlessly replaced, but they replaced it anyway. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “When can I come back”
Reviews.Author: TimmyTucks
Reviews.Content: When we entered the Hotel Lobby we were greeted by Thomas who was engaging and answered any questions we had about the hotel. A complimentary wine hour had just begun in the lobby. We had a romantic dinner in Boston's historic Faneuil Hall which is less than a five minute walk from the hotel. The romance continued when we returned to the hotel with our wonderful view of Boston Common from our room. I wanted to do something special for my girlfriend and that's when one of the manager's John Markunas sent up Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us when we returned from dinner. I've been all around the world but Hotel 90 has the best customer service in the business.

Reviews.Title: “No internet, no bathtub, disappearing waiters and bad food”
Reviews.Author: rubyjungle
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay at this hotel. I could not believe the lack of amenities at a hotel that is supposed to be specialized, and wish I had stayed somewhere else. You could get the internet for free by signing up for their club, but it didn't do much good because it didn't work for the entire 3 nights I was there. They said they were having some problem with the internet but didn't know what or when it would be fixed. Also their two 'business center' computers were completely non functional because they required internet access to even start up, so no printing or anything there. When we tried to eat the restaurant they have almost nothing but steak. They had one pasta dish which I ordered, but then they came back and told me they were out (how do you run out of pasta???). The potato and garlic gratin I got instead was too gross to eat - it was basically just a huge bowl of oily melted cheese with a few tiny slices of potato as a garnish. Also tried to split a piece of chocolate cake with my colleague. We both like chocolate but couldn't even finish one piece between us. Just dry and odd tasting. Also our waitress seemed like she was really the assistant manager or something, and halfway through the meal she disappeared. When we finally asked someone to find her she still never showed up but we got a few other random people coming by. I was also disappointed to find it was not a full bath, just a three quarters (no tub only a shower). On the plus side the rooms were very nice, the front desk staff was nice, they lent us umbrellas, and it's good that when one restaurant staff member disappears, the others pick up the slack. But overall this hotel is a total ripoff and I would have been way way happier at a basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: dancards18
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Nine Zero Hotel, located directly across from the State House in Boston, MA. Booking my reservation was painless. I simply called the hotel a week before my stay (we stayed on Valentines Day). Michael Holzwarth was the gentlemen I worked with over the phone. He was direct and efficient. I had my room booked in literally two minutes. When we arrived at the hotel the door crew slash valet team were both very friendly and made parking and carrying of our bags their immediate priority. This seems like a silly statement, since one would say that they were merely doing their jobs. True. However, the hotel was fully booked and we checked in at a high-volume time, but they made it look easy. Many thanks in that regard. Michael Holzwarth was the same gentlemen who checked me in at the front desk. He provided us with our room keys in under one minute. He was very polite and inviting and treated my girlfriend and me with respect and genuinely warm courtesy. He was also nice enough to provide us with a free breakfast the following morning. I don't believe this always is the case, but maybe us being polite to his crew and him made breakfast on Kimpton. The room was magnificent! From the 16th floor, we had a wide view of the entire skyline of Boston. It was beautiful. The room was in stellar condition complete with a way better than average sound system/CD player, a separate IPOD Dock Station, a plasma TV, and excellent mini bar (full capability to make any martini you want with Grey Goose, Belvedere in-stock as well as Maker's Mark, beer, wine, etc.). We also took full advantage of the comfortable evening wear that came with the room (aka robes). After checking in we strongly considered just ordering room service because the menu was tempting. We realized that going to KO Prime was a pipe dream based on V-Day and no reservation but having a five star restaurant within the hotel is also nice. We decided to paint the town for a while, found a nice place to eat and stopped at The Beantown Pub which is right next door to Nine Zero on our way back for a few nightcap cocktails. In the end, the Nine Zero Hotel was one of the best, if not the best, hotel that I have stayed at in Boston. The staff made you feel good and even important, the hotel was in excellent condition, very modern style, in the heart of the best city in the world. Many Thanks to Michael and staff. Kind Regards, Dan

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: VanessaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! We received an early check-in and a room upgrade, both without asking. The staff was very friendly, even to our large dog. The room was lovely. Room service is speedy. Our car was waiting downstairs for us imediately after check-out. Don't miss the wine hour in the lounge, it's a must. I would absolutely visit the Nine Zero again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel-Definitely a hotel to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: R-n-J_13
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, wonderful view of the city. Within walking distance to the Boston Common. Concierge was very helpful, even gave us an upgrade. Thank you Thomas!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: McShane
Reviews.Content: This was possibly the best hotel I have ever staye din. We were travelling on our honeymoon and e-mailed in advance to let the hotel know. On arrival, we were greeted with congratulations and an upgrade to a fabulous corner room with a view over Boston Common and Paul Revere's grave. Good points: -Brilliant location for sightseeing and shopping -Gorgeous bedlinen and most comfortable beds ever -Fantastic wine reception in a small but beautiful lobby -Modern and luxurious decor -Good choice of tv channels -Loved loved loved the pet friendly aspect - we missed our poodles and meeting all the dogs staying there was like therapy! Bad points (just to be picky) -Bathrobes could have been softer (it's hard to think of anything else!) We found staff so welcoming and friendly, especially Darius. Dinner in KO Prime was delicious - gorgeous fillet steak and the twice-baked Idaho is to die for. It was only half-full on a weekend night, which surprised me and didn't add to the atmosphere, but well worth trying. Finally, the Beantown Pub next door is good fun for a few drinks and their nachos are amazing - only order one between two, though! We can't wait to go back. I would also recommend Top of the Hub and the Oak Room for dinner, but we didn't enjoy Ruth's Chris around the corner - shambolic service and the food wasn't great.

Reviews.Title: “The Nine Zero was top notch!!!”
Reviews.Author: scottseb
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the staff was very welcoming and accommodating. Ben, who helped us with our bags, was fantastic! John, the front desk manager, took care of our request for adjoining rooms and was delightful. The wine reception is always a nice benefit. The room was clean - they also provided a crib which was very helpful. We would go back there in a second - the staff members were exceptional, the room was clean and spacious, the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “awesome for pets”
Reviews.Author: chitownwanderlust71
Reviews.Content: many hotels claim to be pet friendly, but how many actually have a sign up welcoming your pet by name! yes, little mocha was so happy after being in a bag on a plane, to come into the hotel and see a sign "welcome, mocha" as well as a bowl of treats and water for her in the lobby. the room is very stylish and comtemporary. i was also impressed with the location. i didn't realize it is right on boston common in the center of boston. its a shame the weather was so frigid we couldn't enjoy the park, but that's not Nine Zero's fault. would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with a warm and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2tripBoston
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at hotel along with my co-workers for a post holiday dinner in Boston. Our warm reception actually began on the street when a bellman came out to guide us where to park. We received an awesome 19th floor upgrade upon check-in with views of the Frog Pond, the Charles River, Pru and State St. Bank...awesome view. Can't say enough good things about the staff who are very approachable and helpful. Terrific wine reception which our group enjoyed to start our night off. Already booked our next night in town because we were so impressed..Thomas has already got us looking forward to our next trip in!

Reviews.Title: “Oh What A Night!!!”
Reviews.Author: rockyisle
Reviews.Content: Living so close to Boston, we seldom stay over night.. but, in planning our trip to the Boston Wine Expo, we thought a hotel room would be a wise choice. I was familiar with Nine Zero, but felt they were out of my retirement travel budget until I saw a great special from Travelzoo. I booked our rooms on line, was offered an upgrade from Kimpton, but declined it. When we arrived on Saturday afternoon, the valet was quickly at our side insuring a safe deposit of the car. Very friendly and funny!!! Inside, the front desk manager, John Markunas, noted that our friends had upgraded to a view room, but we had not. I explained that our travel budget had its limits.. Their room was ready and in checking on our room, little did we know that he had upgraded us to a "view" room as well at no extra charge. May I say for the record, if you can afford it, book a view room. The view of Boston from the corner rooms is beyond description. I was mesmerized and actually didn't want to leave!!! Having spent most of my working life on the road in hotels, I'm very jaded about quality hotels. This was my first Kimpton and I will be on the lookout for more deals in the future based on our stay at Nine Zero. While the room was small, it was very well appointed and had an upscale yet cozy feeling to it. I felt as though I was living on the edge of the Boston Common... The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had a great shower. There were robes for both of us and just about anything you could think of in the way of food and drink in the mini bar. The only thing missing was a second chair and I bet if I had asked, I would have had one delivered in no time. The hotel is in a perfect location for getting around Boston. It's steps to the subway, a short walk to the theater district, Beacon Hill and so much more. It truly is a gem in terms of location and ambiance. We had a delicious breakfast on Sunday morning. The coffee was hot and strong and each order cooked to perfection... and even a New York Sunday Times.. which we promptly took back to our room for Sunday reading. The staff at Nine Zero clearly love the hotel they are working for. Funny, attentive and willing to serve... What more could anyone ask for? Thanks Nine Zero!!! Oh What A Night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel, well located in Boston”
Reviews.Author: shortperson
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero is a boutique style hotel - dark eating areas, contemporary dressings in the bedroom - I did see some guests use a torch to read the restaurant menu, but this was the general styling of the hotel! Very friendly and helpful staff, and a very good quality hotel, exceptionally comfortable beds. Easy to get to from the subway, and most of Boston was walkable from the hotel. An added bonus, being there over New Year's Eve (First Night) was being able to go to Boston Common to see the fireworks at 7pm, before retiring to the, very busy, bar at the hotel. You don't get the charm of a local hotel in a village at Nine Zero, but equally you don't get the stuffiness of some city hotels. It was quiet, the rooms were an excellent size and they had everything you could need there. The restaurant was nice, but if you didn't like steak (it was primarily a steak restaurant) then the choice was somewhat limited. We had the continental breakfast which was complimentary with our room stay, which was more than sufficient each morning, and the banana nut muffins were particularly lovely!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: rscolding
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been very lucky to travel a lot, across the United States and Europe. When we travel for pleasure we enjoy staying in the finer upscale hotels. I have to say when it comes to the ultimate Hotel experience, this was it for us. The hotel is very very cool, but still has the ambiance of relaxation. The room layout is just perfect, and the beds are the most comfortable I have ever laid upon. The staff where proffessional and friendly, their attitude and appearance helped make our stay at Nine Zero perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, fab location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: StJohnFan
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Nine Zero for a conference, and the hotel was in a perfect location, close to the T and right across from the Common. Staff were friendly and helpful, and I was given a free upgrade on arrival to a "view room." I got a great deal through Travel Zoo, and as a Kimpton In Touch member I had free wireless and a credit for the minibar. The room was decorated beautifully, the bed was comfy, and the marble bath was nice. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Another Amazing Kimpton Property!”
Reviews.Author: samsmom2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights over MLK weekend with our 11 year old son. The hotel is right on the Freedom Trail and a minute or so walk from the Park Street T station. We found the location super convenient for walking the city, jumping on the T and having our friend drive us to/from Logan Airport. Our room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was up to date and roomy. We had a lovely view of the Boston Commons and Charles River. Like other Kimpton hotels, the staff was friendly and helpful. These hotels are beautiful and chic, plus warm and comfortable. We've enjoyed Kimpton hotels in Chicago, D.C., N.Y., and now Boston. Also, the Concierge was quite helpful and recommended an amazing seafood spot for Sunday night dinner, The Oceanaire.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Cramped Room”
Reviews.Author: FTLAW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nine Zero while in town for a big concert event. The location of the hotel is perfect. Very close to Boston Common and an easy walk to anywhere downtown. The lobby is very tastefully appointed. The walls behind the elevators are decorated with an interesting material that makes you want to touch it each time. We booked two rooms, one for my wife and I and one for a couple that travelled with us. We put in for upgrades online and at check-in, were not told if any room had been upgraded. Only one of the two rooms was upgraded and this would have been nice to know on check-in so we could discuss who would stay in each room. The room my wife and I walked into had nice furtniture, but was incredibly cramped. There was very little room to even move freely around the room. We were a little disappointed. Despite the room issues, I would likely stay here again due to location.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been nicer.”
Reviews.Author: klmsailorgirl
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Nine Zero with friends in Jan. 2010. Hotel is beautiful - serene, hip, and elegant and decorated in luxurious shades of purple and gray, and covered in gleaming marble. Excellent service from staff. Location cannot be beat - easy walking distance to both Beacon Hill area or downtown with T access at Park Street across the street. Wine reception from 5-6 was a great treat! I will definitely stay at Nine Zero again and next time will bring my pooch! Oh, and my husband! :-) I can't think of why you would stay anyplace else in Boston - this is a perfect place where everyone seemed comfortable and happy. PS I recommend Mooo at XV Beacon Hotel aabout 2 blocks away for a great (indulgent) breakfast/brunch!

Reviews.Title: “A truly remarkable experience yet again”
Reviews.Author: mdean38
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero will always be one of those hotels I get very exciting to stay at. A rarity if you ask me. A truly unique and welcoming experience every time I stay here. The Nine Zero has captured this distinctive hotel experience that I canâ€™t say Iâ€™ve ever felt. The staff in general is overwhelmingly kind and warm. No matter what requests I make when I stay here, they always meet them and exceed them way above and beyond. Upon check in I was given a voucher for two free mini-bar items thanks to Kimpton Intouch Loyalty program. I was blown away when I entered my room when I saw a bottle wine and a fruit platter. The room itself was perfect. I had windows surrounding my entire room with an excellent view of Boston. The bed was heavenly. Another tremendous benefit of being in the Kimpton Intouch program is the free internet. Hotels of this caliber donâ€™t typically offer complimentary internet. I can always count on the Nine Zero for a remarkable experience. That I donâ€™t usually get anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zero is A Number One”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1896
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero is the latest Kimpton jewel I've discovered in my travels. I stayed there for two nights to attend a hockey game at Fenway Park. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The room was spacious and clean. The mattress was firm. One minor problem -- the shower leaked a little water. But that was the only blemish to report. The staff was courteous and professional especially Mike at the front desk & Fawn who was gracious & provided me with excellent recommendations. The hotel is near the T & within walking distance of Mike's Pastry Shop in the North End. Bravo Kimpton. You've done it again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoblanoJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in two rooms for two nights over New Year's. Rooms were funky, fun, and clean. Beds were super comfortable. Staff was upbeat, friendly, and helpful. Service was impeccable. Location is wonderful -- a block from the Park St. T stop. Every staff member we came into contact with greeted us with a smile. We enjoyed the wine hour, the fun way they take "Pet Friendly" to a new level (and we didn't have a pet with us, and we declined the offer of a goldfish delivered to our room as part of their "guppy love" program, but we still enjoyed walking through a small menagerie of happy pets whenever we came through the lobby), and just the overall vibe of the place. Internet is free for Kimpton In Touch members and members get a "raid the mini-bar" coupon.... You can join when you check in if you're not already a member. Tip: Kimpton Hotels will match any price you can find on the internet, and add a few extras (like late check-out and Kimpton In-Touch privileges) if you book through them, and the best rates are often on other websites, so it's worth checking prices using the TripAdvisor search tool first.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal experience at Nine Zero Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: AgeUrp
Reviews.Content: My husband & I, our dog (Shih Tzu) & my Mom stayed at Nine Zero Hotel in Boston for the Holidays 12/24-12/26/09. We had two King Deluxe Rooms. My husband & I are avid travelers & were quite impressed with the impeccable service, staff & hotel. There's something about their beds & feather top pillow that makes it by far the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in! We also love the decor of the room & hotel. It's very posh/trendy/comfy & the rooms are quite spacious. They also have a cozy 'living room' type lobby where they have a wine tasting nightly. Also have one restaurant/bar within hotel called 'KO Prime'. Looked quite trendy, but didn't eat there so can't comment on that. My Mom ordered room service for breakfast both mornings & loved it. We're not the type to raid the mini-bar as we like to dine/drink out, but we were impressed with everything they had in it! There was just about anything you could drink and/or snack on it! The service is incomparable as the staff goes out of the way to meet your every request. The concierge, "Thomas Burke", was wonderful & so pleasurable to work with! Since we were there during Christmas, we worked with him a lot to find restaurants & places open on the Holidays, make reservations, etc. He was fantastic & made several accommodations for us since the hotel bar/restaurant was closed during the Holiday week. Every person we interacted with at the front desk, room service & housekeeping was truly a pleasure to deal with. Also, since the hotel is 'pet friendly', they provide pet bowls, pet beds & dog walkers/sitters upon request (fee required for dog walking/sitting). We've never brought our dog to a hotel before & what a pleasurable experience they made it for her/us! The best part for dogs is, the Boston Common is 1 block from the hotel which has a dog park. Even if your dog isn't the type to play with other dogs, at least they've always got a close place "to go" since Boston Common is just across the street. They told us all the Kimpton owned hotels are 'pet friendly' which is great to know for future trips. We also stayed here once before during summer 2009 & absolutely loved it then as well! During our 1st visit, we had a Queen Room which was also fabulous & so was the service! We can't say enough good things about this hotel & will definitely go back & only stay at Nine Zero when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zero Pet Friendly and More”
Reviews.Author: AriBella120260
Reviews.Content: This was are first stay at Nine Zero. Right from the start we were made to feel special and our room was upgrade with-out having to ask. They put us on the 18th floor facing Boston Common,"what an incredible view." This was are dogs first trip to the hotel also, she was treated very well. My husband doesn't let strangers watch our dog, but he felt very comfortable leaving Skye with them. They put our minds at ease and didn't hesitate to take our dog (a husky.) I would highly reccomend this hotel to any dog lover. The dogsitting rates are resonable and you will never have to worry, just go out and enjoy the city. When you get back you can be sure that your dog was well treated and maybe even spoiled just a little. Ours was, right down to the evening walk that they took her on while we were gone. Again when going to the city with your pet, you should consider Nine Zero they are very pet friendly. Thanks so much for our enjoyable stay. Fondly, Rob & Robin

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: Liz9872991
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for four nights in October, and was overall pleased with the hotel. It was in an excellent location, just across the way from Boston Common. Like other hotels in the area there was a charge to park a vehicle, so that was expected. I felt welcomed on my arrival, but was rarely spoken to otherwise. In the restaurant, I felt very unwelcome, which is a shame considering the price of the food there. I will say that I was disappointed in the free continental breakfast. With just some fruit and a few stale, quartered pastries it paled in comparison to free breakfasts and other chain hotels. Overall the room was nice and there was never a problem with cleanliness. I just feel that for the price I paid, the service would have been better. I will probably stay further out of the city in a more reasonably priced hotel next time I am in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannmike
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Nine Zero. Wonderful fun place. Excellent room and great service. Great decor and perfect location for seeing the sites. We were there for a week. 2 blocks from the City hall where we got married. Warm smoking area outside with the valet guys who are as nice as can be. Thanks to everyone at Nine Zero for all the fun.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! We travel to Boston frequently this was our favorite stay”
Reviews.Author: MRD11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Boston and the Nine Zero Hotel. We enjoyed our stay immensely; the hotel staff was extremely efficient and friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. The rooms were large and comfortable. We will definitely return to Nine Zero on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Were unable to keep our reservation”
Reviews.Author: deb_ocon
Reviews.Content: We have previously (2008) written a review of this fine establishment. We had booked for this weekend and were so looking forward to spending the night in Boston. We knew that there was a 24 hour cancellation requirement and about 25 hours before, I went to the Weather Channel to make sure all was ok....yeah, weather channel said it was ok at 3pm on Friday but by 9pm they are predicting a MAJOR snowstorm. On the day we were supposed to check in we called Nine Zero at 5AM to cancel and thought we had to beg that they wouldn't charge us the one night fee. We in no way had to beg for anything. The phone was answered in the wee hours by a most pleasant man (Brian) who was very cordial and understood we didn't want to get stuck in Boston in over a foot of snow with Blizzard conditions. He said of course there would be no charge to us. The reason I am writing this review is to let all know what wonderful folks work here and how well you are treated. After 9/11 friends were to stay at a resort in NH who refused to reimburse their deposit under any circumstances..circumstances being there were NO planes flying. This hotel thinks of patrons first not their bottom line. We will be back to Nine Zero very soon as we love the rooms, the personnel, the wine hour, the location and the overall friendliness of employees like Brian.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy with lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: scanetta
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights at Nine Zero Hotel in Boston and was pleasantly surprised. Read that the rooms were small and they were but the extra's more than make up for it. Nicely furnished room, ergonomically correct chairs, featherbeds with mohair throws. Aveda amenities and a marble tile shower with nice extras light great lighting. Tiger patterned robes and socks, cds you can rent and the service was great. Ordered a pot of tea the first night and arrived within 5 minutes still very hot. Morning I left ordered breakfast and had some of the best pancakes I have ever eaten. Nice wine tasting every night between 5 and 6 and great location. Across from Boston Common and the T and within walking distance to Fanuel Hall and Downtown Crossing. Try this place..........wont disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Excellence”
Reviews.Author: srhmbe
Reviews.Content: Once again, Kimpton have proved how well they run hotels. Nine Zero is an excellent example of their attention to detail - and the location was perfect for our short stay as it was within walking distance of virtually everywhere we had time to see ! And what can we say about Thomas, the concierge ? This man went out of his way to help organise our dinner reservations, and also made great suggestions for cocktails etc - and on top of this he loaned us a VIP card for entrance to a jazz club (which meant that we didn't have to queue in the snow !) He is a real gem and a great ambassador for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and style”
Reviews.Author: monkeygirl8
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero exceeded our expectations! Awesome location....so close to everything...North End, Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, Boston Common (ice skating rink was open), shopping, Chinatown. Felt very safe walking around the city with my 10 yr., of course using judgment. The old burial ground across the street provided a lovely backdrop of history and was somehow very peaceful...not eerie at all. We took a trolley tour recommended by staff which gave us a great overview of the city and Cambridge. The Harvard Museum of Natural History was a real gem. Try Mr. Bartley's Burger Cottage right outside Harvard Yard. The staff was very helpful and provided excellent service, especially Thomas the concierge. Beautiful rooms and views and charming lobby. The wine reception was a welcome respite. Lots of thoughtful touches. We're hooked on Kimpton Hotels now!

Reviews.Title: “Made Our Anniversary Memorable”
Reviews.Author: NY1124
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend our 2nd wedding anniversary in Boston. Being that my husband had never been to Boston, and I haven't been in many years, we both had high expectations. Not only did Nine Zero not disappoint, but went above and beyond what I would expect a four star hotel to provide. I spoke with someone over the phone prior to our arrival and asked if it could be noted that it would be our anniversary. I didn't ask for anything in particular, just asked that it be noted. When we arrived, everyone we encountered was friendly and professional. Our room had been upgraded, and we were met with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries along with a personalized note from Thomas, the concierge. This, to me, says quite a lot. The room was just plain cool, with the black, gray and white themed bedding and chic decor. My husband and I loved it! One tip-we did sign up for Kimpton's InTouch rewards program, and I am sure that didn't hurt. Even if you don't plan on staying frequently at Kimpton hotels, a few visits can add up to a free night. The bathroom was good sized (especially being in a city) and functional. They provided Aveda bath products and bathrobes. The view from our room on the 18th floor was tremendous! In terms of location, this hotel cannot be beat. It was right on the Freedom Trail, and convenient to the T. We walked most places, but if that is not for you, the hotel is happy to call a cab. Valet parking is $40 (pretty standard in Boston) per day. However, my husband and I wanted to stay a little later than our check-out time to see some more of the city, and we were allowed to keep our car there for the rest of the day for only $10 more. This really is not bad, and convenient for those who do not feel like searching out parking. We did not eat at the hotel, as the restaurant was closed during our stay for the holiday week. They did have room service available, but we did not utilize it, as there is cheaper food to be found in Boston. The concierge was excellent in providing us with restaurant recommendations as well as a map of the Freedom Trail. Anyone we encountered seemed truly interested in our stay, and if there was anything they could do for us. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, and if we are ever back in Boston, I can guarantee we will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: boleen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Nine Zero as part of our honeymoon to the US visiting San Francisco, Boston and New York. Easily the best hotel and staff that we experienced during our holiday (including one of the five star reputed 'finest hotels' in NYC). We were made to feel very welcome from the moment we arrived until we left. All the staff were particularly helpful espcially the concierge who went out of his way to assist when recommneding local attractions and suitabel bars and restaurants. Would highly recommend to anybody coming to Boston. A true delight to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: PricelineUser
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels at which we have ever stayed. The room was a decent size for being in the middle of an old city, and the location was absolutely perfect. The hour of free wine in the lobby was a really nice touch, as well. And conveniently, the hotel also offers free wi-fi in every room. We'd stay at this hotel on every trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Another Kimpton success”
Reviews.Author: trychterus
Reviews.Content: Kimpton keeps going from success to success. Nine Zero is another comfortable, trendy, and well managed hotel, with an outstanding concierge. We were in Boston for out 20th anniversary, and Tom arranged champagne and strawberries to greet us, upgraded our room and made us feel like old friends. I've stayed in Kimpton hotels around the country, and I've never been disappointed. It's a terrific company.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excellent Excellent”
Reviews.Author: point579
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Nine Zero more than ten times over the last four years and love everything about it. Friendly Staff, Great Service, Super Comfortable Bed, Well Furnished Rooms and Fantastic Location. Couple of areas where they could improve: the room service menu hasn't changed in the last four years, come on guys you can do better than that. They need to get rid of the old televisions and put in LCD screens. Even with these improvement areas, I would not want to stay anywhere else in Boston. Nine Zero is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Kimpton always has nice surprises. And delivers on functionality.”
Reviews.Author: shciteb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on a business trip. Key for me when traveling for business is a good nights sleep. No noise. My room was on the fifth floor facing the main street - Tremont. I never heard ANY street noise. Not even the sound of a horn. And no noise from next door neighbors. Plus, extra comfortable bed with real duvet and fluffy pillows. Made the 6 am wake-up call after coming in from the west coast tolerable. I enjoy the different styles of Kimpton properties and the Nine Zero delivered. The room's palette was beige, black and gray. A funky high headboard, oversized chair and peacock-like throw added to the flair of the room. I appreciate the design with real, working functionality. This room had a nice balance adding in a long desk with multiple sockets for all my plug-in's. The bathroom had a table top sink and shelves for storage. Even though it was small (only a shower), the pocket-door left ample room. Great light. Room service even delivered a made-to-order salad. Great Place.

Reviews.Title: “Goodprice location terrible room service”
Reviews.Author: Madrid1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, but we got a very good price with Hotwire and the room wasn't very good. It was very little and we were given a room for physically handicapped. We ordered room service and the food terrible and expensive. The room was pre-payed but the moment we got they they charged more than 200â‚¬ to my credit card, "just in case"

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice”
Reviews.Author: tkelly7
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero is a fantastic choice for a single traveler or a couple visiting Boston, either for business or pleasure. Like all Kimpton hotels I've stayed in, this one has a real sense of style, both in terms of the decor, but also when it comes to the overall ambiance. Who can complain about a wine tasting in the lobby at 5:00? Or the free wireless (for Kimpton InTouch members)? For me, hotels that charge for wireless are high on my list of places to avoid. The Nine Zero is in the theater district, so if that's where you are headed, you'll certainly want to consider this hotel. The T station (Park) is just half a block away, so the rest of the city is easily accessible. And at check in, they handed over a coupon for two free items from the mini bar. My only complaint? No coffee maker in the room. Duncan Donuts is a 30 second walk (where in Boston is the Double D not a 30 second walk?), but in the rain this morning, having to walk out for coffee was a little annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel making our stay in Boston a dream. Well done Nine Zero Staff”
Reviews.Author: stevans
Reviews.Content: The breakfasts @ the hotel are superb. The beds are so comfortable & with such wonderful staff you could not pick a better place to stay. Ideal location, close to the commons, gardens, Quince Market, Fanueil Hall. Use the tube if you don't want to walk. If its your first time in Boston do the Duck Tour which is very informative & fun (wrap up for the cold weather) If you like art then the Museum Of Fine Art is wonderful & very easy to reach from the Nine Zero by tube. We are returning next spring & of course to the Nine Zero Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “9.0 actually equalls 10.0 in distinction & satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Shan_Kelly
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Nine Zero was absolutely fantastic!!!!! Having read here on Trip Advisor about how amazing the service is, I decided to put in a small request. I called the morning of our reservation and asked if our room could have a â€œnice view,â€� since it was my friendâ€™s first trip EVER to Boston, I considered it a pretty fair demand, yet I know it might have been a lil last minute. I was so pleased to speak with Thomas, the concierge, directly, b/c T.A. users had applauded his efforts in the past. As he was typing away at the computer I heard him murmur, â€œperfect.â€� From that alone I knew this is obviously a gentleman who relishes creating that exceptional experience! Before we got off the phone Thomas promised that our view AND OUR WHOLE STAY would be terrific. I simply hoped not to stare at the side of a building; Thomas however, exceeded our expectations! Our girlfriend getaway became truly luxurious after leaving our car at the valet (directions from the website are right-on) and signing in at the desk where John, the concierge on duty, told us we were on the 19th floor (top!) and had two queen size beds (we had originally only reserved one). Upon entering the room we were absolutely giddy! The dÃ©cor was perfect, which is why I love staying at boutique hotels, muted and posh, not one disgusting floral print in sight! My friend loved the edgy faux fur throws, as well as the IPOD dock which she hooked up to right away and started blasting dance music. We opened up a hand-written note from Thomas telling us to â€œGet ready for THE BEST stay! Seriously.â€� accompanied by a bottle of Pino Grigio chilling on ice and a fruit plate. Glass of wine in hand, good beats, the perfect view of the city lights and Boston Commons; as we ladies started to pretty ourselves up for a night on the town, my friend squealed â€œI love Boston!!â€�â€¦ we hadnâ€™t even left the hotel yet!! When we were ready we moseyed on downstairs and spoke to Johnny about some places to go. He sent us around the corner to Zen for sushi which was great, as well as reasonably priced! For $25 we split several rolls and were more than full. After that we went to the Beantown Pub next to our hotel and across from Sam Adams grave. So of course I ordered a Sam Adams! There was a great crowd there early and we watched some people play pool. From there we decided to hit up Mantra to listen to some music. We wanted to dance too, but seeing as no one else there was, we ended up leavingâ€¦ too many girls with their arms crossed, sitting down, staring off, it reminded me of a middle school dance (ntm my drink was watery and gross). Regardless b/c Johnny had sent us there with the right information of who to ask for we didnâ€™t wait in line and we didnâ€™t pay cover (two things that can seriously inhibit the night if you want to wander around and try new places out). After Mantra, we took a quick cab ride to Ned Devines, only to be told they had reached capacity. I had been there previously and never had a problem but maybe it was more popular that night. While I wanted to try some places within that same neighborhood my friend had enough of places that werenâ€™t living up (how could you beat the hotel after all, even with a crowd and music?!) and said she just wanted to go back to Beantown, so we did. We hung the rest of the night there, and ended up running into some guys from NY staying at the Nine Zero! The party continued as we hung out in the luxe lobby and joked with Brian behind the desk who all took it in good stride ;) The next morning we went out to breakfast with our new friends. Both my friend and I absolutely loved how convenient the Nine Zero is to EVERYTHING. After grabbing some breakfast at a bakery nearby we hit Borders so she could grab a copy of the Boston magazine she had seen in our room that she wanted as a souvenir. We didnâ€™t have to check out our car until 2pm, so why not soak in the beautiful day? We walked around the Commons and went and saw the duck statues and sat by the pond. Later, when waiting for our car, I spoke some more with John about the recommendations he had made to us and he seemed pleased our night had turned out well and invited us to return soon. My friend lives in the S. Jersey/Philadelphia area, yet is already talking about how taking weekends to Boston would be so manageable. Not to mention, she never will stay anywhere else in Boston but the Nine Zero! I live closer, on the Cape, yet, I have to say I agree! I cannot stop singing their praises to anyone who will listen. The service beyond excellence only makes me want to stay at more Kimpton hotels on any other vacations/weekends I take! Seriously. Thank you so much to the whole Nine Zero staff for making our experience truly enviable;) Fantastic service deserves recognition and you are all BEYOND professional, knowledgeable and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: taffymia
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the Nine Zero while visiting Boston and prior to a cruise. We selected the hotel because of its great location on the Freedom Trail and near Fanneul Hall, and that was really great. Even more so was the fantastic staff and great room. Everyone was helpful and extremely friendly. Tom, the concierge, helped us immensely and made us feel welcome. The wine event in the pre-dinner hour was very friendly and we met many people....they even set up a Weii game for us to play. Personal service in a great location and a wonderful room.

Reviews.Title: “Will only stay here for future trips to Boston!”
Reviews.Author: leh4245
Reviews.Content: Everything was spot on here. The location...you just can't get any better. We walked to Beacon Hill one day, North End the next day, and Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market the next. Amazing shopping is a block behind the hotel. Bars/pubs galore on every corner. Boston Commons is just a block away. The front desk was cordial and inviting. The rooms were posh and comfortable. The bedding is for sale and I had to really talk myself out of taking them home! The ambiance of the entire hotel, including rooms, is just unbeatable. I will only stay here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “No better way to celebrate an anniversary.”
