Reviews.Author: Challah
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to a Kimpton Hotel in Boston. We'd stayed in their Vintage Park Hotel in Seattle and loved it, so when the chance to repeat the Kimpton experience presented itself, we jumped at it. We loved the afternoon wine reception that is part of Kimpton's hospitality. It was our anniversary, so after making our overnight reservation, I called to ask for a special room because it was our anniversary. The Consierge, Tommy, happened to answer the telephone and happily added a note to our reservation noting that fact. Upon our arrival, on a hot July 5, we were greeted by a friendly staff who offered us freeze pops to help cool us down while we checked in. There was a Wii Fit in the lobby to entertain anyone who wanted to play it. We were a little early for check in and the room wasn't quite ready, but we were ushered into a cool lounge to wait for the room. The wait was worth it. Our room had been upgraded to a suite for our special stay. The suite was roomy and had beautiful furniture. It lacked a real view, but this was not a big deal since the room was so plush. When we returned from a walk through the public garden, the wine reception was going on. A delightful white sangria was a perfect cool off for the hot day. Up in our room, we found a tray with a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries and a happy anniversary note written in chocolate. Had everything else in the hotel been awful (which it definitely was not) the special treatment we received would make it all okay. We also got a great recommendation for dinner from the consierge and fine treatment from everyone we encountered. This is not an inexpensive hotel, but the location, right off the Public Garden, the physical beauty of the hotel and its fabulous staff made our anniversary overnight a night to remember.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Greengirl0901
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Nine Zero in downtown Boston and couldnt have been more pleased. The staff was very helpful in providing directions, the hotel was chic and modern and offered a complimentary wine reception in the evening! Just across the street is the Park Street "T" station which was VERY nice to have so close by! Will for sure stay here again on our next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vjr09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husband's 40th birthday (just the two of us, kids stayed home). I had seen all the great reviews on Tripadvisor and had usually found them to be reliable. They certainly were for this hotel. I am pretty critical in general but I was so pleasantly surprised with this place. It was gorgeous, very modern, clean, had a great location, staff was great. I had told them ahead of time that it was my husband's birthday and wanted to get a room on an upper floor with windows and a view. (which was one thing that had been recommended by people on tripadvisor which was so helpful). Anyway, the room was so nice, even down to the music they had on their cds which they put in the rooms and are available to purchase. We are pretty picky about music also but we loved the songs they had chosen and the sound system was good. It definitely added to our stay. The shower was great. There were all these different kinds of pillows you could pick from. The beds and linens were excellent. The location was great - we walked back and forth from Faneuil hall a few times. And the Common was right on the other side of us as well. The wine reception was great with good wine and hors d'oeuvres. The thing that really blew us away was that they sent chocolate covered strawberries up to our room on a tray on which they had also written happy birthday and my husband's name in chocolate along with a complimentary bottle of champagne! We were really blown away. I vowed I would get right on tripadvisor and write a review but I can't believe almost a year has gotten away from me and I'm just getting to it now because I was on here planning a trip for this coming year. Anyway, a little long-winded, but I actually think I'm leaving things out! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: JER235
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, recommended by a friend. Located close to entertainment, shopping, restaurants, and sight-seeing. We stayed in a beautiful room on the 18th floor, overlooking the Common. Staff at the hotel were gracious and professional. The room was beautifully decorated. The bed was so comfortable! I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Delicious! Definitely would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best location & Upscale”
Reviews.Author: Abbey K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nine Zero for five nights on business and the location on Boston Common/Beacon Hill is perfect to walk everywhere. I got the room for $209 a night which is very low for this location and a Kimpton hotel so I was pleased! It's a small hotel, yet has an upscale vibe. I found it to be very quiet in the rooms even though it's on such a busy street. Valet is great but expensive at $38. Aveda products are a plus too! The staff was friendly and when I told them I forgot my toothbrush they brought me one, and some toothpaste for free. Lastly, the only thing I did not like was the bathtub in my room - it appeared to have never been cleaned and I'm not just saying a little, I mean alot, like hadn't been scrubbed for awhile which seemed odd for such a nice place, so I reported it to the front desk. Other than that, everything was clean and I'd recommend staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: PointBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my wife. The location is perfect, you can walk to every where. The hotel is very nice, modern and trendy with very comfortable rooms; we really loved the style of this hotel. I felt the staff was extremely helpful and very polite, it seemed like everyone went out of their way to say hello and ask if we needed help with anything. This is the 2nd time that we have stayed at a Kimpton hotel and are big fans. We will continue to look for Kimpton hotels are our upcomming vactions.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raquelos
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, not excessively pricey, Free wine okay, cheese a bit weird (kind of cheesy puffs). Room was a good size and nice decor. The restaurant food was really nice - Prawn cocktail highly recommended (not your average prawn in a glass). Husband said the gym was okay, but a bit basic. Good location, pretty central. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Crazycat
Reviews.Content: The main plus point for us was the location of Nine Zero. Right in the middle of Boston, on the freedom trail and close to 2 subway stations and Faneuil Hall which was great for restaurants and souvenir shops. The hotel itself was fine for a few nights stay. The room was a good size, with a great mini bar, the prices were steep though, so we used the Seven Eleven a few doors down instead! The bathroom was ok, clean and the shower worked fine. Bed was comfortable too. The wine reception held each night at 5pm was good for a free glass of wine which we took to our room as the lounge area was full, so get there early if you want to sit in the lounge. The restaurant was expensive, but the food was good, and had a good atmosphere, but we preferred to eat out in Boston anyway where it was usually half the price. Our stay was fine, and for the price was good value, and again the location couldn't be beaten!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. A Few Issues.”
Reviews.Author: SpeedwayCJ
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero is fantastically located just 1/2 block off Boston Common with very convenient access to the Park St T station. Directly across the street from Old Granary Burial Ground and within short walking distance of most historic sites. Nice room, well appointed. However, with a price of over $300 per night, I expect a bit more. Air conditioning had to be turned as far down as it would go and fan had to be kept on at all times or the room became uncomfortable and stuffy. Shower curtain was moldy and shower drained VERY slowly, which resulted in standing water up to my ankles during each shower. Had to call down to the Front Desk for an additional roll of toilet paper to prevent running out. Really, even Motel 6 provides an extra roll, just in case, particularly in a room designed for 2-4 people! I searched high and low, but no extra roll anywhere. Even with arranged late checkout on our final day, housekeeping insisted on visiting twice to try to make up the room before we'd left (communication seems to be a little lacking). Must join Kimpton One Touch to get free wi-fi in the hotel, which seems rather pennypinching for such an upscale place. Why is it the hotels you pay the most for offer the fewest free amenities? On the up side, the front desk and lobby staff were very helpful and quite pleasant. As Kimpton One Touch members, we received complimentary champagne upon arrival. Also enjoyed the nightly wine reception. Room service dining was great, particularly the brioche grilled cheese, and priced on par with restaurants around the city. On the whole, my friend and I enjoyed our stay, but some of the fairly minor issues really seemed out of place in such a high-end establishment.

Reviews.Title: “I am now a fan for life of this place”
Reviews.Author: Thejarvisfamily
Reviews.Content: I had to best experience at the Nine Zero 9/18-9/20/09 for a girls weeked for four 40ish friends. What could have been a major screw up on my part turned out great only because of the staff at the hotel. I had booked the hotel at $269/night for a a two queen room a month ago. I got an email offering a one day sale for the same room at $199 as part of a Kimpton Loyalty program. Seeing the opportunity to save money, I cancelled the higher reservation and rebooked at the lower price. I accidentally booked the new reservation a day too ealry. When I arrived at the hotel, they thought I was a no-show the night before. Instead of charging me for the no-show, they immediately found me a new room and did not charge me for the night I did not show up. They could not have been nicer about it. They even noticed my friend was pregnant and gave her a coupon for $10 off anything in the mini-bar in she got hungry. They even upgraded us to a room with a view (15th floor) for the $199 night. I have stayed at 8 Kimpton hotels (DC, New Orleans etc) before and this was my favorite. The bedding was incredibly comforable (down comfortors and feather pillows with very high thread count) and I am a total sleep snob. The bathroom was roomy enough for four women to get ready for a nigt on the town. The shower had the perfect water pressure, we were all raving about it at dinner. I loved the location of the hotel . The decor was modern and funky but comfortable. The wine reception was perfect as usual for a Kimpton. All my friends were so pleased with my hotel selection and we all felt it was a great deal. I just can't say enough about the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. I could not have loved it any more!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good if under $250”
Reviews.Author: HoltFamilySingapore
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel if a little pretentious. Location is central but in the evening you have to run a gauntlet of night creatures in front of the Park St. subway, 7 eleven and Burger King - cross the street before you get to that part makes it nicer. Breakfast was good, but $5 for a cup of coffee!? DId not like having to give alot of personal info online to get the 'free' internet but it worked fine. Wine testing evening looked cheesy, and we did not partake. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Gym was good, but could not lower TV volume. I would recommend this hotel but not at +$350/nite

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: AUTISMSMITH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 2nd-4th September and was not impressed at all. Staff on main desk were friendly and helpful, but our room was not nice at all. They had two dressing gowns in the room which I would not let my dog sleep on, one was washed out and had a hole in the sleep (elbow) and the the other one (also washed out) had been given a new belt that didnt match! My husband sat in reception with our son for 1-1/2 hours while the wine fest was on and was not offered a single glass even though people were coming in and being handed it!! The bath room was not clean (especially the bath - which I had to clean before using it) the windows were filthy - so dirty you couldnt see out properly. The staff generally were very polite and helpful but the room we had (1209) needed a good clean and new soft furnishings - the bed a fake furry cover which moulted all over my hubby!!! The towels also had a really nasty weird smell about them. I do NOT recommend this hotel. Oh yes, and the internet cost nearly 6 dollars for 15 minutes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Boston sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: HippoPi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in July. Loved the modern trendy room, which was well equipped and clean. Breakfast was very good, though quite pricey - the restaurant was very classy and service was excellent. The best thing about the hotel was the location - right by Boston Common. It was very close to the start of the Freedom Trail. Also very easy to get to Boston's other sights (e.g. Harvard, aquarium etc) from the hotel - either on foot or on the T. We'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Plush modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew029
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on Business. Small check in area and lobby but all very nice. The rooms were very well specâ€™d with an eye on modern design. Very comfy armchair in room and bathroom was very nice and all perfectly clean. Only had a shower, no tub, but that didnâ€™t bother me as prefer a shower anyway but could upset some. Had a cd player in the room which was useful. Nice location short walk from the park and shops, and although itâ€™s on a busy road it was very quiet. Great little Irish American style bar next door which was great for a couple of cold beers.

Reviews.Title: “Yeah, this place is great”
Reviews.Author: PickyGuy
Reviews.Content: OK, so the 24-hour long techno music and modern looking furniture in the lobby was fun, if not a bit much, but overall this is a great hotel. You can tell that these guys try to do their best - a rarity in the US. They clearly are watching lots of little details. Great location for a tourist, near the subway, near the park, near the State Capital building, across the street from a very old cemetery where Paul Revere is buried, etc. Hotel was clean. Free WiFi was great and they also have cabled internet just in case. Nice soft bedding and pillows. Nice furnishings. Friendly staff. Parking was $38 per day but that's par for this location in Boston. I was only there for 1 day and didn't get to enjoy the 5 p.m. wine but I"m sure that this would be fun. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities. Terrific location. Good price.”
Reviews.Author: dogloverIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: This is a cool boutique style hotel. Very attractive facilities and rooms. Excellent location for walking the historic trail. Friendly complimentary wine-beer reception in early evening. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: brxbmrzfan
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to this stay. I travel to Boston frequently but have never stayed at Nine Zero. I have stayed at other Kimpton properties so I have pretty high expectations. I found this to be the worst of the Kimptons that I have had the pleasure of experiencing. 1) The rooms are small...which isn't a huge deal since I don't spend much time in the rooms. 2) The A/C in my room was ineffective. I had the A/C set to the coldest temperature but the room was very warm, even at night. I woke up several times each night because I was so hot. I had to sleep on top of the sheets and blankets. 3) The towels in the rooms are really thin and hard....they are in dire need of replacement. 4) The wifi went out for about 12 hours during the stay and there is no wired option that I could find. Luckily, I brought a cable to tether my computer to my Blackberry. When I first arrived to my room, the wifi worked. But, after returning from dinner, I had a signal and my computer said I was "Connected," but I couldn't get on any sites. Mid-day on Saturday the wifi magically returned. (I am pretty tech experienced, so I know what I was doing.) 5) The service was friendly but, at times, incompetent. I called down for a few items that were promised and not delivered without second calls 45 minutes-1 hour later. 6) The hotel is really looking worn and soiled. The carpeting in the public areas is littered with lots of stains. On the flip side, I liked the Aveda products. And, the location is very convenient to the Govt. Center and Park Ave. T stops. But, overall, a pretty disappointing stay relative to other Kimpton experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: bakio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights with our two kids, 8 and 11. Excellent location walking distance from all of downtown Boston's historical sites--Faneuil Hall, Public Garden, Boston Commons, the North End. And the Granary Burial ground is across the street; you can't sleep much closer to more famous 18th-century Americans! The hotel staff was warm, friendly and helpful. Rooms are not large, but they are well appointed, sparkling clean, and comforting. And you don't spend time sitting in your hotel room in this amazing city, so the fact that the rooms are not sprawlingly huge didn't matter. The hotel is a short walk from a T station, which will get you everywhere else you need to go in the city--for example, we took the T to Kenmore Square to see the Red Sox and to Cambridge to walk around Harvard Square. Will certainly stay here again on our next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellant location.”
Reviews.Author: JohninDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (my wife, 17 year old son, and I) for 3 nights. Very nice location - walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go. Very clean, somewhat trendy hotel. Small lobby and only 2 elevators, but the room was clean and pretty, and the hotel was quiet but still fun. Nice amenities and a reasonable rate. Overall an excellant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish and well located”
Reviews.Author: Eddiecat
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpfull service. Well designed, attractive room. Well located for many of the sights and the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great service. A refreshing change”
Reviews.Author: Smudger_by_the_Sea
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Nine Zero in July for a business trip to Boston. Let's start with location. This hotel is nicely situated....3 walk minutes to Faneuil Hall, 5-10 minutes to Back Bay and a few steps off the Freedom Trail. The rooms aren't huge, but beautifully decorated with good accessories. Every evening a free wine 'hour' is held in the seated lobby area - nice way to informally meet some entertaining strangers. Next door is the "Beantwon Pub" for a simple brew. For a more upscale meal, the hotel's restaurant 'KO Prime' has a good selection and ambience. The wireless internet carries a charge, UNLESS you sign up for Kimpton's loyalty program - it then becomes free (no brainer really!) All in all, a great boutique hotel. Good base for a business traveller or those exploring the city and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “A little unusual”
Reviews.Author: Yug3
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero is modernly quirky place to stay that is clean, comfortable and very well located but seems to sit at odds with the 16th century charm of America's oldest city. Alsoâ€¦ it allows pets.. Situated in the middle of downtown Boston (on the border of the theatre and financial districts) everything is within walking distance. For those looking for history, the Freedom Trail passes right outside the door. Across the road is the "burying ground" that contains the tomb of Benjamin Franklin and the grave of Paul Revere. Only a few steps away is a view of the famous North Church ("one if by land... two if by sea"). Only 10 minutes walk away is the dicks area with many good restaurants and bars. (But donâ€™t pass up the Beantown Pub right next door for a taste of real Boston). The lobby is small and full of an eclectic and varied set of furniture and the theme continues on to the leopard skin dressing gowns hanging in each rooms' bathroom. The beds are deliciously comfortable and welcoming and the facilities are all workable and easy to find. Yesâ€¦ a bit strange.. but I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but disapointing”
Reviews.Author: alenas12
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice to look at and looked very clean at a first glance. However, all of our sheets, comforters, bath mats had rips and holes. The floors were not vacuumed well at all. The shower curtain was a bit moldy. When we brought up the issues to the staff, they apologized and assured us it would be taken care of, they also took off the parking fee. Yet, only the sheets and comforters were replaced. The location was great, very central to things. Staff and restaurant was nice as well. Probably would not stay again, since cleanliness is VERY high on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nine Zero!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingteacher3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nine Zero Hotel in June of 2009 for 3 nights for a fun sight seeing trip. We got an upgraded room that overlooked the Boston Commons. We booked through the hotels website and got the third night for FREE! The hotel itself is very modern, somewhat compact, but overall was wonderful! The beds were extremely comfortable!! The staff was friendly and helpful. Concierge was helpful in upgrading Red Sox tickets. Pros: stay for location, easy walking to most sights, great beds, modern decor Cons: Parking is difficult and costly, check bill for extra mini bar charges!

Reviews.Title: “Star Count Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: hotelwise16
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not a four-star hotel, so set your expectations realistically. It is a good three star hotel in a great Boston location right on the Freedom Trail. If you like traditional elegance, this is not the place for you. On the other hand, if you like animal motif, you might love this pet-friendly place. The room was small, not unlike many downtown hotel rooms and animal print was everywhere. Walking into the hotel room is somewhat like walking into "The Shopping Channel" - items for sale are strategically placed throughout the hotel room. The shower stall had a mouldy odor, but appeared clean. On the positive side, the complimentary wine reception in the small lobby between 5 and 6 p.m. was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MFabulous
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Nine Zero over the weekend. We had booked a queen suite but, upon check in, were given an upgrade to the Cloud Nine Suite..without even asking for it. The Cloud Nine Suite was amazing with a wonderful view of Boston Commons and with all the amenities and extras you would expect. Super clean and super quiet too. Our children loved it and didn't want to leave. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was just what we wanted. The breakfast was delicious and delivered to our room each morning within 25 minutes. The location of the hotel isn't perfect, but other than that we have no complaints. It was one of the best hotel stays we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, modern hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: exhibitv
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's location -- located right by the Boston Commons on Tremont Street. The hotel's lobby presentation was modern and nice. Our rooms were small, but fully updated and beautiful. We spent a lovely day seeing all of Boston's best and felt like we could really relax in our room. The bathroom was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. All our interactions with the hotel staff were very good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A must for your stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel2381
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Nine Zero while vacationing in Boston recently. We were greeted with a glass of wine during their complimentary wine hour from 5-6 pm. I had mentioned that it was his birthday upon check in and we were surprised in our room with complimentary champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, and a nice birthday card from the staff. This was a lovely treat and one we assumed to be charged for but weren't! The decor/vibe of the hotel are impressive as well. Very clean, modern, and chic. Loved the colors, prints and overall atmosphere. There is a fun little pub next door with pool tables etc and a few great restaurants within walking distance. Also a short cab ride (or longer walk) from Newbury Street where lots of restaurants, cafes, and shops are located. Our room was very spacious and nicely decorated. The showers were rather large and really neat, and beds/linens really comfy. Another highlight was upon check out. We needed a rental car asap to drive down to Cape Cod and catch a ferry and were on a huge time crunch. After attempting to rent one across the street and being told they were sold out we frantically approached the front desk for addresses of others to walk or cab to. A very helpful young man at the front desk made a phone call to a nearby rental company and requested a car be delivered to the hotel with priority rush. We were shocked at how easy and quick the process was from there. The car arrived in 10 minutes, we signed the papers and were immediately on our way. That made the difference between us making or missing our ferry boat. Everything at Nine Zero was done a prompt, professional, and extremely helpful manner. I will not ever stay anywhere else when visiting Boston in the future...a truly amazing experience from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: salsrug
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston on business and stayed two nights in the Nine Zero and loved it. The bed was fantastic and the location was great (in walking distance to my building). The staff was friendly and everything in the room was spotless. I could have even had my own goldfish if I was lonely.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Service, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jmyw35
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two week tour of the East Coast. Booked the Nine Zero after reading the reviews. I LOVED IT! Traveling alone I am sometimes lost in a Hotel however I could not have beeen made more comfortable than the genuine warmth of the staff. Very Clean and modern, amazing location (on the freedom trail!). Cnt wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We generally had a very nice stay at the Nine Zero. We really liked the shower in the bathroom, which was a nice size with good water pressure. The hotel is in a good location for Boston tourist locales. The hotel service was generally good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved Nine Zero!”
Reviews.Author: scullwalker
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero was our favorite hotel on our New England vacation. We stayed 3 nights. Great room size for our family which includes 2 teens. We had 2 queen beds and a cot and still had room to walk! The beds were very comfortable. Great location - right on the Freedom trail! We walked everywhere - we didn't even need to use a taxi. Restaurants, sightseeing, Long Wharf - it's all right there! Staying at the Nine Zero really added to the wonderful time we had visiting Boston! Love Kimptons!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: UnitedStatesVacation
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, comfortable hotel in a great location for seeing the city. We were traveling with two teenagers and the hotel and staff were fantastic. I have stayed at this hotel several times before and have always had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly! Really!”
Reviews.Author: MaineLab_mom
Reviews.Content: We picked the Nine Zero first because of their willingness to allow us to bring our two labrador retrievers along. Many hotels that list themselves as dog friendly are not really - they allow one dog or only dogs under 20 lbs., etc...I inquired about the policy at the Nine Zero prior to making reservations and received a very prompt email response "we love dogs, of course you can bring them both". It worked out GREAT! When I arrived, we'd been in the car a while so I asked if I could walk my dogs before completing my check in. They valeted my car and off we went for a walk. Check in was smooth, I was offered a glass of wine and the room was perfect. It is not a large space but it's a boutique hotel, so it was in line with what I expected. We booked the queen size room to allow for more floor space for our dog crate. Dog sitting/dog walking services are available if needed. They also can provide you with bowls for use during your stay. Biscuits are handed out freely along with pick up bags. Unrelated to the dog part of the stay, the service was quite good. I am always impressed when staff remember your name and greet you by it. We did not eat at the hotel but did have drinks in the bar. Service quite good there as well. A good breakfast recommendation was made for us and the concierge called to be sure they were seating and could accommodate us. All in all, a very positive experience. Years ago, I worked at one of Boston's finer hotels and have since stayed at several in the area that are highly rated. The Nine Zero has now become my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel, great location, better service”
Reviews.Author: pjsjr1
Reviews.Content: Thomas (concierge) and Sean (asst mgr) were great. They made the trip with my family wonderful. I almost never review hotels but this one was great. The price was a value and the service was wonderful. We got 2 rooms through hotwire to give us room for the kids. The rooms are nice but on the small size. Every member on the staff was pleasant and outgoing. My boys wanted to move to the hotel. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, but otherwise a mixed picture for the cost”
Reviews.Author: Masterpsych
Reviews.Content: The location of this facility cannot be improved for the casual traveler who seeks a history tour of Boston. Easy access to the subway, walking distance from the North End and Quincy Market and right on the Freedom Trail, Boston Commons, and a block from the Capital Building. Most of the staff was well presented and extremely helpful and knowledgeable (far better than most hotels), while others seemed to be too bothered to attend to us and pushed a handful of brochures our way when we asked for recommendations. If you travel with a dog, this is your place, although we do not, and find this policy a minor nuisance. The bed was very comfortable, although it inexplicably squeaked when we moved. All other furnishings were clean, fairly new and Spartan. Three window vents can be opened to let in fresh air. Housekeeping service was minimal, and some days we had little soap, shampoo and toilet paper (odd for a better hotel), although there were plenty of towels and the room was generally clean. Everything about the hotel was small: the lobby, the hallways and especially the room. We did not have a bathtub (important for us), and would have asked to be moved, but didnâ€™t learn that some rooms had baths until late in the stay. Our view was good (facing Tremont), but the traffic noise was bad, even on a higher floor, and woke us up until we were forced to sleep with ear plugs. We were given a $10 certificate against the courtesy bar products (a reward for joining the Loyalty Program), but there was not a hint anywhere of what those items cost, so it could have been generous or a small faction of the costs of a bottle of water. When we mentioned this dilemma at the desk, the clerk simply smiled and shrugged. We have come to expect some sort of complimentary breakfast buffet and in-room coffee makers from the better (and even some cheaper) hotels in recent years, but that was not the case here. They have a restaurant, but there were far better and less expensive meals to be had within a few blocks of the front door. In a bizarre episode, as we were unpacking upon arrived, an Asian man with a key walked into our room! He described himself as an â€œemployeeâ€� (he had a strong accent, so we may be wrong) and asked if everything was good. I pointed out that the phone was blinking and asked him to explain (we just arrived so there could not be messages for us), but he said he did not know and would have it fixed. We never saw him again and the phone never stopped blinking. Maybe that was the how it worked?

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: croenenberg
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in June. Had a great trip, and was very pleased with Nine Zero as a base of operations. The room was spacious (given the urban setting), very comfortable and clean (great bed and a super-comfortable desk chair, too). Had breakfast in the restaurant, a comfortable room with food that was good if a bit overpriced (again, what you would expect from a city-center hotel). Service was great: whatever you need, they are right there to provide it. We had two small problems during our stay, one with the shower drain, another with another customer's charge showing up on our bill at check-out. Both were taken care of virtually instantly with a call to the front desk. Location is superb: walking distance from many attractive areas and you are just a block from the Park street "T" station, which runs both the Green Line (toward the Museum of Fine Arts, among other destinations) and the Red Line (to Cambridge in one direction and South Station with connections to Amtrak and commuter trains to outlying areas in the other). We took the T to the airport at the close of our trip, and it was a breeze. I would certainly consider the Nine Zero for future stays in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpdl1402
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate in February - travelling on buisness but my sister joined me at end of trip for some shopping and dining. The hotel was very comfortable and the decor was trendy/cool. A bit too much black was used in the rooms, though. I couldn't help wondering what all the dark colors were hiding...I'm a clean freak though. While the room was a bit small, the shower was huge and the bathroom amenities were great. The complimentary wine in the evening was o.k. - not the best quality wine and the lobby area was small and cramped. What my sister and I loved most was the location - even though it was cold, we walked through the neighborhood to the park and we were very close to great shopping and restaurants. Service was very good but not all that warm. The concierge was very helpful with dinner suggestions and reservations. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy loft suites”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: Wow! Now, I've rented suites before, but I've never felt like I walked into my own trendy loft apartment looking over the edge of the Boston Commons! Between the ideal location (barely a few blocks to all the historical sites) and the neat sliding doors and the fabulous customer service, I'm not sure what else to say. One note: only three stars for location BECAUSE of the poorly marked entrance! We had to call the front desk and have then stay with us on the phone while we tried to find the hotel because the sign is so small and easy to drive right past. However, the gentleman on the phone was very patient and remarked that it happens often; we didn't feel too bad. Once we found it - onward to a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Center of Town”
Reviews.Author: SusanLLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at a Kimpton hotel (my husband has stayed in several) and once again I was not disappointed. The Nine Zero staff could not have been more accommodating. We arrived earlier than normal check-in time and the front-facing room we had requested was not quite ready. So the front desk person gladly found us another room on a lower floor and we were able to check in early. The concierge was very friendly and took time to answer all our questions. He called a museum in Cambridge for us to check whether it was open during renovation and gave us several suggestions for restaurants near the hotel. Though our room was not large it was very nicely appointed with a comfortable chair , a great bed and all the usual Kimpton amenities, including bathrobes. The bathroom was a good size with plenty of shelf space and the shower was wonderful. The hotel's location near the Boston Common and Public Garden is very convenient for walking all over and taking the "T", Boston's trolley/subway system. As other Trip Advisor reviewers have commented, there are a number of homeless people in the area but we were never bothered and felt perfectly safe walking around. We had a great breakfast in the hotel restaurant and a terrific dinner at the nearby Teatro restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “I don't believe there are any hotels BETTER than this in Boston!!!”
Reviews.Author: w1ldb0y
Reviews.Content: After a terrible journey and a lost suitcase, it was great to arrive at Nine Zero to a friendly smile from Jessica on reception and a complimentary glass of free champagne. Our 'double double' room had been oversold, so we were offered and extra double bedroom at no extra cost! One of our party was due to have a birthday during our stay so we received a lovely bottle of red wine and some chocolate dipped strawberries in one of the rooms. Each bedroom was perfectly appointed - wonderfully comfortable beds! Sadly, one of the rooms had a few straight onto the office block across the street, but that was hardly a heartbreak! Absolutely no fault to be found in this hotel, and I'd like to offer a very sincere thank you to Jessica on reception and Corey and Tom from the concierge desk for spoiling us rotten and making our stay in Boston something to really to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nancy7471
Reviews.Content: Room was small but very clean and modern-nice. Hotel staff was professional, helpful and friendly! We loved Joe, the bartender too! Thanks for a wonderful weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel despite the weird stuff in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: sal04
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Location not bad although it seemed as if most of the nice bars and restaurants were on the other side of the parks (10-15min walk max). Rooms were nice but the animal print bathrobe, pyjamas and big leather headboards were a slightly odd touch! I really liked the facility to borrow stuff you had forgotten for free e.g. hair straighteners etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wow--such a great staff + new”
Reviews.Author: roli13
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay so much we decided to write a review. The hotel is in a great location--steps to the Common and the T. Plus, the hotel is entirely new. Our room faced another building which was very dull...but oh well it didn't matter as the staff was so great. Everyone talks about a nice staff, but this place was really great. Plus, a nice 'wine tasting' hour. It's a neat place. Thanks Nine Zero--we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Thomas the Concierge = The MAN!!!”
Reviews.Author: pickles1107
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy Kimpton hotels, so we decided to spend the last night of our honeymoon at the Nine Zero. We arrived at the hotel at 12:30 and Christina promptly informed us that no rooms were available at that time and to come back at 3, which is the official check in time. They must have been full the night before because we were told this without even being asked our name and looking in the system to see if our room was ready. No problem...we left our bags and headed out for the Freedom Trail. At about 4:15, we arrived back at the hotel and went to the front desk. Checkin was smooth and each guest is offered a glass of champagne at checkin. We decided we would rather have a coke and were instructed to take one from the mini bar. I fully expected these cokes to be charged to our room since this was not standard practice, but the charges have not yet shown up on my card statement (I did mention this at checkout and jokingly told the clerk that I would have to call him back tomorrow to have the charges removed and he said that he would see to it that it was taken care of). We were assigned room 1705. When I booked the hotel (using the best price guarantee over the phone), my reservation was for a Queen Deluxe room (the lowest room type). After emailing the concierge and inquiring about the cost of any available upgrades, Thomas informed us that he had upgraded us to a Queen Deluxe View room. Perfect!! If you look at the photos of the hotel building, the top four floors all have floor to ceiling wraparound windows, and we were lucky enough to be in one of these rooms. Room 1705 is a corner room facing the Boston Common with a divine view of Park Street Church, the State House, the river, and Back Bay. Absolutely could not have asked for a better view!!! The room itself was not large by any means, but comfortable enough with space for a working desk with chair beside the bed, a circular armoire housing the minibar and TV (a CRT-this is the first Kimpton I've stayed in without a flat screen), and a nice comfy chair with a view toward the corner of the room. The bed looked and felt larger than a queen to me, and was truly heavenly. We stayed at the Hotel Marlowe and the Mandarin Oriental also during this same trip, and this bed ran circles around the others in terms of comfort (and the other ones were comfy...this one just more so). There was also a coffee table with a couple of magazines, including a DuPont Registry. Could these people read my mind?? One of my favorite magazines anywhere!! Major brownie points there. The bathroom itself was a bit small with a standup shower and a sink with a view. The door to the bathroom was on a slider (picture a pocket door without one of the walls concealing the door) and got sticky with about a foot remaining until closed, making it extremely hard to shut completely. The armoire furniture was quite tired looking with chipped paint and a large section along the side which had clearly been repainted with flat black paint and didn't quite mesh with the original glossy black finish. Thomas also was nice enough to send up some chocolate covered strawberries and some sparkling apple juice (we requested this as apposed to champagne). YUM. We quickly found space in the mini fridge and saved them for later. When we walked into the room, it was extremely hot...about 77 degrees. It was an unseasonably hot day (high of about 90), and with all those windows and the sun beating down, the AC, while blowing cold air, just wasn't cutting it. We had the bellman manually turn the AC on high and he told us if it wasn't better in 10 minutes to call the engineer. In 5 minutes, I checked again and it was 78, in 10 it was 79. Okay...we are going the wrong direction here. In came the engineer, who could not have been more apologetic. He immediately began checking the wiring of both thermostats (yes-there were two thermostats in the room). We later discovered that these independently controlled each vent because we set the one in the hallway near the door on 70 before bed and when we woke up it was chily. We checked and the one in the hallway was on 70 but the one near the bed was still on 68 and the vent above it still dutifully blowing. 15 minutes after the engineer arrived, it was time to head to the Fenway for the Sox game. He promised us it would be cool when we returned to the room later that night. We hopped on the Green Line at the Park Street station, which is about a 3 minute walk from the hotel. After the game, we decided to walk all the way back to the hotel since it was so nice out. This was a pleasant 40 minute stroll down Newbury and through the Public Gardens and Boston Common back to the hotel. When we got back to the room, it was much cooler-what a relief! On Friday, checkout was slow. I believe the problem centered around the $10 allowance card to use in the minibar that Kimpton InTouch members receive. There seemed to be a problem applying this $10 credit to our bill. We eventually checked out and headed for the Blue Line towards the airport. We were there the night of 5/21 and checked out on 5/22, and thankfully didn't experience any of the water problems the previous reviewer did. Overall, the service we received prior to check in from Thomas was excellent, and our stay was excellent, but the tired looking armoire and the hot room kept me from giving it 5 stars. Thanks Thomas, and keep up the good work!! People like you are why we love Kimptons so much...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BigIslandRox
Reviews.Content: I had a King Premium room. It was pretty basic. A/C didn't work that well - either hot or cold. No towel racks in the bathroom, which I never realized how important they are when there are two travelling. We lost hot water for awhile due to a problem somewhere in the block. That was a pain, but the hotel was not able to do anything about that except offer free breakfast. Outside noise is kept outside - but noise within the hotel was obvious (had a few door slammers across from our room). Restaurant was very nice - both our dishes had to be sent back due to issues with cooking time - but they went over the top to remedy the situation. We got back to our room after dinner and received a call offering us an after dinner drink in our room. Very nice (I assume that was because of our dinner problem.) Keep in mind it is a dog friendly hotel so there are dogs off leash in the common areas from time to time. Workout room was small, but had the basics. Staff was all very nice - Overall above average -

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome staff, overall great time”
Reviews.Author: kman3528
Reviews.Content: We were guests at the Nine Zero from May 14th through May 18th. The hotel is in an excellent location and provided us access to all that we wanted to do. Very easy walk to Quincy Market, Boston Common and the "T" stations. Staff were very friendly, and everyone made you feel welcome. Rooms were very quiet and clean. Beds and linens were awesome. The evening concierge, Scotty, was very good in handling our requests for dinner locations. Both recommendations were awesome and greatly appreciated. Beantown Pub right next door was great for drinks, quick bite, and interaction with the locals. We had a great time out and about in Boston which was made all the more better by being able to come back to such a nice hotel that was very close to where we had been out. I will recommend this hotel to all of my friends due to our experience. Thanks again Nine Zero.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time”
Reviews.Author: Clancy79
Reviews.Content: A week or so since our stay and we are still saying "that was a really nice weekend".The hotel staff are exceptional. Greeted with a glass of wine upon arrival was very nice.Thank you Meghan. The room was great. The bath amenities are excellent. This hotel is so close to everything. Only downside.. take out a loan to buy a good martini at the hotel bar Love this place

Reviews.Title: “Save up if you want to use the phone”
Reviews.Author: Rob207
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel and stayed for four nights but our views were spoiled by the outrageous charges for a short phone call - $17 to leave a voicemail message on a USA landline. The hotel is very nicely appointed and superbly appointed. Staff very helpful and also a nice touch of providing a complimentary wine reception at 5pm in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable boutique style”
Reviews.Author: PeterLondonW9
Reviews.Content: Easy to miss this hotel because of its discrete name plate. Once inside however the hotel is very stylish and comfortable. The blackout blinds in the rooms and supremely comfortable beds make for an exceptionally good night's sleep. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Really clean room”
Reviews.Author: wow_justdoit
Reviews.Content: Stayed this hotel for 12 nights. The location is great, very close to Park Street station of the subway and Quincy Market which is one of the famous spot in Boston. People are nice here, also food are good and healthy. They clean up the room every day with extra care and room service is so polite when they bring up dinner. I would certainly stay here again on my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Howell_from_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent on all counts. The design of interior decor in the room was very good and the attention that had been given to this sets it apart from other hotels (in my view). The attitiude of the staff was very helpful, (especially the conceige who helped us sort a hire car out and suggested locations to go to for a day trip). Happy hour in the late afternoon with complimentary drinks was a very nice touch. Location is great, in the downtown area. I'd make a point of staying here again if I go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: YankeeFan10182
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once a few years ago for business and remembered it when I was coming to town for the Yanks/Red Sox game this past weekend. We were greeted by the front desk and riffed a little about the baseball rivalry. We were given an upgraded room on the 17th floor with a view of Boston Common and the downtown area. The room was clean, the hotel was quiet and the bed was comfortable. I stayed at the Sheraton on Dalton Street last year when I went up for the game and it doesn't even come close to the flawless experience we had at Nine Zero. This is definitely the only place I will stay from now on. Although I wish it was a bit more affordable (paid $197 AAA rate, booked the night before), especially in these times, I think it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in central Boston”
Reviews.Author: Artmoz
Reviews.Content: For a first visit to Boston this was a perfect hotel. Very close to the T (half way between Park St and Government Centre) and to Boston Common, and easy walking distance of Beacon Hill, Quincy Market and North End. The hotel is luxurious and seems to have aromatherapy oils pumped continously through the air conditioning as everywhere smelled amazing! The wine reception every evening is a great way to relax before going out for the night. Every interaction with reception staff was flawless, although after checking out, when we came to collect our bags in the evening no porter was available and the receptionist had to bring them herself which was very surprising. Rooms are very nice, with a spacious bathroom and fantastic Aveda toiletries. However, the TV was not flat screen and the mini bar was strange, with huge bottles of mixers and the whole black-ash unit looked like something out of the '80s. Additionally, despite various mentions of a hi-fi in the literature we couldn't find one anywhere. Cleaning could have been better, on arrival the floor had not been vacuumed and the room service menu was covered with coffee rings, while the outer shower curtain was water stained. For this 2 night stay we booked using Skoosh and got a room-only price about 50% lower than directly quoted and were even given a free continental breakfast for both days (mistake or generousity? Although a 1.5 inch muffin was hardly enough to fill us up for a morning). Overall a sumptuous and stylish hotel with great service in what can only be described as the ideal location to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: LATOTLV
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the ONLY place to stay in Boston. Smack in the middle of the city, upscale, reasonably priced, but what makes this hotel a real standout is the service. The staff are ready to assist at all times. From directing us to fantastic restaurants and sights around the city, to taking care of us while we were at the hotel (they have a "Forgot it? We got it." service that provides their patrons with most anything they forgot from home). They know your name and treat you like a repeat customer from day one.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy small Kimpton boutique hotel with mind-blowing central location!”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Small and trendy, with a pocket lobby including comfortable seating, trendy house music on the speakers, bright colored modern artwork on the walls and a valet stop. Room: Trendy touches, specifically the bed linens and headboard, similar to most Kimpton hotels. Slightly narrow, but wasn't an issue. Bathroom was the only small unpleasent surprise, as it seemed rather standard compared with most boutique hotels trendy renovations. (could have been in any basic hotel, with small bathtub and sinks with vanity mirror.) Location: Amazing location, at the head of the Boston Common park, between the gold-domed State House, the skyscrapers of the financial district, the theater district and the historic sights of Fanieull Hall, Boston Massacre, etc. Staff: Professional, friendly, attentive are all words I would use for the valets and front desk clerks I interacted with, as well as the restaurant staff. Restaurant/Bar: Restaurant, KO Prime, looks very good, with creative twists to classic favorites. We only had the breakfast, which, while small, was top quality, including fresh fruits and melons and a muffin or croissant, as well as coffee and juice. The bar, unfortunately, closed rather early, about midnight; however a couple bars right next door solved that problem with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: amateurhistorian
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero just gets better and better -- and being a Kimpton In-touch member definitely has its perks! We were greeted as returning guests and made to feel personally welcome throughout the trip. Out top-floor room was clean, quiet, spacious, and had a terrific view of Boston. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, from transportation tips to emergency luggage repair. The wine reception in the evening is a nice touch after a day of chilly sightseeing. I highly recommend this hotel...and so does my 16-year-old daughter!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price or frustration”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrails1984
Reviews.Content: I visited the Nine Zero hotel in March 2009. The location is quite prime for Boston, easy access to everything the only downside is the homeless people waiting right outside to ask you for change. When I arrived, I asked for a room upgrade. We recieved a slightly larger room and a "view of the city" Unforunatley, we got a corner room on the top floor and all we could see was an apartment building being built next door. The room itself was nothing to brag about. This hotel claims to modern and trendy, but only on a Ikea budget. The bathroom had a sliding door, which made pieces of the ceiling break off everytime it opened or closed. Everything seems quite small on the inside, narrow hallways, small rooms, large price. Typical inner city overpriced with little amenties in the rooms. On the day that we were checking out I recieved a bill under my door. It was for the room upgrade, which I expected, but it also had charges for the mini bar on it. I never used or took anything from the mini-bar. I went to the front desk to get it resovled and the girl quickly removed the charge without any questions. After arriving home, I checked my credit card bill and saw that I was charged even more money for the use of the mini-bar. All charges that I had not approved. I immediatley contacted the Accounting department in the hotel and no one will ever answer their telephone no matter what time you call. After 5 or 6 unanswered calls, I asked to speak with the manager, who also did not answer the telephone. I ended up having my credit card company remove the charges. I've noticed from other reviewers that this is a typical thing to the hotel does to screw people out of more money. Such a hassle and a horrible way to end a trip! Would not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic luxury”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: First off, if you are planning to stay here: Please, for the love of all that is holy and good, use the driving directions from the hotel website and do NOT use Google maps to get directions. They fail, completely and utterly. The Nine Zero Hotel is fantastic and luxurious. I stayed here for only one night, but wish I could have stayed more. I was upgraded to a Queen Suite which was bigger than my first apartment and a whole lot better furnished. The room, grounds, and the entire facility was spotless. Everyone was friendly, helpful, and eager to please. The only other issue that comes to mind is that when they tell you to allow 30 minutes to recover your valet parked car - they mean it. Even though I left quite early, it still took a long time to get my car. Oh well, life goes on..

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, peaceful rooms! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jamjelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my husband's 40th birthday. We were very pleased with our stay! The hotel staff even delivered chocolates and a card for my husband. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very clean and quiet. We had a great night's sleep. The hotel is in a great location. We had dinner at Ruth's Chris and walked to the restaurant. I agree with the poster about the charge for parking, but I've found that is typical Boston Hotel parking fees. This hotel was a great escape and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: mingos
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the location of this hotel. It was in the center of everything. You are about 4 blocks from quincy market and yet in the heart of boston. We had such a wonderful stay. The room was amazing, the people were great. The hotels food is a little expensive, but there is a great pub next door called beans hometwon pub. Everynight there are cocktails in the lounge which we loved. However my one complaint is the parking. Valet parking was 40 a night which I thought was little much. There is public parking for about 20 night dow by the aquarium which is only 6 or 7 blocks. Well worth the money. FYI: they do allow pets and when you arrive they have a food dish set up for your dog at the door as a welcome as well as home made biscuits in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: K13
Reviews.Content: The NIne Zero is in one of the best locations in the city. Within a fifteen minute walk is the North End, Quincy Market, the Waterfront, the Public Garden and Newbury Street. The hotel was immaculate, with good sized rooms and spacious bathrooms. The shower was awesome - even my 13 year old was impressed by it. We will definitely return to the hotel for our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, odd mini-bar; everything is for sale!”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: No complaints which is unusual for me. The room was good sized and we upgraded to a higher floor with a view. (lower floors can look over an alley way). Nice service. There is a rocking bar with fun cocktails that should be tried. The mini bar is odd (see picture) - everything is full-sized! Big old half-gallon of mixers - enough for a party of 40. nothing smaller. Everything is for sale in the room. The toiletries (yes, there is a takeaway tote stored under the sink you can buy for $90++), the bathrobe (that's a given) and the pajamas neatly hung in the closet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, super staff and nice location... loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Travels2Light
Reviews.Content: I've spent literally hundreds of nights in hotels.... probably nearing a thousand now...and this place knows a thing or three about service. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, and never treated a request like an imposition. I was offered a glass of wine at check in, got an upgraded room, and the decor was refreshingly un-hotel. Starbucks just around the corner! The one time I was unable to print in the business center, the concierge obligingly printed out all my documents for me. Doormen, housekeeping, reception, concierge, all great. A little disappointed that their restaurant did not open for lunch, as it would have been a nice venue for a business lunch, but you have Ruth's Chris just around the corner. It's a short walk to shopping and dining streets. My room was great. Only slightly inconvenient thing was the tiny size of the closet, and the fact that much of that was taken up by an ironing board that did not fit on the hooks intended for it in the closet, as well as animal print lingerie "for sale" that was hanging in there. There are a lot of hip/trendy items for sale in the room, which would have been better off in a downstairs gift shop, but the trade-off is the Nine Zero is also stocked with "items you might have forgotten" that are handy travel essentials. The wireless internet connection is very good in the rooms, and the desk is functional and well lit. Overall, a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: jvieve19
Reviews.Content: We had an awful experience at Nine Zero. My husband and I travel to Boston a lot, and we have never been treated SO rudely in our lives. My husband has had brain surgery, and since his surgery in 2006 he tends to stutter a bit. We were in the hotel lounge and we got asked to leave because they assumed my husband was drunk when he went to order up a couple of beers. It was a complete embarassment, and totally uncalled for since he hadn't even had one drink yet. I would never recommend this hotel to anybody. Due to the reckless nature of the hotel employees...and it is completely over priced! Good Luck

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: tom_redlaw
Reviews.Content: This is a trendy, modest sized property in an upscale part of Boston near the government center. The rooms are sytlish and somewhat minimalist, the bed comfortable, the bath modern and mid-sized. The value here is reasonable for Boston and the location outstanding. The gym, though modest in size, is clean and modern also. The folks at the front desk were very helpful and engaged at both check in and when I confirmed directions to a restaurant. The sytle is not overbearing or pretentious. Did not eat at the hotel but within a five minute walk are a number of fantastic if pricey restaurants on Beacon Street. I was going to the Orpheum theatre that night and it was COLD with some icey sidewalks so this location was ideal. I would definitely go back if I was going to another show at the Orpheum in less than ideal weather, can not beat the distance or proximity of great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelfishe
Reviews.Content: We were at the Nine Zero hotel for a three night stay in Boston. The hotel is located directly on the Freedom Trail, next to a subway station and an easy walking distance to Quincy Market. The room was modern, clean, very comfortable and identical to the pictures shown on their website so no bad surprises. We enjoyed the free wine tasting held in the lobby every night. A great way to relax after a day of sightseeing. I have no negative comment about this hotel. We would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: firlefanz
Reviews.Content: i selected the NineZero for a total of seven nights during a conference in Boston on the basis of great reviews and must admit that i was truly disappointed. - check-in staff were pleasant, but no offer of help with my luggage to my room, which i had to find myself and no explanation of how the hotel's service functions - no indication from check-in staff as to what was available to use, e.g. where to find the restaurant - the room was ok, but dusty on arrival - room service was terrible, with towels not hung up properly, basin area left wet, used items not replaced (eg shower gel etc.) and bed throw left on the floor - no turn-down service at night, coming back to a dark room after long days of meetings - i would have expected the minimum of some fruit and some complimentary drinks in the room, but everything was charged for - had a hectic coffee in the restaurant on the first morning but felt that i was intruding on the staff rather than being welcomed by them. so did not go back! - only after going through the service book did i discover that i could request a coffee maker for the room, which i did - but refill of coffee bombs then erratic and machine not cleaned every day or cups replaced - no customer service feedback form or indication of check-out time the night before departure, which i really expect. indeed, no indication that i was checking out the next day at all! - kept looking for 'vibe' in the hotel, but if anything, the atmosphere was 'flat' and the lobby had neither drinks service nor did it even have any reading material on offer. - daily newspaper started arriving outside my door on most mornings, which i thought was great, only to discover in small print that this would be charged for and i had to opt out beforehand. check-in staff did not alert me to this. - big question that remains for me is how on earth am i going to choose my hotel on my next business trip to the US? if price level, reviews and stars do not reflect the hotel, what will?

Reviews.Title: “The Newtonian physics of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Ravenshaw
Reviews.Content: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction. That's one of the binding laws of Newtonian physics. That also applies to the Nine Zero hotel. It is an entity full of unrealized potential. They do something outstanding. Then they wipe the experience out with something silly. I have stayed in Kimpton hotels at least 100 times in the past 10 years. I know Kimpton for having very competent, non-robotic employees. If you stay in hotels a lot, you know what I mean. Usually, their people are so good that it is a bit shocking. You don't expect such presence or individuality in a hotel. However, here at the Nine Zero, they seem to have had a communication breakdown. The right hand did not know what the left hand was doing. In our case, they didn't know when the restaurant closed. Kimpton get big points and applause for their "green" record. They are loud and proud about it. But, then on a cold day, you wonder why the room temperature drops so rapidly. You follow the temperature gradient and it leads you to the obsolete windows. You feel the drafts around the window frame and realize where the heat is going. When you know that at least 1/3 of the energy expended to heat the room is flying out the window, it is hard to take their organo-groovy position seriously. Kimpton puts a lot of effort into design. Their rooms are interesting and functional. I cannot think of one that I was ever uncomfortable in... until this one. They put two queen sized beds in a space that just can't justify it. There was no place to open up luggage. We were tripping over each other. 1 person, 1 bag: OK. 2 people, 2 bags: NO-GO. Then there was the parking charge: $38. Cheeky. I'll take Boston over NY hands down, but they doesn't mean they get to charge ridiculous prices for things. Then there was the phone bill. $27 to call Lowell for 9 minutes. Lowell is just 30 minutes north of Boston. Add that to the $26 it cost to call New Jersey for 6 minutes and your blood begins to boil. After threatening never to stay at this hotel again, the reasonable woman in accounting agreed to reduce the charge to a reasonable $5. The restaurant KO Prime is horribly overpriced. There are better steaks for better prices elsewhere in Boston. (and you should be eating lobster anyway!) As for breakfast... their $12 French Toast is excellent, however, it is not twice as good as the $5 French Toast at Mike's City Diner. You want to hate them for their prices, but you can't because the wait staff is so nice. The same goes for the bar / lounge. The cocktails are very pricey. I would only drink there on a special occasion. Our special occasion was that we were snowed in! The price of the menu gives you gas pains, but then the talent of the bartenders somehow gives you relief. Again, action & reaction. All things considered, they barely justify their price. $239 / night (plus tax... CONSIDERABLE tax) should buy you more. At <$200, the NINE ZERO would be good deal. Don't write them off, though. Apathetic they are not. They have enough people striving to do the right thing that I expect they will make improvement. And I'll be back to see what they've achieved.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Beans1284
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked our trip through Expedia, which we encountered several problems with in the time before our visit. We ended up dealing directly with the staff at the Nine Zero, and were so happy we did! Even before our trip (which was the first time for both of us in Boston), staff members contacted us to offer ideas on things to do, sites to visit, and restaurants to try. We were in Boston to celebrate 25th birthday, and Thomas Burke (the concierge) gave me ideas for a great surprise! We also brought our dog, as the Nine Zero is a pet-friendly hotel. I have to stress the "friendly" in pet-friendly. There are chain hotels that do "allow" pets, but the staff at the Nine Zero truly cater to you and your pet! Our dog was personally greeted (as were we) by all the staff including the doorman, reception agents, and more. There was room service, which our dog loved! They brought him an amazing dinner and dessert on a platter, he could barely contain his excitement when it arrived! The Nine Zero gets it right, down to the smallest detail, and they were helpful before, during, and after our trip. If you are looking for an amazing experience from a world-class staff, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: leorakaye
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the hotel. It was a beautiful place, they were attentive to everything we needed and gave us an upgrade when I emailed to say we were looking for the evening to be a respite for some busy times for me and my husband. They were wonderful, the place was classy and we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: drboothy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nine Zero for 4 nights in the middle of November. From the moment we arrived the staff were helpful and polite. The room size was fine and the bed was amazingly comfortable (and although we didn't use it we could have selected our pillows from the "pillow menu"!). Free wireless internet which connected quickly and without any problems plus and iPod dock in the room were very useful. The nicest touch of all was the wine reception each night (5-6pm) in the foyer - perfect for the moment at the end of a long day sight seeing or shopping when all you want to do is relax! It was of course very popular but if there was nowhere to sit the staff were quick to suggest taking a glass back to the room! We had no complaints about our stay, this was a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: drlaz
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, my two-day stay started late (thanks, United Airlines), at 3:45 am. The staff were quite cheerful for such an hour. Room and bed were excellent. The bed was huge; the room was not. I found surprisingly few moderate-priced restaurants in the area, and much of the neighborhood was nearly empty after business hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel - Staff was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: stacey0303
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for one night and we were glad we did. It was my husband, myself and our 20-month old son. We had a room on the 14th floor (didn't check out the view). The room itself was large w/a king bed, flat screen tv and two lounge chairs, very modern feel. The free internet was super fast. The bathroom was also large and the shower pressure was very good. My son enjoyed opening and closing the various drawers and doors (seems to be in that stage). We ate dinner around the corner at Scolly Square and returned to the KO Prime Lounge in the hotel for some beers and martinis. The bar is very loungy and wasn't crowded so it was perfect b/c we had our son with us and he could roam around. We ate breakfast at KO Prime - we received a free continental breakfast from the hotel. The continental breakfast was plentiful and very good - hubby had the french toast which he enjoyed very much. This hotel is within walking distance to the Boston Commons, the Aquarium and Fanuiel Hall. I would highly recommend this hotel when staying in Boston. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful - one gentlemen even brought up my son's pacifier we left in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: I "zeroed" in on this hotel for a special occasion and was very satisfied with my choice. The location is ideal for walking to many of Boston's features and it's very near the Park Street T stop, which has access to red and green lines, so getting to further points is simple. Staff exuded genuine warmth and the rooms, as others have described, are comfortable, indeed. The decor is a pleasing mixture of fun/formal, modern/cushy. We were just ordinary travelers, but got the VIP treatment (not in a bowing and scraping kind of way, which I cannot stand), but with a room upgrade and a tasty fruit bowl. Great bed, elegant bathroom, super view with morning light--ahh--that and good vibrations added up to a Nine Zero close to perfection. Our only complaint? Don't laugh--clean towels---meaning in spite of the hotel having a "green initiative" that asks guests to hang up and reuse towels, ours were replaced daily. We already addressed this issue with management and were assured the practice would be better implemented. Thanks Nine Zero - we plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “9.0 for Nine Zero”
Reviews.Author: tymelyron
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Nine Zero last weekend in a "Queen Queen Premier" room; we had gotten a great promotional rate after having signed up on the Kimpton website. There are only 10 rooms on each floor and spaced well so it was very quiet and private. The room was very clean, as was the bathroom, and the decor was ultra modern. The bed had multiple pillows of differing firmness, with more varieties to be had at the desk. The bed was most comfortable with a soft pillow top. The staff was most courteous, and the location was great, within a 10 minute walking distance to the TD Banknorth Center and the North End. My only issues were no free access to a computer for email (charges apply in the business center) and no complimentary coffee available in the morning (though a coffee machine for the room can be requested.) Other than that, I would highly recommend Nine Zero.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT. Perfect all around. VERY dog friendly!”
Reviews.Author: luvmybasset
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for just the weekend. Hotel is perfectly located in the center of Boston. You can walk to the Park T stop and get to any part of the city. Just off the Commons and easy walking to Faneuil Hall, Newbury street, Beacon Hill or Charles street. We brought Dudley our basset hound since Kimpton hotels a VERY dog friendly. They had a bowl of treats and his name on a plaque. In our room was a doggie bed, food and water bowl, on a cute doggie mat and a welcome card from the hotel for Dudley! We drove and getting to the hotel was really easy. Valet parking was a little pricy at $38.00 a day. Check in was a breeze and our room was large and clean. Staff was awesome! This is an excellent hotel and we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieTBJ
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but great things to report on our recent stay in Boston. The Nine Zero hotel was a marvelous hotel in a great location! Upon arrival in Boston our luggage was taken upstairs, and we enjoyed complementary wine tasting to kick off our vacation. The concierge provided great recommendations for restaurants in the area, as well as things to do while we were in the city. We really enjoyed the hotel room. Extremely comfortable bed, and great shower with nice bath products. Staff were extremely tentative to service, and went out of their way to ensure our trip was an enjoyable one. Book your stay at the NineZero to ensure your stay in Boston is a memorable one. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: lancet72
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Expedia and since it was a special occasion - we wrote the hotel an email to let them know. After reading thegreat reviews on Tripadvisor we expected to be happy with the choice, but the hotel was far better than that.. They upgraded us to one of their best corner rooms on 17th floor with breathtaking views of Boston. Entering the room we found a bottle of Champagne on ice and strawberries... The room and the hotel itself were spotlessly clean, the reception staff extremely efficient and polite. The bed was fantastically comfortable and the bedding was top notch. And the shower pressure makes you stay there forever :-) This is definitely a number one hotel in Boston.Do yourself a favor and choose it for your next stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: rakibey
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero is a really great hotel in the center of Boston. Hotel service is very professional and nice. Hotel atmosphere is relaxed and trendy. Rooms are very spacy and nice. Fresh furniture and rooms that feels nice and clean. Free internet access is a good feature at the hotel. Only recommendations for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zero - Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: CruzanTom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Boston Hotels and recently stayed at the Nine Zero twice. Pros: Centrally located, Excellent and courteous Staff (I had good experiences with all, including front desk, valets, housekeeping and room service), good restaurant and bar in hotel, free wine hour each evening, free WiFi, comfortable beds. Cons: Rooms are a bit small and high priced (but much in mid-town Boston is, too), furniture is old, TVs are old with poor speakers and color adjustment (in both recent stays my TV speaker was cracked causing a "lisp" sound), the robes and lingerie provided in the closet seemed strange (leopard or cheetah patterned boxers and camisoles). Suggestion to Management - Upgrade the rooms. Do what it takes to keep your staff happy, they are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anita_7
Reviews.Content: I have a mixed review of this hotel. On the plus side, its a lovely, clean hotel, with a very comfy bed and powerful shower. Its also centrally located.
