However, the reason for booking was for my partner's 40th birthday (and it wasn't cheap!), when we arrived I explained the reason for booking and asked if something could be done to help celebrate, i.e. have a room with a good view of the city, the girl on the front desk said we were in a nice room anyway at the front of the hotel, but our room was only on the 4th floor so we didnt get a good view. Also, they made a mistake with our booking as we had paid for 4 nights but they only had us booked in for 2 nights. Again we explained we had already paid for 4 nights and showed them confirmation of this, but when we got our bill they still added 2 more nights, so we had to sort this out too. I would however say the concierges were excellent, and very friendly and will help you in any way they can. Boston itself is a great city, with lots to see and do - I would definitely recommend the whale watching trip, this was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “THANKS SO MUCH !!!”
Reviews.Author: Lion_in_Exile
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the NINE ZERO a number of times during recent business trips to Boston. This weekend though, my wife and children were with me. It was my sons 3rd birthday and when we checked in, there was a birthday card for him, along with milk and cookies... A truly welcoming touch.. Thoroughly recommend the NINE ZERO, staff are great, location is great and the overall experience on all occassions has been top rate...

Reviews.Title: “Cheetah bathrobe!! That looks 10 years old!”
Reviews.Author: jeonyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nine Zero after looking through Boston's many hotels. I have been to several Kimpton's throughout the country for business. I was expecting to find a newer hotel.The lobby looked fantastic however for 336.00 a night I found the room to be old and weathered. The best part of the stay was the tattered Cheetah bathrobe in the closet- and to boot was a matching cheetah night outfit. The carpet was stained and walls seemed like they needed a refreshing. I believe I stayed on the sixth floor- which is very dark and gloomy and presents no views-except a dark alley way! My suggestion-rethink staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: skigator93
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 glorious nights at the Nine Zero for our 10th Anniversary. The desk staff and concierge are all warm and friendly and the complimentary nightly wine tasting is a nice touch. The housekeeping staff was superb, both in cleaning the room in the morning and providing nightly turn-down service. The rooms are nice sized for Boston and the hotel has paid a lot of attention to detail. The king bed was very comfortable and covered with gazillion thread count sheets. The pillows started out fluffy, but then flatten out when you lay your head on them - no big deal though. The bathroom was roomy and water pressure was excellent. The toiletries were smelled great and were in adequate supply. The mini bar was well-stocked with more choices than the average hotel, including a martini bar with shaker, rimmers and several flavorings. The location is outstanding - virtually right across the street from Granary Burial Ground and Boston Commons, and a short walk (less than 10 minutes) to Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, North End, etc. The Bean Town Pub next door was a very cozy pub and perfect for a bowl of chowder and a pint. The only negatives? Room service is a little slow - we requested a couple forks to eat our take out pastries from the North End. After about 15 minutes, we gave up and cancelled the request. Also, the hotel is a little too focused on selling you items from the room. Most hotels offer the robes for sale - but this one had pajamas hanging in the closet for sale, full-sized bottles of the toiletries, CDs, etc. etc. It was a little annoying, but really, who cares if that is the only negative thing to say about a hotel?!? I would highly recommend the Nine Zero for your next stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: duncanA
Reviews.Content: The Nine -Zero Hotel is in a great location, has nice rooms but most importantly has a great front of house team. Expert advice on where to eat in Boston which was spot on in terms of our requests and were happy to make bookings for us and get us into busy places during Boston's restaurant week. Excellent hotel in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: francy76Milano
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my husband the Nine Zero from the 14th till the 17th of August, the location is just perfect, easy walking distance to almost everywere. The room was nicely decorated, the bed very very confortable. The negatives: the room was small and the air conditioning was too cold, almost freezing, and it is too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “High standards throughout”
Reviews.Author: Xtaltips
Reviews.Content: Had a very enjoyable 3 night stay at the nine zero. The hotel is fitted out to a very high standard and the staff provided excellent service throughout our stay. I feel that the very few negative comments posted are of a very minor nature and not entirely accurate - some travellers seem to lack common sense - so I would encourage anyone to give this hotel serious consideration. BTW - wireless internet is free.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan_01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nine Zero for 3 nights, as an early 30th birthday present for my husband. It was on a whim that I thought of Boston so I rang up my travel agent to see if she had any weekend deals. I hadn't had time to do my research as I always usually do before I book a hotel but she knew the kind of hotels that we liked. She found a great deal for Nine Zero and told us that we would love it, so I trusted her judgement and went for it. We couldn't be more delighted that we did. When we arrived at Nine Zero, it was pretty late (about 10pm) because we had a nightmare with our flights and had been delayed in Philadelphia for a number of hours. So we were looking rather exhausted and bedraggled when we entered the beautiful lobby to say the least! So it was really nice to be greeted with a warm smile at the front desk when we checked in and we were immediately much more relaxed and at ease. We were given the keys to our room and we made our way up there through the gorgeously decorated public areas. It all felt so warm and welcoming and I'm sure that they have some kind of scent pumping through the heating or air con vents because the hotel even smelt beautiful! When we got to our room, we were absolutely delighted with it. It was spacious, clean and was decorated beautifully. The bathroom was lovely and the shower was great with really good pressure. The tolietries were gorgeous too. We found the bed really comfortable and everything that we could have wanted was in the room. We felt completely at home. The view out of the window was really pretty too. Because we had arrived at the hotel so late, we didn't really want to venture out to look for somewhere to eat so we decided to order room service on our first night. I rang up and ordered our meals and was told that it would be about 15 minutes. Over half an hour later, it still hadn't arrived so I rang up to check where it was. I wouldn't normally do that but we were so tired, having been on the go for almost 24 hours with no sleep and no opportunity to eat since the flight to Philadelphia. All we really wanted to do have dinner quickly and go straight to sleep. We were told that there had been a rush on in the restuarant but that it would arrive at any minute, and I almost felt a bit guilty for ringing up! Sure enough, it arrived soon afterwards and the lady who brought the food couldn't apologise enough. She even asked if there was anything we'd like to make up for the inconvenience which was very kind, although we didn't take her up on the offer. We just ordered cheeseburgers and fries and I have to say, that it really was tasty. It was fresh and hot, although the portion size was too much for us! My husband and I never happened to be in the hotel during the wine hour but it is a lovely little extra and a nice way for guests to socialise. The location of the hotel was absolutely superb. It was about a 10 minute walk to Quincy Market, 5 minutes to Downtown Crossing and probably less than 5 minutes to Boston Common. There were plenty of shops, restaurants and a cinema around the immediate area as well the more historical sights and walks of Boston just steps away. The general ambience of the hotel was just lovely. It was such a welcoming place to come back to after a day's sightseeing and I can't really can't fault the place. If we ever return to Boston in the future, we won't even think of looking at any other hotel but Nine Zero.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: cf18
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero was a great hotel. Stayed on 08/23/08 wish we could have stayed longer. Spent one night in Boston for Anniversary without the kids. The hotel was excellent from check in with complementary wine hour for guest in the lobby from 5Pm-6Pm. The room was a King Premier corner could not have asked for a better room for our anniversary. The room over looked the city. The rooms are modern and clean with walk in showers and marble. The hotel is right in the middle of everything and close to the subway. This hotel went above and beyond especially Rob the Concierge who sent a special gift to the room as a welcome and Anniversary present. It was unexpected and not necessary but greatly appreciated. We would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Boston and looking for a little more then your average chain hotel has to offer. Can not wait to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammybaka
Reviews.Content: Ninezero is one of the best hotel experiences I've had in recent memory. It's got a fantastic location near Boston Common and Downtown Crossing, with easy access to both the green line (e.g: back bay) and blue line (e.g: airport). The hotel is tastefully decorated, and everywhere from the lobby, elevator, room and bathroom were well lit and arranged. It even smelled nice and fresh. The staff was excellent and friendly, eager to help and provided very useful information. They all seemed to carry a genuine smile and happy to do their job. For example, I asked where to find the boston Duck Tour (highly recommended btw), and I was immediately informed of the two closest locations around the hotel, but she referred me to the concierge desk to book the tour in advance just in case. The gentleman at the concierge was equally friendly, and offered concise directions on where to locate the duck tour at the Prudential center. Furthermore, we were fortunate to find out in advance that the Saturday tour was already fully booked, and we quickly snatched a preferred time on the next day. All of this was done by the Hotel concierge desk without extra charge. In addition, he recommended that at the end of the Freedom Trail we could ride a ferry from Charlestown back to Long Wharf. That's valuable information I didn't have, and was glad to save a bunch of walking time. I just have two minor criticisms: (1) could use a little more towel hanging space in the bathroom, and (2) the air conditioner was very cold, and the room remained pretty cold even after I turned it off, but it's manageable. I will definitely return to this hotel in the future. Great location, great room and great service all at a good price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Nine Zero”
Reviews.Author: armedpolice020
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel. the best location. only problem was no plasma screens in the room thanks was in the king premier room thanks for everything

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarniamish
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at a Kimpton Hotel so our expectations were high since we had previously stayed at Hotel Monaco in DC. Nine Zero is outstanding. The hotel itself is stunningly beautiful. It is the ultimate in luxury. When we checked in we told the gentlemen checking us in that we were celebrating both our anniversary as well as my husband's birthday. Although we later found out he was the manager our room was upgraded and upon returning back to our room the first night we were greeted with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries..wowwww....Big Kudos to Mr. Shaun Flannagan...the manager..he runs a spectacular hotel but besides that has an unbelievable way of making you feel like you are special. It is because of Mr. Flanagan that not only will we recommend the NIne Zero but when we return to Boston it will be the only place we consider. Dr Michelle and Mr. Frank Krause

Reviews.Title: “Nice room/good location”
Reviews.Author: Papaleadfoot
Reviews.Content: Super efficient staff starting w/valet-luggage; reception and an exceptionally efficient/knowledgeable concierge (3 of them alternate shifts!). Rooms clean & nice size. Location convenient. Hotel restaurant excellent w/noted chef. Bay Trans (617 872 0496) dependable (posh vans) & reasonable if you need shuttle service to/from airport or cruise terminal

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: smittydmd
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for its central location and was not dissapointed. The service is great, Thomas, the concierge was able to get me two Red Sox tickets for a cheaper price than on any website I had checked for weeks. He also recommended and reserved a great restaurant in the North End for me and my wife. Everyone was great from the bellman to the valet. I'll be sure to book here the next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: S_G.UK
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. Hotels in Boston are pricey so I thought that this place was good value - expensive but good standard, really nice contemporary decor. Stayed here with my mother for a long weekend in March and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. It's excellently placed for sight seeing in Boston, which is frankly a small and accessible/easily navigable city. We never ate in the restaurant but it seemed very much 'the' place for out of towners 'in the know' and locals alike. We chilled in the bar, where the bar staff were cool and reserved, but polite and quite sweet - letting my mum and I taste the cockails before we decided what to have next! This hotel has two main drawbacks; firstly, the heinously expensive mini bar - easily addressed by staying out or frequenting the 7 Eleven down the street! the second issue is slightly harder to resolve - our room looked out over a side street which obviously housed the bottle banks and trash bins for nearby bars, or perhaps the hotel's own. Whatever - the noise of rubbish and glass being thrown into the bins, and then the early morning street cleaners was pretty disturbing. The hotel should invest in some better soundproofing for these rooms - this is not a bargain basement hostel - at these prices and with the level of comfort and style offered in the rooms, this really tainted the otherwise great experience. Oh, and the concierge could have been more helpful. We were trying to find and book some restaurants recommended by a friend and he made no offer to call and book on our behalf, etc. Would have been a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: okapigirl
Reviews.Content: Received Travelzoo alert on this hotel in May. Family of 4 on first trip to Boston. Two days before the trip I realized I did not book the right length of stay and the reservation was revised with no hesitation! During our stay the staff and concierge were very helpful with trolley tickets, limo service and restaurant recommendations to suit our needs (kids) and remembered our names. The location is superb. We walked just about everywhere and metro station is 1/2 block away. Book the highest floors for a stunning view of Boston Common. On the 4th the parade stopped for almost an hour right in front of the hotel. Later we avoided the fireworks crowds, and cranked up the JVC stereo provided and listened to the POPS simulcast while enjoying the show from the room. Very comfortable beds. Bathroom had a little mildew. A few modifications and flat screen tv could add a few more sq ft to the nice size. See pics!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: celebrationkim
Reviews.Content: We are huge Kimpton fans and the Nine Zero did not disappoint. It was perfectly located on the Freedom Trail (which was the purpose of our trip) and we never needed to get our car from valet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location -- Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cubalibre3
Reviews.Content: This was great hotel, centrally located. My husband and I stayed for a weekend. We booked our hotel through AMEX using our points, so it was a steal. After reading the reviews I was a bit nervous, but compared to the other boutiques, 9-0 had the least amount of bad reviews. We arrived late on Friday and the staff were very nice and welcoming, especially Brian from the valet service. I had called ahead and asked for a room on the highest floor and they said they put a note on my file. When we arrived to our room, which we paid extra for a view, I was disappointed that our "view" was of a building across the way. We were then moved to a room on their top floor and the view was better, but honestly, I would not pay the additional money for the "view", unless you want to look at the top of buildings. The beds were comfy, the shower was good and I liked knowing I was staying at an eco-friendly hotel. We didn't have any noise complaints, except that the suite next door let their alam clock ring for an hour, but when we called guest services they sent someone up to take care of it immediately. Overall it was a great stay -- if you like the swank, boutique hotels. I found the people of Boston to be a little less than "warm and fuzzy," but the staff including Scotty, the concierge were more than happy to accommodate! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aggiebeth01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The staff were very friendly from the start. The room was very nice and clean. The beds, including the roll-away bed, were extremely comfortable. The door to the bathroom locked when closed. A staff member was there quickly to get the problem resolved. The hotel is right on the Freedom Trail and is a great location for walking to most of the sites. I would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great!”
Reviews.Author: Greg187
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Nine-Zero and am happy to report that it is still a great destination when visiting Boston. I haven't been there since the first year they opened and was delighted to see that most things are still up to par. The most alluring feature of this hotel is the location - I can't imagine a more convenient hotel in all of Boston. It's sleek/hip design is also very cool. But, like all trendy hotels, it seems to tire from hipness. While still sharp, nothing really has changed since I've been there 4 or so years ago. The room is very comfortable and stylish but was showing slight signs of wear (minor wall scuffs, slightly aging furniture). Also, on my first visit the robes and towels were Frette and that was no longer the case. The Mario Russo products were great but seemed to be smaller in size. And the cheap plastic made it difficult to actually get the shampoo or conditioner out. And, as mentioned in another review...it is a little tacky that there are so many things for sale in the room. The bed was super comfortable and very roomy. A luggage rack would have been nice. One great addition from my last stay was the evening cocktail hour. Nice wines were served in the lobby from 5-6. A nice touch. Staff was friendly and helpful. Needed some extra soap and it was sent up promptly. As instructed, when I needed my car I called about a half hour before hand. I came downstairs and it was ready and waiting. Although the $38 fee is quite steep! The Nine-Zero is no bargain but look around the web. I got a great rate through one of their promotions and it was actually a little cheaper than comparable hotels such as the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Nine Zero Boston”
Reviews.Author: sunnyday12
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I booked our stay at the Nine Zero Boston through a Travelzoo promotion. We were staying in the city for a Red Sox game and thought it would be fun to try a different hotel. We booked a "King Premier" room which was nicely appointed. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the design was funky and fun to be around, but the size of the room and the bathroom shower were disappointing. Everyone on tripadvisor had talked about the beautiful, large shower. Unfortunately, we only had a standard bathtub which we definately expected more from the hotel. The shower still functioned properly, we just expected more than an average tub/shower from such a nice hotel. The evening wine reception was a really nice touch. Room service was delivered promptly, but I feel strongly that the prices did not live up to the quality delivered. The Staff is very nice and outgoing and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: ad521
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for a conference and our first hotel had no rooms for Saturday night so we booked elsewhere only to find the other hotel had overbooked. We called my credit card travel agency and they found us the room at Nine Zero. The city was packed, so we were happy to get a room, but were not impressed at all. The staff was very young and peppy but most were not very helpful. I don't think it was an attitude issue but rather a lack of experience. However, the Concierge was very knowledgeable and helped us pick an excellent Italian restaurant in the North End for dinner. She went out of her way to map out the walking route and to call and confirm that reservations were still available. She also followed up with us when we returned. Other staff members did not seem to know their way around the hotel itself and were not versed in helping out-of-towners. The room was clean with newer furnishings. It was mod and chic but with a corporate office feel. The most annoying, yet funny, detail was the price tags. It seemed like everything in the room was for sale! Like this robe? It can be yours! Enjoyed the bath products? Here is a package of regular sized products that you can buy? Need aspirin? You can buy it here! While some might find it cool or convenient to buy up the hotel room for the same feel at home, we found it annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JKell83
Reviews.Content: A little pricey, but very trendy, modern and nice. SO CLEAN! Also, they listened to my higher floor request... always appreciated. Internet was super fast, which was imperative as I was there for business. Nightly wine hour is a nice treat. Amazing location, can walk to all of Boston. Although a little far to Fenway. Nice staff, always friendly. Especially the doorman.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel through travelzoo, $189 a night. It was perfect for our family with teen daughters. The location was fantastic, right in the heart of all of the action in Boston, and what a wonderful view from our room! Definitely request a higher floor! The staff was friendly and helpful, we would stay here again in a heartbeat! The rooms while not huge were comfortable and a larger bathroom is so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Boston”
Reviews.Author: MartinPh
Reviews.Content: Never been to Boston before, and chose the Nine Zero because of its location and very happy experiences at other Kimpton hotels in San Francisco & Washington DC. It did not disappoint and I will stay there again if/when we return to Boston. The staff were friendly & welcoming & the evening drinks reception is a nice touch. Room well appointed (go for a floor at/near the top with a view of the state building if you can), although for a design hotel, I would have expected a modern flatscreen TV (the one in the room was an old CRT model with a relatively poor picture quality) and an iPod dock would have been nice. Having said this, the hotel still merits a 5* review.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: WMadge
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is great, a perfect location centrally located for all areas and attractions. I can see why the other reviews were so complementary, this is the 4th Kimpton Hotel we have stayed in and it was just as good as the others have been. The Hotel is well managed and the staff represent this well. I asked to see the top floor room Cloud 9 which they were happy to do. The staff member who took me up there was extremely helpful and informative and very keen to tell me what a great Hotel this was to work for. This atmosphere comes across. We asked for a high room and were pleased to be on the 17th floor with a great view State House, it was a very quiet room. We had breakfast once, I can highly recommend the pancakes we ate out other times. We tried The Paramount in Charles street, Down the hill (Beacon Street) and on the right. get there early and enjoy the atmosphere, it is not a place for lingering but worth going to. Charles Street has some wonderful older shops to browse in once you have had breakfast. There are a lot of coffee shops around the Hotel but not so many breakfast places, if you want more than bagels and muffins. Not many diners, there is one down the hill at South Street though. Restaurants we enjoyed and were recommended to us by a Bostonian friend were Mooo just around the corner in beacon Street from the Hotel, not cheap but good quality and atmosphere. The hotel bar on the 2nd floor was great, plus the bar food. The Beantown Pub next door is a great place to watch sport and have a beer and bar food and a game of pool. Plus not far to get back to the Hotel! The Daily Catch is a small restaurant that you would pass by without a thought in Hanover Street North End. I was told to go there and did so for a late lunch...wonderful. A handed down family run restaurant with seafood that melts in your mouth. In the evening people queue aroudn the block so my recommendation would be a late lunch after whale watching if you take the 10.30 boat. You have to pay in cash though so beware! Whale watching was fantastic if you want to get out of the City for a few hours. The Boston Harbour Cruise catamaran was fast, clean and has marine biologists on board giving great information and collecting data.. Well worth the trip as was a day trip to Salem if you have time... A CIty trolly tour is a must when you first arrive to get an idea of what is where and some history. I would recomment the Red Sox one as it covers a larger area, it depends how much time you have. You can get on and off the trolly all day, you do not have to stay on for a whole tour. We will definitely stay there again when we are next in Boston

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT !!!”
Reviews.Author: bmarr
Reviews.Content: Friendly, warm and very helpful staff. Comfortable beds and spacious clean room. Terrific location to walk the city. Wine served daily from 5 to 6 - a very special touch to end the tour day and before relaxing to go out for dinner. I would look for another Kimpton hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick62London
Reviews.Content: I'm still here! A perfect location, excellent staff and clean modern rooms. I like the Kimpton group of hotels and would mark this one as the best in the chain. Even the Monaco in Chicago can't quite match it! I will be staying here every time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zero is great!”
Reviews.Author: lvlover8
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. The location was great, close to the "T" and walking distance to Quincy Market. The staff was really great and even left a little gift bag for my dog in the room even though we did not bring him. Definitely will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ouststanding hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: rqh
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend at Nine Zero in Boston. This is an outstanding hotel, the staff was very friendly and helpful and we loved the location. Next time to Boston we'll pick Nine Zero and we will recommend it to all of our friends. A great place to stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel smack in the city”
Reviews.Author: glasbcy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nine Zero for two nights for business, but I would recommend for vacation as well. It is a modern style hotel, but not cold or uncomfortable. Very nice staff who went out of their way to help me with maps, directions and restaurant recommendations. My room was super clean and was much bigger than the tiny New York rooms I am used to. Great water pressure! I asked for a room away from the elevator and not facing the major street before I arrived and that made a big difference because it was very quiet at night. They have a nice (and free) happy hour in the lobby every night and the location was optimal for shopping (and my meetings).

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: emma580
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for our stay. - Booked through theis own website, got a good deal for $215, there is last minute upgrades available for very small amounts. They email these to you so you can book them on line. - Great pub / bar right next door if you arrive late at night as we did, it does American bar food which tastes fantastic and it's 2 steps from the door. They still do food at 11pm. - Perfect location to stay in Boston. You're basically in the middle of town close to everything and you can walk everywhere. - Rooms are fab. Bed was very very comfy with a massive walk in shower. - Careful if you arrive late at night, the valet parking is extra and they didn't tell us. It's only an extra $10 but it was a little annoying. Also it takes 20 minutes for them to actually go and get the car as the parking is not on site. Just leave enough time to get it. Airport is exceptionally close, about a 10-12 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Good and satisfying stay”
Reviews.Author: cattails121
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nine Zero Hotel to attend a commencement ceremony in Boston. The hotel is a few steps away from the subway (Park St station, Red and Green line), and close to Boston Commons. Area is also safe (we came back late at around 10-11pm every night). About the hotel : we reserved our room through the hotel website, which gave a much cheaper rate than if you called the hotel directly. On the website, it asked whether you want 'higher floor, or lower', and whether you want 'feather pillows or foam'. We asked for a room on the higher floor, and feather pillows, and both requests were accommodated when we arrived. We were given a room on the 18th floor, with a beautiful view of the State House. Pillows and bed are very comfortable. Sheets are very clean. Hotel has a chic feel, smells nice as soon as you walk in. The interior decor of the room and the hotel can be interpreted as either stylish or tacky, but these are not major issues for me as I much prefer hotel to be clean, which the Nine Zero is. We also used the hotel gym, and although it is rather on the small side, it is functional, clean, doesn't smell, and it has good equipment. One thing we really liked was the in-room safe which is designed to accommodate laptop computers. We put our two laptop computers in it everytime we went out. Some issues : 1) housekeeping didn't replenish the body soap when they cleaned our room. We wondered whether they forgot about it. No big deal. When we came back from walking around Boston that night, we just stopped at the front desk to ask for soap, and they readily accommodated us, and even asked whether they should call housekeeping to replenish us with more. Very professional and accommodating. 2) Second issue : On the brochure in the room itself, it stated that there's 'complimentary coffee' somewhere in the hotel (I forgot where, lobby perhaps), but when I called front desk to inquire about it, they said they don't have complimentary coffee, but coffee could be bought at the hotel restaurant. Hmmm. If you don't have it, then don't say it on the brochure ! Probably they changed the policy, which is fine, but the info given to customers in the brochures should be updated as well. Oh, by the way, room doesn't come with coffee maker or coffee, but they do have margarita mix ! All in all, it was a very good and very satisfying stay. Staff is professional and friendly. Nine Zero tends to be on the expensive side (we paid around $375 per night for our room), but the hotel is nice, clean, with comfortable bed and pillows, clean towels, crisp sheets, very close to subway. There's Dunkin Donuts and Finagle Bagel a block away for your morning coffee and breakfast. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ltittle jewel box”
Reviews.Author: ajdemcoe
Reviews.Content: This little jewel box was perfectly situated for our needs. Check in was quick and staff were all smiles. Thank you Thomas and Scott for your advice and help on local information. Room decor was comfortable. Located on the 15th floor we were above most street noise we have come to expect from close city areas, a hazzard of staying in town. The location cannot be beat for foot travel and the T stop is close by for subway and train access. We would stay again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: thetripchick
Reviews.Content: We love our Kimpton hotels! Nine Zero actually began as a happy fluke when we arranged for a Boston hotel through Priceline. Imagine how ecstatic we were when we got the Nine Zero! Check-in was quick and painless, and the room was absolutely gorgeous. Typical Kimpton style, modern and clean with a large room and bathroom...wonderful!!! The bed was absolutely one of the best we've slept in, and the entire staff was beyond helpful, cordial and pleasant. Even better, the location is central to most historical things in Boston...steps from Boston Common. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Nine Zero!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_Jones
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very impressed with the hotel. Maybe we had a different experience, but we had none of the problems mentioned by the previous reviewer. We found the lobby perfectly spacious. We had no problems with the valet parking or getting a lift which always came within seconds. We also didn't experience any problems with noise in the room - we were on the 10th floor. The location of the hotel is brilliant - just off the Common so you are in the heart of everything. The rooms were a good size - they were funky and just the kind of styling we like. We had a corner room with an amazing view of the burial ground and the treetops of the Common. The bathroom was spacious and the beds were comfortable, everything was spotless. The staff were friendly and really helpful- they could not do enough for us. If we ever asked for anything they didn't immediately have they would always look it up. We had breakfast every day in the hotel and it was always excellent. They also agreed a late check out for us which was really helpful. I thought the hotel was really good value for money especially given the very central location. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2 Thumbs Down for 9-Zero”
Reviews.Author: kellybr3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel on 5/3/08, based on reading great reviews, and was extremely disappointed with the accommodations & amenities. There is virtually no lobby / reception areaâ€¦the parking valet is difficult to access, and there are only 2 elevators that service the entire hotel. As for the room, I was very surprised that they would let someone occupy it due to the noise level. We stayed on the seventh floor, yet it sounded as if there was a garbage truck in the room with us from the hours of 1:30am to 7am. Upon mentioning this to the staff at check out, they simply said sorry, and we will have someone look into it. This was obviously a canned response to a frequently complained about issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: darlinbeck
Reviews.Content: Our overnight stay at the Nine Zero ( 90 for regular folks ) worked perfectly because of its proximity to central Boston. One block from the Boston Common and an easy walk to Quincy Market and the red-line walking tour to Paul Revere's House and the Old North Church. Even better was the walking distance to Boston's Little Italy and great restaurants. The staff was friendly and check-in was a breeze. Directions and maps were provided promptly upon request. Our room was ample with a very nice bathroom. My only complaint was the low lighting throughout the hotel and rooms. Other than that, our stay was great and I would recommend the Nine Zero. The staff was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reiskash
Reviews.Content: From what I remember, this was a really nice hotel. The beers in Boston flow rather smoothly, so I do not remember much about that night, but checkin was great, room was nice when we got there, and service was good. I book through some sight called skoosh.com or something(was leary at first) at a rate of $210/night, so that worked out well. Nothing bad to say here, you will enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: abcabcabc11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our time at the Nine Zero in early April. Got a good online deal, which cost us just over Â£100 per night - so it's worth shopping around for deals on this hotel. We had an excellent, comfortable room - bed was very, very comfortable, excellent bathroom, nice shower, etc. From the hotel website images we were worried the decor might have been a bit too much - but actually the room felt very comfortable. The rather patchy wireless coverage (which came and went) was the only significant problem. Staff were excellent. No snobbery, but still very helpful when needed. Our 7th floor room was a little noisy from the street - ideally would have been better to be higher up, but this wasn't a real problem. Well-stocked minibar. Really great central location - just off Boston Common, and right next to both Government Central and Park St metro stations (and H&M, Borders and Macys just a block away!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but watch out for street noise”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Smallhill
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. No snobbery. Also, for a boutique hotel, interior decoration is rather understated rather than artsy-fartsy, which creates a pleasant low-key atmosphere. Rooms are very functional, and include extremely comfortable bedding and good quality amenities. However, when you book, if you are sensitive to noise book on an upper floor. Street noise on lower floors is a real problem because the rooms are not sound proofed and there are noisy garbage trucks operating around 3-4 AM some nights. ( Also, neighboring TV can be heard sometimes.) The upper floors also have nice views whereas the lower floors have no view at all. They book you in a lower floor room unless you make this request. Location is excellent for a walking tour. Paul Revere's grave along with other early patriots is right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: spyglassweb
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Nine Zero is the service. From the bell service to room service to the front desk, every experience was excellent. Also the location is great for a business trip. The rooms are very clean and stocked with Mario Badescu beauty products (shampoo, etc). Also the robe is a nice touch. The only thing I didn't care for was the decor. To me, it looked like a tacky, garish modern interpretation of the Art Deco style. The bed cover was black and tan wide stripes...ugh. The chair in the room looked like it belonged in a clowns room, with its ridiculously high back. Way too much laminated black furniture! Also, in the areas outside the elevators there is tacky shimmery bronze lamae curtains covering the walls. This is just not my preference, as I prefer a more understated atmosphere. Others I was traveling with, loved the decor. The bathroom was nice, in all white tile and marble, very different in style from the rest of the room. I enjoyed the service, but since ambiance is important to me, I will look for a different hotel next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with Nine Zero”
Reviews.Author: bbsleek
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in Boston but the first time styaying in the city. Nine Zero is located near everyting. If you are going to stay here make sure you have a street map because everything is so close and usually only a walk away. Nine Zero made my stay in Boston one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place to stay in Boston....”
Reviews.Author: sben123
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Nine Zero during a business trip and was very pleased. Prior to check in, I requested a higher floor room of which I was upgraded to upon check in. The hotel has a free cocktail reception in the lobby from 5-6pm and is worth checking out. They also have free coffee in the morning in a to go cup in the restaurant hotel on the 2nd floor. The room is of average size and modern (a little larger than another Kimpton I stayed in). The shower and bed are amazing. Nine Zero really puts care into every detail (in room chocolates upon arrival, use of robes, fully stocked mini bar with martini bar (fee) and a complimentary CD to listen in the room). I ordered room service for dinner and had the Nine Zero Burger and lobster bisque (both delicious, but a bit expensive). The hotel staff was very friendly and patient. They helped me print several copies that I needed for a meeting and didn't charge me for it. The hotel staff including Thomas Burke was extremely kind and helpful about advice on places to eat and things to do in my short stay. Overall, a wonderful stay and I would highly recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Nine Zero”
Reviews.Author: cpepperpot
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Nine Zero. Great location, beautiful room, very good service. The free wine reception from 5 - 6 each evening was a nice way to wind down and meet some of the other guests. Would recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: edinweegie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights en route to New England for a skiing holiday, and overall, it was okay. I'm probably a little disappointed in it and maybe had higher expectations based on the reviews here. The hotel is modern, but the room we had was a little small, a little scuffed round the edges, had a lot of traffic noise, had a Queen bed rather than a King and did not have a bath tub, only a shower. The lack of bath probably wouldn't bother some people, but as we were doing a lot of walking/sightseeing and fancied a soak to rejuvenate the feet and legs, we asked for a room with a tub after the first night. The staff were very good and immediately changed us to a slightly higher floor room, with a tub, and strangely about twice the space although the room types were supposedly the same. This room actually proved to be much better and was quiet as it was at the back of the hotel. Unfortunately as someone else pointed out, as it was low down it was actually dark the whole day, even on the glorious sunny days that we had. The safe in this room was locked when we got in, so we asked for it to be opened for us and the staff said it would be done right away. It wasn't. We asked again the next day and were told again it would be done. After coming back to the room late that night, we found it still hadn't been done. No big deal, but as we were checking out the next day, it wasn't worth asking again. On the plus side, the staff are genuinely pleasant, the location is really good, the wine reception is a nice touch and the hotel offers free wi-fi. There was nothing that bad about the hotel and nothing that great either. It is a little too focused on style, and while the staff are pleasant, the service is a little hit or miss. Based on this visit, I wouldn't stay at Nine Zero again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: David-H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from what should have been a week in Boston, but some bad weather in Europe delayed our arrival by a day. Our stay at The Nine Zero was very good. Our room on the 16th floor was very nice. The bed was very comfortable and shower was excellent. Can't speak highly enough of the staff who were all fantastic. Scott & Thomas on the concierge desk were very knowledgeable. The wine hour was a nice touch allowing us to unwind after a hard day shopping. Didn't eat dinner at the KO restaurant but did go for breakfast one morning which was pretty good. We'd certainly stay at the Nine Zero again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: M partner and I took a quick weekend trip to Boston for Valentines Day. We have stayed at a few Kimpton Properties in the past and decided to check out Nine Zero. It was a good hotel but I didn't necessarily feel as if it was as nice as some of their other properties. Our room was a nice size for a hotel downtown as was the bathroom. Not too small...not overly spacious. The mini bar was very nice and gave us the opportunity to mix martinis. Prior to arriving at the hotel I received an email asking if there was anything I would need prior to my arrival. I am part of the Kimpton Loyalty program. I replied back that it would be great to receive some restaurant suggestions. I never heard back from anyone. If you don't plan on responding to requests genereated by YOU.....then I suggest you not send out emails. Overall our stay was good. But I am not certain if I would stay there again if I visited Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EvaC
Reviews.Content: Date Feb. 22 -24 I booked this hotel through Expedia. I had asked for a king sized bed. But when we checked in I was informed that there were none available, so they had given me a Queen instead.When I told the girl that I was there for my 30th anniversary and she said that she would see what she could do for me. I still couldn't get a king but she upgraded our room to the 18th floor with a great view. The room was small but very nice. Comfy room and great shower. It's in walking distance to Fanueil Hall. We did not try the KO restaurant, it is a little pricey. Plus we love to eat in the North End.

Reviews.Title: “Such great service in a great environment!”
Reviews.Author: ebrphoto
Reviews.Content: This was exactly what we were hoping for when my best friend and I booked a "girl's getaway"! -The Nine Zero is a stylish and clean hotel with large comfortable rooms and amenities. Best part? THE SERVICE! From the bell hop to the concierge to the front desk clerks, bartender and wait-staff everyone was happy and did all they could to please! The price was right because it included parking and breakfast. Really one of the nicest bartenders I've ever experienced at KO Prime on Saturday night! Only reason it doesn't get a 5 is because the breakfast was only OK. They were out of lox at 9am on a Sunday in an empty dining room. That actually might have been a good thing because we also found out the bagels were from New Hampshire!?!? On checkout, we noticed that the breakfast had been added to our bill when it was supposed to be included. Easily and readily fixed, but you will want to double check your bill if you book a package. We would definitely go back for a well-located and relaxing weekend in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: CLB27
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for a night, but it was a really nice hotel. I would definitely recommend it to others. The location is great - right around the corner from Downtown Crossing, close the theater district, close to china town, close to beacon hill and Boston common and within a mile to Fanueil Hall and the TD Banknorth Garden. Lots of great things within walking distance. The hotel itself has funky modern decor, which was fun. The rooms were a decent size with extremely comfy beds and were nice and clean. The bathroom was decent too, all marble and looked very clean. There was a decent sized closet, which contained a bathrobe, slipper socks (to purchase) an umbrella, etc. The minibar was tempting but ridiculously expensive (no shock there). The restaurant was far too pricey for my liking, but there was a decent pub next door with good nachos, drinks and good music. One complaint: I called for directions on the way into Boston, which were fine, except the receptionist told me that the valet parking enterance was on Broomfield St, which was a one way street, we were unable to turn onto. So we spent a half hour trying to maneuver the busy one was streets, only to find out it was the wrong street altogether! The valet enterance was actually on Bosworth St. Talk about a bit of frustration, though we eventually figured it out. Regardless, given the opportunity, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: trble666
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nine Zero this past Friday night and had an amazing stay! My boyfriend and I were looking for a short getaway from the mountains of NH and came across the Nine Zero hotel on the internet. We browsed their website and were quite impressed with what we saw. We were even more impressed with the price for such a unique spot. We stayed in one of the King rooms and it was just enough space for the two of us and the bed was to die for! We actually spent an extra half hour in bed trying to convince each other that we should get up. Neither of us wanted to leave the bed it was so comfortable. The rooms are alittle small but still plenty of room for a couple such as our selves. We spent more time wandering the city and shopping than we did in the actual room anyways. The overall decor and comfort level of the room was great and just what we were looking for. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the moment we checked in. The wine reception in the livingroom was a nice touch and a great way to unwind after a long day of driving and shopping. We also had a chance to dine in the KO Prime restaurant and it was amazing! By far one of the best meals either of us have ever had. Everything was fantastic. From the service, the rooms, the food, to the location (only a couple of blocks from Fanueil hall market place). A perfect setting for a perfect getaway. We'll be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zero a hip mid-Boston refuge”
Reviews.Author: Morgey24
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 very pleasant days in a 16th floor (upgraded view) Queen room. Design & decor touches are evident everywhere in the hotel. The staff was lovely; the concierge called around to help me locate a needed souvenir item -- while they were only a pair of Boston Red Sox SOCKS, he made it as important to him as if I was requesting a certain diamond ring. Amenities are lovely -- the room mini-bar has a martini bar and lotsof (overpriced) goodies. Restaurant dining (Room Service) was not recommended. $25 for a tiny piece of salmon served on a couple of teaspoons of edamame, no sides, no veggies, etc. Add some tax, service charge, etc and you can't justify it. Other than the food situation (but there are zillions of options within walking distance) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience At Nine Zero”
Reviews.Author: Rina4720
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. We drove through a blinding snowstorm New Years Day for 4 and 1/2 hours and arrived as you can imagine pretty worn out. From the first moment until our check out the hotel staff did everything to make our stay relaxing and memorable. Our room, a high floor with a terrific view of the skyline, was spacious, especially for a large city hotel (we're used to the shoe boxes we stay in for twice the price in New York). The whole atmosphere is classy but not pretentious. We had been vactioning in Maine, skiing and hiking, and we felt completely comfortable at Nine Zero in our jeans and sweaters. The evening wine reception is a nice touch. The housekeeping staff was so accomodating with a coffee pot and extra pillows. The front desk was so helpful, right down to printing our boarding passes for our flight home. The restaurants recommended to us were all universally terrific. Just the right feel for our casual vacation. I would recommend this hotel for a romantic get away or celebration as it never felt stuffy - just fun. Great design, great staff. A terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Nine”
Reviews.Author: cactpcjs
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent boutique hotel. The beds are comfortable and so soft. They even except dogs but you don't see them. I only heard one dog bark a little bit and that's it. The location is excellent. You are in walking distance to everything and close to subway train. I enjoyed my stay very much and it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKDunc
Reviews.Content: The nine zero hotel was a great base to stay for sightseeing and shopping in boston. The loacation is great quite close to quincy market (5 mins walk) and 5 mins walk away from Macys. The quality of the hotel rooms was superb with great furnishings, all the staff were really helpful, the concierge guys deserve a special mention for the expert advice. I'd definitely stay here again if i was in boston.

Reviews.Title: “Big Lovely Room...”
Reviews.Author: vessy78
Reviews.Content: I travel very often for business, and this was the first time I had ever been to boston. The location was really nice, about a mile from Fenway Park. I was there during the baseball playoff, and boy is this town crazy for its baseball team. Upon checking in, my co-worker and myself both had the Deluxe room, and man, was this room big! Rooms are very nice with modern design. I thought the staff was excellent and helpfull, especially with recommendations of good local eats, as we wanted to walk around the city we never been before. I love Boston, where old meets new...... I would love to come back here again when I get the chance!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful city hotel in downtown Boston.”
Reviews.Author: TD60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from weekend getaway at the Nine Zero in Boston. Hotel and Location: The Nine Zero is a deluxe boutique hotel located near the northeast corner of Boston Common adjacent to the Freedom Trail. The Nine Zero is within walking distance of the Public Garden, the Government Center, the Theater District, Faneuil Hall, the North End (Little Italy) and downtown restaurants, shopping and nightlife. There's also a nearby "T" (subway) station about a block away. We found the hotel to be so conveniently located that once we handed our car keys to the valet at check-in, we didn't need them again until we checked out. The hotel's somewhat minimalist decor can best be described as "urban chic". The hotel offers complementary wine tastings nightly in the hotel lobby, which is a fantastic amenity. The Nine Zero's well-trained staff is very professional, gracious and accommodating. Room: As a "Kimpton in Touch" member I got a very reasonable "One Day Sale" rate of $209 for a King Premier Room (compared to the $279 weekend rack rate). I must admit that due to the "territory-marking behavior" of dogs I was skeptical of staying at a "pet-friendly" property, but my concerns were unfounded. The room was very clean and stylishly decorated. The extremely comfortable king-sized bed had plush linens, a warm down comforter and the softest down pillows weâ€™ve ever slept on. The marble bathroom was very nice and my wife loved the hotelâ€™s deluxe toiletries. The room and bathroom were more spacious than most standard city hotel rooms. Among the many appreciated in-room amenities were chocolate truffles and raspberries at nightly turndown. For those travelling on business, there's free high speed Internet and wireless connectivity in each room. Dining: We had dinner at "KO Prime", an innovative steakhouse located on the hotel's second floor. KO Prime is an extraordinary restaurant named after renowned Executive Chef Ken Oringer (formally of the Boston Eliot Hotel's Mobil 4-Star restaurant "Clio"). The appetizers, sides, entrees and desserts were all delicious, portions were generous, the service and presentation were superb and the wine list was impressive. The restaurant's "hip" atmosphere was trendy but refined. Like most fine restaurants, KO Prime is somewhat pricey - plan on spending $100 per person for a four-course dinner not including wine (if you order the Kobe Beef, plan on spending at least twice that per person). Most of the reds on the wine list were priced between $100 to $150 per bottle (there were few offerings below that). In fact, my only complaint about the restaurant is that the wine list markup seemed excessive to me. (I have a small wine cellar at home consisting mainly of Barolo, Barbaresco and red Bordeaux, so I consider myself to be pretty good at "cherry picking" limited-production/good value reds off of restaurant wine lists). These days, I can usually find a very good/delicious 1996-2001 Barolo or Barbaresco or "Cru Classe" Bordeaux from a better producer for around $80, which I consider to be a relatively good value at finer restaurants. Unfortunately, I was unable to find a good value at that price point on KO Prime's wine list. Despite this, KO Prime is definitely worth visiting for a special occasion. Overall, the Nine Zero is a wonderful city hotel in a great location... The "One Day Sale" rate of $209 was also a great value... We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs to get it together!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jrjetsetter
Reviews.Content: I loved Boston!!!...but this hotel was horrible! My husband and I arrived at the hotel around 1:45 pm, of course the room wasn't ready, but to make matters worse, they sent us on a wild goose chase..no joke! We figured we had just enough time catch the last tour of the Sam Adams brewery. We would have made it to the tour if the concierge didn't send us on a 3 mile hike to the wrong place. Apon returning to the hotel and telling where the brewery wasn't located they gave us the keys to a room the maid was still cleaning. The front desk has little to no customer service; I called a few times for phone #'s and given the wrong #â€™s. They had no clue how to set up transportation back to the airport, they told me that they could call to set it up, but it would be at least 20 minutes before he could find time to get to it. Thankfully this was our last night there!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Contemporary Hotel with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine13
Reviews.Content: I was a bit wary of Nine Zero after reading a few of the "not so flattering" reviews on TripAdvisor, but our reservations were made and I'd had good experiences with Klimpton Hotels in the past in San Francisco and Silicon Valley so I decided to just leave the reservations as they were. Upon arrival (which was tough because we drove into Boston and unfortunately missed the small alley off Tremont St. where the valet is located), we were warmly greeted by the friendly staff. Our room was ready even though we were early. The room was small but comfortable, and the bathroom was perfectly fine for us in terms of counter space for toiletries, etc. I left the room in disarray as we rushed to make our dinner reservations on time (that the concierge made for us at Bricco, excellent choice) and when we returned, we found everything neatly stacked and our bed turned down, soft music playing, chocolate truffles, and the ice bucket full. We enjoyed watching the Red Sox game 7 of the AL championships on the tv which we thought was fine for the room. We don't travel to watch tv and don't have a flat screen at home either so we didn't mind that it was a regular television. Upon our arrival earlier in the day, we had let the bellman know that the blinds in our room were not working. A maintenance man was sent up immediately, but he could not fix them as they were broken. I didn't think much of it at the time as we were leaving the room and when we returned it was evening. However, on the 2nd day when we returned to our room at 3:00pm, the room was scorching hot and we could not get comfortable with that sun beating down on us in the room. I went downstairs to get scotch tape to tape down the blinds because the towel I tried to block the sun with kept falling. As I was asking for the tape, I realized how ludicrous it was for me to be taping down a blind in a $450.00 a night room. I give Nine Zero credit for superb customer service because once the front desk manager saw how upset I was getting over the situation he remedied it immediately by moving us to another room for the night -- a much superior room which my husband and I luxuriated in for our last evening in Boston. We would most definitely stay at Nine Zero again for its excellent location at Boston Common, the chic, modern surroundings, but most importantly for the outstanding service and treatment we received as guests of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: crusaderS510
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Excellent customer service. Hotel looks iffy from the outside, but once you go in you will see modern improvements. Hotels rooms are clean, fresh linens, CD music is played while you enter your room, complimentary chocolates and water. Bathrooms have marble counter tops, huge shower w/ lots of water pressure and adequate soap, lotion, shampoo toiletries. The provide daily bed prep and provide ice in the evening. After a hard days work, its great to have it.

Reviews.Title: “Party on!”
Reviews.Author: raja79
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my 5 night holiday at this hotel! Rooms were not huge but very comfy! Fab beds! Extensive mini bar! Lovely bath products, Stayed in one night (party fatigue) and was so glad of tv movie order service, robe, lushious moisturisers, cd player & complimentary chocolates! Staff were adorable. would definitely stay again. Breakfast in the resturaunt was good. A little expensive but catered for my vegetarian diet. (didnt try dinner... menu didnt look at all veggie friendly) Bar was cool, good wines, smart decor. Only complaint was shower low pressure but had bath in room so that was cool. Overall totally recommend to twentysometings like me looking for comfort while partying in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! ..Please Read”
Reviews.Author: kalena79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a prime location as far as attractions, dining and restaurants. The staff was extremely professional, very delightful, friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms were considerably small, however, I felt at home! My room offered a very nice decor.. It was a bit on the small size.. considerable smaller than the average size hotel room but I felt very comfortable while staying in it. My room offered a decent size bathroom with a stand-up shower-l arge enough for two, it was very clean, and house keeping comes by twice a day to make sure you have clean towels. My bed was very, very comfortable, furnished with a down comforter, and down pillows. The room also offers free high speed internet and a desk to do work if needed. Their was a cd player and a complintary cd in the player to listen to during my stay..I enjoyed it very much that I purchased it before leaving. The tv featured all the local channels, cable channels and the latest movies for order. The armour was very nice but not large enough for more than one person so if you are not traveling alone, keeping your clothing in your suitcase seems to be your only option. The room also features a mini bar with snacks and refreshments, including, water, soda, wines and liquors all for purchase...HOWEVER, i do recommend you finding a liquor store nearby if you plan on having a drink in the room.. and picking up all your needed items because a small (one shot) bottle of Belveder Vodka was $9.50. Snacks were condsiderably reasonable but if you dont want to spend unnecessary money..stop at a local store! Room service was OK. If traveling on the weekend, give yourself about 45 minutes to order because it takes that much time for them to arrive due to many orders. Breakfast is served from 6:00AM- 11:00AM and they do not take any breakfast orders after that so don't call past that time if you are looking to eat breakfast in. As far as the menu- for breakfast.. their is not a great deal to choose from but the french toast and smoked bacon was pretty good but ask for extra maple syrup on the side if you enjoy syrup because they hardly give you any. as far as dinner and desserts... i enjoy salt with my food but the food was EXCEPTIONALLY SALTY.... the lobster sandwich with fries was pretty good but do not get your hands on the ceaser salad if you have high blood pressure because it is wayyy too salty..as far as dessert . they offer only two sweets..the chocoate bread pudding, and the coffee cream brulee..if you enjoy bread pudding which is why i ordered it, you will be very disappointed because it did not taste anything like it! they also offer coffee-cream brule but that was pretty good As far as the fitness room, it was also very small but managable and noone is ever in it so working out in there was very nice because I felt like it was my own room. As far as the hotel resaurant ko prime I never had the chance to eat in there but Its decor was very nice. As far as nearby dining, lucca Restaurant was great! It is located on Hanover street in the heart of Boston's little itay. I ordered the antipasta for two which was very good and I had the beef tenderloin which was excellent and the service was up to par. Tresca was also very good. Overall, my stay here was very pleasant and I felt very comfortable here but the above average rating that I give is more because the staff here is excetionally better than most other places that Ive stayed and also the location is great! Enjoy your stay.. if you have any further questions you can contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Average Service, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoubleSaggitarius
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor. I was not at all disappointed in the service which was excellent but the hotel was, at best, nothing to write home about. The rooms are very, very small; it was impossible to store one's clothing in the tiny armoire so that meant luggage had to be left out and that made it impossible to walk around the room easily. I thought the decor was stark, cold, a little garish, and not exactly a soothing color scheme. It was a little too 'in your face' for my taste. The internet connection was intermittent and wonky. On the plus side, I had a view facing the Old Grainary Burial Ground with a lovely view of Boston rooftops. The bath products are good, the restaurant is fabulous (but overpriced), and the hotel is in a convenient location. The hotel appeals to travelers in their 20s and 30s for its perceived 'hipness' and trendiness but it would not appeal to anyone looking for charm, comfort, real class or space. I would not stay at the hotel again but I would have dinner at the restaurant if I were in the area

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place!”
Reviews.Author: chhase243
Reviews.Content: WOW a great experience, tremendous location and very friendly, knowledgeable staff. We consider this THE happening place to stay! Great decor, nice amenities, and wine complimentary in the PM dont book anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “High expectations, but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Georgester
Reviews.Content: Given the rave reviews this hotel had recieved I had high expectations of what it would offer. The rooms are well styled (comfy bed, nice furnishings), although a little tired around the edges (curtain was frayed). There was no bath in the the bathroom - apparently only 10% of the rooms have baths. And there are no coffee machines either - these are available only on request as I found out (so not sure what those nice coffee machines are doing on their website!). My room service meal was also forgotten about. On the positive side, the restaurant for breakfast was excellent - the service quick and attentive (although this was at 6.30am, so perhaps a little early for most people). Style wise, this is definitely more pleasing than the usual impersonal hotel, but given it calls itself a 'boutique' hotel (and a price to match) overall I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Nine Zero - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Wrathie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night to catch an early flight. Our friends were travelling with us and we all agreed our stay at Nine Zero was probably the single best hotel expereince we've ever had. We travel quite a bit and go to New York and Boston a couple times a year for long weekends. We look for the best deal and make our decisions based on Trip Advisor reviews, always! Back to Nine Zero...a week before we left for Boston we received an e-mail from the manager offering assistance during our trip. They reserved tour tickets for us and couldn't have been nicer, like our own personal consierge. When we checked in, the front desk staff were so friendly and helpful, I couldn't believe it. We were early so they got us into one room and then rushed to get the other romm cleaned. They brought up our bags shortly and then ushered us to our room -- both were amazing for standard rooms but ours was a corner room overlooking the park. We loved the hotel so much we didn't even want to go on our tour, which was great too. We did the Duck Tour. When we returned from our tour and dinner (in Little Italy - YUM!) there were robes and chocolates set out! Loved it!!! Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zero Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: willSA
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: A Trip Advisor member from San Antonio, Texas. Family of three (son age 14) stayed 8/11/07-8/15/07. Had reserved standard double queen room (summer special $309 rate), but as a Kimpton in Touch member, upon check-in, we received a free upgrade to a deluxe room with a view on a higher floor. Hotel is very modern in design and execution and is quite attractive throughout. Best of all is the location --adjacent to Boston Common right on the Freedom Trail and only a block from the subway. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful--particularly at the concierge desk. The stay was not without a couple of problems, however. The modern design of the bathroom--and the glass shower in particular--was a problem, in that the shower door leaked water on to the floor and had to be fixed. Also, several channels on the Direct TV feed froze, and required a call to get them working. Finally, the hotel's highly praised restaurant just recently closed--it changed names and format (the previous chef left to open his own reataurant), and the new menu and prices did not look good enough to attract us for dinner. The one breakfast we had there was good, but overpriced. All in all, we really like Kimpton Hotels--the style, the amenities and the people. I recommend the Nine Zero.

Reviews.Title: “Two Paws up from Luxury Loving Dog”
Reviews.Author: rumpoleon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend this summer on our way back from Maine with our large, black labrador. Well if you want to be treated like a rock star (or more likely your dog will be treated like one), bring your pet to this hotel. From having your pets name on the reservation, cookies at check in, lavender scented baggies for those delightful waste management moments and doggy room service, this hotel had it all. AND it is right next door to the Boston Common and portions of the Freedom Trail. Combine the doggy amenities with pretty nice ones for non-canines (wine reception, immaculate and comfortable rooms, good food at "KO Prime") and it is hard to go wrong for the pet owner who wants to stay at an interesting city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location + service, but rooms need better soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: teabrit
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife a few days ago. I can't fault the hotel on much: the room was very comfortable, the staff were helpful, etc. Unfortunately our night was marred by the couple in the room across the hall who had a fight. That went on. And on. the soundproofing made all the yelling indistinct (thankfully!) but it was obvious that some poor couple were having a long drawn out argument. It was annoying at first (we called security at 3am, and kudos to nine zero for sending someone around rightaway) but hey, it could have been us, right? and so we decided to see the funny side. After all, everyone has bad days. Let's hope they made up. At $300/night it's a freakin expensive place to be unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JenCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 4 months baby for 2 nights, from July 28 to July 30. The room was really nice, and staff helpfull. The hotel is perfectly located, near of the Freedom Trail, Quincy Market and Botanic Garden. We'll definitly return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zero Hotel - Best Boutique Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JRToronto
Reviews.Content: Exceptional concierge, front desk, and bell/car service. A beautifully appointed boutique hotel in an excellent central location on Tremont Street near Beacon Hill. Great for business and personal travel ... they treat everyone like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KingsleyRoyal
Reviews.Content: Just had a great three days in Boston. This Hotel has a great location, clean and reasonbly priced. The rooms are 'standard' and for seeing the sights you could not ask for a better location. A T station (Park Street) is abount fifty years and the freedom trail goes past the Hotel. Tip...don't use the hotel coutesy Taxis theses cost $30 to the airport as oposed to $21 for a taxi flagged down in the street. Gripe...A constant dripping sound coming from the air conditioning. All staff were polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mathdan
Reviews.Content: Family of four stayed at the Nine Zero for 3 nights in June. Great location, right on the freedom trail and a 5 minute walk to the T. We stayed on the 14th floor with 2 queen beds which really were queens, not doubles like some places call queens. The beds were very comfortable. Sheets were in good shape, bathrooms were clean, everything worked. There were a few spots on the carpet, but nothing out of the ordinary for non brand new hotels. Room was adequate in size. We weren't in the rooms that much except for sleeping and getting ready in the morning. We don't choose hotels for the amenities, but rather look for something clean, comfortable, quiet, reasonably priced and in a good location . The Nine Zero fit all of those. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinJen
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Nine Zero Boston and LOVED it. The location was great. Right next to Boston Commons and very close to other areas such as the Back Bay, the North End, Quincy Market, etc. The hotel was clean and decorated very nicely. They had a nightly turndown service and left you little treats each night. It was very quiet as well. We stayed in a King Premier room and really liked it. It was not huge but just fine for two adults. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful as well. Next time we are in Boston we'll be sure to stay at the Nine Zero again.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time - and still my choice!”
Reviews.Author: jbond1007
Reviews.Content: This last time (the third time I've stayed at the Nine Zero), I had actually been booked into another hotel by the travel department at my company. That hotel, however, lost my reservation. To top it off, it was the weekend of St. Patrickâ€™s Day - not the time to be looking for a hotel! That hotel called NineZero and verified that not only did they have rooms, but at a discount price! I finally got settled, had excellent room service after midnight, and came home each night to soft jazz playing on the CD player. Great experience and very convenient to downtown activities. I let the concierge decide what seafood restaurant to eat at each night and tell me where the best night spots were. Great picks each time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gerry23
Reviews.Content: Great location, good price, nice brand new hotel right by Boston Common. Booked with their central reservation and got the best deal. Friendly welcoming staff. Very quiet rooms, even though the hotel was fully booked didn't hear anyone in my room and only saw one person on the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: lhpotter
Reviews.Content: I read others' reviews of this hotel on this site and was looking forward to spending two nights here while I was in Boston on business. Some things about the hotel were great -- the night I arrived, for example, I did not get to the hotel until 1:30 am and had not had dinner -- room service quickly brought me sandwich and a pot of tea and I was grateful! Their internet access was excellent, wake-up calls flawless, and their staff was invariably polite. The room was comfortable, with many nice amenities and extras, including a CD player. I liked the decor a lot. Their express dry cleaning service was super. A few negative experiences, however: (1) The room was not as clean as it should have been, particularly the bathroom -- it did not meet the standards of a standard business class hotel like a Hilton or Hyatt. The walls were dirty, the sink and floor in the bathroom had splotches and sticky patches, the drinking glasses were dirty, the upholstery and carpet had spots and stains, and the bathrobes were frayed and worn; (2) On the second morning, I ordered a french omelette off their room service menu, as I had done the day before. Twenty minutes later, I got a call from room service asking me what the ingredients were for a french omelette. I told the person that I wasn't sure exactly but didn't they know since it was on their menu? She told me that the french omelette was not on their menu. I told her that I had ordered the same thing the day before from their menu, which was sitting in front of me! 45 minutes after I initially ordered, my french omelette did arrive -- and was delicious as usual -- but this was an annoying interlude on a busy morning; (3) Both mornings, the housekeeper knocked once on my door and before I could get to the door to see who it was, had unlocked the door and entered my room (this is not reassuring for women traveling alone); (4) There were errors on my bill which had to be ironed out -- a valet parking charge when I didn't even have a car. To their credit, they rectified the situation quickly and politely -- but it was time-consuming. Bottom line -- the hotel was comfortable and the staff was polite and friendly, but no hotel can lose sight of the basics: cleanliness and a well-trained staff.
