Reviews.Title: “Very OK hotel?”
Reviews.Author: SUMMIE
Reviews.Content: HIwe stayed here for 4 nites during the boston marathon. well pampered travelers and hotelados, we thought this was a very decent hotel. nice decor, decent size rooms, great restaurant, very central within walking distance from everything. Service is good, nothing to complain there. All the staff are very friendly and helpfull. We normally do not like hotels that allow pets, but this was clean enough for our liking. We liked the little touches like the martini kits, and the design interior, which is fine and not over the top (the lightswich is actually a switch, and its easy enough to find how the taps work :-) Also the free drink reception at 5 with good wine and softdrinks makes one feel very welcome No gym/pool though which i find a negative. We normally stay at the 4seasons which is the complete opposite as fas design is concerned, this hotels compares favourably especially when you compare the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great views possible, great staff...”
Reviews.Author: TwoAmps
Reviews.Content: Great hotel (but it should be great for the price--when did a good big-city hotel room get to be 4-something a night? I missed that memo...). Wonderful staff. The concierge did what concierges are supposed to be able to do--make good tables appear at great restaurants that we wouldn't have thought of otherwise, the valets knew foolproof (important in Boston) shortcuts to anywhere we wanted to go, and overall, it just felt like the machine was really running well. Even at the high-end, the rooms aren't exactly huge with a single King, and would be really packed, as reported elsewhere, with two Queens. Closet space is at a premium, with the safe, a big drawer, and the ironing stuff taking up a lot of room. we had trouble finding room for 4 days worth of coats and clothes for two. We did like the comfy-modern decor, and the views from the upper floor rooms, with the floor-to-ceiling windows, can be pretty jaw-dropping. (chatting with someone at the University (I think it's a law school) across the street, he pointed out that the views IN those big windows can be pretty jaw-dropping, too. This isn't the only building on the block with 19 floors, and that ain't one-way glass, folks...)

Reviews.Title: “If only I could live here”
Reviews.Author: citygirl716
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nine Zero two years ago to celebrate our anniversary and fell in love with the hotel. Even though we only live a few blocks away, it's always fun to stay in a hotel :) Anyway, we got a gorgeous king size city room and were thoroughly impressed with the entire hotel. We had dinner at Excelsior and when we came back, he had asked the hotel for the romantic get-away package and the bed was scattered in rose pedals, a bath had been made, candles were everywhere, and jazz was softly playing in the background. Everything was perfect. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. I want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Malie
Reviews.Content: This was a stylish hotel. But my room was dirty and that can pretty much ruin it all. When I arrived it was clear that there were rings and spots on the bathroom sink/countertop and it was evident that the desk had not been cleaned in a while. I had work to do so the idea of setting my paperwork on what appeared to be coffee stains was not appealing. When the manager came to check on this and clean it, he first indicated that nothing needed to be cleaned, but he would try. He said the spots were hard water, old stains, etc. Whatever... miraculously they all came off when he sprayed the surfaces with cleaner and wiped. The next day, it seemed that the housekeeper was not too attentive to her duties. There was no attention to detail. Also the robe hanging in the bathroom was worn enough that I did not want to put it on. The best thing about the place was the restaurant attached to the hotel. Now that was good. But it's more important for me to feel like I'm in a really clean room, so I wouldn't choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best dog friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmamartini
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were staying in Boston with our beagle and were nervous about how we would be treated. The Nine Zero staff were outstanding, friendly and helpful. The concierge arranged for a private inroom dog sitter who was very nice, a dog gift basket and set up a welcome dog bowl with treats and water in the lobby with a picture of a beagle!! We were so happy they welcomed him! The room was clean, modern, with nice amenities including a super-comfy bed with top notch sheets. The bathroom was spacious with a fantastic shower. The hotel is in a good location walking distance to the park. I would highly recommend this hotel and if I'm ever in Boston again, will certainly stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Great!”
Reviews.Author: jll1960
Reviews.Content: We took our 13 year old for a long weekend in Boston. It rained for 3 days and 3 nights, which made viewing the sights a real bummer. Thank goodness for the Nine Zero! It made the 3 nights worthwhile. We had great service, a lovely, quiet room, wine tasting every evening from 5-6, and the best breakfast I've had in ages. We were so lost trying to find the hotel that the concierge stayed on the phone with my husband and guided us all the way there. Our NAV system was taking us to 90 Tremont in Charlestown, so beware! I'd go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “OK at best”
Reviews.Author: TravelingN0mad
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for this hotel but was sadly disappointed upon check-in. The hotel obviously had money invested in to its decor a couple of years ago but now things are looking a little ragged. My phone & safe did not work. The bedding was unironed, the towels had definately seen better days and the bathrobe was badly marked. My view from the 10th floor was of the office block 12metres away and I was charged a ludricous amount for a call back to the UK. Taking all the above into consideration, I have stayed in worse hotels and perhaps I just has a bad room. However following all the other glowing reviews I did have higher expectations for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: janey5600
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives a great first impression. The reception and lounge area is very smart, clean and comfortable. However, the room was a little on the small side. We booked a queen room expecting a little more space but we could hardly walk around the bed. The bathroom was also small and compact, but that aside the room and bathroom did have everything we needed. One downside was that when we left the hotel after four nights, I did experience a lot of bites on my body, I informed the hotel after we left via e-mail that the room may have bed-bugs or fleas and they told me that the room had been sprayed to be on the safe side but maybe I had picked up the bites elsewhere!!!!! On a very positive note, my husband and I asked the consierge for a bar with live music and he directed us to an amazing place which I am sorry I can't remember the name of (as a too good a time was had) but they served shrimp out of a bucket. Ask the consierge to direct you, it was brill.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but some glitches”
Reviews.Author: Sailou
Reviews.Content: Nice room, great location and great staff at front desk but check your account balance carefully. Two days in a row I was billed for items from minibar which I did not take (a quick call to front desk and the situation was immediately rectified); the breakfast order we left on door handle overnight was not picked up (we called front desk to inquire and order was taken and brought up in 15 minutes); felt a bit ripped off after we kept tipping for room service because we saw a line for "Tips" on receipt, but realized on last day that the total already included 18% gratuity. Would stay here again though if I got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton excels again with 9-0”
Reviews.Author: kennethwalker
Reviews.Content: I am a big Kimpton fan so maybe I am a little biased but I found 9-0 just about perfect. The location is exceptional, the staff were friendly and professional, and the room was functional and in good condition. I was upgraded from a Queen Deluxe to Queen Deluxe view (1903) on the top floor with view of Boston Common, the State House and Charles River/Cambridge in distance (Thanks for the upgrade Jorge). Request a coffee maker for your room as the lobby coffee setup was not available until after 7am and was out of regular coffee on more than one occasion. Celebrated birthday dinner at Spire-the food and service were excellent. Entrees $25-35. I have read some of the negative reviews about the hotel but aside from the lobby coffee set up and the broken ice maker on my floor I had no complaints. Would happily stay at 9-0 again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Nine Zero”
Reviews.Author: Englishmum
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time researching which hotel to stay in for a 3 day holiday to Boston and was sure i'd picked the right place. One the plus side the location is great and we had a fantastic view overlooking Boston Common. When we arrived the check in staff were helpful. I also really appreciated the free coffee in the lobby every morning. The wine reception at 5pm is a great idea but we didn't get to try this out. However, we had numerous small complaints which spoiled our enjoyment: the bathroom was dirty and tired-looking, the CD player was broken, the sheets were torn, we were disturbed by hotel staff when we had the privacy sign displayed, we were given someone else's bags when we came to check out. These may be only small matters but they meant that I wished I'd stayed next door at the Parker Omni Hotel! Again, on the plus side, when I did complain we were offered a free night's stay at a future date.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: CaseyCz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed for an anniversary celebration on a Saturday night. I first checked expedia and found the hotel, but then decided to check the hotel website and they offered a "hot deal" rate $30 cheaper a night than expedia. The hotel is in a great location across from Boston Common and 2 blocks from the State House and Downtown Crossing. It is a few blocks to Fanuel Hall Marketplace. We were seeing a show in the Theater District and it was a pleasant 15 minute walk. When we checked in they did not have the king room that we reserved due to a party and damage in the room. After offering us a smoking room with an ionizer which we declined they did offer us an upgrade to a queen room on the 19th floor with a view of the State House dome. I at first thought of it as a downgrade because it's now a queen instead of a King, but the high floor was nice and it was a corner room with a view. The rooms are well appointed and it was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. The radio and cd player with cd's was a great touch. We've stayed in many Boston hotels, and so far this is by far our favorite. Staff was very friendly also.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jatallah
Reviews.Content: This is a swanky, small hotel. The ratings are good enough. They've acquired enough awards and accolades. The location is fantastic for the leisure traveler wanting to walk Boston--you can hop on the Freedom Trail just outside. The rooms are nicely appointed with European sheets, robe, and spa items from Mario Russo. The staff was helpful in loading/unloading, check-in, concierge services and calling transportation. What is not good? THE BEDS ARE OLD. You can have the finest linens in the world, but it will never mask a worn-out bed. My husband and I had a queen and neither of us got a full night's sleep on any of the four nights we stayed. We left our vacation feeling more tired than when we arrived. Second, THE ROOM SERVICE IS TERRIBLE. On two mornings we ordered from from the room service menu. On a continental breakfast, they forgot the juice both times, neglected salt/peppper, butter for toast and breads, and sugar for our tea and coffee. They were out of an offered yogurt for our entire length of stay. The second morningn they sent a completely different meal from what my husband ordered! They did make it right, but at a hotel of this advertised calibur, the service could be 100x better. We did not even dare enter the restaurant, Spire, for that reason. Also, be advised with the pampering service, this means they enter your room about 3x a day. Once in the a.m. for cleaning, once in the afternoon and once for turndown. If you want more privacy, let them know, rather than shooing housekeeping three times in a day, as we had to do.

Reviews.Title: “More toward the Zero than the Nine”
Reviews.Author: UrbanLiver
Reviews.Content: What can i say - for $350 a night you would expect better service. I was a woman traveling alone with several bags and all they did was hand me my key and say - "elevators to the left". No offer to help with bags. The room was clean and neat but overall service was bad or mediocre. The restaurant was so-so. And beyond medium food, all the waiter did was mention several times what time they closed. So, if you check in late, be sure to eat dinner someplace else. The views were good for sure. For better service - much better service - stay at XV Beacon and the food at the Fed will give you dreams for weeks afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately a disappointment a second time aroung”
Reviews.Author: Fintraveller
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Nine Zero. My first time was in August and I was so excited about the hotel that I recommended it to our company's travel and event services. Everything (except the extremely poor service in the Spire restaurant) was excellent. I couldn't wait to go back! And I do not say this lightly - I'm a very seasoned traveller and have over 50 hotel nights per year. This is not a cheap place (I paid $400 per night, but it was worth it). So, with great expectations I returned in October. I'm a very light sleeper so my assistant had requested a quiet room on a high floor. (And last time it worked perfectly). Not such luck this time although thispreference is also clearly stated in my Kimpton frequent quest profile. I was given a room 1502 - high floor, but so much street noise that I had 3 very poorly slept nights. The housekeeping, which as impeccable last time, left a lot of room for improvement this time around: the empty shower gel bottle stood in the shower for 3 days and a new one was not provided until I called and requested one (most annoying when you're wet in the shower already and notice this). The sheets were so worn that there literally was a hole in it! You would expect this in a cheap budget hotel but not in a place like Nine Zero... Then the room service. On both mornings I ordered a big pot of green tea. On the first day the pot of hot water came with 8 tea bags (which was a bit excessive, but at least enough) on the second morning I just got one (with a big pot of water and with at $10 price tag not quite what I expected). When I requested a second tea bag from the waitress, I was told that I can have one only if I pay extra ($5). Granted, I'm on an expense account and it doesn't matter, but this kind of greediness gives a very poor overall impression of the hotel's mentality. And about the Spire restaurant; the menu had 3 seafood choices (I don't eat meat) of which 2 were "sold out". What was most annoying was that we were not told about this in the beginning, but only after we had already made our selections. At that point the waitress told us: "Oh, we don't have that anymore tonight. No, that neither." Overall my second visit didn't meet my expectations, but that might've been partly do to the fact that the hotel seemed to be fully booked., which was not the case during my first visit. Let's hope they'll get their act together since this place really has a lot of potential!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bjorkebo73
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i stay in this absolutly faboulus hotel ask for room 1807. A really large "standard" room, large bathroom and a really nice view over the city. The breakfast is good continental breakfast 15 USD. The staff is friendly and helpful, location is good. Nicely decorated rooms. I can not find anything really to complain about. So go there and ask for room 1807. Rooms are clean. My only small complain about that the elevator was out of order for more than 12 hours which is a little bit too long since they only have two elevators. 5 minutes walk to the park and 5 min opposite direction to Quincy market and Faneuil Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, low on biz traveler standards”
Reviews.Author: KateKirk
Reviews.Content: I seek out Kimpton Hotels for their stylishness and great locations in major U.S. cities. Nine Zero hits most marks for friendly staff, wonderfully comfortable rooms (oh those sheets...), chic local brand toiletries, a great Tremont Street location and a swanky bar/restaurant, but for $400 a night, I expect a little bit more catering to the weary business traveler. Coffee is offered but it's not out until 7 am (on a weekend that's ok), the desk is completely unworkable for a laptop, and the fitness center was really subpar...rickety equipment, no television, a door that sits open rather than being keyed...not my idea of security when you are a woman working out alone at 5 am. It's the little things that really matter when you have to be away from home for work and I think Nine Zero could work on it. I did enjoy a fantastic view of the Charles River, Fenway and other sites from my 19th floor room....really spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bobolito
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the nine zero for three nights earlier this month...we were very happy with our entire stay. the staff was one of the nicest we have ever encountered in all of our hotel stays and we do alot of travel. the hotel is small but intimate with a private feel. you never see many people in the lobby ...it is quiet and calm. we stayed in a corner view room on the 14th floor and had an amazing view, the windows were huge and it had a really wonderful urban feel. the room was spaced nicely even though it was not big. the matress was the best one i have slept on in a long time including just about every 5 star hotel. the linens were wonderful, clean crisp and white with great pillows. we were greated with a fruit plate and coffee as we arrived early in the morning. it was so nice to check in early with no questions asked. the room had a great choice of magazines and daily newspapers. the spiro restaurant was an excellant place for drinks and a snack. nice atmosphere. we also had a few fabulous breakfasts there. my only complaint was of the young bartenders behind the second floor bar at night. both during room service and at the spiro bar itself they were cold and did not know anything about the wines they had in stock, nor did they care to find out. it seemed as if they were bored students just making their buck , it supprised me that this would be the case since everyone else in the entire hotel was excellent...in spite of that we still had a nice time while we were there. Akeem and Thomas were EXTREMELY EXCEPTIONAL front house workers...anything you wanted they would help you with ( and with a real smile, not some phony yes sir or yes mame service.) the location cant be beat. its right next to park and a 5 min T ride to airport or a 10 min cab ride to airport. lots of great shopping and restaurants nearby and accross the park. the free internet access was a nice touch as well as the wine happy hour which we seemed to keep missing. the hotel had somewhat of a W feel but a much much nicer staff and cozier feel. we will definitely be back and will try out the other kimptons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..”
Reviews.Author: Marco-Mintwithhole
Reviews.Content: Great location for central Boston just near the top of Boston Common. Wlaking distance to just about everything that matters for the tourist. Our room was on the small side but that was reflected in the price and would happily stay there again. Service very friendly and helpful and the 2nd floor bar appears to be something of a destination. Didn't get round to trying the reataurant but looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Di2442
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Nine Zero in July, 2006, with our 2 small kids, aged 18 months and 3 and a half years. From the moment we arrived, to the time we left, the staff at the Nine Zero went out of their way to make us feel like valued customers. We had a lovely room with 2 Queen-sized beds, and a huge bathroom. We often stay at Kimpton Hotels around the US, so we belong to their customer loyalty program. As a result, the first night, we were greeted with chocolate truffles, strawberries, and a huge bottle of designer water. And in the evening, the complimentary wine hour can't be beat. I had also asked for a room on an upper floor, which we were given. All in all a terrific experience! Location: right in the heart of things in Boston, a short walk to Boston Common (literally right across the street) and the financial district. Close to good shopping, and the acquarium, which is amazing. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice stay in Boston. We are very discriminating travellers, and we were very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Hotel, Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: njsuburbian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very trendy hotel and is in a great location. We walked everywhere during our stay. Even Fenway and the Prudential Center are only a 15 minute walk. Quincy Market is 3 Blocks away and Boston Common is literally across the street. The rooms are a decent size. They aren't small, but they aren't tiny. The beds are very comfortable as well as the other furniture. The staff is good as well. The concierge there, Steven, was very helpful in providing help for a myriad of different requests. I saw him sit down with a person for practically 30 minutes and plan out her entire weeklong vacation with numerous reservations and other requests without even showing a negative look on his face. There are a few downsides to staying in the hotel: - Parking is $35 a day and isn't on-site (it's a valet service) - For a 4-star hotel there is no doorman - The valet entrance with the bell-hops is on the side and it's very hard to manuver cars in the small side street. There is no stopping on Tremont St. in front of the hotel -The staff didn't seem to be very organized, however whenever anything went wrong, they were very helpful and without a doubt, the staff tried their hardest to make each and every customer's stay a positive one.

Reviews.Title: “Busy time but fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyHawaiiKaian
Reviews.Content: We often choose hotels because of location. In fact, the last visit to Boston we stayed at the Onmi Parkerhouse, which is a great hotel, too. However, our experience at the Nine Zero was more pleasant. The Nine Zero team was friendly, professional, and well informed. They were truly hospitable in accomodating any kind of requests. They were kind and unpretentious. Our room was very spacious and we had a pretty view of some architecturally interesting rooftops, the Boston commons with a glimpse of Fenway Park in the distance. The rooms are upscale and really clean. I never felt like the team was hovering, but were always available when you need them. GREAT JOB guys, especially on the 4th of July weekend! Thanks! We'd recommend to all visiting. P.S. to Hawaiian travellers: 10 of 10 shakas on the aloha scale here :) !

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and Sub par for price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff lacks basic customer service skills, most of the them are really young and appear to have just graduated from hospitality school with poor grades. We booked directly through the hotel and did so for the "spectacular view" and king sized bed, however when we got to our room we had a spectacular view of the building next door. When we were finally given a room with a view, we had to be down graded to a queen size bed. The shower door was broken which caused a large flood throughout the entire bathroom and we had to use all of our extra towels to soak it up. I requested a comb as I had forgotten one, and was told it would be "right up", it NEVER came, despite my asking on two ocassions. The topper was when we where overcharged $100.00.....HORIBBLE experience.....we even wrote a letter to management which we never do, but we felt we got raped out of 400 bucks. Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Nine Zero!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Boston and the Nine Zero Hotel. We enjoyed our stay immensely; the hotel staff was extremely efficient and friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. The rooms were large and comfortable. We will definitely return to Nine Zero on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a Great location!”
Reviews.Author: tonikeb
Reviews.Content: The Nine Zero is a modern boutique hotel located in downtown Boston. The outside of the hotel is brick and looks like a lot of the other buildings in this city. However, its insides are quite modern and sleek making for an enjoyable contrast in such a historic town. The hotel is located on the Freedom Trail directly across the street from the very old Granary Cemetary. Paul Revere, Samuel Adams, and the parents of Benjamin Franklin (among others) are buried there. Our corner room allowed us a terrific people watching view, including the groups taking tours led by people dressed in revolutionary period clothing. Boston is known as a walking city and almost everything is within walking distance from this hotel. The financial district is in one direction and the theater district in another. One edge of Boston Common (the furthest side from the Public Garden) is 1block away to the south. You can choose from high end stores and dining on Newbury Street at the end of the Public Garden or find moderate shopping and fast food on Washinton Street, which is one city block to the east of Nine Zero. The Park Street "T" (subway) station is only 1 block away, too. Both the red line and green line trains can be taken from this station for $1.25 per person per ride. The red line (outbound) will take you over to Cambridge and the green line will take you to Fenway Park or up to the North End. You could also transfer from the green line to the blue line, which takes you to the wharf. Don't panic if this sounds complicated. It's not! The friendly and very helpful concierge at the hotel provided us with a clearly marked map and very easy to follow directions. The decor of this hotel is modern. Our room was nicely sized and the bed was wonderfully comfortable. The bath was stocked with Mario Russo (a local salon) products. The sea salt soap is divine!! Our room was so comfortable we decided to have dinner via room service one night. It was delivered hot & quickly and it was delicious. Note: When we were calling to place our dinner order, the line to room service rang a few times so the call was automatically routed to the front desk. Instead of trying to transfer us back to that line, the front desk person took our order! This was a very nice customer service touch. The only quirk to the Nine Zero hotel is finding a few items tucked into dresser drawers. We discovered our coffee maker in one drawer after already grabbing some coffee from Starbucks around the corner. Also, housekeeping came by bright and early on a Saturday morning but we didn't find our "do not disturb" hanger (in another drawer) until a day too late. Very, very minor for an otherwise outstanding stay. I would definitely stay at the Nine Zero again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but we could hear every sound”
Reviews.Author: JAD49
Reviews.Content: For a new hotel they sure blew it when they didn't make the rooms more sound proof. My husband and I could hear the bell on the elevator every time someone used it. We could hear voices in the hallways and doors closing and we couldn't tell if it was an ice machine or cleaning staff but what a noise! Our sleep was interrupted several times. Also I had to ask them to change the sheets right away as there was a blood stain on the bottom one. However, the staff was friendly, the room was nice, a little small but overall I felt we payed too much for the room. You can walk everywhere in Boston so I think we could have found another hotel nearby for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Maslach
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with the rooms at this hotel. We were fortunate enough to be given a corner room on the 18th floor with floor to ceiling windows and great views of the city, all at great value. The beds were huge and incredibly comfortable. They even had a pillow menu, although we didnâ€™t try it out. Bathrooms were spacious, clean and had nice toiletries. The mini-bar was extensive although a bit pricey â€“ reduce the priced by a couple of dollars and we would have probably emptied it - $4.50 for a small bottle of water is excessive by any standard. We had drinks/dinner at the hotels bar/restaurant Spire. The bar was really nice, had a good vibe and was very stylish â€“ the restaurant the same. Service was good and the menu and food excellent. I would highly recommend it even if you are not staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous!”
Reviews.Author: ElleSheri
Reviews.Content: As a single woman traveller, I must admit the hotel takes great care of its guest... From the friendly reception to the excellent concierge.. they were very patient despite my numerous demands!!! I had such a wonderful time in Boston, thanks to Nine Zero.. Absolutely wonderful! A special thanks to Kelly for all her help.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Walking distance to many Boston shops and restaurants. car valet. Very friendly staff. Pet friendly. (we brought our pom). they even walked our dog for us! ($10 charge) great breakfast! (inhouse restaurant) over all a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: sunny0
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at Nine Zero. It was my first time there and I was very impressed. The staff are the nicest people I have ever experienced in a hotel setting. They are so helpful and polite. The room was nice, everything was very modern. We spent a few hours in the bar. The bar staff again were very friendly. I would reccomend this hotel to couples who just want a quick getaway. It was a very pleasant time at Nine Zero!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, slightly dodgy plumbing.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a holiday to Boston. Very nice hotel, room was well furnished, and staff very helpful. Good location too. Only fly in the ointment was the plumbing - the lever to switch between shower (over the bath) and the bath tap didn't work, so it was showers only. Not a big problem in itself, but the water pressure wasn't up to much for showering, and neither was the water temperature on one day. On the other hand though, the cold tap did give hot water at times, which was slightly disconcerting, especially as it meant the wc also got pretty hot too. Don't imagine this affects all rooms, and it didn't really put us off. Enjoyed our stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AandASanJose_CA
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel 3 times in the past year and it is consistently excellent. The service is great and any requests are immediately seen to. The rooms are relatively spacious and very comfortable - particularly if you have a "fantastic" room. The bar is a great place to hang out and the restaurant serves great food. We'd have no hesitation in recommending this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Sleek Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRWB1960
Reviews.Content: If you like a new hotel Nine Zero will make you happy. It is very modern and trendy from the lobby to the bar to the room which was fairly large and very well apointed with comfortable beds and a very nice bathroom. Good location if you want to be on the State Street side of town. The only complaint was that it was noisy outside and the walls did not shield from the late night construction noise like the quiet rooms of its stodgey neighbor the Omni Parker House. Great place overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Sharonb423
Reviews.Content: Very nice, small boutique hotel, catered to our needs and had a wonderful champagne and chocolate strawberries package - was thrilled when we came back to the room and they had strewn rose petals everywhere and drawn a bath, knowing what time we would be back it was still warm when we returned. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: Joannecam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Nine Zero. We receceived a discount rate for staying two weekend nights and paid $200 a night, excluding the exhorbitant Massachusetts/Boston room taxes. The hotel passed with flying colors my 3 basic rquirements: great location with everything but perhaps Fenway Park within walking distance, wonderful bed and bedding and a great shower with very hot water and great pressue. The service was beyond great. Unfortunately we had a problem with our room not being made up until 4:30pm. I was exhausted from walking around the city all day and mentioned to the front desk the inconvenience. I was surprised and delighted to have the immediate response be appologies and an offer to have drinks and appetizers on the hotel in their restaurant. It was totally unnecessary, much appreciated and very impressive. We would love to reurn to this gracious hotel very soon.

Reviews.Title: “WE DIDNT WANT TO LEAVE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vern1978
Reviews.Content: I took my fiance here for a surprise trip to Boston weeekend. I got a great price on hotels(-) but was so not treated any differently than the $350 a night visitor. Let me start by saying i took my 2 dogs, a boston terrier and a german shephard mutt. The minute i called to make sure it was ok - The girl asked me their names and informed me that they would have a surprise for the dogs. When we checked in, the front desk was polite and sweet. The hotel is located accross the street from boston commmon. Prime location. They have their own restauraunt and bar. The bar - slightly snooty, strong drinks. Our room was on the fifth floor, i read reviews that people said the room was small with hardwood floors - Uhh...NOT US!!! We had a huge room, a minibar with a martini setup, fabulous bathroom with marble and a rugged floor, kingsize bed, posh chair and huge desk. The bellman was so nice and NO ONE had their hand out if you know what i mean. The concierre was great!!! And they have their own livery (better than the cabs and not much more expensive). Dont listen to these other reviews that says the place isnt great....i would go back in a heartbeat. Ive been to some great hotels so i am very picky. Ive stayed at the Long Wharf in Boston and that is nothing compared to this. THis place spoiled us - the beds were UNBELIEVABLE. Those pillows!!! Our view - a normal city view of the building next to us. We ordered room service breakfast(15 minutes) - not so good i am sorry to say. We ordered a late night dinner at about midnight (30 minutes) - Fabulous !!! Only one real compaint - the towels and bathrobe were not soft at all. OUCH!!! They really treated us as well as the dogs so nicely though and expected nothing in return, we did tip, but only for exceptional service. Oh and that surprise for the dogs- their own dog beds, bowls, dog shampoo, scented poopy bags, Nine Zero dog tags, and they even have their own canine room service menu!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Remove the NIne and what you have is zero!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have spent a lot of time in nice boutique hotels, and nine zero may have been the worst hotel I've ever been to. From the minute i checked in with the snippy kid at the fornt desk to the fifty-five minute wait for room service everything was terrible!!

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: lrnyn
Reviews.Content: An average 4 star hotel, good location, but definitely nothing special. Rooms are small. Stayed in a "fantastic" room but had to call to make sure it wasn't the "intimate" room. Bathrooms have one sink and no seperate shower/bath. Pretty average. No cups were provided in the bathrrom and the honor bar contained an open bottle probably from the last guest. Fitness room is small with likely second or third hand old machines. They do provide complimentary passes to the Bally's 3 blocks away but make sure to bring a lock or you have to buy one. I wouldn't recommend the hotel if you're someone who wants to workout during the stay. Had problems with the wireless internet. It never worked! Service was overall fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: botlon
Reviews.Content: From arrival I loved the style of this hotel. The decor in the public areas is very cool and modern. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful at check in and couldn't do enough for me. The room was also very stylish and everything had been carefully thought out - wireless internet, great mini bar, lots of other thoughtful touches too. The bed was REALLY comfortable and the bathroom was one of the best I have ever seen (despite not having a bath!). Overall I was disappointed to have to leave having loved my stay. Plus the location is perfect for exploring Boston - right in the heart of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “TrendyModern Hotel Decor Missing Details”
Reviews.Author: HIWALSH
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel advertised and said it was a Boutique Style Hotel. Its a Boutique hotel but they must have run out of money as the decorators made it just average and the rooms are small and the floors are un-attractive painted black wood. We agree with some of the other guests comments on the feedback that the staff is not very friendly and cold. For the prices they are charging you would think they would be service oriented and have a little nicer accomodations and details in the decorations. Sorry but not a great Boston experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LPS77NewYork
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with our stay at Nine Zero, the hotel tries too hard to be trendy and the place is basically a money trap. The rooms are nice, but expensive. We got charged for everything from a packet of aspirin to $10 for a bottle of water. I feel when your paying a certain amount for a room, the least a hotel can offer is a complimentary aspirin and a bottle of water. I would never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Room was well decorated. Great view if you get a room up high enough. Found the bed a little hard to get comfortable in, but once you do, you don't want to get out. Minor flaw was that bed was made up with a ripped sheet. I didn't notice until I was packing, but should have been caught by housekeeping. Nice lounge but too crowded for a relaxing drink. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “great in room amenities”
Reviews.Author: la femme folle
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed for 2 nights in September. The hotel was very busy, but the staff remained very friendly and professional. Hotel has a great location, can walk to Fanieul Hall, quincy market, Boston common, the T etc. We really enjoyed the in room amenities. Mini bar had a wide variety of options including a martini bar with mixers, great in room coffee, bath toiletries were great too. Room was spacious, and we were on a high floor, so we had a great view. Food in Spire was good, but a bit on the salty side for a luxury restaurant. Great stay at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Very Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Shton1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nine Zero with 5 other friends for 3 nights two weekends ago. We had 3 rooms and I chose the hotel partly for its location, although everything seems pretty close in Boston, and also partly because of the accolades the hotel has received from various travel magazines. The rooms at Nine Zero are quite nice if you like contemporary decor. The beds were incredibly comfortable, although the pillows were a little soft for my taste. I also liked the color schemes of the rooms with bright yellows and reds accenting the almost black mahogany furniture. I was placed in a "Spectacular" room on the 17th floor with nice skyline views. The bathrooms are spacious, with nice bath ammenities. One of my biggest pet peeves is showers with low water pressure, I was quite pleased with the copious water pressure and plentiful hot water at the Nine Zero. One other thing that would probably make this hotel even more desirable for the business traveler is the oversized work desk with ergonomic office chair and high-speed internet access in the room. While the rooms were certainly nice, the staff really sets the hotel apart. Every interaction with all of the staff from check-in to check-out was quite pleasant. Fatima at the front desk and all of the doormen/valets derserve special kudos for treating my group like VIP's. The doormen were amazing in getting us transportation anywhere we needed to go at a moment's notice, including a private car to Fenway Park on a game day. We only had one meal at the restaurant, but it was very good and the prices were comprable to hotels in this class. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation to anyone looking for nice accomodations and professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good handicapped bathroom, great bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The restaurant serves an very good breakfast as well. The bed was incredibly comfortable; it may be the best hotel bed that I've ever slept in. I am in a wheelchair, and the handicapped bathroom is well designed. I did expect the main room to be a little larger, but it did not impair my ability to move around the room to access the bed nearest the door, the desk, and the entertainment unit. I only could not get to the window, which would have made a difference were I alone and needing to open or close the blinds. Their blinds are also excellent for keeping out light if you are something of a late sleeper, as I am. The location of the hotel is fantastic. It's in the middle of the city with a historic graveyard just across the street, where Paul Revere, Samuel Adams, and many of Ben Franklin's family members are buried. You can wander for five minutes in any direction and reach something enjoyable or significant. Boston Commons is not far away. I had a great trip to Boston, and the hotel was part of the reason.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, staff was very friendly. The best part of the hotel is the beds. The bed was the most comfortable bed i have ever slept on. The bar was nice and the brunch on Sunday was good as well. I would recommend the hotel. P.S. It is right next door to the Beantown Pub whichis a great sports bar.

Reviews.Title: “corporate feel - no character”
Reviews.Author: lstein
Reviews.Content: If you plan on visting boston for business this is a good bet - nice location, nice rooms. If you, however, are on a vacation or with a spouse - looking for something with more character - this is not a good bet. The hotel and rooms are stark, minimalist and a bit "cold". The hotel has little character. For the prices - I'd suggest XV beacon instead.

Reviews.Title: “Not so impressed”
Reviews.Author: Amandatrip
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night get-away here (babysitter at home with toddler) and were disappointed. We had booked an "intimate" room which was tiny and looked out at a brick wall. During checkin the staff asked us if we would like to upgrade to a nicer room for an additional $25. This really put me off -- if they had extra rooms, I think they should have upgraded us for free. They clearly know that the "intimate" rooms are not that great. The room had a missing handle on the bathroom door, a shower door that didn't close properly, and a phone that didn't work. Ph, and the hotel umbrella (which I had to ask for) was broken. I should have called to the front desk to complain about all this, but I just didn't have the energy to get into it with them. For as much money as they charge for a room, I would expect a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Lousy Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hooray1
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal on this hotel through expedia and expected quite a lot of Nine Zero (on the basis of the reviews here). The hotel is very well located, right in the heart of the city, near Boston Common. The room was good - clean and minimalist. But the staff were TERRIBLE. Staff on reception were most unwelcoming and I don't think anybody smiled while we were there. By far the worst staff were in the restaurant - unpleasant and unhelpful each time we were there. (but the food was v. good!). This hotel has a lot going for it but needs to get the right staff in place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Too Small”
Reviews.Author: DougJ193
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews which brought me to this hotel. I will say if it wasnt for the restaurant which was the best lamb I have ever had, I would not rave about this place. The room was simply too small, something you would expect in Europe, although the bathroom was very nice and the furnishing was very modernly creative. I will say that the view we had was also spectacular, but in a big city in the states, you should be able to walk in the room without having to basically crawl over the bed. For this reason, I would not stay at this hotel again, however, I would visit the restaurant in a heart beat. And finally, the lobby is way to small and there was little room for the crowd of people waiting to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Stylishly Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: MicOliver88
Reviews.Content: Pros - Near a redline T stop (very convenient) - Near Boston Common and multiple historical areas - Generally nice and friendly staff - Nice, cute bathroom amenities (though less available in standard rooms) - Everything new and sparlking Cons - Many features of the room designed for style not comfort or function - Weak (though free) hi-fi, poor overall on anything technical - Rooms are on the small side - Standard rooms lack bathtub - Area gets pretty sketchy at night I'd heard through the locals and read that Nine Zero was THE new hip and trendy hotel in Boston. That is most certainly the case. During our stay, Louis Farrahkan (and a huge entourage) as well as the Black Eyed Peas, also stayed here. The hotel was definitely buzzing. Nonetheless, the staff stayed on top of their game throughout the week - always polite and efficient and even quite friendly. That much was fun. Only exception was when we tried to get a DVD player they brushed us off, eventually admitting there is only one in the hotel and it was lent out indefinitely. When I called again the next day and asked about a wait list I was discouraged from this and then told I probably wouldn't want it anyway since it was attached to a 13 inch television. We were far from impressed by the overall tech features of this hotel, even though it tries to brand itself as being high tech. More on that below. The rooms, however, are a royal pain. The beds are very comfy, and that's vital for me in any hotel stay (a main reason I steer clear of most Marriotts nowadays). Unfortunately, many details are either inconvenient or just plain nonfunctioinal. For example, you simply cannot turn on the shower without getting your face, shoulder and arm blasted with cold water. This is in addition to a very cool looking sliding barn door on the bathroom that will slam your fingers if you're not paying attention. I thought I was just an idiot when I did this so didn't mention it to my boyfriend and he ended up slamming his hand in the door later that day. Also, there are no towel racks. After four days of staying here, I finally improvised a towel rack above the toilet, but housekeeping steathily removed and corrected these attempts, folding and replacing the towels below the sink, where they were unreachable from the shower. Another annoying feature - while they do have free wi-fi, it's very spotty. My boyfriend kept cursing every time he got booted. I got frustrated at the waxing and waning of the connection - you developed a rushed mentality whenever a strong signal appeared and tried to get everything done. This was compounded by the fact that there are no electrical outlets near the bed. Since my boyfriend was constantly at the desk working, god bless his productive soul, and the arm chair was unattractively squashed into the corner, the only other place to use your computer was on the bed. I had to constantly try to remember to plug my laptop back in to juice up the battery. Since we're locals (ousted by renovations), things like our gym being nearby and a big movie complex are great. Btw, the gym here is subpar for a nice new hotel. The SCLA is down the block, attached to the Ritz, and the nicest gym in Boston. Not cheap, but excellent facilities. The climate control, as I mentioned above, is not very precise. It is not digital and when it's on, it's hard to keep it below freezing. Not a problem during the day, but at night it's freeze or burn. When I brought this to management's attention, they offered to switch my room but said all rooms were the same in this regard. As mentioned by others, check Expedia, they have great rates. We paid $229 the first three nights and when I checked Expedia prior to renewing, I saw a quoted rate of $185. I told the front desk this and after some haggling they extended my stay for $189. They initially told me I would have to downgrade rooms for this rate. They said I had been upgraded to the second level upon check-in. This second tier room is supposedly identical to the standard room but has a view. When I pointed out to the front desk that this room has no view without pressing your face to the window, they let us stay. This hotel is a good value. Many Boston hotel rooms (Park Plaza, The Omni) are older and not updated. I like The Charles Hotel in Cambridge - free DVD player in room, large rooms, nice views, nice area. I also like the Marriott Longwharf - large comfy rooms and the best doormen in the city, but this hotel has some great rates available.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Nine Zero”
Reviews.Author: TejasGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed the weekend of May 27th-30th to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. I called to see if the hotel could place a birthday note in our room for my boyfriend upon our arrival. They not only did that, but also placed a huge delicious piece of double chocolate cake for us. My boyfriend loved it and ate the entire cake himself. The hotel was extremely clean, nice, very up to date. Bathrooms were spacious with great soaps, shampoos and a fantastic hair dryer! The mini bar was something I'd never seen before. You had your own bar with an assorment of mixers, recipe book etc. The hotel bar served good strong drinks. Sat. night we decided to rent a car for Sunday and the concierge was extremely helpful with this. We had our car ready for us by 8am Sunday morning. We drove to New Hampshire (45 min drive) and Maine ( 10 minutes from NH) to have some New England chowder and lobster rolls. This hotel is a perfect location for first timers or regulars to Boston. Hotel is directly accross from the Freedom Trail, Granary Burial Ground where John Adams, Paul Revere, John Hancock are buried. Only one thing went wrong on this wonderful trip. One of our bags was mistakenly left with hotel concierge and we had to go back to hotel to retrieve it. I'm sure this is common sense, but please remember to verify all baggage is with you before leaving your hotel. Overall, this was an awesome hotel. I highly recommend it to anyone staying in this fabulous city!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Snowman321
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at this property on several occasions after it first opened, and l had looked forward to my return visit. I was disappointed. The "non-smoking" room that I was placed in clearly was used as a smoking room. At check-out, the front desk did not seem very concerned about this fact, suggesting that it was perhaps the previous guest. At check-out, the hotel attempted to charge me an early departure fee, although I was not advised of that policy at check-in but instead, was assured to simply "advise us" if I intended to leave early. The hotel describes one class of its rooms as "fantastic". There was nothing "fantastic" about this room, which was located next to an active broom/housekeeper's closet and which had a direct "view" of a brick wall and roof (that made the room dark and uninviting). The bar area also did not have the energy that I had experienced on an earlier trip, but was instead dark and looked closed. Finally, I found the concierge service a joke; when I asked for a recommendation of an Italian restaurant, I was told to go to the North Side of Boston, walk around, and "find a restaurant that you like, they're all good." All in all, I would probably opt not to stay at this property on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbomer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nine Zero over the weekend of August 5th. Check-in: flawless Room: very nice Location: can't beat it Value: unbelievable (paid only $125/night thru Expedia) This is a legitimate 4/5 star hotel (I've stayed at numerous Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton properties) and I couldn't believe we were able to book our room at only $125/night. In Boston, you'd probably normally pay more than that for a Holiday Inn. Would recommend it to anyone, especially business travellers or couples. It would be fine for families as well, but they don't have a pool. We had drinks at the hotel bar, which was a nice, cozy place with friendly bartenders. Also had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was very good. Dinner the first night was at Hamersley's Bistro. I'd give it a 4 out of 5. Food was excellent, but service was not quite there. Dinner the second night was at Great Bay (attached to the Hotel Commonwealth). Not overly impressed with this place. No big complaints; it just didn't quite live up to the expectations that come along with a $180 bill for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Cloud Nine- best ever!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a suite reserved at Nine Zero and was given a complimentary upgrade to the Cloud Nine- the $$$$ penthouse suite! It was out of this world!! It would have been worth every penny if I had to pay for it! The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in, the service incredible, and all of the staff sooo friendly! I am an attorney in Philadelphia and stay many places on business. I absolutely plan to stay here again every time I come to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Boston and stayed at the Nine Zero. The hotel and staff are wonderful. They were quick to fulfill any request that we had. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom was very comfortable and clean. There were four of us in one room and we had plenty of space. The hotel staff was wonderful in recommending restaurants. If you love French food go to Pierrot's. For sea food Skip Jacks was wonderful. In the North End try Mike's Bakery. The gelato is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nine Zero - the best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero was quite simply the best hotel experience I have ever had and I travel a lot. After my flight was delayed for over four hours, I was dying to get to the hotel and get some sleep - this hotel provided the most comfortable bed I have ever stayed in and a lot more. The concierge and bell boy were extremely helpful - immediately rushing to take my bags when I entered the hotel (I had a lot of luggage!) and the check-in process was smooth and problem free with smiles all round despite it being past midnight. The room was pretty big and there was plenty of space for all my bags, a desk with all amenities for easy work if you're on business like I was, two luxury turkish cotton robes (so nice I bought one!) and a number of removable hangers in the large wardrobe. A nice touch was the personal bar with your own margarita, cosmo, bloody mary and apple martini mixes, along with rimmers and all sizes of glasses you could possibly need with a separate well-stocked mini-bar and fresh ice bucket. The bed was a large double with feather pillows and duvet, and I literally sinked into it! The bathroom is huge, with all toiletries you could possibly need - by Mario Russo, which smelt fantastic - and a large marble shower. Only possible complaint is no bath, but I was personally more than happy with the shower. The hotel is two minutes from Boston Common and shopping centres, and five-ten mins walk from Freedom Trail locations. I also used the gym, which although reasonably small, was deserted on Sunday morning and was supplied with numerous towels, apples and water. The accompanying showers were also clean and spacious. I was more than happy to head back to my hotel and relax after the conference - the bar and restaurant is great and despite being on a busy road the hotel was very peaceful. Needless to say check-out was just as pleasant. Essentially, what more could you ask for?! Great service, great location, great amenities, great room - I'll most definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: joopynyc
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to stay at Nine Zero after reading some of the glowing reviews. We also got a GREAT deal online through an airline-hotel combined package. We quickly found out, however, that you get what you pay for. The hotel is beautifully appointed with the sort of dÃ©cor we love. Spire, the hotel restaurant, was one of the highlights of our stay: In addition to the fantastic food, we had such a great time chatting with the bartender that we decided to have dinner at the bar instead of our table! So what's wrong with Nine Zero? The front desk seemed unwelcoming from the beginning. We kept asking ourselves if our reservations had a note attached to it that said "These folks got a deal on the hotel, so they're not worth your smile!" During a slow time when it seemed less than half the hotel was occupied, we were relegated to a noisy room across from the elevator with a window facing a brick wall. When we asked to check out an hour later because of a late flight, we were met with a curt "Fine." This is not customer service at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Style, Comfort, Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisab
Reviews.Content: The room was great (we needed one with two beds and it was not cramped at all! Yeah!), the staff was great, and the location is excellent! The bar was small but "very chic" in decor, as were all common areas and our room. Definitely NOT the stereotypical colonial Boston look, but very modern, yet always comfortable feeling. The friendly desk staff offered us umbrellas one night when it looked like rain, was always ready with restaurant suggestions and directions, and the housekeeping staff was very quick with extra mugs, coffee, towels. The city was in the middle of a record breaking heat/humid spell when we were there, but the hotel's air-conditioning was always up to the task, and easily adjustable in our room. Black-out shade at the window was welcome and mattresses were so comfortable. Have stayed at Lenox and Park Plaza and this was so much nicer. Definitely hope I get to Boston and this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great amentities, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: youngprof
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nine Zero, following all of the hype. While our "fantastic" room was good (clean, charming decor) and the bathroom amenities were great, the hotel was very noisy, even in the middle of the night (and we were on the 15th floor). Other guests sounded like they brought their partying to their rooms after 1 am and the hotel staff doesn't turn down their walkie-talkies late at night as they walk through the halls. We ate a quick dinner at the bar as soon as we got there and the bartenders were very friendly, talkative and wonderful. The next morning we also dined at Spire for brunch and the food was delicious and the wait staff attentive. I can see why the restaurant has been given such high kudos.

Reviews.Title: “I've had better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, but for the very substantial price tag, I expect a lot more! Service was medicore, rooms were decently decorated, and the view was disappointing. I'd rather stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “The place to be”
Reviews.Author: Travelin'hoody
Reviews.Content: perfect. My wife and I live in Mass, and wanted a short weekend getaway away from the kids. We chose the Nine Zero based on the Tripadvisor reviews, and I am glad we did. Took the T in, super-easy, the hotel is a short walk from the Park street station (Boston Common). The hotel is in a GREAT location. Walked almost everywhere! PFChangs, ColdStone, Bricco's (NorthEnd rest.), Fanuel Hall, Q-Market, Newberry st., Washington st (both for shopping). I noticed others marked this hotel down based on price. I guess everyone's experience will be based on expectations, and our experience exceeded our expectations. We found a deal on Expedia and paid $170/night for an 'intimate' room. At first I was worried that the room would have a view of a dumpster or something. But our room was on the 12th floor in the front of the building...not the best view, but not the worst...heck, we didn't get back to the room until around 1AM, and we were asleep by 1:01 ;) . The room was on the small side, but so are most big-city rooms. I would (and will) most definately go back to this hotel...!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a three day weekend and found the hotel to be grossly overrated. First, we booked a suite. Big mistake. All suites are located on lower floors and have just one window that look out to an office building on Tremont Street. For nearly $650/night, we found ourselves in a dark room (the bedroom had no windows to speak of). Second, we told the hotel we were traveling with a child and repeatedly requested a crib for our baby. When we arrived, no crib. When the crib did come it was old, rickety and not all that safe. Moreover, there was no room for the crib in the bedroom and the hotel concierge suggested that we push it up against the wall facing the open electrical outlets. We understand that not all hotels are outfitted to cater to children, but having made the explicit request well in advance, we had expected at least our room to be child friendly. Third, our room was in a state of disrepair. Food stains on the couch, lampshades that had burn marks from where the lightbulb had burned through, hair in the bathtub, and enough grit on the carpet that it wasn't pleasant walking barefoot through the room. Even the hotel acknowledged that our $650/night room was sub-par. Fourth, the service was not in keeping with its rating at all. We complained to the hotel manager who never showed his face. We got one voicemail message and that was it. Never heard from him again. After repeated complaints to the front desk, they knocked off $100/night on our room which didn't seem like adequate consolation, but we were just so glad to be out of the hotel we did not care at that point. We are not picky travelers who require every pillow to be fluffed and duvets to be "just so." We just require value for the money we are spending. I am pretty sure that had we stayed at the Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton, the service and amenities would have been worth the money we paid. As it was, we felt like we were being robbed every night that we stayed at Nine Zero. I would definitely not recommend. At this price point, there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel...Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler003
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nine Zero for two nights during Memorial Day Weekend and could not have made a better choice. The hotel staff was friendly and provided great service. The concierge picked out great restaurants. The bed is amazing...where can I buy those pillows! Splurge on a "Spectacular" room and you will not be disappointed by the floor to ceiling windows overlooking Boston Common and the skyline. The hotel's location is perfect. All T (subway) lines are within 3 blocks, the Common is right out the door, Newbury Street shopping is very close. Overall, great place, excellent location, fantastic style.

Reviews.Title: “Boston chic at a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero is great - superb location and within walking distance of just about everything you'd want to see in this fab city. The staff are friendly and accommodating, even when we decided to change rooms at nearly midnight (all done with a smile). Breakfast is pricey but worth it and the concierge will happily book tables for you at other places if you want a bit more atmosphere with your seafood... We booked direct with the hotel and negotiated a better rate than we could find on the internet so it's definitely worth calling them first.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: unclejames
Reviews.Content: First things first: save money by not booking via Expedia, Travelocity, etc, and do it direct with the hotel's website at -----. While it does use a frameset which makes it look insecure when typing in your credit card number, it did mean, over a three day stay, we saved around $60 - which was a good amount of beer in the pub round the corner! Walking into the room - welcomed by classical music on the CD stereo - we were impressed at the decoration (modern chic), and the spaciousness of the room. Anywhere that has a variety of mixers for your own cocktails next to the minibar scores marks with me! Why you'd want to drive to this hotel beats me - it's a two minute walk from Government Center T-stop, which is only four stops, I think, from the airport. Its central location does mean it can be a little noisy: we (jet-lagged) were woken by a dust-cart on our first night. But, its central location does mean that you're close to everything: from a cheap breakfast at Quincy Market to cheap shopping at Downtown Crossing. A cheap breakfast? Well, the Spires restaurant did a splendid breakfast, for $19: really tasty, nice, relaxed, in a splendid restaurant with a great corner-view. But, Quincy Market does a breakfast which is almost exactly as tasty, for $4.50. And, much as I enjoy having a smart waiter trotting up to me every five minutes and asking whether everything's okay there and can I get anything else, I enjoy having another $15, per person, for buying Sam Adams with later in the day. The hotel bar is equally splendid, though don't go ordering the brandy: $17 is also half a bottle at the airport! It's a nice place to be, but you might find, as we did, that the local pubs are cheaper and rather more friendly. We ended up in a disabled room, I notice, which generally means that there's a bit more space in the room, to the detriment of fiddly bits. I only noticed this on the day we were leaving, which shows how little impact it had. So, not a cheap hotel by anyone's standards: but highly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MJohnsToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nine Zero recently for a business trip. The hotel is small, but very nice and in an excellent location. Across the street from the Boston Common, walking distance to Quincy Market, and other great shopping. The rooms are extremely well equipped and nicely decorated. I'll definitely return with my husband or girlfriends for a weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, stylish, hip”
Reviews.Author: mcneelj
Reviews.Content: awesome room, great food at the restaurant --new chef and the bar was fun and stylish. the view was great. will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Reception: A bit TOO warm.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nine Zero on a March weekend based on reviews on this site. Had problems with temperature control in the room which had settings of "high" or "none at all". Room like an oven after leaving "cooling" on for several hours. Unable to cool the room without opening the window. Noted multiple others at checkout with same complaint; staff not terribly responsive to issue, told it was a generalized problem with the entire building. Other aspects of stay were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: RosieCLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in March 2005. It is very well located in the centre of the city, close to all places of interest, and just across from the Common. The room was a good size, with great attention to detail - we liked the design furniture and the little flourishes like the cocktail bar. Service was discreet and helpful. The hotel is good value given its location and elegance. Only one complaint: the sink in our bathroom had a large crack running across it. Other than that, we were very pleased with our choice. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Other then having a difficult time finding the hotel (everything is a one way street), everything there was great. Everything from the check in to check out went smooth. We were able to get into our room at about 12:30 rather then the 3:00 usual check in time, and courtesy check out time was 2:00 rather then 12:00. The Intimate room was a little small for a long stay. It was just he right size for the amount of stuff two people would need for a long weekend. The only things I found strange was there was no lock on the bathroom door. All the employees did more then expected in trying to make our stay a conformable one. Everyone was as helpful as they come. Its in a great location too...not too far from all the attractions most people want to see when they are in Boston. The hotel is only about 2 years old so everything is new, modern and clean! Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice quiet stay in a pretty busy city...or anyone else for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in the WORLD according to T & L Magz!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nine Zero for 4 nights in June. The hotel is easily in my top 5 hotels in the US, particularly for the short $$ it costs. I booked online for $199/n. The rooms are alittle small but very warm & cozy. The bed and linen are the best. Forget about W's "Heavenly beds", these beds try to coax you into staying in bed all day. All down spreads, mattress covers, & pillows. Plush robes. There are CD (w/remote control) players in the room for ambience and a wide selection of CDs can be borrowed from the front desk. Rooms are cleaned twice daily. They leave fresh Ice in your room for you in the evening! A very nice touch that I dont think I would have thought about. Nice change from the cookie cutter hotel chains. It is ranked in the Top 60 Hotels in THE WORLD by T&L Magazine & even featured as a Top 10 Boston Hotel on Travel Channel. Very chic & modern feel. Only CONs I had were that the Lobby & the Hotel Restaraunt is alittle too fancy for our tastes. Kinda of one of those where you pay $100 for dinner (w/o our alcohol $$ included in this figure mind you) & the food was only "okay." Maybe our palates weren't "sophisticated" enuff. But in a city like Boston, there are plenty of other places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Think a W without the attitude”
Reviews.Author: Tampa_Law_Guy
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at Nine Zero with my partner and was glad to see that it lived up to the hype. Check-in was smooth. We had originally booked an "intimate room" through Quikbook and upgraded to a "fantastic room" for $25 more a night. The employees at the front desk were always helpful. The lobby is fairly small. There is a living room-like space to the immediate right once you enter the lobby. It has some comfortable sofas and chairs to relax in while waiting to go out or even to read the paper in the morning. The decor is very modern and streamlined, but with good use of warm colors to make it feel more inviting. The room was a good size with a king bed that was very comfortable. The duvet is very warm and comfy as well. The room is decorated in earth tones and the furniture is very modern, black, but very functional. The one thing we did laugh at was that it seemed like everything in the room had a price tag. There is a price list in the entertainment center that gives you the price for snacks and drinks, but also t-shirts, stuffed bear, playing cards, baseball caps and even a condom set all bearing the Nine Zero name and logo! You can even buy the Mario Russo products in the bathroom from them! The bathroom was a good size, decorated in white and gray marble. The aforementioned Mario Russo products were very nice. I would have loved a double vanity, but the space did not seem to be an issue with just one sink. The fitness center is pretty basic but all you would need at a hotel. The business center on the third floor was convenient as I needed to send and receive faxes during the trip. The hotel provides complimentary high speed interest access in all rooms, which was very nice, except that I got 5 viruses over the weekend that I needed to have removed from my laptop. Our only complaint was that the room did get a bit warm at night in spite of turning the air control all the way to the cool setting. While it may have been 30 degrees outside, the room was a bit stuffy overnight because they pumped in heated air regardless of your individual control settings. As far as the location, the hotel is in a pretty quiet area at night. During week days, it is a bit more animated as the business district is to the back of the hotel. The hotel is about two blocks from the Government Center T stop and about two blocks in the other direction from the Park Street T stop at Boston Common. This makes it very easy to get around the city on the various subway lines. While we took a taxi cab in the night we got in, we walked over to the Government Center T stop the last day and caught the subway to the Airport stop. It cost only $1.25 a person and took only 15 minutes. You then board a bus from the station that takes you directly to your departing terminal. All in all, I would say that the Nine Zero was a pleasant experience and that we enjoyed the facilities and customer service. We would definitely consider staying there again on a return trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute magic”
Reviews.Author: gameranger
Reviews.Content: I recenty stayed at the nine zero hotel in tremont street in Boston (early march 2005). The staff cannot do enough for their guests to ensure their stay is a memorable one, from the porters to the reception, concierge, room service....basically all the staff i came into contact with. The room i stayed in was well layed out, very comfortable and with nice additionals like a cd library and a very big range of bathroom accesories plus a well appointed bar with valuable extras like maps of boston and a host of others. The room was very clean, the linen nice and comfortable to sleep on and the views of the commons magic. This hotel scores very high on my list, to give an example...After my stay at the nine zero i proceeded on to chicago, on my return from chicago, en route to the UK, i had to stop over at Logan airport. My plane was leaving for the U.K approx 7 hrs later and there was nowhere to check my luggage in--I contacted the nine zero and they offered to keep my luggage while i used up time walking around Boston, not only that, I was offerd a room at a really knock down rate to refresh myself in before i left fo the U.K en route to S.A Now thats what i call client service from a magic, modern well appointed and situated clean and well staffed hotel. If I ever return guess where i will stay...no prizes for guessing right

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nine Zero in Boston and was able to stay on the top floor for only 125.00USD per night. The staff was very helpful. The only issue I had was when we checked out and the front desk clerk asked for another 330.00USD. I explained I had already prepaid. However the clerk smiled and said no problem. I then left and went on my merry way. GOOD LOCATION!

Reviews.Title: “The only place I would stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: PrettyPrankster
Reviews.Content: I simply love this hotel. Sure, you can find less pricey places to stay, but there are so many good things about the Nine Zero that I find it to be worth every penny. The location cannot be beat. Just up the street from the Boston Commons, right on the Freedom Trail, near Filene's, just mere blocks from the Orpheum and only five minutes to a major T-stop. The decor of the hotel is beautiful, but then I'm all about clean, modern design. The rooms are very well-kept and contain all the necessary amenities. Even having purchased my reservations through Expedia on each occasion I've stayed at the Nine Zero, I am still greeted with a "welcome back!" when I check in. The staff is efficient and helpful. The conceirge went out of her way in setting up a shuttle to the airport for me and delivering documentation directly to my room. I'm not a usual "talk to the concierge" kind of person, so maybe I should have expected all of that. But I was impressed that, for such a slight little arrangement that they even managed to make me feel as if I were being pampered. I enjoyed eating in Spire and found the food to be well above average. Upon asking a few questions of my wait person, regarding preparation of the dinner I was eating, the chef came out to answer the questions personally. The menu has been interesting and creative, each time I've eaten there. All in all, one of my favorite hotels in this, or any other, country!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend here January 14th & 15th 2005. The room had a spectacular view and the people working their from the doorman to the concierge(Richard) were top notch and true professionals! The hotel is in the best location to the common or a stroll to the north end for some great dining! You will love everything about the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
