Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nine Zero for two nights (Nov 21-22, 2004) and had an amazing experience. When I first checked into my "Fantastic" room, it had a queen bed and seemed a bit small, but had a window overlooking Boston Common. I immediately called the front desk, who offered to move me to a larger room on the other side of the building that had no view. Since I didn't intend to be in my hotel room much during the visit, I thought this was a worthy trade -- and, in retrospect, I made the right decision! My bigger "Fantastic" room had a king bed and was very spacious. The amenties in the bathroom were terriffic and the overall decor was very chic. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Perhaps the best part was the location- right off of Boston Common, you can walk almost anywhere in a hurry (plus, the T station is a block away on the direct line to Harvard). One downside was that the hotel lobby is rather small and uninviting. While it's fashionably decorated, the lobby makes for a poor waiting room. My only other issue was the price of room service: $40 for soup/sandwich/juice seemed excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for Lovely Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, room was great, staff were very friendly. Room was clean, sheets were clean, bathroom was clean, had a great view, stayed one night which cost $180, but $205 after taxes. Excellent value for that price ... i would recommend it to anyone who would like a lovely hotel for a reasonable price.I stayed there on Nov 26 for one night and would stay again.. i got that price just from walking in... next time i would book online in advance and prob get a better rate again....worth trying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and decadent living!”
Reviews.Author: Bluebonnet4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed this hotel 2 times and both times were out of this world. The rooms are huge with wonderful city views and the service was exceptional. The 2nd stay we were upgraded to a spectacular room with floor to ceiling windows which was fabulous. We ate breakfast at Spire each morning (4) and it was 5 star service/food and we had dinner there on our final evening which was superb. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in "Beantown" location by Boston Commons - walking distance to Fanuiel Hall/Quincy Market and subways to get you anywhere in the city. When in Boston again the Nine Zero is home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Exactlyhowitwas
Reviews.Content: Super comfortable Spectacular room with fantastic views of the city. The beds and Egyptian linnen are just amazing! Price was fine (about $335) considering we had just come from a very average B & B in Chatham (Captain's House Inn - don't bother!) which was not a lot cheaper! Very chic, modern and extremely clean and efficiently managed. Would not hesitate to go back. Stayed for 5 nights and got really well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but still cosy”
Reviews.Author: familytraveller083
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nine Zero for 3 nights at the beginning of September. When booking I had advised we would be on our honeymoon and that we would appreciate a room with a good view of the city. We had booked a 'fantastic' room - and we got a fantastic view - definitely worth asking for! The hotel also surprised us with champagne and strawberries. The room was clean, of an average size & the decor was sleek and modern but still cosy. The bed was very comfortable and the toiletries provided in the bathroom smelt so nice I took them with me! We found every member of staff to be proactive, friendly, very efficient and helpful - and to remember who we were. The hotel is very well located for seeing the city and the sights although the downside of this was that we found the city noise to be a bit much at night. The only other downside was that the room had only a shower and no bath which I would have expected for a hotel in this price range. We loved Boston and intend to visit again. We would certainly consider the Nine Zero - and if they would only soundproof those windows we would return without a doubt....Also - loved the 'cocktail' minibar - every hotel should have one like that!

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to worth it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked the spectacular view room at $330/night. We ended up staying at the hotel for about 4 hours. Upon arriving, we found our room to be unsatisfactory. Everything was covered in a layer of dust. The desk and tv cabinet were both painted black, and were beaten up. The scratches and gouges in the wood were colored in with a black magic marker, I kid you not. It kind of looked like Trading Spaces had been through the room. You know, lots of trendy trinkets and colors, but when you look closely you see the crappy paint job. Did I mention the "stains" that were visible on the comforter covering the bed? The covers were black and white stripes, and the black showed every drip of, well, whatever bodily fluid. The staff was pleasant, and moved us to another room. This room featured a similar layer of dust, except this time there was no dust in the main areas of the desk. You could actually see where the staff had cleaned and where they had not. The pillowcases had rips/shreds in them. We had seen enough. We took our bags to the front desk, informed the clerk we were leaving, and he responded with "oh ok." Clearly not a 4 or 5 star property. The rooms, besides being dirty poorly maintained, were quite small. It's trendy/cool, but it doesn't say a lot for the crowd that thinks this place is "it". We moved to the Ritz-Carlton down the street, and for the same price we were treated to a 4-post featherbed and white-glove service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel blunted only by Spire”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from an amazing holiday in America, four nights of which were spent at Nine Zero. Whilst you cannot, no doubt, please everyone previous reviews criticising the staff and service seem entirely unjustified. The most helpful bell trolley and reception service greeted us whenever we needed it. The feel of the hotel was trendy but relaxed. The rooms we had were to a very high standard. Our last night stopover (after a 4 night trip to Cape Cod) included a free upgraded room (which was a genuine upgrade from the room we had first stayed in - which we had been more than happy with). The one slight disappointment - our meal in Spire. It just tried too hard with overly fussy food and seems to have been over-hyped by the available reviews. There are plenty other great places to eat in Boston - but for accomodation I cant see it being beaten. When I return to Boston I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an easy location for walking to see everything, then this is a great place. The front desk clerks could use a little personality. The rooms are clean and very chic. If you are looking for a true luxury hotel, check elsewhere. I'd give a 3-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Super Stylish Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nine Zero was a fantastic hotel in Boston. Besides being incredibly comfortable and stylish, the staff were gracious and friendly. Lots of nice touches in the bathrooms, Mini streo system, high speed. The restaurant is also worth checking out

Reviews.Title: “chic but not five-star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got NineZero on Hotwire for $201/night (it was running about $239 on other websites). Location is very convenient, lobby small but elegant. Valet took our car but there was no one in sight to assist with luggage so we carried into the room ourselves. Were told that we were upgraded to "fantastic" room. I am not sure wha the lower category looks like but this room was quite small. The linens are indeed Frette and the bed is very comfortable. Liked the toiletries but there was no tub just shower. In the morning there was no newspaper which had been promised. Asked for a bucket of ice, and it was delivered promptly. Overall it was worth the money but did not feel in the lap of luxury

Reviews.Title: “No ice please!”
Reviews.Author: ADH001
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Boston. The hotel is wonderful. Fantastic location in downtown Boston. Easily walkable to most of the major attractions. Our only complaint was that on our first night, we were given a room whose bathroom backed on to the room with the ice machine, so all night we kept being woken by people filling ice buckets or the machine simply producing another batch of ice. To be fair to the hotel, after we complained the next morning, they found us another room and moved all our luggage for us. We found all the hotel staff to be very courteous and helpful without being in your face all the time. Rooms are good sized, but wardrobe space is geared more for business travellers than holiday makers. Overall, an excellent place to stay. we would certainly go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Calvin_Anna
Reviews.Content: After reading a few very different reviews i was a little scared but found an excellent deal on the hotel, so gave it a try any way. It was teriffic. Great location, great amenities in the room, very fast room service. I will definitelly be back. And working for a hotel myself, I can say that I WILL BE recommending this hotel for everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Lulu_2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the 4th of July and found Nine Zero to be very accomodating. No problems with service. Professional, clean and on the modern side. Will recommend to others and will be returning again!!! They also had a buckwheat pillow for me. Not many hotels carry them.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the business traveller!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nine-Zero for a night when in Boston for business. It was terrific! The place is very chic and the bed is incredibly comfortable with a terrific shower and bathroom. The service was great--quick check-in, hailing cabs, and I ordered breakfast the night before and it arrived bang-on time and was very tasty. The free in-room internet service is awesome and I got more work done there listening to the awesome sterio than I do at home! I highly recommend this place. Staff is friendly and not snobby or snooty like they are at the old time hotels. The only thing they can improve is that the health club was a little small--but good equipment (3 treadmills, a few stair climbers), but they had a TV in that room. I would definitely stay there again (although pricey).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but service is inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was an overall lovely hotel. The design is very clean and modern. The choice of Frette linens is impeccable, and our room was very spacious and had a lovely view of Boston. However, the service staff still need basic service training. The hotel maids did a very cursory job in cleaning and did not replenish the toiletries. Room service meals arrived incomplete, with the rest of the meal arriving about 45 minutes later. As well, the restaurant menu is overpriced for the quality and taste. Despite this, the hotel is well-located and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “All style, no substance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it looked stylish. The location is suberb, as are the rooms. Comfy beds, a spacious shower and fab toiletries. There the luxury ends. The staff were inconsistent. Some more than willing to help, offering ideas of where to go, what to do. Others were downright rude. I had phoned in advance and booked a bottle of champagne to be in my room as a thank you to my boyfriend for taking me away. Not only was the champagne not waiting, but when I enquired at reception as to where it was, I was asked if I had booked it at the right hotel. There was no sorry, no attempt to rectify the situation. Then when I returned home, I found my Visa card had been charged for it. I phoned and complained and was assured, after faxing them a copy of my bill, that they would get back to me. Unsurprisingly, they still haven't responded 24 hours later. The room also was not stocked properly (we only had one bathrobe and the coffee sachets were not replaced after we had drunk the one we were given). Nine Zero could be a lovely boutique hotel. Instead it is a sweatshirt pretending to be a cashmere sweater. As a footnote to my previous review, Nine Zero has now fully re-imbursed my Visa card

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire for a five night stay in early June. I did have to pay an extra $30/night for a room with two double beds but it was worth it. We checked in about 4 hours later than we expected due to airline delays. Our first room was a smoking room but we were immediately moved to a non-smoking room on the fourth floor. The hotel offered to improve our room the next night and we were moved to a room on the 16th floor that had a fantastic view. The staff at the concierge desk was really helpful. One staff member even remembered that my daughter needed some medical attention on our arrival and enquired about her health when we checked out. My only negative feedback was that the water pressure in the shower was much better on the fourth floor than it was on the sixteenth floor but that view made this inconvenience a minor one.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Space, awful service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned back from our second trip to Nine Zero and for the second time the service was terrible! We had so many problems the first visit that they upgraded us to a one bedroom suite. When we arrived the first night - it had been given away so they said they would move us the next day. For the night (and instead of moving) we stayed in a "Spectacular Room" which is on a high floor and just lovely with beautiful views of the city, comfortable beds and nice marbel bathrooms. In our two stays at Nine Zero only one time did someone offer to help us with bags, rarely did anyone offer to get us a taxi for the most part the staff was pretty much clueless. I would never stay here again - a room with a view is simply not enough - I have NO IDEA how this hotel has earned top reviews in it is not worthy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for several weeks on business and found it to be uneven at best. The hotel itself is nice. The design is modern and chic, but inviting. The rooms have some nice amenities, including comfortable beds and a fast internet connection. The young-ish staff, on the other hand, seemed inexperienced and unschooled in hospitality. Wake-up calls and breakfast frequently arrived late, if at all. A colleague's laundry was lost for several days. Maids began knocking on doors at 8 a.m. By far the worst experience of my stay, however, was being bumped from my room. I awoke one morning to find my bill placed under the door. When I called to inquire why, I was told that my reservation had ended and that the hotel was fully booked for the evening. Incredulous, I asked the hotel's reservations desk to look into this and fix what must have been a simple mistake on their part. I was greeted, alternately, with indifference, denials and blame. Worst of all, the staff made no attempt to rectify their error in any way, even by offering to find me a room at another hotel. Over time, the hotel may iron out its service problems, but for now I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived via taxi from the train and the friendly staff let us check in before noon, and the next day, after checkout, they kept our bags safe for us until after 7:00 p.m. At dinnertime, it was pouring rain so we peeked in to the restaurant with our two boys (aged 8 and 10) -- they saw us and said come on in, we'll cook for all of you. The boys had a great meal and went on back up to the room and we sat and had the most romantic, delicious meal I've ever while travelling with the family. The room had a huge Wow factor for all of us, reasonable view, modern but inviting decor, fabulous bathroom and lots of electronics to keep all happy. We will go back there and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “No Charm and No Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visit Boston alot trying new places and this hotel is not able to take care of its guests.We couldn't even get breakfast in the morning. Waiting for almost a hour.They said they are very busy and no tables open for the morning. Recomended to go next door to at another restaurant. We enjoy working out every day and the exercise room is so small everytime we went to go there we couldnt use it with 4 pieces always being used this was inconveinent to us. Paying this much for a hotel we should be able to use the services and get something for our money besides a standard hotel room. The housekeeping staff cleaned our room so late we had to go out again and were rushed to get to dinner on time. There is no parking and it took almost a hour to get our car back and even to find the hotel entrance was crazy as its in a alley tucked behind another big hotel and dirty street with dumpsters and construction equipment. We did have a good breakfast next door after they recomended trying there which would be faster.

HotelInfo.Name: Nine Zero Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 90 Tremont St., Boston, MA 02108
